ENGINEERING OPPORTUNITIES

ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

Litton Data Systems has achieved a well-respected position as one of the 
world's foremost developers and manufacturers of military command, control 
and communication (C3) systems.  Our Air Defense Systems group has an 
immediate requirement for individuals with a strong background in applied 
research and exploratory development in automated target identification, data 
fusion, tactical decision making, mission planning and intelligent 
human-computer interfaces.  The successful candidates must be self-motivated, 
creative and possess excellent communication skills.

PRINCIPLE INVESTIGATOR

Responsible for scoping the problem, defining technical approach and 
directing a small team to achieve project objectives.  Position requires MS 
CS, Ph.D preferred, leadership ability and a minimum of five years' recent 
experience in designing AI system and demonstrable familiarity with planning 
literature.

KNOWLEDGE ENGINEER

Responsible for design and implementation of real-time embedded 
knowledge-based systems.  Requires BS CS, MS preferred, a working knowledge 
of Lisp, demonstrable familiarity with AI techniques and a minimum of three 
years' recent professional experience developing knowledge-based systems.  
Additional skills include object-oriented programming, C++ and UNIX.

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and must meet 
eligibility requirements for access to classified information.  Litton Data 
Systems offers an excellent salary and benefits package.  To apply, please 
send resume, including salary history to Litton Data Systems, Employment 
Dept. 479, 29851 Agoura Road, P.O. Box 6008, Agoura Hills, CA  91376-6008.  
Principals only, please. EOE M/F/D/V.

Subject: Theorem Proving/Interface Job Available.
Date: Wed, 17 Aug 94 12:18:56 +0100

Dear Colleagues:

Please circulate the attached.  I apologise for multiple copies due
to mailing list overlaps.

Tom Melham

=====================================================================
                   RESEARCH ASSISTANT POSITION 

       User Interface Design for Mechanized Theorem Provers

                     University of Glasgow


Applications are invited for a Research Assistant post available under the
EPSRC grant `User Interface Design for Mechanized Theorem Provers'.

This project will investigate the design of user interfaces to theorem
proving tools such as HOL, ERIL, or LP.  The project will employ methods of
research into Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) - including cognitive science
and the psychology of programming - to formulate and test hypotheses about
the effectiveness of user interface features for theorem provers.  The aim is
to produce design principles for interfaces that will help increase the
practical usability of theorem proving systems. A distinctive feature of the
project is its interdisciplinary nature, with investigators in HCI (Phil
Gray) and theorem proving (Tom Melham and Muffy Thomas).

The post requires someone with a Ph.D. or comparable experience.  Ideally,
the appointed candidate will be an expert in the relevant HCI techniques
(including empirical evaluation), know a bit about logic and formal
reasoning, and be able to learn about theorem proving quickly.  Applicants
who are primarily theorem proving experts but willing to master the relevant
methods of HCI will also be considered. In any case, good programming ability
is required for rapid prototyping of interface ideas.

The post is for three years, starting on or after 1 November 1994 (the actual
start may be negotiated). The appointment will be on the RA 1A Scale (13,941 -
17,813 pounds p.a.) with an annual increment. The appointed researcher will be
equipped with a workstation and have access to funds for travel.

The Computing Science Department at Glasgow has an excellent research
environment.  The Department received the highest possible rating of 5 in
the most recent UK research assesment exercise. There are large and active
research groups in formal methods and HCI, with links to psychology and
graphics. The city of Glasgow is an exciting place to live, with a rich and
varied offering of theatre and the arts. There is mixture of modern and
grand Victorian architecture (and affordable housing) and the Scottish
Highlands and Islands are within easy reach.

Written applications should be sent to Dr Tom Melham, Department of Computing
Science, The University of Glasgow, Scotland, G12 8QQ, to arrive no later than
30 September 1994.  Your applicantion should include a covering letter
outlining your qualifications for the position, a Curriculum Vitae, a complete
list of publications, and the names and addresses of two referees.  Informal
inquiries are also welcome - these should also be sent to Tom Melham,
preferably by electronic mail addressed to tom@dcs.glasgow.ac.uk.

The University of Glasgow is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

===========================================================================
Dr Tom Melham                               Tel: +44 41 339 8855 [ext 4967]
Department of Computing Science             Direct line: +44 41 330 4967
University of Glasgow                       Facsimile: +44 41 330 4913
Glasgow, Scotland, G12 8QQ                  Email: tfm@dcs.glasgow.ac.uk
===========================================================================

To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu, ai+lisp-jobs@cs.cmu.edu, 
    ai+prolog-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: note about the lists

To prevent any more subscription requests from appearing on the lists,
my mailing list software now looks for certain keywords (e.g.,
subscribe, signoff, unsubscribe, etc.) in the message. If it finds
any, it will redirect the message to me for approval.

It is trivial for me to add new mailing lists. If folks want to see
more specialized job announcement mailing lists (e.g., nlp-jobs,
robotics-jobs, etc.), let me know and I'll add them.

Right now the lisp-jobs mailing list has 341 members, of which about
40 have been added since the list was moved from anzus.com to
cs.cmu.edu. The ai-jobs mailing list has 38 members so far, and the
prolog-jobs mailing list has 46 members.

As a matter of policy, the contents of these mailing lists are
considered confidential and will not be disclosed to anybody. 

--mark

Subject: Software Engineer/Developer (N.Y.) [Neural Networks] Wanted
Reply-To: d.rosen@ieee.org
Organization: New York Medical College

Full-time position for Software Engineer/Developer with recent Degree.
Possible alternative: Part-time Experienced Software Engineer/Developer.

Starting date: Immediate/September.

A federally-funded research team at New York Medical College is
applying neural networks and advanced probabilistic/statistical
methods to improve the accuracy with which the stage (of advancement)
of cancer cases can be evaluated -- an important factor in determining
treatment.

We seek a skilled developer to take primary responsibility for the
design and implementation of our neural network software, which will
be geared towards flexible experimental use in our fast-paced research
program, as well as a simple GUI prototype of clinical production
software.  The successful candidate will work with us (medical, neural
network, and statistical researchers) to plan the best path from our
current C code to a more carefully-designed, extensible, OO approach,
perhaps with partial rapid implementation in an interpreted language,
and evaluate the possible role of other available tools and libraries.
It is expected that eventually, much of the resulting software will be
freely distributed for use in many fields.

Candidates should have demonstrably outstanding skills in designing
object-oriented software, and in C++ (or both C and some OO language)
development under the Unix[/X11] environment.  Prefer knowledge of as
many of the following as possible: neural nets, statistics, numerical
/ scientific computation, portable GUI, prototyping language (Python,
Smalltalk, Perl, S-plus, ...), MS Windows, and Unix system
administration.

New York Medical College (NYMC) is located in the community of
Valhalla, NY, just half an hour north of New York City.  The position
would be on-site, though doing some portion of the work remotely could
perhaps be arranged.

NYMC is the third-largest private medical university in the United
States. It is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Institution.
Currently we do not believe we could justify hiring an individual who
is not already authorized to work in the U.S.

If you are interested and qualified, please e-mail your resume to me
as soon as possible (plain text preferred).

--
David Rosen, PhD   <d.rosen@ieee.org>

Organization: Department of Computer Sci, University of Melbourne
Date: Mon Aug 22 01:54:08 EDT 1994


Department of Linguistics, University of Melbourne, Australia.
Lecturer in Computational Linguistics (Limited Tenure: 3 years)

The Department of Linguistics is a dynamic new Department with growing
strengths in discourse, semantics, cognitive science and speech synthesis.
We wish to develop new teaching and research programs in computational
linguistics at undergraduate and postgraduate levels, and are seeking a
lecturer in Computational Linguistics, for a three year appointment beginning
in 1995.  The position is funded by University Development funds and the
Microsoft Institute of Advanced Software Technology.  Subject to the success
of the program in attracting students and establishing research in the area,
it is hoped to advertise a continuing position in computational linguistics
at the end of the three-year term.

You should have expertise in Computational Linguistics, a good background in
general linguistics, and additional specializations in an area such as Machine
Translation, Text Generation, Natural Language Processing, Computational
Phonology or Computational Morphology, Linguistic Knowledge Representation.
You will contribute to the development of teaching and research in
Computational Linguistics through the teaching of undergraduate and
postgraduate courses in the Linguistics and Cognitive Science programs, as
well as some teaching in general linguistics; through supervision of
postgraduate research in Linguistics and in relevant parts of the Cognitive
Science program.  You will pursue research in one or more of the above areas,
and help coordinate the Linguistics contribution to the Master's in Cognitive
Science.

Salary:  $41,574 - $49,370 p.a. according to experience and qualifications.

Further information and a position description: Ms Indra Kurzeme,
Administrative Assistant, Department of Linguistics (03) 344 5488;
fax (03) 344 4980; email Indra_Kurzeme@muwayf.unimelb.edu.au

Applications close: 3 October 1994
Reference number: G0001481

Applications should be sent, in duplicate, quoting reference number and three
referees (including facsimile numbers) to the Director, Personnel Services,
The University of Melbourne, Parkville, Victoria, Australia 3052;
fax (03) 344 4694.  The University of Melbourne is an equal opportunity
employer and has a smokefree work-place policy.

Subject: fwd: Voice Processing for Info Retrieval

From: anne@dcs.gla.ac.uk (anne sinclair)
Organization: CS Dept Glasgow
Date: Thu Aug 25 13:10:41 EDT 1994

VIPIR

A Research Assistant's post on a three-year University of Glasgow funded
research project VIPIR:  Voice Processing for Information Retrieval, a
joint project between the Computing Science and Statistics Departments.

The aim of the project is to develop voice processing techniques which will
integrate with the storage and retrieval of documents containing images and
text.   Extensive use will be made of statistical approaches, especially
the Hidden Markov Models.   The research will be based on a Sun
SPARCstation running HTK and will use some Power Macs.

Preference will be given to a candidate with a PhD in information
retrieval, or equivalent experience, and with some knowledge of formal
logic, probability theory, and computer-based speech processing.   The
successful candidate will join the IR group in the Computing Science
Department.


DRASTIC

A Research Assistant's post on a three-year EPSRC project is available in a
group developing a high-performance distributed software platform, suitable
for supporting very large, evolving, resilient, heterogeneous, persistent
application systems.  The research group has been involved in building
persistent object stores, persistent languages and distributed object
managers for more than a decade.   The research will use a mixture of
Digital's Alpha workstations and Sun's SPARCstations; both companies are
collaborating with this project.

Preference will be given to candidates with extensive experience and/or a
PhD in relevant systems research topics.  Evidence will be required of
experience in designing and implementing systems software.

The DRASTIC and VIPIR projects are situated in a large and thriving
department with a research rating of 5 and an Excellent teaching rating.
Both appointments will be made on the RA 1A scale (#13,941 - #20,953) with
USS superannuation.  Applications should be submitted no later than 30
September 1994 by e-mail to vacancies@dcs.glasgow.ac.uk (from whom further
particulars may be obtained) or on paper to Anne Sinclair, Department of
Computing Science, University of Glasgow, Glasgow, G12 8RZ.   These should
include a full CV (four copies), publication list and the addresses of two
referees.

Subject: fwd: EPFL - Switzerland

Job offer - Switzerland

The Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (EPFL) is a
nationally funded research center and educational establishment on the
shores of Lake Geneva in the French speaking part of
Switzerland. Switzerland is in the center of Europe; EPFL is thirty
minutes from France, ninety minutes from Italy and two and one half
hours from Germany. There are four thousand undergraduate students and
approximately three thousand research staff. Subjects include all
branches of engineering as well as architecture. Along with its sister
establishment in Zurich (ETHZ) it is the leading center for
engineering teaching in the country and one of the most generously
funded research establishments in the world.

The Artificial Intelligence Laboratory was founded in 1987 by Boi
Faltings.  We are currently seeking a person who is *willing to work
hard* for a year in the area of AI applications in design. More
specifically, we are looking for someone to assume significant
responsibility in order to participate in a research project on
intelligent objects in architectural design. Work will involve
collaboration with one other person to implement, test and improve
upon recently developed algorithms for constraint satisfaction.  An
appropriate user interface is also required. In addition, this project
will be carried out in collaboration with architects in Zurich (ETHZ -
Gerhard Schmitt - a former faculty member of CMU)

Programming experience in C, C++ and LISP would be an asset.

Salary will depend upon age, education and experience. An approximate
figure is SFr 50,000. Taxes will depend upon family conditions - they
usually vary from ten to twenty percent. Health insurance is private
and must be payed separately.

Starting date : from October 1994

If you are interested in such a position, contact :

Ian Smith
email: smith@lia.di.epfl.ch

AI Lab (LIA), DI
EPFL
1015 Lausanne
Switzerland
Tel: (+ 41 21) 693-5242 --  fax: 693-5225 --

Please attach references with phone numbers to your resume.

Subject: fwd: Research Positions at IC-Parc

From: jml@doc.ic.ac.uk (Jonathan M. Lever)
Subject: Research Positions at IC-Parc
Date: Thu Sep 01 07:37:23 EDT 1994
Organization: Department of Computing, Imperial College, University of London,
+             UK.

RESEARCH ASSOCIATE POSITIONS

IC-Parc: Centre for Planning and Resource Control
IMPERIAL COLLEGE of Science, Technology and Medicine

IC-Parc invite applications for two Research Associate positions funded by
EPSRC under a new project "RESPONSE: Resource-based Planning and Reactive
Scheduling: A dynamic constraint logic programming environment".  The
partners in RESPONSE include three major companies, British Airways, BT and
ICL. The goal of the project is to integrate techniques from Approximation
Algorithms, such as simulated annealing, and Operations Research with
constraint-solving in the framework of Constraint Logic Programming, and to
make the results available in the generic planning architecture parcPLAN
which is currently under development at IC-Parc.
The ideal candidate will have advanced research experience, and preferrably
a PhD in Computer Science, with a strong background in at least one of the
following areas:

  * Approximation algorithms, e.g. simulated annealing
  * Operations Research
  * Scheduling and Planning
  * Constraint logic programming.

The positions are for 2 years and the starting date is 1st January, 1995.
Salary will be commensurate with experience and qualifications on the RA1A
scale (up to 17700 pounds inclusive of London Allowance).

To apply send a cover letter and CV by regular or electronic mail before
22nd September, 1994 to

Professor Barry Richards
Director
IC-Parc
William Penney Laboratory
Imperial College
London SW7 2AZ
U.K.

Direct Line:     +44 71 594 8429
Fax:             +44 71 594 8449
Internet:        ebr@doc.ic.ac.uk

Informal enquiries may be addressed to Dr Jonathan Lever (jml@doc.ic.ac.uk)

                                OPPORTUNITIES FOR PROGRAMMERS

The Automobile Club of Southern California has excellent
opportunities at our Data Processing Center in Costa Mesa, California
(Orange County), for experienced Programmers degreed in MIS/CS.

                                           PROJECT LEADERS

Marketing Database Development
This position will develop customer/product profiles and market
segmentation databases. Proficiency in market research database
development and knowledge of COBOL and SAS software is required.

Insurance Claims Systems
This position will provide the technical enhancement of an
insurance claim processing application in PL/1 and COBOL with CICS
and VSAM files.

 Business Management/Compensation System
Will develop large scale systems for a personnel compensation
application. Requires proficiency with COBOL, CICS, VSAM, JCL and
DB2. Experience with payroll or compensation systems preferred.

Cartographic Publishing System
This ARC/INFO Programmer will perform AML programming to
automate road map publishing. You will use ARC/INFO software and
UNIX Graphic Workstation to design, display, query and provide
spatial analysis for a Cartographic Publishing System. Requires a
minimum of one year ARC/INFO programming using AML.
Knowledge of AIX and SQL/DB2 a plus.

Publishing Systems
This position will design artificial intelligence systems to support our
insurance processing business. Knowledge of expert systems, neural
networks, Windows and client/server technologies required.
Proficiency with COBOL II, DB2 and IEF preferred.
Member/Customer Identification System
This project is in Phase II design and implementation of a
reengineering of a large customer/member information database
using COBOL II, DB2 and IEF casetool.


                                         SENIOR PROGRAMMERS

 Human Resource/Compensation System
This position will develop a personnel benefit/tax system using
Dunn & Bradstreet software HR:M System. Proficiency with M & D,
and experience in the following personnel applications: flex benefits,
facts datafile, tax installations and PDL preferred.

Interactive Technology
This position will be a part of a team developing multimedia
interactive product applications, such as CD-ROM, on-line networks,
or other interactive technology for computers and televisions.
Proficiency in Windows programming in C, C++, or Visual Basic; OLE
2.0;  DB2 and CICS is needed. IBM mainframe/PC and Macintosh
programming for on-line environments required.

We offer excellent salaries and benefits packages. Please send
resume and salary history to: Automobile Club of Southern
California, Personnel Dept. P152 (RA-INT) 3333 Fairview
Rd., Costa Mesa, CA 92626. Equal Opportunity Employer.

                  AUTOMOBILE CLUB OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA

Subject: fwd: Speech Job in Switzerland

From: hornstein@ubilab.ubs.ch (Thomas Hornstein)
Subject: Open position in speech research
Organization: Union Bank of Switzerland (UBILAB)
Date: Sat Sep 03 07:55:48 EDT 1994

UBILAB (UBS Information Technology Laboratory) is the corporate information
technology innovation center of Union Bank of Switzerland (UBS), the
largest bank of the country.  It pursues a small number of attractive,
highly competitive research projects foussed on both the IT departments of
the Bank and the CS research community at large.  UBILAB has the status of
a highly competitive research institution; we are publishing scientific
papers, participate in international conferences, and maintain contacts
with universities and other research institutions on a worldwide basis.

There is a position to be filled immediately for a highly qualified
researcher in the area of Speech Research.

Speech Research at the UBILAB so far concentrated on telephone voice
interfaces and speech recognition that were applied in an interactive voice
response system for the general user. A pilot system for the languages
German, French and Italian was successfully implemented. In the future, we
intend to also explore speaker recognition and voice synthesis.

Most of the project work at UBILAB is done on different hardware platforms
under UNIX and is programmed in C/C++.

An applicant must have both a degree in Computer Science or Electrical
Engineering, preferably a PhD, and an outstanding research record.  In
addition, the applicant must be able to speak and write either English or
German perfectly (or both, of course).

For more information on the open position please contact
   Thomas Hornstein
   e-mail: hornstein@ubilab.ubs.ch
   fax: +41-1-236-4671
   phone: +41-1-236-6703

Your formal application including CV, list of publications, transcripts,
and references should be sent to
   Thomas Hornstein
   UBILAB
   Union Bank of Switzerland
   Bahnhofstr. 45
   8021 Zurich, Switzerland

PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT MANAGERS - Neg. A$120,000 + relocation.

The Australian Artificial Intelligence Institute (AAII)
is seeking one or more Product Development Managers to
manage the development of products for commercial, banking
and finance, telecommunications, aviation and other industries.
Immediate priorities are the commercial development of a business
process management product (ideally suited to single-point customer
service environments) and an air traffic management system.

Reporting to the MD, you will be responsible for managing technical
resources to ensure the product is taken to the market. This will
involve managing the technical interface with external organisations,
leading product development teams, and ultimately delivering agreed product
functionality and quality within time and cost budgets.

AAII is seeking world-class people to work on exciting and
innovative projects. You must have a software engineering background
with product development experience, a strong commercial focus, broad
vision, and demonstrate experience in assembling and managing a team to
ensure commercial success. AAII is pre-eminent in Australia
and has well-known local and international business and government
shareholders. Established for more than six years, it employs some of the
best researchers in the world and is now looking to capitalise on major
commercial opportunities. It currently has a strong portfolio of
strategically valuable, knowledge-based systems suited to real-time and
distributed environments.

Written applications, including a current resume and names of two referees,
should be forwarded to the address shown below. Alternatively, you are welcome
to email your application to: pdm@aaii.oz.au.

All applications will be treated in strictest confidence.

        Level 6, 171 La Trobe Street,
        Melbourne 3000,
        Australia.

Subject: SRI/Software/Systems Architecture in Speech Recognition
Date: Tue Sep 06 14:49:32 EDT 1994
Organization: SRI International
From: staffing@sri.com (Staff Recruiting)

The Speech Technology and Research (STAR) Laboratory at SRI International
is currently seeking applicants for a Software/Systems Architect position.
 You will be responsible for the architecture, evolution, and maintenance
of SRI's DECIPHER (TM) Speech Recognition System.  You will provide
software engineering leadership for a team of engineers and speech
researchers.  Expertise required in Unix software development, specifically
on the Sun SunOS/Solaris, SGI IRIX, and DEC ALPHA OSF/1 platforms.  Mastery
of C and C++ required. Experience in speech recognition and/or digital
signal processing preferred.  Experience using other Unix and microcomputer
platforms a plus.  Requires a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science plus
5-10 years experience in large-scale software development.  Master's degree
a plus.

The STAR Laboratory has a staff of about 25, including engineers, computer
scientists, and linguists, offering a fine balance of the skills required
for leading-edge speech technology development: signal processing,
phonetics/phonology, mathematical modeling, and software engineering.  The
staff represents expertise and fluency in many foreign languages.

The STAR Laboratory maintains substantial facilities including about 70
networked UNIX workstations, digital signal processing hardware, signal
processing software tools, digital telephone interface capability, and
audio data capture, archival, and playback equipment.

If you are interested in the above position please forward your resume to :

Subject: C++/Oracle/Mac Positions - LA/Lake Tahoe
From: "RRA" <p00801@psilink.com>
Date: Wed Sep 07 17:04:37 EDT 1994
Organization: Rohn Rogers Associates

RRA, a major NYC consulting company, currently has full-time openings in
Los Angeles, to relocate to Lake Tahoe, Neveda.

2 Lead Engineers
Experience should include a solid grounding in OOA, OOD, C++ and Windows as
well as proven project management experience.  Experience with Oracle,
PowerBuilder, or statistical analyses would be a plus. Salary is $70-90K
depending on experience.  These two people would be resposible for a team
of 5 other more junior people.  They need to be able to handle daily project
management with minimum intervention by management (approx 1/2 day per week).
This project is estimated at 2 years development time.  We wish to move the
project up to Tahoe as soon as possible, but these two people will have some
input as to when (not if) that move occurs.  These individuals should expect
10-15 days of travel per month during the Analysis phase of subsequent
projects.

5 Junior Windows Developers
Experience should include solid C++ and Windows programming experience.
Experience with Oracle, SQL, or statistical analysis would be a plus.  Salary
ranges are estimated at 35-65K depending on experience.

1 Windows/Mac Developer
Experience should include solid C++ and Windows programming experience.  In
addition some Macintosh programming experience is required.  This person
would be spending half of their time developing a commercial project targeted
at low cost home users in Windows, and the other half maintaining an existing
Macintosh program and supporting its users.  This individual will obviously
need strong communication and support skills.  It is anticipated that this
project will be moved to Tahoe in the Summer of 1995.

1 Macintosh Developer
Experience should include a solid grounding in object-oriented software
development on the Macintosh, excellent C++ skills, and be well versed in the
Apple Human Interface Guidelines.  Experience with Genetic Algorithms,
ODBMS's, and Neural Networks would be a plus.  This person will be joining an
existing team of 2 other Developers.  This is the first project to be moved

Subject: fwd: Job in mathematical/computational linguistics 


	  POSITION IN MATHEMATICAL/COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS
		       CITI -- Montreal, Canada


The Center for Information Technology Innovation (CITI), a research
laboratory of the Canadian Department of Industry, invites
applications for a position as research scientist in mathematical and
computational linguistics.


DUTIES: Work in close cooperation with the other members of the CITI's
machine-assisted translation team in developing new techniques in
machine-assisted translation. The team includes computer scientists,
linguists and translators. More specifically, the employee will be
expected:

      1) to play a key role in the development of abstract translation
      models of the translation process, especially with respect to
      their mathematical and computational properties. The relevant
      models range from classical rule-based linguistic models (ex:
      unification grammars) to stochastic models (ex: Hidden Markov
      Models), and are meant to provide the foundation for the
      development of a new generation of translation support tools;

      2) to participate in the implementation and testing of these
      models as they are embodied in tools designed to perform tasks
      such as automatic translation checking, automatic transcription
      of spoken translations and, in the longer term, automatic
      translation of simple texts.

      3) publish the results of his/her research; monitor the relevant
      literature. 


REQUIREMENTS: Applicants should have a Ph.D. in applied mathematics or
computer science or possess a proven track record of high-quality
research in these areas.  Some previous research experience in
computational linguistics would be an important asset, as would
experience in computer programming using languages such as C, Lisp and
Prolog . While a good knowledge of both French and English would be
desirable, an excellent knowledge of either language would be
sufficient.


TERMS: The position is open for an initial term of three years with
the possibility of renewal. The CITI is located in Laval, a suburb of
Montreal. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications, as assessed
by a ministerial committee responsible for the evaluation of research
scientists. Priority will be given to Canadian citizens, but all
applications will be considered.


Applicants should send a detailed resume before October 1, 1994 to:

	Pierre Isabelle
	Program Head, Machine-assisted translation
	CITI
	1575 Chomedey Blvd., Laval
	Quebec, Canada, H7V 2X2

	e-mail: isabelle@citi.doc.ca
	fax: (514) 973-5757

3

From: albert@bastille.ilog.fr (Patrick Albert)
Organization: ILOG S.A., Gentilly, France
Date: Fri Sep 09 05:20:41 EDT 1994


ILOG S.A., Gentilly, France (99 meters south of Paris), invite
applications for a Research and Development position in the area
of CONSTRAINT-BASED SCHEDULING.

The job will involve participation in a project currently starting at
ILOG, aimed at providing a generic Object Oriented framework for
interactive, distributed scheduling, based upon ILOG SCHEDULE.

ILOG SCHEDULE is an add-on to the generic C++ library for constraint
based programming ILOG SOLVER.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in constraint-based
programming as well as significant experience in one or more of the
following areas:

      * application of constraint propagation techniques to actual
        planning, scheduling and/or resource allocation problems;

      * interactive, mixed initiative scheduling;

      * distributed computing.

The job requires programming experience in C/C++.
French speaking is not mandatory, but will have to be learned.

To apply, please send a cover letter and Curriculum Vitae by regular
or electronic mail to:

        Patrick Albert
        V.P. of R&D
        ILOG S.A.
        2 Avenue Gallieni - BP 85
        94253 Gentilly France

POSITION IN INTELLIGENT LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS/ADAPTIVE INTERFACES
CITI -- Montreal, Canada

The Centre for Information Technology Innovation (CITI), a research
laboratory of the Canadian Department of Industry, invites applications
for a position as research scientist in intelligent learning
environments and intelligent job aids (performance support systems).

DUTIES:  to work in close cooperation with team members in the
Performance Support Systems group at CITI to develop new technologies
in job and learning aids.  The team includes computer scientists,
knowledge engineers, cognitive ergonomists, and educational
technologists.  More specifically, the employee will be expected:

        1) to play a key role in the research and development of models of
assistance
        for job aids and intelligent learning environments.

        2) to participate in the implementation and testing of these models by

        applying them to the development of computer-based tools and
applications
        for performance support systems.  Components may include simulations,
        electronic libraries, intelligent agents, knowledge-based advisors
and,
        in the longer term, adaptive interfaces and adaptive learning
environments.

        3)  to publish the results of their research and to monitor relevant
        literature in the domain.

REQUIREMENTS:  Applicants should have a Ph.D. in Natural Sciences
(Biological Science, Medical Science, Physical Science, Mathematical
Science, Computer Science or Engineering) or a proven track record of
high-quality research in these areas.  Some previous research
experience in artificial intelligence and user modeling, while not a
prerequisite,  would be a definite asset.  A good knowledge of both
French and English is desirable but an excellent proficiency in either
language is sufficient.

TERMS:  The position is for an initial term of three years with the
possibility of renewal.  CITI is located in Laval, a suburb of
Montreal.  Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and will be
assessed by a ministerial committee responsable for the evaluation of
research scientists.  Priority will be given to Canadian citizens, but
all applications will be considered.

From: LSLynn@oracle.com (Larry Lynn)
Subject: Oracle-development, support, consultant, managerial positions available
Date: Tue Sep 13 20:08:40 EDT 1994
Organization: Oracle Corporation, Redwood Shores, CA

Mostly Redwood Shores, California, feel free to inquire further.

  Oracle Corporation plans to hire over 1,000 more people in this FY
which runs through May, '95. In addition, to the positions listed below
we need experienced sales and administration people. We currently have
positions in virtually every division. Please apply in any of the
following ways.

            E-mail your resume to LSLynn@Oracle.com (straight ASCII please)
            FAX to  415+506-7732 or 415+506-1073
            US MAIL to : Larry Lynn
                         Oracle Corporation
                         500 Oracle Parkway
                         Redwood Shores , Calif.  94065


SOFTWARE DEVELOPERS:
               Developers at Oracle are given the opportunity to design,
code, build, and test a wide variety of products. Oracle products range
from relational database management systems to tools, 4th generation
programming languages, networks, and a variety of applications--Oracle
offers total systems solutions. We use innovative technology, including
object-oriented programming, windows, bit-mapped graphics, expert
systems, artificial intelligence, and advanced programming languages to
develop our products. Since Oracle products are ported to over 100
machine environments, our developers often have the opportunity to gain
experience working with a wide range of hardware and operating
systems. Developers work on Macs, work stations, minicomputers,
super-minis, and mainframes. We are also dedicating significant
resources to massively parallel computers.

If the opportunity to explore an enormous variety of cutting-edge
projects using state-of-the-art machines appeals to you, then you should
talk to us.

WORLDWIDE SUPPORT ANALYSTS:

                        Oracle's technical support team ensures that our
customers worldwide are able to use Oracle products to their full
potential.  Because our support team needs to be well versed in the
entire range of Oracle products, they are involved in ongoing intensive
training. In addition to their superb technical skills, our support
professionals possess excellent interpersonal skills.

A position in Worldwide Support is one for problem solvers. Our
technical support team tests and analyzes each product before our
customers ever see them. Then, once our product is installed on a
customer site, they must often deliver a detailed analysis and working
solution to our clients' problems under strict time constraints. Our
support division is the final piece of Oracle's total systems solution.

CONSULTANTS:
              Oracle Consultants provide expertise in customizing Oracle
products to meet the specific needs of clients in various industries. In
addition, our consultants often find themselves in the roles of teacher
and advisor for our customers. Currently, we have Consultants working on
state-of-the-art software systems used in everything from computer
integrated manufacturing, to fighting heart disease, to ensuring
astronaut safety in space. Our Consultants take on significant
responsibilities; the systems that we install are often critical to our
clients' business success, and our Consultants are responsible for the
final customization and implementation of those systems.

PRODUCT MANAGERS:
                Oracle Product Managers are the creative force behind
our products. They work in conjunction with our developers, salespeople,
and customers to design and position our products in the
marketplace. Each Product Manager is responsible for a specific Oracle
product, taking it from design through development and beyond. Because
Oracle continues to develop a wide spectrum of products including the
ORACLE RDBMS, networking, development tools, and applications, there are
a variety of select Product Manager opportunities.

Superb technical skills, creativity and foresight are the "trademarks"
of Oracle Product Managers.

+         Mosaic
Organization: NASA/ARC Information Sciences Division
Date: Wed Sep 14 21:47:59 EDT 1994


                                 RECOM TECHNOLOGIES
                  Principal Investigator-in-a-Box Project
 APPLICATION PROGRAMMER POSITION AT NASA AMES RESEARCH CENTER

Position: Software Engineer / Systems Analyst / Programmer

Location: NASA Ames Research Center, Moffett Field, CA

Computer programmer needed to design and implement complex space science
support software using integrated commercial off-the-shelf applications.
Initial programming tasks will involve upgrading the existing system to use
current versions of LabVIEW (National Instruments), HyperCard (Claris) and
CLIPS (NASA) on the Macintosh platform. As the project evolves, migration to
a RISC-based platform is likely. Programming in C, Lisp, CLIPS and LabVIEW
will then be required. The user interface will be developed under X or Motif.
Whether on the Macintosh or the RISC-based platform, rapid prototyping will
first be required. As the user requirements crystallize, flight-qualified
software will be developed. Therefore, the candidate must be able to produce
robust, well-documented code quickly. Good communications skills are required
to interface to various NASA personnel as well as outside scientists,
hardware manufacturers, software vendors, contractors, etc. The candidate
will also be responsible for design and development of Mosaic project
presentation, possibly extending to other space science aspects.

The ideal candidate is a strong programmer with diverse experience on the Mac
and some UNIX environment. Experience developing in some of LabVIEW, CLIPS,
HyperCard, C, Lisp, X, Motif, Mosaic required.

Note: This is a contractor position, not a civil servant position. Green Card
or US citizenship is required.

Please send resume to

Dr. Stephen A. Lesh
Recom Technologies
Mail Stop 269-1
NASA Ames Research Center
Moffett Field, CA 94035-1000

or via email

lesh@ptolemy.arc.nasa.gov

+        programmer levels
Keywords: HCI, user interfaces, data visualization, AI
Organization: School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon
Date: Fri Sep 16 17:24:54 EDT 1994

The SAGE project at the  School of Computer Science, Carnegie-Mellon
University has openings for immediate employment at the following levels:

1. Post Doc and research faculty
2. Senior research programmer (roughly MS or 6 years job experience)
3. Research programmer (roughly BS level or 1-3 years experience)

Candidates should have training in computer science or related areas, but
a strong interest in human-computer interaction and substantial experience
in the design of human computer interfaces is required.  Additional experience
in either of the following would also be desirable.

- data visualization (computer graphics for displaying data) or data
   exploration and manipulation environments
- AI planning systems

The SAGE project is concerned with:
- the development of knowledge-based data graphic generation
(data visualization) systems, especially for combinations of diverse
relational,  quantitative, geographic, temporal and other information

- integration of text generation and graphics generation systems to create
 coordinated multi-media explanations of these large data sets,

- development of novel data visualization and direct manipulation interfaces
for data exploration, search, and analysis.

If interested, please send (ASCII email preferred) resume, description of
your interests, references, and related information to:

School of Computer Science

Carnegie-Mellon University

Data Integration Research Programmer

There's got to be more to cruising the information highway than 500
 interactive channels of bad movies and cubic zirconia shopping.  If you
can come up with creative ways to  use  bandwidth in the business world, you
 may be interested in our job opening at the Price Waterhouse Technology
Centre in Menlo Park, CA.  There is tremendous potential for knowledge-based
tools  that filter and transform gigabytes of corporate data to meet business
information needs. We'd like to hire a Research Programmer who wants to help
us incorporate text processing, database integration, and machine learning
techniques into usable systems that run on PC-compatibles.  Familiarity with
Prolog, C, SQL, and parsing  techniques essential; must also know or at least
be willing to work with rapid protoyping tools in Microsoft Windows. Strong
programming abilities are required, along with the interpersonal skills to
converse with domain experts and users who are not technology specialists. A
master's degree in computer science or closely related field is preferred. The
position is full-time with competitive salary and benefits.  The work
environment is a small but growing rearch and development group backed by the
stability of a Big Six accounting firm.

Interested candidates should send resumes to:

Human Resources
Price Waterhouse World Firm Services Technology Centre, BV
68 Willow Rd.
Menlo Park, CA  94025

Organization: Human Communication Research Centre
Date: Fri Sep 23 09:16:57 EDT 1994

        RESEARCH FELLOW IN NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING R&D

The Human Communication Research Centre at the University of Edinburgh
wishes to hire an experienced researcher with expertise in bringing
together rule-based and statistical approaches to natural language
processing. Applicants should have a strong track record of research
in this area, and a willingness to initiate and manage projects which
develop and apply hybrid technologies for language engineering. An
interest in collaborating with our ongoing work on human sentence
processing would also be desirable.

The ideal candidate will hold a PhD degree in Computer Science,
Artificial Intelligence, Linguistics, Cognitive Science or a related
discipline and will have experience in the development and
implementation of state-of-the-art natural language processing
algorithms.

The successful candidate will be hired on the Grade 1A or Grade 2
researcher scale (up to 25,735 pounds/annum), depending on age and
experience. The post is funded for a period of three years
initially, starting in April 1995 or as soon as possible thereafter.

Candidates should send a copy of their CV, a statement of past and present
research interests and work experience, and the names of two referees
before October 20th to
        The University of Edinburgh
        Personnel Office
        1, Roxburgh Street
        Edinburgh EH8 9TB
quoting reference 490453.

also be retrieved from ftp://ftp.cogsci.ed.ac.uk/pub/jobs:

From: research@netcom.com (Michaelle Fields)
Date: Wed Sep 21 15:12:22 EDT 1994

Speech Engineer

First Byte is soliciting applications for the position of
Speech Engineer. The successful candidate will have the
responsibility of steering the future technical direction
of First Byte's technology.  In addition to investigating
general directions for our product development plans, the
candidate will work with our staff of linguists and
engineers to develop tools in support of our principle
mission of creating the finest speech technology
available.

The successful candidate should have a strong digital
signal processing background with skills in the
application of DSP to speech synthisis, speech
recognition or speech coding; speech production or
perception; acoustic phonetics; language modelling;
speech compression; statistical pattern classification;
robust speech processing in the presence of noise. Strong
software engineering skills are a must as is familiarity
with Windows, Macintosh and/or Unix programming. We
expect the candidate to have a Ph.D. degree with
extensive lab experience or a technical MS degree with
2-4 years relevant work experience.

First Byte was founded in 1982 specifically for the
purpose of developing and marketing text-to-speech
synthesis products to the then emerging micro-computer
market. At this point we are the largest vendor of
text-to-speech synthesizers in the world, with an
installed base exceeding 8 million units.  We currently
offer competitively priced solutions for systems ranging
from multi-CPU, multi-DSP telephony systems to all
popular desktop systems to handheld dictionary
products. First Byte is located in Torrance, California,
a community just south of Los Angeles.

Salary will be commensurate with qualifications and
experience. First Byte offers an attractive benefits and
compensation package.

Address Inquiries, Resumes/Supporting Materials to:

First Byte
Attn: David Seifert
19840 Pioneer Ave.
Torrance, CA 90503

email: dseifert@firstbyte.ccmail.compuserve.com

                            Opportunity:
                KNOWLEDGE-BASED SOFTWARE ENGINEERING 
                         R&D AT GTE LABS

R&D in knowledge-based tools supporting process re-engineering and
systems analysis.  The job will involve design, development and
deployment of robust field prototype involving significant use of
AI techniques.  A prototype modeling environment, built in Lisp
and KEE and making heavy use of knowledge representation and
reasoning techniques, needs an extra set of hands to enhance,
improve and shepherd through technology transfer opportunities. 

The employee will work with the existing staff of the Requirements
Engineering project in their research activities.  Initially, the
position is short-term, 3-4 months as a contractor/consultant, with
strong possibility of extension, and some possibility of conversion
into permanent position.

Need someone immediately. Seems there should be good candidates
in the Boston area who are able and ready.

   - MS in Computer Science required.  Ph.D. and an emphasis on 
     Software Engineering and/or AI preferred.

     systems, and user-interfaces. Prior use of KEE a strong plus,

     software engineering issues and beyond the specific platform.

                            Opportunity:
[My apologies if this is being sent to you more than once--I am getting
lots of indications from mail servers that this message isn't getting
through. So, here goes again. -- S. Greenspan]


                KNOWLEDGE-BASED SOFTWARE ENGINEERING 
                         R&D AT GTE LABS

R&D in knowledge-based tools supporting process re-engineering and
systems analysis.  The job will involve design, development and
deployment of robust field prototype involving significant use of
AI techniques.  A prototype modeling environment, built in Lisp
and KEE and making heavy use of knowledge representation and
reasoning techniques, needs an extra set of hands to enhance,
improve and shepherd through technology transfer opportunities. 

The employee will work with the existing staff of the Requirements
Engineering project in their research activities.  Initially, the
position is short-term, 3-4 months as a contractor/consultant, with
strong possibility of extension, and some possibility of conversion
into permanent position.

Need someone immediately. Seems there should be good candidates
in the Boston area who are able and ready. 

Qualifications:

   - MS in Computer Science required.  Ph.D. and an emphasis on 
     Software Engineering and/or AI preferred.

   - Need significant programming skills in Lisp, knowledge-based 
     systems, and user-interfaces. Prior use of KEE a strong plus,
     but also need deeper understanding of knowledge-based and 
     software engineering issues and beyond the specific platform.

Please send resume (e-mail preferred) to:

 Sol Greenspan 
 GTE Laboratories Incorporated
 40 Sylvan Road 
 Waltham, MA 02254      
 e-mail: greenspan@gte.com
 fax: (617) 890-9320

From: mccree@csc.ti.com (Alan McCree)
Date: Wed Sep 28 12:41:31 EDT 1994
Organization: Texas Instruments


                JOB ANNOUNCEMENT - SPEECH CODING POSITION

        The Systems and Information Science Laboratory, part of Texas
Instruments' Corporate Research in Dallas, Texas, is seeking a candidate with
the following qualifications:

o       Ph.D. in EE or equivalently MS in EE with 2-3 years of experience

o       Strong background and experience in speech coding methods, especially
        Code Excited Linear Prediction

o       Strong background in Digital Signal Processing theory & applications

o       C/Unix programming experience

o       Interest in working on speech coding algorithms for applications such
        as digital cellular telephone, digital telephone answering machine,
        and low-complexity speech and sound-effect synthesis

o       Knowledge and experience in one or more of the following will be a
        plus: programming experience on a floating-point or a fixed-point DSP
        microprocessor, forward error correction, and vector quantization.


        If you have these qualifications and are looking for a challenging
R&D position, please send a copy of your resume to:

        Dr. Vishu Viswanathan
        Texas Instruments
        PO Box 655474, Mail Stop 238
        Dallas, TX 75265

        Fax: (214)995-8600
        e-mail: vishu@csc.ti.com

SUMMARY  : Must have a minimum of 5-15 yrs. (non-academic) experience in
           detailed design and/or integration.  Experience in

           accommodation isolation, and data storage.  Experience with

           (FDIR), and signature analysis.  Experience in writing
           detailed specifications for software implementation.
           Aerospace/aircraft industry experience and ability to see
           the "big picture" essential.

From: rjn@rdaneel.predict.com (Jim Nusbaum)
Subject: ENGINEERING & OPS STAFF @ PREDICTION COMPANY, SANTA FE, NM, USA
Date: Tue Sep 27 16:54:51 EDT 1994

OPERATIONS AND ENGINEERING STAFF

September 27, 1994
Prediction Company

Prediction Company is a small (currently ~12 people) Santa Fe, NM
based startup firm utilizing nonlinear forecasting technologies for
prediction and computerized trading of derivative financial
instruments. The senior technical founders of the firm are Doyne
Farmer and Norman Packard, who have worked for over ten years in the
fields of chaos theory and nonlinear dynamics. The technical staff
includes other senior researchers in the field. The company has the
backing of a major technically based trading firm and their partner, a
major European bank.

The Prediction Company computing environment consists of 14 Sun
Workstations and servers (SS2s, SS5s and SS10s), 8 PCs (486/66 and
Pentium) and various pieces of communications and networking gear.  We
maintain a telecommuting environment with multiple dialup lines and
the ability to run SLIP, PPP or serial X protocols over dialup
connections.  Our main development language is C++, with Perl, Tcl,
Splus and SQL being used where appropriate.

The openings described below offer a unique opportunity to get in on
the ground floor of something big.  Prediction Company is structured
as an S corporation with direct profit flow to stock holders.  All
positions include a stock options grant which will give the employee
the opportunity to reap the benefits of Prediction Company's success.
We are seeking to build a high-powered and flexible team of
scientists, engineers and domain specialists to conquer this new area
of financial engineering.

Prediction Company offers a relaxed and informal work environment.  We
are located in a converted studio on the top floor of a building in
the Guadalupe commercial district.  Our offices include a full
kitchen, shower and roof deck.  We are within easy walking distance of
many cafes, restaurants and the historical central plaza of Santa Fe.
Prediction Company does NOT have the hectic pace or high pressure of
conventional Wall Street investment firms and Santa Fe is definitely
not New York or Chicago.

Santa Fe is an almost 400 year old city (settled in 1605, one
of the oldest in the country) of ~60,000 people with a wealth of
cultural and recreational opportunities.  Known as a center for the
visual arts, Santa Fe is host to many festivals and exhibitions.
Located at 7000 feet elevation in the foothills of the Sangre De
Cristo mountains in northern New Mexico, Santa Fe has an abundance of
outdoor diversions.  Biking, hiking, camping, rock climbing, fossil
hunting and skiing (within 45 minutes at Ski Santa Fe and 90 minutes
at Taos Ski Basin) are all possible within a short drive.


Software Engineer - Research Support
------------------------------------
The job responsibilities include supporting a research group by
building, evaluating, installing and maintaining tools, class
libraries and software systems.  Prediction Company is building a
state of the art platform for model development and this person will
be a key player in that effort.  The successful candidate for this
position will have an advanced engineering or science degree, a math
background, broad experience in specifying, designing and implementing
software systems and significant experience with C++ and other
object-oriented languages and systems.  The ideal candidates will have
experience with simulation and modeling systems, mathematical or
scientific programming, neural networks, genetic algorithms and/or
Splus.  The ability to communicate well with PhD. level research staff
is required.


US or Canadian Citizenship required, or US Permanent Residency.  We
are unable to assist persons requiring H-1 or F-1 Visas.


Applicants should US mail resumes to:

Prediction Company
320 Aztec Street, Suite B
Santa Fe, NM 87501
attn: recruiting

or email them to Laura Barela at laura@predict.com (postscript or ascii)
--
Jim Nusbaum              Prediction Company     rjn@predict.com
320 Aztec Street, Suite B               505-984-3123 Voice
Santa Fe, New Mexico  87501             505-983-0571 Fax

From:  Online Career Ctr <occ@nero.aa.msen.com>
Subject: MS-Windows Software Engineer-Oxford Computer-CT
Date: Fri Sep 30 23:51:56 EDT 1994
Organization: Msen, Inc. -- Ann Arbor, MI (account info: +1 313 998-4562)


Work Description
Work under the direction of senior engineering staff to create
user-friendly programs with a graphical user interface that are written
in Visual C++ or Visual Basic and run under Microsoft Windows on an
IBM-compatible PC.  Programs are required to fill many needs, including:
(1) development of an assembler, compiler, debugger, and simulator, and
signal processing and neural network run-time libraries, for use with our
parallel digital signal processor chips, and (2) development of software
tools and graphical user interfaces to help customers test, evaluate, and
develop applications for our parallel digital signal processor chips.

Educational Requirements
Master of Science in Computer Science (MSCS).

Experience Requirements
Extensive programming of applications, graphical user interfaces and
dynamic link libraries (DLLs) that run under Microsoft Windows 3.1 is
mandatory.  The programming may be in an academic and/or commercial
setting.  Hands-on experience and proficiency with programming and
creating tools and applications for parallel processors is highly
desirable.  The candidate must take responsibility, be self-motivated, be
quick to learn, have excellent communications skills, be financially
responsible, willing to work extra hours, able to take instructions, meet
deadlines and work under pressure, and have a professional work attitude.

Citizenship Requirements
Candidates must be legally able to work in the U.S.

Other Information
Position is available immediately.  Must pay own relocation.  Great
medical benefits provided.

Contact Information
Send a resume, salary history and salary requirements to the address
given below, Attn: Human Resources.  Submission of ASCII files by e-mail
is preferred; do NOT e-mail Postcript files.

Oxford Computer, Inc. 39 Old Good Hill Road, Oxford, CT 06478 USA
Tel: 203-881-0891 Fax: 203-888-1146
Product Information Fax-back: 203-881-9391
E-mail: oxfordcomput@delphi.com

Subject: fwd: AI, Multimedia, Network Technology applied to education

M.S. Level programming position; 
AI, multimedia, & network technology applied to education;
LRDC, U.Pitt., Pittsburgh PA.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Summary Position Description: 

"Programmer Analyst II", full time, 1 year position with possible renewal.
NSF funded project: Alan Lesgold, Dan Suthers, and Arlene Weiner principle
investigators. Supervised by Dan Suthers. Individual will design, implement,
and test modules of an interface for a scientific argumentation learning
environment.  Work will involve writing Common LISP applications in Unix and
Macintosh environments.  Will work closely with project members, including
computer scientists, educators, and psychologists, to coordinate efforts and
evaluate the effectiveness of the software with public school students.  Prior
experience with Common LISP is essential.  Experience in interface
programming, artificial intelligence applications, HTML, and/or network
communications is highly desirable.

Minimum Knowledge/Education: M.S. in Computer Science or similar.

Minimum Experience Level: Successful participation in a substantial
software project (preferably on the order of several thousand lines of
code or more).  Artificial intelligence programming experience.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Duties, responsiblities, performance standards, and percentages of time:

 PROGRAMMING. Percentage: 60
 Individual will design, implement, test, and maintain modules of a scientific
argumentation learning environment.  Work may include implementation and
mantenance of:
 (1) An editing and browsing interface for displaying scientific theories
     and arguments concerning these theories in both graphical and textual
     forms.
 (2) Application-specific knowledge representation and reasoning utilities.
 (3) Explanation, coaching, and tutoring modules making use of the above.
 (4) Tools for use by other project members, including database
     construction and editors for explanation, tutoring, or coaching
     strategies. 
 (5) Network communications between multiple users of the software.
 (6) Access to and display of multimedia resources obtained from WWW.
 Related Performance Standard: Be able to manage one's own software
development activites such that prototype modules and subsequent improvements
are available when they are needed for testing by other project members.
Prioritize tasks and identify and discuss potential problems before they
impact on delivery deadlines.

 PLANNING. Percentage: 15
 Meet with project members to design the software and coordinate work with
other aspects of the project.
 Related Performance Standard: Ability to interact well with project members
from diverse backgrounds.  Sufficient understanding of software design
techniques and project goals to contribute to planning and design.

 USER SUPPORT. Percentage: 15
 Assist project members, teachers and students in learning to use the
software, handling errors, etc.

 DOCUMENTATION AND WRITING. Percentage: 10
 Code must be well documented. May be asked to write short reports on the
status, design, implementation, and testing of code.
 Related Performance Standard: Basic familiarity with word processing software
and willingness to learn new word processor. Ability to write clear, concise
documentation.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Further Comments:

For someone interested in AI, CAI/ITS, HCI, CSCW, and similar fields and
looking for on-the-job experience programming relevant applications, we can
offer a diverse programming experience and contact with established
researchers.  Programming will involve use of Common LISP, CLOS (Common Lisp
Object System), CLIM (Common Lisp Interface Manager), LOOM (a knowledge
representation language), and HTML (HyperText Markup Language) in Unix/Lucid
and Macintosh/MCL environments.  Software will be portable between these
environments.  In both environments, multimedia resources will be managed and
displayed as needed.  In the Unix environment, tools for network communication
between multiple users of the software will be maintained. Prior experience in
Common LISP is essential.  Persons who have demonstrated the ability to learn
new software environments on their ownexperience with all of the other software.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Contacts:

Send queries and applications to:

                Dan Suthers
                suthers+@pitt.edu
   


M.S. Level programming position; 
AI, multimedia, & network technology applied to education;
LRDC, U.Pitt., Pittsburgh PA.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Summary Position Description: 

"Programmer Analyst II", full time, 1 year position with possible renewal.
NSF funded project: Alan Lesgold, Dan Suthers, and Arlene Weiner principle
investigators. Supervised by Dan Suthers. Individual will design, implement,
and test modules of an interface for a scientific argumentation learning
environment.  Work will involve writing Common LISP applications in Unix and
Macintosh environments.  Will work closely with project members, including
computer scientists, educators, and psychologists, to coordinate efforts and
evaluate the effectiveness of the software with public school students.  Prior
experience with Common LISP is essential.  Experience in interface
programming, artificial intelligence applications, HTML, and/or network
communications is highly desirable.

Minimum Knowledge/Education: M.S. in Computer Science or similar.

Minimum Experience Level: Successful participation in a substantial
software project (preferably on the order of several thousand lines of
code or more).  Artificial intelligence programming experience.

- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Duties, responsiblities, performance standards, and percentages of time:

 PROGRAMMING. Percentage: 60
 Individual will design, implement, test, and maintain modules of a scientific
argumentation learning environment.  Work may include implementation and
mantenance of:
 (1) An editing and browsing interface for displaying scientific theories
     and arguments concerning these theories in both graphical and textual
     forms.
 (2) Application-specific knowledge representation and reasoning utilities.
 (3) Explanation, coaching, and tutoring modules making use of the above.
 (4) Tools for use by other project members, including database
     construction and editors for explanation, tutoring, or coaching
     strategies. 
 (5) Network communications between multiple users of the software.
 (6) Access to and display of multimedia resources obtained from WWW.
 Related Performance Standard: Be able to manage one's own software
development activites such that prototype modules and subsequent improvements
are available when they are needed for testing by other project members.
Prioritize tasks and identify and discuss potential problems before they
impact on delivery deadlines.

 PLANNING. Percentage: 15
 Meet with project members to design the software and coordinate work with
other aspects of the project.
 Related Performance Standard: Ability to interact well with project members
from diverse backgrounds.  Sufficient understanding of software design
techniques and project goals to contribute to planning and design.

 USER SUPPORT. Percentage: 15
 Assist project members, teachers and students in learning to use the
software, handling errors, etc.

 DOCUMENTATION AND WRITING. Percentage: 10
 Code must be well documented. May be asked to write short reports on the
status, design, implementation, and testing of code.
 Related Performance Standard: Basic familiarity with word processing software
and willingness to learn new word processor. Ability to write clear, concise
documentation.

- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Further Comments:

For someone interested in AI, CAI/ITS, HCI, CSCW, and similar fields and
looking for on-the-job experience programming relevant applications, we can
offer a diverse programming experience and contact with established
researchers.  Programming will involve use of Common LISP, CLOS (Common Lisp
Object System), CLIM (Common Lisp Interface Manager), LOOM (a knowledge
representation language), and HTML (HyperText Markup Language) in Unix/Lucid
and Macintosh/MCL environments.  Software will be portable between these
environments.  In both environments, multimedia resources will be managed and
displayed as needed.  In the Unix environment, tools for network communication
between multiple users of the software will be maintained. Prior experience in
Common LISP is essential.  Persons who have demonstrated the ability to learn
new software environments on their own initiative need not have prior
experience with all of the other software.

- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Contacts:

Send queries and applications to:

                Dan Suthers
                suthers+@pitt.edu
                412-624-7036

Subject: Software/Customization Engineer - Syracuse, NY
Date: Thu Oct 13 18:21:55 EDT 1994
Organization: Coherent Research, Inc.


Coherent Research, Inc. (CRi) is a company that produces software
products for converting raster images of hand-drafted drawings into
intelligent databases.  The SmartMaps Automated Recognition System is a
leading-edge software product that has been engineered to be
configurable for drawings from power (electric and gas) and
communication utilities to parcel maps.

CRi offers a dynamic environment and challenging work.  Established in 1987,
SmartMaps has become our core product focus, but research continues in the
areas of parallel processing and document understanding.

CRi is currently looking for qualified candidates for both Software Engineer
and Customization Engineer positions.  The successful candidate will have a
positive attitude and good work ethic, as well as:

for the Software Engineer position:

- Experience in software engineering in a product environment
- 2-3 years C/C++ programming experience
- Familiarity with developing in the X-window/OpenLook environment
- Image processing, segmentation, and/or expert system development experience

for the Customization Engineer position:

- Familiarity with the concepts of declarative programming
- 2-3 years programming experience
- Ability to work within the C-Shell environment
- Excellent attention to detail
- Familiarity with gas or electric distribution a plus

Candidates should respond via US Mail to the following address:

        Coherent Research, Inc.
        ATTN: Personnel Dept.
        1 Adler Drive
        E. Syracuse, NY  13057

No phone calls or Email, please.

From: robertg@dcs.shef.ac.uk (Robert John Gaizauskas)
Subject: Researh Posts in Natural Language Engineering
Date: Tue Oct 11 19:05:25 EDT 1994
Organization: Department of Computer Science, University of Sheffield


                        The University of Sheffield
                                England

                       Department of Computer Science

                            TWO RESEARCH POSTS IN
                        NATURAL LANGUAGE ENGINEERING

Two research associate posts are available in the Natural Language research
group from January 1995. These posts are associated with a grant from the
UK Engineering and Physical Science Research Council on 'Large Scale
Information Extraction from Text'. Both appointments will be for 36 months.

Post 1: The candidate will be involved in the development of a general
architecture for text extraction (GATE) which will support the integration,
testing, and enhancement of existing language processing components to produce
evaluable information extraction systems. The candidate should have a strong
background in computational linguistics or artificial intelligence, including
good programming skills, and should have a PhD or equivalent research
experience in a relevant area. The post will be on the UK RA1A scale, with a
starting salary of around 15K pounds p/a.

Post 2: The candidate will be required to liaise with UK and international
research sites to obtain, install and evaluate language processing components,
corpora, and lexical resources in the context of GATE. The candidate should
have a good degree in computer science or related area, with knowledge of
computational linguistics and should have good Unix/Internet skills. The post
will be on the UK RA1B scale, with a starting salary of around 13K pounds p/a.
The candidate may have the opportunity to register for a PhD.

Informal enquiries to Yorick Wilks (y.wilks@dcs.shef.ac.uk) or Rob Gaizauskas
(r.gaizauskas@dcs.shef.ac.uk).

Further particulars from:
        Director of Human Resource Management,
        The University of Sheffield,
        Western Bank,
        Sheffield S10 2TN
        U.K.

        Tel: +44 (0)742 824144

Closing date for applications: 15 October 1994. Ref: B2321.

************************************************************************
MASSACHUSETTS INSTITUTE OF TECHNOLOGY
LABORATORY FOR COMPUTER SCIENCE

POSITION:  Research Specialist - Spoken Language Systems Group
************************************************************************

DESCRIPTION:
Research Specialist for the Spoken Language Systems Group in the
Laboratory for Computer Science to provide research support and perform
various system development, maintenance, and administration duties
critical to the functioning of the group.  Will participate in the
design and implementation of various modules and research tools for
spoken language systems development; modify existing software to
meet the changing needs of the group, port the systems to new
platforms; with heavy emphasis on application programming (20% of
time will be spent on system administration, the other 80% on
application programming).  The researcher will work closely with
other staff involved with this project.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering (or
equivalent); experience in system administration and expertise in
UNIX/C and Lisp.  Knowledge of graphic user interface systems,
speech recognition and natural language systems, and ability to
adapt and maintain large programs are desirable.  The ability to
accept responsibility and to work independently and cooperatively
with others is essential, as are good communication and writing skills.

JOB NO:  94-0676R

letter referencing the job number to:

(4)COMPANY PROFILE

   Matsushita Electric Works, Ltd. (MEW), was started in 1918 to
manufacture wiring devices.  The company then expanded into
electrical construction materials, home appliances, residential
building materials, automation control products, and electronic
materials and components.  MEW today operates in a diverse range
of fields, answering the needs of the residential market as well
as those of office buildings, commercial establishments, and
factories.  And MEW is proud to hold leading positions in all of
its business fields.
   The company slogan, "A&i:  Applying Intelligence for Amenity
Environments," was adopted in 1988 to express MEW's dedication
to developing, manufacturing, and offering hardware and software
products as efficient, integrated systems to create comfortable
environments in which to live and work.
   MEW has 29,345 employees, 34 plants within Japan, 11 overseas
plants, and a sales network encompassing 2,600 agents and 163
sales offices within Japan and 35 overseas.
   MEW is a sister company of Matsushita Electric Industrial
Co., Ltd., which is especially renowned for its top-quality
audiovisual equipment and consumer appliances.


(5)RESEARCH

   Research at MEW is carried out in a group of 12 laboratories:

* Central Research Lab.
* Electromechanical Technology R&D Lab.
* Technology Development Lab./Automation Controls Group
* Semiconductor Development Center
* Electronic Materials and Devices R&D Lab.
* Evaluation and Reliability Technology Center
* Lighting Products R&D Lab.
* Building Products Development Lab.
* Production Engineering Research Lab.
* IBS Research & Development Lab.
* Tokyo Research & Development Lab.
* Home Appliances Technology Development Lab.

The following disciplines are represented in these laboratories:

* Electricity                        * Machinery
* Electronics                        * Chemical Engineering
* Control Technology                 * Chemistry
* Communications                     * Metallurgy
* Instrumental Analysis              * Management Engineering
* Information Engineering            * Architecture
* Systems Engineering                * Design
* Physics                            * Wood Products Fabrication
                                     * Other Sciences


   Thank you very much for your interest in Matsushita Electric
Works, Ltd.


Howard Yamamoto
General Manager
R&D Administration Division
MATSUSHITA ELECTRIC WORKS, LTD.

From: cic@crl.com (Communication Intelligence Corp)
Subject: Character Recognition job in SF Bay area
Date: Wed Oct 19 16:52:42 EDT 1994
Organization: CRL Dialup Internet Access


Communication Intelligence Corporation (CIC) is a leader in handwriting
recognition and other pen input technologies. We currently market
recognizers for English, Western European, and Asian languages on a variety
of platforms (e.g., DOS, Windows, Macintosh, and so on). These systems enable
the pen to serve as the sole input and control device, combining the functions
of both keyboard and mouse, and adding new capabilities.

Advanced development is directed toward integrated discrete/cursive
recognizers, and future integration with voice recognition, OCR, and
similar technologies.

CIC was founded in 1981 in conjunction with SRI International (formerly
Stanford Research Institute).  CIC is headquartered in Redwood Shores,
California, and has an international subsidiary, CIC Japan, Inc., in
Tokyo, Japan.
**** NOTE: please reply only to ostrem@cic.com

**** NOTE: positions are being offered only to those currently
           residing in the US


CIC currently has an immediate opening for the following position:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

POSITION: Researcher/Software Engineer

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

1.  Strong background in statistics, pattern recognition, algorithm development2.  Expert C programmer (at least 3-5 years experience)
3.  3-5 years experience in designing and coding for large software projects
    in a UNIX environment
4.  Good English communication skills and works well with other people.
5.  MS or substantial experience in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering
    or the equivalent

HIGHLY DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

1.  Experience with CHARACTER RECOGNITION, especially handwriting recognition,
    either on-line or off-line (OCR)
2.  Experience working in commercial companies
3.  Experience in Speech Recognition
4.  Linguistic experience (particularly statistical linguistics)

JOB DESCRIPTION

Work with a team of researchers on the next generation of handwriting
recognition systems (both off-line and on-line) for the commercial
market


**** NOTE: CIC's research is proprietary and hence results are NOT published

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Subject: Entry-lvl MS-Windows Software Eng-Oxford Computer-CT
Date: Wed Oct 19 23:50:10 EDT 1994
Organization: Msen, Inc. -- Ann Arbor, MI (account info: +1 313 998-4562)
Work Description
Work under the direction of senior engineering staff to create
user-friendly programs with a graphical user interface that are written
in Visual C++ or Visual Basic and run under Microsoft Windows on an
IBM-compatible PC.  Programs are required to fill many needs, including:
(1) development of an assembler, compiler, debugger, and simulator, and
signal processing and neural network run-time libraries, for use with our
unique, powerful, low-cost, parallel digital signal processor (DSP) chips,
and (2) development of software tools and graphical user interfaces to
help customers test, evaluate, and develop applications for our parallel
digital signal processor chips.

Educational Requirements
Bachelor's or Master of Science in Computer Science (BSCS or MSCS),
or equivalent.

Experience Requirements
Extensive programming of applications, graphical user interfaces and/or
dynamic link libraries (DLLs) that run under Microsoft Windows 3.1 is
mandatory.  The programming may be in an academic and/or commercial
setting.  Hands-on experience and proficiency with programming and
creating tools and applications for parallel processors is a plus.
The candidate must take responsibility, be self-motivated, be
quick to learn, have excellent communications skills, be financially
responsible, willing to work extra hours, able to take instructions, meet
deadlines and work under pressure, and have a professional work attitude.

Citizenship Requirements
Candidates must be legally able to work in the U.S.

Other Information
Position is available immediately.  Must pay own relocation.  Great
medical benefits provided.

Contact Information
Send a resume, salary history and salary requirements to the address
given below, Attn: Human Resources.  Submission of ASCII files by e-mail
is preferred; do NOT e-mail Postcript files.

Tel: 203-881-0891 Fax: 203-888-1146
