COMPUTER/TELECOMMUNICATION SYSTEMS OFFICERS

CENTRAL INTELLIGENCE AGENCY

OFFICE OF INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY


        The Central Intelligence Agency is responsible for collecting
researching, and analyzing foreign intelligence information senior
officials of our government use to make informed decisions necessary to
maintain national security.  The Office of Information Technology (OIT)
operates one of the world's largest and most technologically advanced
computer installations.  OIT is responsible for the Agency's Washington
area communications network and serves the Agency's information
technology needs.

        Our computer/telecommunications professionals face some of the
toughest information processing challenges in the industry.  At the
present time we are specifically searching for those unique individuals
who wish to be involved in all aspects of Local Area Networks to include
LAN configuration, LAN engineering, product evaluation, performance
analysis, interoperability of LAN systems, and application programming in
the LAN environment.  The CIA has a very complex network environment and
we continue to upgrade our LAN's with the latest hardware and software
products.  Our supported products include IBM LAN Server, Novell Netware,
Microsoft LAN Manager, UNIX, Token-Ring, Ethernet, and a host of
infrastructure hardware.  IBM PS/2s, DELL, COMPAQ, SUN and MACINTOSH are
included in a long list of personal computers.  As technology changes,
our biggest challenge is to ensure the interoperability of new products
in our environment.  Our requirements demand initiative, curiosity,
creativity, integrity, and technical excellence.

        Our computer/telecommunications professionals have the
opportunity to work in a variety of disciplines with a variety of
state-of-the-art equipment including IBM, DEC, and the CRAY
supercomputer.  Opportunities exist in other areas including:

+ Computer Systems Architecture        + Database Management Systems
+ Data and/or Voice Communications     + Artificial Intelligence
+ Computer Switching                   + Intelligent, Knowledge-
                                          Based Systems
+ Performance Timing, Simulation       + Commercial Product
   and Modeling                           Evaluations
+ Message Switching                    + Graphic Systems
+ Network and Teleprocessing           + System Project Management
   Systems
+ Operating Systems                    + Testing and Evaluation
+ Hardware/Software Integration        + Data Network Architecture
+ Computer Security                    + Network Management
   Systems
+ Computer Networking                  + Telephone Switching
                                          Systems/Network
+ Local Area Networks                  + Systems Integration
+ Packet Switched Networks             + Video Distribution Systems
+ Work-Group Computing

        QUALIFICATIONS:  The successful OIT applicant will have a
bachelor's degree in Computer Science.  The GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0
scale is desirable.  An MS degree in desirable, as is experience in any
of the technical areas mentioned above.

        All applicants must be U.S. citizens an meet CIA's stringent
security, medical, and personnel standards, including a polygraph
examination.

        BENEFITS:  Starting salaries are competitive and range from
$31,000 to $52,000 depending on qualifications and experience.  Internal
and external training are provided as well as insurance, retirement, and
leave programs.  A true sense of contribution, advancement potential, a
challenging professional environment, and the attractions of the National
Capital area are among the many intangible  benefits enjoyed by CIA
employees.

        TO APPLY:  If you would like to be considered for one of these
exceptional career opportunities, send your resume to:

                CIA EMPLOYMENT
                Dept. 34AP

                Arlington, VA  22209-8727

BOSTON UNIVERSITY seeks an ASSOCIATE or FULL PROFESSOR for its
graduate DEPARTMENT OF COGNITIVE AND NEURAL SYSTEMS. This department

Building Tomorrow's Intelligent Systems Today ...

Our company is a software house based in Singapore, a clean, modern

consultancy for clients primarily in the transportation, manufacturing
and communication-services sectors. The systems we have delivered
make innovative use of current technology, including graphics
capabilities, search and constraint-based optimization and other AI
techniques, wireless communications and client-server architecture.

We are looking for highly motivated computer professionals who are
flexible enough to carry out a wide range of tasks ranging from
software research, analysis and design, implementation, documentation
and testing to customer liaison, support and training. These positions
offer excellent prospect for individual growth, providing you with
challenging and beneficial experience in emerging technologies.

-  Effective written and oral communication skills.

following positions:

   constraint-based systems or expert systems would be highly regarded.

   especially in a transportation, manufacturing  or
   communication-services environment, would be advantageous.


Software Engineers (Computer Graphics)

-  Familiarity with RDBMS.

From: "Dr. Dekai Wu" <dekai@cs.ust.hk>
Subject: NLP/CS jobs at HKUST 


             THE HONG KONG UNIVERSITY OF SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY
                       Department of Computer Science



The Department of Computer Science will have at least 10 faculty
positions open AT ALL LEVELS for the 1995-96 academic year.
Applications for senior-level positions are particularly solicited.
The department began its first classes in October, 1991.  It currently
has 41 faculty members recruited from major universities and research
institutions around the world and 430 undergraduate and 95 postgraduate
students.

We have active research groups in the areas of artificial intelligence,
computer engineering, data and knowledge base management, software
technology, and theoretical computer science.  We are looking for new
faculty with research interests in these areas as well as in the areas
of Chinese (or multi-lingual) computing, natural language processing,
neural networks, and robotics.  Research funding is available through
government agencies and industry-sponsored research institutes at the
university, such as the Hong Kong Telecom Institute of Information
Technology and the Sino Software Research Centre.

The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology is a publicly-funded
research university.  It has Schools of Science, Engineering, Business &
Management, and Humanities and Social Science.  It is located on a new,
well-equipped coastal campus overlooking the spectacular Clear Water Bay.
Students admitted to the department rank among the top 10% of Hong Kong's
secondary school graduates.  The medium of instruction is English.

Salary and benefits are competitive.  Initial appointments will
normally be on a three-year contract which is renewable subject to
mutual agreement.  A gratuity of an amount equal to 25% of the total
basic salary received will be payable upon contract completion.
Shorter-term visiting positions are also available for senior
applicants.

Applicants should have an earned Ph.D. and high potential in teaching and
research.  Senior applicants must have exceptional research records.
Applications/nominations should be sent with a curriculum vitae together
with names of at least three references to:


                    Prof. Vincent Y. Shen, Head
                    Department of Computer Science
                    The Hong Kong University of Science & Technology
                    Clear Water Bay, Kowloon
                    HONG KONG

                    Fax No.   :    (852) 358-2679
                    E-mail    :    vshen@cs.ust.hk


Applications will be evaluated immediately upon receipt.  Maximum
consideration will be given to applications received by December 31, 1994.

From: cic@crl.com (Communication Intelligence Corp)
Subject: Character Recogition in SF Bay Area
Date: Mon Oct 31 13:19:16 EST 1994
Organization: CRL Dialup Internet Access


Communication Intelligence Corporation (CIC) is a leader in handwriting
recognition and other pen input technologies. We currently market
recognizers for English, Western European, and Asian languages on a variety
of platforms (e.g., DOS, Windows, Macintosh, and so on). These systems enable
the pen to serve as the sole input and control device, combining the functions
of both keyboard and mouse, and adding new capabilities.

Advanced development is directed toward integrated discrete/cursive
recognizers, and future integration with voice recognition, OCR, and
similar technologies.

CIC was founded in 1981 in conjunction with SRI International (formerly
Stanford Research Institute).  CIC is headquartered in Redwood Shores,
California, and has an international subsidiary, CIC Japan, Inc., in
Tokyo, Japan.

**** NOTE: please reply only to ostrem@cic.com

**** NOTE: positions are being offered only to those currently
           residing in the US


CIC currently has an immediate opening for the following position:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

POSITION: Researcher/Software Engineer

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

1.  Strong background in statistics, pattern recognition, algorithm development2.  Expert C programmer (at least 3-5 years experience)
3.  3-5 years experience in designing and coding for large software projects
    in a UNIX environment
4.  Good English communication skills and works well with other people.
5.  MS or substantial experience in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering
    or the equivalent

HIGHLY DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

1.  Experience with CHARACTER RECOGNITION, especially handwriting recognition,
    either on-line or off-line (OCR)
2.  Experience working in commercial companies
3.  Experience in Speech Recognition
4.  Linguistic experience (particularly statistical linguistics)

JOB DESCRIPTION

Work with a team of researchers on the next generation of handwriting
recognition systems (both off-line and on-line) for the commercial
market


**** NOTE: CIC's research is proprietary and hence results are NOT published

Subject: Job Opportunity/ VX-Works programmer/fuzzy control
Date: Tue Nov 01 15:31:15 EST 1994
Organization: Cybernet BBS, Boca Raton, Florida.


The Autonomous Underwater Vehicles (AUV) Group at Florida Atlantic University
has an opening for a programmer to support the real time control systems on
the groups AUV's. The operating system  is VxWorks. The embeded controller
 consits of 680X0's on a VME backplane connected to a distributed control
network based on the neuron chip and LONTalk protocol. The low and high level
control systems use various combinations of conventional, fuzzy, non-linear,
and neural controllers.  The work would also involve support of the
hardware in the loop simulation of the vehicles operating in an ocean environ
ment. The simulation is done on SGI workstations.
(Power Onyx Reality Engine 2).

(If you get sea-sick easily you may not want to apply)

Please send resume and references to
Salary commensurate with experience and aptitude

Dr. Samuel M. Smith
Ocean Engineering Dept.

solutions to the worldwide operations of the CRA Group.

demand for knowledge-based system expertise.

applications.

development would be an asset.

knowledge-based systems.  In addition, experience with authoring tools, graphicdesign or video production would be an asset.

Subject: Singapore - C++/AI/Graphics/Unix Engineers Wanted
Date: Thu Oct 27 09:08:01 EDT 1994
Organization: Technet, Singapore


Building Tomorrow's Intelligent Systems Today ...

Our company is a software house based in Singapore, a clean, modern
city. Being situated in the technology hub of the Asia-Pacific
region provides us with a conducive environment for world-class
research and development. We specialize in the application of
Artificial Intelligence, object-oriented technologies, graphics and
RDBMS to real-world problems. We undertake turnkey projects and
consultancy for clients primarily in the transportation, manufacturing
and communication-services sectors. The systems we have delivered
make innovative use of current technology, including graphics
capabilities, search and constraint-based optimization and other AI
techniques, wireless communications and client-server architecture.

We are looking for highly motivated computer professionals who are
flexible enough to carry out a wide range of tasks ranging from
software research, analysis and design, implementation, documentation
and testing to customer liaison, support and training. These positions
offer excellent prospect for individual growth, providing you with
challenging and beneficial experience in emerging technologies.


Are you the one we are looking for?


All interested candidates should possess the following:

-  A degree or higher degree in Computer Science.
-  Sound knowledge of UNIX, C++ and object-oriented analysis and
   design methodologies.
-  Effective written and oral communication skills.
-  At least 2 years of practical experience in software development.

In addition, the following skills are highly desirable for each of the
following positions:
Software Engineers (Artificial Intelligence)

-  Working experience with Artificial Intelligence technologies,
   constraint-based systems or expert systems would be highly regarded.
-  Experience in implementing planning and scheduling systems,
   especially in a transportation, manufacturing  or
   communication-services environment, would be advantageous.


Software Engineers (Computer Graphics)

-  Good working knowledge of X Windows, Motif or Interviews.
-  Familiarity with RDBMS.

If so, and you wish to join us and enjoy the benefits of a dynamic
working environment where you can excel to your full potential, send
us a detailed resume. Please enclose your personal particulars,
educational qualifications, working experience, contact telephone
number and expected remuneration. (In real-time please.)

                  Knowledge Engineering Pte Ltd
          Changi Airport P.O. Box 8001, Singapore 9181
                       fax: (65) 543 2109
                  email: ke@solomon.technet.sg


          Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

From: isabelle@citi.doc.ca (P. Isabelle [TAO])
Subject: JOB: Research in comp./math. linguistics
Organization: Communications Canada
Date: Wed Nov 02 12:03:54 EST 1994

Please note that our previous deadline for applications
concerning the job described below has been extended
through November 15, 1994.



          POSITION IN MATHEMATICAL/COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS
                       CITI -- Montreal, Canada




The Center for Information Technology Innovation (CITI), a research
laboratory of the Canadian Department of Industry, invites
applications for a position as research scientist in mathematical and
computational linguistics.

DUTIES: Work in close cooperation with the other members of the CITI's
machine-assisted translation team in developing new techniques in
machine-assisted translation. The team includes computer scientists,
linguists and translators. More specifically, the employee will be
expected:

      1) to play a key role in the development of abstract translation
      models of the translation process, especially with respect to
      their mathematical and computational properties. The relevant
      models range from classical rule-based linguistic models (ex:
      unification grammars) to stochastic models (ex: Hidden Markov
      Models), and are meant to provide the foundation for the
      development of a new generation of translation support tools;

      2) to participate in the implementation and testing of these
      models as they are embodied in tools designed to perform tasks
      such as automatic translation checking, automatic transcription
      of spoken translations and, in the longer term, automatic
      translation of simple texts.

      3) publish the results of his/her research; monitor the relevant
      literature.


REQUIREMENTS: Applicants should have a Ph.D. in applied mathematics or
computer science or possess a proven track record of high-quality
research in these areas.  Some previous research experience in
computational linguistics would be an important asset, as would
experience in computer programming using languages such as C, Lisp and
Prolog . While a good knowledge of both French and English would be
desirable, an excellent knowledge of either language would be
sufficient.


TERMS: The position is open for an initial term of three years with
the possibility of renewal. The CITI is located in Laval, a suburb of
Montreal. Salary will be commensurate with qualifications, as assessed
by a ministerial committee responsible for the evaluation of research
scientists. Priority will be given to Canadian citizens, but all
applications will be considered.


Applicants should send a detailed resume and a small sample of their
recent scientific production (article, tech. reports, etc) before
November 15, 1994 to:

        Pierre Isabelle
        Program Head, Machine-assisted translation
        CITI
        1575 Chomedey Blvd., Laval
        Quebec, Canada, H7V 2X2

        e-mail: isabelle@citi.doc.ca
        fax: (514) 973-5757

                       KBSE R&D at GTE Labs

NOTE: This posting replaces an earlier posting. The earlier posting
indicated a parttime position with possibility of extension.  The
position is now FULLTIME.  

A full-time, permanent position at GTE LABS, the central research
facility of the GTE Corporation. Located in Waltham, MA.  

The employee will work with the existing staff of the Requirements
Engineering project, whose objective is to perform state-of-the-art
research and to transfer technology to the business units. The job will
involve design, development and deployment of proof-of-concept
prototypes involving significant use of AI techniques.

The position requires superior implementation skills as well as
superior knowledge of AI problem-solving techniques.  Background in
knowledge-based software engineering (KBSE), Requirements Engineering
and other Software Engineering subjects is strongly desired. MS in
Computer Science required, Ph.D. preferred, with several years of R&D
experience in relevant fields.

Replies should emphasize proven experience in the fields of
Requirements Engineering and/or KBSE, and a demonstrated record of
seeing projects through to completion with successful results.
Please note the emphasis on implementation skills in addition to the
other job requirements.

GTE Laboratories is the central research facility that supports GTE's
business units. It is located in Waltham, Massachusetts and is an equal
opportunity employer, M/F/D/V.

Please send resume (e-mail preferred) to:

	Sol Greenspan 
	GTE Laboratories Incorporated
	40 Sylvan Road 
	Waltham, MA 02254      
	e-mail: greenspan@gte.com
	fax: (617) 890-9320

From: Roger Evans <rpe@itri.bton.ac.uk>
Date: Wed, 9 Nov 94 15:49:02 GMT
Subject: Job Advert - RF in Computational Linguistics

(Please forward to any additional interested parties)

University of Brighton

Information Technology Research Institute

Research Fellow - Computational Linguistics   (fixed term for 3 years)
up to #19,137 per annum

This post is concerned with the development of techniques for enhancing
the representational structure of large-scale lexicons. The work will
involve surveying and collecting existing lexical resources, rapid
prototyping of enhancement techniques, testing and evaluation through
construction of pilot applications, and refinement of the techniques
into usable tools. A PhD in Computational Linguistics or a closely
related area, experience of lexical representation  and good programming
skills,  including familiarity with PROLOG and either POP11 or LISP, are
essential. Familiarity with the lexical representation language DATR, as
well as other lexical formalisms, is highly desirable. Experience of
large-scale lexicon development or acquisition, and of developing tools
for language engineering would also be an advantage.

Ref:   IT916

For an informal discussion about the post, please telephone Dr. Roger
Evans, Deputy Head of the Information Technology Research Institute,
(01273) 642900, or email Roger.Evans@itri.bton.ac.uk.

For further details and an application form contact the Personnel
Department, University of Brighton, Brighton, BN2 4AT, or 24 hour
answerphone: (01273) 642849 quoting the appropriate reference number.
If you need further information, ring  (01273) 642837.

Closing date:   25th November 1994


Information about the post and the project may also be found on the ITRI
FTP server (ftp.itri.bton.ac.uk) in the following files:

    pub/itri/posts/IT916-SEAL-advert        This message
    pub/itri/posts/IT916-SEAL-jobdesc       Job description for the post
    pub/itri/posts/IT916-SEAL-project       Project description

Note, however, that applications should be made on the forms available
from the above address.

Subject: fwd: Statistical NLP
Date: Thu, 10 Nov 94 00:05:20 EST
Message-ID: <379.784443920@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>
From: Mark Kantrowitz <Mark_Kantrowitz@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>


                       Two Job Opportunities
                               In
                Statistical Natural Language Processing
       ATR Interpreting Telecommunications Research Laboratories
                             Kyoto, Japan

ATR in Kyoto, Japan is looking for two talented, experienced, and
highly motivated individuals who are interested in coming to Japan and
joining an exciting research project in statistical natural language
processing.  The ultimate goal of the project is speech-to-speech
Japanese to English and English to Japanese translation.  The
immediate goal for the next few years is to produce a natural language
parsing system based on statistical machine learning algorithms.


  *************************************************************

                       Programmer/Researcher

The first position is for a computer scientist who has at least a
Bachelor's degree (preferably a Master's) in computer science, with
extensive programming experience in C and significant experience in
C++. Experience with statistical modelling and machine learning
techniques is a big plus.  Motif experience will be helpful, although
it is not required.  The candidate should also be well-versed in UNIX
and must be willing to participate in some shared administrative
responsibilities.

This first position is a combination of programming and research, so
the candidate should demonstrate a willingness and ability to program
efficiently and accurately, but he or she should also be interested in
and capable of pursuing research ideas as they come up in the course
of the project.


  *************************************************************

       Mathematician (Probability) / Experimentalist / Programmer


For the second position, a qualified candidate must have the Ph.D.
degree, preferably math, physics, computer science; with extensive
programming experience and expertise in C and significant experience
and expertise in C++. Ability to innovate approaches to applied
mathematical problems in the area of probability required. Experience
with statistical modelling within general pattern recognition field
also important. Familiarity with natural language field a plus but not
absolutely necessary. Candidate should know UNIX well and in general be
a highly expert programmer.  This is not a job for those who are
theoreticians only, but rather is for someone who is equally at home
with issues of statistical modelling theory, experimental method, and
detailed coding matters. Motif experience would be nice, though again
not required. Mentoring of less experienced (though able) researchers
is involved as well.

Salary and conditions highly competitive.

Please send cover letter, cv, and at least 3 contactable references
(covering programming abilities, for the first position; and
mathematical, experimental and programming abilities, for the second
position) to: Ezra Black (black@itl.atr.co.jp). Thank you.

               P L E A S E     P O S T

========================================================

RESEARCH POSITIONS AVAILABLE IN ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE

The "Institut Dalle Molle d'Intelligence Artificielle
Perceptive" (IDIAP) in Martigny, Switzerland seeks to hire
qualified researchers in the areas:

	* Image processing, with applications to object
	  and handwriting recognition

	* Neural network design and training, with
	  applications to classification and optical
	  implementation

	* Automatic speech recognition, with applications
	  to vocal servers.

Candidates should possess a Ph.D. or equivalent degree in
computer science or a related area.  They must be able to
conduct independent research on the basis of solid theoretical
and applied knowledge. Salaries will be aligned with those
offered by the Swiss government for equivalent positions.
Researchers are expected to begin activity by or before
September, 1995.

IDIAP is supported by the Dalle Molle Foundation along with
public-sector partners at the local and federal levels (in
Switzerland).  The institute maintains close contact with the
University of Geneva and the Polytechnical School of Lausanne.
IDIAP's computational facilities are Sun/UNIX based.  More
information about the institute is available via the World Wide
Web: http://maya.idiap.ch/

The town of Martigny, offering a variety of cultural activities,
is situated in the south of Switzerland, close to both France
and Italy.  It is located in a scenic Alpine region with some
of the best skiing and hiking in Europe, and is well connected
by rail and highway to the rest of Switzerland.

To apply for a position at IDIAP please send the following
documents in plain ASCII format via electronic mail:

	- a curriculum vitae 
	- a list of publications
	- a description of the research program
	  that the candidate wishes to pursue
	- the names and addresses of three personal references.

Applications are due by December 15, 1994 and should be sent
electronically to "search@idiap.ch".

Provision of all posts is dependent on final approval by the
Swiss government.

Subject: AI opportunities
Date: Thu, 10 Nov 1994 15:23:06 -0500
From: "John D. Burger" <john@linus.mitre.org>

The MITRE Corporation is seeking candidates for the following
positions in our Artificial Intelligence Center in Bedford, MA:

A technical business/management leader to help grow our language-based
interaction effort. This position will have an emphasis on developing
new customer relationships, maintaining visibility in existing
research and customer communities (e.g. NSF, NLM, ARPA) and building
synergy across related technology areas including intelligent
tutoring, speech, human-computer interaction, collaborative computing,
and digital libraries.  This position requires prior experience in
successfully leading groups of technical professionals and
demonstrated expertise in one or more of the following areas:
speech/natural language processing; information retrieval;
human-computer interaction.  A PhD in a related field is strongly
desired as is a solid basis of knowledge in Computer Science and
language based interaction.  Previous accomplishment in identification
and development of new customer relationships is desirable as is a
significant publication record.

A Lead Scientist is needed to function as a an individual contributor
in our effort to develop and implement standards for intelligent
mutimodal interfaces.  This position requires thorough understanding
of the underlying issues in intelligent interface design and strong
familiarity with theory and implementation for more than one interface
component.  This might include speech interfaces, knowledge
representation, parsing, generation, multimodal graphical
presentation, and discourse.  Strength in trainable and corpus based
language and interface technologies to promote robustness and
portability is highly desirable.  This position requires a high level
of skill in LISP and C programming and experience with object oriented
models of client/server computing, such as CORBA.  The successful
candidate should have a MS (PhD preferred) in CS or a related field
and several years of experience in building large intelligent
interfaces.  The ability to express technical ideas clearly is vital.

A Member of the Technical Staff with a strong background in advanced
natural language processing and information extraction technologies is
being sought to pursue integration of information retrieval and
automated tagging approaches with natural language processing.  This
will include development of automatically trained modules for rapid
adaptation to new domains and languages.  This position requires a
high level of skill with LISP and C programming as well as experience
working with large corpora.  Background in trainable or corpus based
systems is a plus, as are excellent interpersonal and communication
skills.

The MITRE Corporation is a not-for-profit organization operating in
the public interest that conducts research and provides systems
engineering and acquisition support.  MITRE is responsible for
providing objective expertise and guidance to technology dependent
government agencies.  Working at corporate offices in Bedford, MA and
McLean, VA, and at various worldwide site locations, MITRE also plays
a key role in uniting existing and emerging technologies to meet the
nation's most complex electronic information needs.

For confidential consideration please forward your resume' by Fax to
(617) 271-3402, Attn.  David Gentes.

E-mail response should be submitted to dgentes@mitre.org.  

Mail response should be submitted to:  
	The MITRE Corporation
	Office of Human Resources; Section INET
	P.O. Box 857
	Bedford,   MA  01730 - 0857

MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer
and is committed to diversity in our workplace.  U.S. Citizenship is
required.

(tentative) Job Posting:  Computational Linguist

General Motors expects to hire a computational linguist to join an
existing R&D project.  The position is contingent upon final management
approval.

Minimum Qualifications:  MS/MA in computational linguistics; Common LISP
experience; outstanding teaching skills; excellent oral and written
communication skills; native or near-native fluency in both English and
French.

Additional desirable skills include fluency in other major languages
(esp. German or Spanish); technical writing;  technical automotive
knowledge.

The successful candidate would be employed in Warren, MI by GM's Service
Technology Group, although the initial work location would be at GM's
Research and Development Center also in Warren, MI.  This posting is only
a solicitation for resumes from qualified candidates.  Interviews will
begin following management approval of the position, which is expected in
early 1995.

Please send resume and cover letter to:

Dr. Kurt Godden
Analytic Process Dept., Bldg. 1-6
NAO Research and Development Center
30500 Mound Rd.
Warren, MI 48090-9055

General Motors is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.

From: angela@coyote.NoSubdomain.NoDomain (Angela Wee)
Date: Mon Nov 07 02:24:46 EST 1994
Organization: ISS Research
Keywords: Recruitment of NLP Software Engineer

INSTITUTE OF SYSTEMS SCIENCE

NATIONAL UNIVERSITY OF SINGAPORE


A CAREER IN IT RESEARCH

The Institute of Systems Science (ISS) is a leading Information Technology (IT)Research and Development Centre in the Pacific region with close to 100 research
 staff.  Our objectives are international and regional leadership in next genera
tion technology creation and spin-off.  We are looking for dynamic, enthusiastic
 and innovative individuals to join us in furthering their career in the area of
 information technology research.


MULTI-LANGUAGE PROCESSING (MLP) PROGRAM

The mission of the MLP Program is to nurture a new language services industry th
rough developing advanced multilingual technology and usable product prototypes,
 and conducting application-driven natural language r&d projects inspired by ind
ustrial needs.

(1) Software Engineer (Ref:MLP/SE)

Duties :
*  Assist in the research and implementation of practical natural language appli
cations

Requirements :
*  Bachelor or Masters in Computer Science or Electrical & Electronics Engineeri
ng
*  Proficiency in C, C++ or Lisp
*  Interest in natural language processing in general (English, Chinese or Malay
) and its applications
*  Good knowledge of Artificial Intelligence techniques will be an advantage
*  Good work attitude and communication skills

Subject: C++ GURUS -- NYC Investment Research

                      C++ Gurus - In the Heart of NYC
           Work with one of the most selective teams on Wall Street

Job Description
===============
We are looking for the best hackers to work on two efforts:

    We are developing an object oriented analytic data base to help
    traders manage the risks of complicated financial instruments.

    We are applying the latest buzzwords (chaos, nonlinear dynamics,
    neural networks, and pattern recognition) in developing models to
    trade our markets.

MANDATORY Skills
================
   3+ years C++ in commercial development. Experience PERSONALLY developing
   a large application (20K+ lines of code).

   User-friendly personality.

   A quick, analytic mind.

   Ability and willingness to work 60+ hours per week when required (not
   constantly).

COMPENSATION PACKAGE
====================
   We are EXTREMELY competitive, and offer a full range of benefits,
   including a generous relocation package.

Company Background
==================
   Ours is a group of 21 programmers, mathematicians, physicists, and
   engineers worldwide.  Most of us have had no financial experience
   before joining the company. We are the analytic and quantitative
   group for the smallest division of a large, prestigious investment
   bank.  Ours is a collaborative, team oriented enviornment. In our
   business, the best firm is the one with the best people, and we want to
   be the best.  So we make an unusual effort to identify and recruit the
   very best person for every job.

   While we all wear suits and ties, our primary focus is to get the job
   done.  The hours are long, but we don't punch a clock, we don't fill
   time sheets, we don't hold long planning meetings, and we don't go
   through formal code reviews.  The atmosphere, in this way, is more like
   a startup.  And we have no tolerance for bureaucracy.

   We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate in
   employment on any basis that is prohibited by federal, state, or
   local law.

RESUME CONTENT
==============
Please include a list of projects.  Each item should include:

    A BRIEF description of functionality, and size (approx lines of code)

    What YOU did, how many lines you wrote, and in what time.

    Technology used ( cpu, os, language )

Sample code would be EXTREMELY useful in making your case.  The more,
the better.

E-mail, please use plain ASCII text format.

STATISTICIAN

Job Description/Responsibilities:

   Chief Statistician position offers an exciting opportunity for a
   highly intelligent and motivated individual in a successful, growing
   AI companyin Maryland.  The company specializes in the R&D and
   application of forecasting, classification, and modeling technologies
   involving statistics, statistical pattern recognition, neural
   networks, genetic algorithms, fuzzy logic, chaos and fractal theory,
   expert systems, and hybrid systems.  Current projects include credit
   card activation modeling, site selection, fraud detection, biomedical
   pattern recognition applications, financial and commodities
   forecasting (stocks, currency, etc.), portfolio optimization, and
   sports forecasting.  Responsibilities include involvement in the R&D,
   testing, and verification of all models and modeling systems developed
   either for internal use and for clients.

   The position offers an excellent salary and benefits commensurate with
   experience.

   with 2+ years experience and 2+ years experience in C/C++ programming.

Other Desirables:

   mathematics and optimization, any of the AI techniques listed above,
   and Windows GUI development.

PhD program.

graphics, image processing, visualisation, artificial intelligence,
automated theorem proving, computer architecture, distributed systems, VLSI
and parallel algorithms.  Applicants in these areas are especially
encouraged to apply.

Colour X-terminals, Apple Macintoshes.  This is directly connected to a
campus-wide network.

Subject: Dallas, GTE, Software/Systems Modeling&Analysis Methodologies&Tools 
X-Sun-Charset: US-ASCII
Content-Length: 3500


	          Software/Systems Tools Expert
  GTE Telephone Operations World Headquarters, Dallas(Irving), Texas
		        Call for Resumes


JOB DESCRIPTION:

Skilled and experienced Software and Systems Engineer to facilitate
method and tool use in an organization that is responsible for
requirements gathering, business process re-engineering methodology,
and other systems planning functions.  The employee will play a key
role in establishing methodologies and tools that support business
process modeling, requirements modeling, logical design, and other
modeling and analysis activities using computer-based tools.

The employee will have responsibility for transfer of software
technology from the corporate research lab to this organization, and
conversely, will be responsible for the communication of methodology
and research requirements to the research lab.  The employee will
deploy prototype software tools from the research setting into
practice, and support/oversee their use on live projects.  Working
closely with GTE Labs personnel, the employee will adapt the technology
to the user environment, determine new needs, and participate in the
development of new features; also, may convey tool requirements to
external vendors for commercial tool development and oversee the
development/procurement. 

The new employee will be responsible for administration of tools,
including applications, systems software, and software platforms.
The employee will be a technical resource to members of the
organization. 

The employee will participate in and/or lead projects that use the
methods and tools;  participate in training other participants and
leaders; create training materials and user documentation; evaluate and
improve processes and tools; work across organizational boundaries to
plan and deploy future processes and tools that fit into corporate
software development strategies.

An example of a tool being used by the organization is a conceptual
modeling tool used for logical design of systems that implement modeled
business processes. The tool is based on object-oriented modeling and
AI knowledge representation and reasoning techniques.  The candidate
should have an understanding of these technologies as well as
programming experience in Lisp and KBS development platforms. 


QUALIFICATIONS:

Masters or Ph.D in Computer Science, plus four or more years of
experience in software development and systems administration.

Highly skilled and experienced software engineer, with proven 
record of skills and accomplishments.

Excellent interpersonal communication skills. The ability and maturity
to teach and lead in a multidisciplinary environment having both
technical and nontechnical people.

Experience with requirements modeling, systems analysis and
development; experience with development and adaptation of software
engineering methodologies.

Proficiency required in most or all of the following:  programming
languages such as Lisp, C, C++, etc.; Unix workstation and network
administration; knowledge-based platforms such as KEE, ProKappa, OMW,
ART-IM, etc.

Must be highly organized and a self-starter.

Will work in Dallas. Some travel required to research lab (Boston area)
and other GTE locations (e.g., Tampa).


Please send resume (e-mail preferred) to:

	Dr. Sol Greenspan 
	GTE Laboratories Incorporated 
	40 Sylvan Road
	Waltham, MA 02254 
	e-mail: greenspan@gte.com 
	fax: (617) 890-9320

JOB DESCRIPTION
===============================================
JOB TITLE:      Senior Research Associate
LEVEL:  15 (hiring range $46,200-52,150)
DIVISION:       Research
DEPARTMENT:     SMaRT
SECTION:
LOCATION:       Headquarters
===============================================
GENERAL FUNCTIONS:

To define and coordinate a program of continuous enhancement of applied
statistics and research methodologies for AARP research activities, and
coordinate research on automated aides to organizational decision
processes.


JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Education: PhD required
Experience: Six to eight years of experience in conducting applied social
science/organizational research
Minimum Qualifications:
- Excellent research design and methodology skills
- Excellent knowledge of applied statistical methods
- Ability to define and conduct applied quantitative and qualitative
research
- Ability to work effectively in a client-consulting relationship
- Knowledge of decision theory, decision modeling, decision support
systems, and artificial intelligence approaches to decision support
systems
- Experience with groupware and other collaboration technologies used to
support group work

SUPERVISORY RELATIONSHIPS:

Received: Reports to the Department Director and project leaders of
teams on which the staff member participates
Given:  Supervises project team members of those teams for which
leadership is provided by this staff member. Directs contract activities
and
individual consultants as required.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work activities include:

- Take a leadership role in development and implementation of a program
to enhance the research design and statistical analysis skills of research

staff

- Maintain state-of-the-art knowledge of applied social science/ survey
research methodologies

- Work cooperatively with other Research department and Division staff
in conducting research projects in support of the Association research
agenda

- Provide leadership on statistical and methodological issues and
assistance to other research staff and Division clients

- Propose, plan, manage and report applied research projects
including a research program on organizational decision processes and the
use of collaboration technologies to facilitate group decision-making
based on research information.

- Direct the research efforts, as a working supervisor of project teams,
and
directly supervise staff on projects for which this staff member has
leadership responsibility, including completion of performance
management feedback to team participants

- Maintain state of the art knowledge of collaboration technology tools
and processes

- Work cooperatively with staff affiliated with the Group Decision Center
in the development and evaluation of decision processes and tools

- Other tasks and special assignments which may more be specifically
mentioned, but which are consistent with this type and level of work

        Development/Programming Positions Available at SciComp Inc.


SciComp Inc., a new software company located in Austin, Texas, has several
openings involving knowledge-based program transformation for scientific
computing applications.  The project is to extend a prototype software
system. It involves the development of high-level languages to specify
mathematical modeling programs and their interfaces to visualization and
numerical libraries, and a transformational system to implement the
specifications.  The prototype is written in Mathematica.

We are looking for several high-energy individuals.  An appropriate degree
for these positions would be an MS (or PhD) in computer science, but
technical background, interest, and willingness to work on the necessary
tasks are equally important ingredients.  Relevant experience should
include some subset of the following:  knowledge-based or object-oriented
programming, program transformation, compiler techniques, mathematical
modeling, scientific computing, implementation of numerical PDE programs,
and parallel and distributed computing.  Mathematica programming experience
is desirable but not required.

                          SYSTEMS ARCHITECT - OSMS
                           Philadelphia, PA Area

  -  Master of Science in Electrical Engineering or Computer
     Science with 5+ years in-depth experience with large scale

     information systems or data warehouse.  Knowledgeable in
     IBM, Tandem, Teradata system implementations.

     programming

Job Responsibilities
Systems Architect will provide UNIX-based systems integration
services to Unisys and non-Unisys clients including: Analyze
business process and systems; Identify opportunities for
improvement; Build business case for data warehousing or decision
support systems for presentation to upper-level management; Make
use of prototypes, etc. to invoke client participation; Develop
information models of business; Document organization flow of
data; Develop full life cycle project implementation plans such
as requirements definition, detailed design, development and
testing; Integrate client's current information systems and
operating environment into the data warehouse and/or decision
support system utilizing hardware and software tools that best
satisfy the organization's IT strategy; Provide consultation
services to assist in evaluating effectiveness of data warehouse
or decision support system.

The System Architect position is located in the Philadelphia, PA
area.  Candidates should send resumes to:

- Computer vision
- Artificial intelligence
- Graphical simulation/animation

SALARY RANGE:   Negotiable
STARTING RANGE: Negotiable

HOURS:          Full-time

field robot prototypes.  Duties include working with scientists,
engineers and programmers to integrate, test and evaluate complete
robot systems; participating in group efforts of problem analysis,
preliminary and detailed design discussions and review integration;
developing software specification documents; engaging in code
development and debugging; document production; evaluating and testing
software developed by others.

experience in software development in a project team setting or
completed software projects outside the classroom; strong UNIX, X11, and
C experience; strong math, analytical, oral and written communications
skills to write software documentation; ability to work under pressure
and meet inflexible deadlines required.

Preferred:

one or more years in a non-academic position in a related field;
experience with modern software engineering methods including CASE
tools; experience with SunOS/Solaris/VxWorks real-time operating system.

Organization: National University of Singapore

Senior Speech and Language Engineering Researcher

The Apple-ISS Research Center (AIRC) a US$ 10 million joint
venture between Apple Computer Inc. and the Institute of
Systems Science of the National University of Singapore.
Located in Singapore, the Center is looking for a project
leader for an important research initiative in Asian language
Text-to-Speech and Text Analysis technology.

The project leader will define research goals and work with
a team of professional software engineers in implementing
the next generation of speech output technology for Asian
languages.  This position includes interaction with scientists
in the National University of Singapore, and with Apple's
Text-to-Speech research and productization efforts located
in Cupertino, California.  Attendance and publication in
international scientific/engineering conferences is encouraged.

The successful candidate will have research expertise and/or
significant professional experience in two or more of the
following areas: computational linguistics, including natural
language parsing, lexical database design, and statistical
language modeling; text tokenization and normalization;
prosodic analysis.  Substantial knowledge of the phonology,
syntax, and semantics of Chinese is required.  Knowledge of
acoustic phonetics and/or speech signal processing is desirable.
The successful candidate will have a PhD with at least 2-4 years
of relevant work experience, or a technical MS degree with at
least 5-7 years experience.

Very strong software engineering skills, including concept,
design, implementation, and productization are required for
this position.  Knowledge of Macintosh OS, C, and C++ are
preferred.

Benefits include an internationally competitive salary,
housing subsidy, and relocation expenses.

--------------------

qualifications, experience and contact telephone number to:

From: lji@dnai.com (Lee Johnson)
Subject: US-DC-Washington > Smalltalk Guru with Security Clearance
Date: Sat Jan 14 13:00:26 EST 1995
Organization: Lee Johnson International
Keywords: Smalltalk-80 VisualWorks OOD OOA OMT EBI SBI Top Secret


                 Smalltalk Senior Consultants with Security Clearance

                              Positions in:  Washington D.C

             Copyright (C) 1995 by Lee Johnson International, I.R.S, INC.

Company Background
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Our client Company's consulting practice division provides C++ and
Smalltalk-80 expertise to World Class software developers and research
labs, thus providing an opportunity to work shoulder-to-shoulder with
some of the brightest software developers in leading edge environments.
As one of our placements said, "To get a feel for the difference between
being a Developer and a Senior Consultant, think of the Developer as being
a Weaponsmith, and the latter being a Gladiator."

This consulting practice, which augments the parent Company's very
successful object-oriented system-software product, has been in
business since 1990 and is led by the founders of a large software
Company's  consulting practice division that they grew from zero to $75
million revenue and 300+ consultants before left to start this new
object-oriented consulting practice.  They hope to exceed their previous
accomplishment.  So far, they have assembled a team of 26+ extremely
competent consultants plus an outstanding sales team from the most
successful software companies in the World.  They have regional offices
in Atlanta, Austin, Boston, Chicago, Cincinnati, Dallas, Denver,
Los Angeles Piscataway, Phoenix, San Francisco, Seattle,
Washington, D.C., London, Tokyo, Paris, Australia, and Wiesbaden, Germany.

Career Growth
~~~~~~~~~~~~
Other fast-track, highly competent people we have placed in Senior
Consultant positions said their technical prowess has been greatly
increased by the opportunity they have to work closely with World Class
developers, as well as the parent Company's  World Class product
engineering group, has been like getting a MSCS in one year ... and that's
from people who already had a MSCS!  They also say that being in close
contact with their clients (in some cases, CEOs and Research Lab Directors)
has sharpened their business and speaking skills.  All feel that in
addition to adding to their already extensive Smalltalk skills, that after
a year into the job, they have also become an expert in the parent
Company's system-software product.  One Consultant we placed was promoted
to a Senior Consultant in about a year and one-half, and then Regional
Consulting Manager 6 months later.  Another was promoted to Regional
Consulting Manager a year after starting, then Engineering Director of a
new division a year after that. Another was given a challenging individual
assignment in Europe six months after starting!  Everyone at the Company
says their business is only limited by their ability to find high-achiever
Smalltalk experts who, like everyone in the Company, make a 150% effort.

Upward visibility possibilities and the business contacts gained are
unbelievable!  As the consulting practice grows there will be a need for
managers for all the new offices that will be opened.  Other possible
avenues could be into Sales or Engineering at the parent company.   In any
event, the experience you will be able to put on your resume will make you
EXTREMELY valuable!

Senior Consultant Job Description
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Technical Lead Consultant will divide his/her time approximately as
follows: 50% of time providing consulting in advanced Smalltalk programming
techniques and object-oriented applications design as a technical leader
on technical problems which the customer is unable to resolve
independently;  25% of time developing prototype applications and
providing technology transfer to clients;  25% of time giving formal
instruction in advanced Smalltalk and use of the Company's software
development product.  The position requires 50% - 80% travel (3-4 days per
week, but always home on weekends) in the local Region and bimonthly trips
to the parent's Engineering Department to consult on product enhancements,
testing, and benchmarking.

MANDATORY Skills
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1. 3+ years (ABSOLUTE MINIMUM!) Smalltalk (preferably Smalltalk-80 and
   VisualWorks) COMMERCIAL application development (NOT academic
   research) with full-lifecycle involvement and a thorough understanding
   of the application and ability to describe it in detail.

2. Good knowledge of database sorting and searching algorithms (e.g.
   hashing tables, disk access, how data is stored on disk).

3. 2+ years in an UNIX workstation, MS-Windows, or OS/2 development
   environment, including enough UNIX Systems Administration experience to
   be able single-handedly support the system when it is taken on the
   road.

4. DYNAMIC UP-BEAT PERSONALITY AND EXCELLENT PUBLIC SPEAKING SKILLS.
   (This is VERY important; without these, an offer will not be made.)

5. Ability and willingness to travel 50% - 80% of the time, primarily
   within the office's business region.  (a maximum of 3 weeks at client
   site, but always home on weekends)

6. Ability and willingness to have a significant portion of compensation
   be based on individual goals and regional/national sales goals ... up
   to, and possibly more, 50% of base salary, paid quarterly.

7. Ability and willingness to work 60+ hours per week when required (not
   constantly.  (Remember, I said ALL my client's people put out a 150%
   effort!)

8. B.S. Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other technical
   discipline.

9. Fluency (reading, writing, speaking) in language of country stationed.

10. Security Clearance required for Washington D.C. position.

DESIRABLE Skills
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1. Hands-on experience in working with various software development tools,
   such as CASE tools, GUI builders, forms managers, and report writers.

2. Hands-on experience developing ECAD, MCAD, GIS, Network Management,
   Financial Modeling, or Office Automation software.

3. Recent experience in the development of applications under MS-Windows.

4. General understanding of database internals and modern software
   engineering methodologies, especially object-oriented analysis
   (modeling) and design.

5. Advanced degree in Computer Science or Engineering.

COMPENSATION PACKAGE
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  Base Salary range:        $45K-70K (based on Smalltalk and consulting exp.)
  Incentive Salary:         $15K-15K   (at 100%* of goal; higher if 100%
                            ~~~~ ~~~    is exceeded)
  Total Cash Compensation:  $60K-$85K

  * 100% billing goal = 42 billable 8 hour days/quarter.

  Stock Options: Option at VC prices.

  Benefits:  The normal, plus 5 day/4 night all expense paid vacation in
  the middle of Winter on a tropical island for you and your spouse if
  you make your 100% goal.  Frequent Flyer miles worth thousands!

Candidates we CANNOT help
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
LACK MINIMUM
EXPERIENCE:          You MUST have ALL the skills listed in the MANDATORY
                     SKILLS section above.

IMMIGRANTS:          We are unable to place people on F-1 or H-1 visas.

ENTRY-LEVEL GRADS:   Employers utilize College Placement Offices to hire
                     recent graduates with no paid commercial industry
                     experience.  EMPLOYERS DO NOT USE RECRUITING FIRMS
                     FOR THIS PURPOSE.  WE ARE UNABLE TO ASSIST
                     ENTRY-LEVEL GRADUATES WITH NO PAID COMMERCIAL
                     INDUSTRY EMPLOYMENT.  ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

FREQUENT JOB         Our client companies hire us to find ONLY the top 10%
CHANGES:             engineers who have been on each job 3+ YEARS MINIMUM
                     and have had FULL LIFE-CYCLE development experience
                     on LARGE, COMPLEX systems.  If you have changed jobs
                     every 1-2 years, EVEN THOUGH NO FAULT OF YOUR OWN,
                     the probability of one of OUR clients hiring you
                     through us is very small.  YOU ARE MUCH MORE LIKELY
                     TO RECEIVE AN OFFER BY APPLYING DIRECTLY TO THE
                     COMPANY.


RESUME ADVICE
~~~~~~~~~~~~
RESUME CONTENT:      Content is much more effective in attracting an
                     employer's attention than cosmetic appearance.  Make
                     sure that EACH PROJECT you describe in your resume
                     covers 4 points: (1) Your FUNCTIONAL title (e.g.,
                     Lead Consultant of 3-person team); (2) Specific
                     functions you PERSONALLY performed (e.g., analysis,
                     design, coding, testing, etc.); (3) Description of type
                     of project, CPU, OS, languages, methodologies, tools;
                     (4) The end result (e.g., the system went into
                     production or was shipped on schedule).  You should
                     also have a Summary of Expertise at the beginning of
                     your resume that lists the GENERIC AREAS (e.g. GUI
                     design, Network Management design, etc.) that you are
                     truly expert in, as well as CPU, OS, languages, tools,
                     and methodologies.

                     MAKE SURE YOUR RESUME SPECIFICALLY DISCUSSES IN DETAIL
                     ALL THE SKILLS REQUIRED IN THE MANDATORY SKILLS
                     SECTION.

                     IF YOU NEED HELP, DOWNLOAD OUR "EasyResume(tm)"
                     OUTLINE AND SAMPLE RESUME FROM misc.jobs.misc, or our
                     URL: http://www/dnai.com/~lji, or our BBS 510-787-3191,
                     8N1.

TEXT FORMAT:         If sent by email or uploaded to our BBS, please use
                     plain ASCII text format.  If FAXed, please use the
                     200 lines per inch mode (aka "fine," "detail,"
                     "high-quality").  U.S. Mail is okay.

SEND RESUME TO:
(in order of preferred mode)

#1. Email to: lji@dnai.com
#2. Direct upload to our BBS: 510-787-3191  (8N1, hardware flow control)
#3. U.S. Mail to:  Lee Johnson
                   Lee Johnson International
                   P.O. Box 817
                   Crockett, CA  94525
#4. FAX to 510-787-3191 (same phone as BBS)  USE HIGH-QUALITY MODE ("FINE")

BACKGROUND OF THIS RECRUITING FIRM
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
LEE JOHNSON INTERNATIONAL is a small search firm established in 1974
specializing exclusively in employer-paid-fee recruiting and placement of
Software Engineering professionals.  We work in leading edge technologies
such as object-oriented, connectivity, fuzzy logic, neural networks,
distributed database internals, communications networking, optimizing
compilers, programming environments, GUI, and multiprocessor OS.

We operate on a one-to-one relationship with our client companies and
candidates.  In order to never overlook any skill set or person, we use an
OCR system and full-text database software that indexes every word in a
resume.  When conducting a search, we query the database with a complex
boolean search statement.  If your resume is retrieved, we will contact you
with a detailed description of the position, discuss the opportunity with
you, and ask if you care to be presented as a candidate for the position.

YOUR RESUME IS SECURE: The database resides on a stand-alone PC that is not
connected to any network.

WE NEVER RELEASE YOUR RESUME WITHOUT YOUR AUTHORIZATION.

Subject: Speech recognition, Kurzweil AI, Waltham, MA

                Data Assistant Position

Job Description:

Help collect and process speech recognition data, including particularly
microphone and usability tests.

Activities include:

        Simple hardware setup: connecting microphones, etc.
        Microphone calibration and testing.
        Analysis and reporting of experimental results.
        Running experimental tools under DOS and Windows.
        Using, and sometimes maintaining UNIX shell scripts.
        Testing algorithms against benchmark databases.
        Scheduling and collecting usage data from users in the field
        Analyzing recordings of user's behavior

Required qualifications

        Experience running experiments involving real hardware
        Experience analyzing and reporting experimental results
        Experience running computer controlled experiments
        Experience analyzing human behavior

Desired Qualifications:

        Experience running experiments in a Unix environment
        Relevant undergraduate degree (e.g. an experiment science,
                computer science, or psychology)

for more information, contact:

Mark Horvath                            markh@kurz-ai.com
Data collection and analysis
Kurzweil Applied Intelligence, Inc.     617 893 5151 x 439
411 Waverly Oaks Rd.,                   fax: 617 893 6425
Waltham, Ma. 02154 USA

               Speech Scientist Position

Job Description:

As a member of a small team, participate in algorithmic development of
isolated-word and continuous large vocabulary speech recognition products.
Activities include:

        generating new algorithms,
        coding them,
        testing them against benchmark databases.
        assuring that algorithms included in the product are correct.

(Actual product coding is done by another group, in close consultation
with the research group; but the research group is responsible for helping
to check that the product implementation is correct.)

Areas of technical responsibility may range over the whole recognition
process; but are likely to focus on candidate selection, acoustic
representation, computation of acoustic scores, or search.

Required Qualifications:

        Ability to program in C and C++
        Masters or doctorate in computer science, electrical engineering,
                or related field

Desired Qualifications:

        Experience with speech recognition algorithm development.
        Experience programming products or large projects.


for more information, contact:

Vlad Sejnoha                            vlad@kurz-ai.com
Chief Scientist
Kurzweil Applied Intelligence, Inc.     617 893 5151 x 308
411 Waverly Oaks Rd.,                   fax: 617 893 6425
Waltham, Ma. 02154 USA

                Position for Language Model Scientist

Kurzweil Applied Intelligence is looking for someone to help improve
the language model in our large vocabulary speech recognition products.
We sell Kurzweil Voice for Windows, a large vocabulary isolated word
speech recognizer which allows the operation of PCs, including text
dictation, by voice.

Job Description:

Develop and test Language Model algorithms in order to improve
        the accuracy of our speech recognizers.

Help with product implementations of the language models.

Assure that the product implementations of the algorithms work
        as desired.

Qualifications:
Required:
        experience with information theory, including
        stochastic processes, estimation and modeling,
        C/C++ programming experience;
        relevant masters or doctorate degree

Desired:
        knowledge of mathematical approaches to language modeling;
        experience with computational linguistics
        experience with natural language processing
        experience with speech recognition


For further information, please contact:


Francis Ganong                          francis@kurz-ai.com
VP Research

411 Waverly Oaks Rd,                    fax: 617 893 6525
Waltham MA. 02154

engineer to join a team developing a continuous speech, natural
language system for controlling Windows applications.  Development is
done in C++; duties will span much of the project, and include the
development and testing of Windows, NLP, speech recognition, and
application scripting code.

Requirements:
        BA in CS/EE
        3-4 years work experience
        2 years C++ programming experience
        experience in product development

Desired experience:

        C++ class design
        Windows programming, preferably including MFC and OLE 2.0
        Visual Basic or other application scripting language
        NLP
        speech recognition
        software testing and QA

               Speech Research Assistant Position

Job Description:

As a member of a small team, participate in algorithmic development,
and particularly testing of isolated-word and continuous large
vocabulary speech recognition algorithms taking close direction from
more senior staff members.  Position involves coding algorithms (in C
and C++), writing shell scripts to run experiments, maintaining structure
of data in UNIX directories, and analyzing experimental results.

Activities include:

        Coding new algorithms, in C or C++.
        Writing and maintaining shell scripts.
        Analysis and reporting of experimental results.
        Testing algorithms against benchmark databases.
        Managing data in benchmark and product databases.

Required qualifications

        Experience running experiments in a Unix environment
        Experience analyzing and reporting experimental results
        Ability to program in C,  C++, and Unix shells.

Desired Qualifications:

        Undergraduate degree in computer science, electrical engineering,
                or related field
        knowledge of or experience with speech recognition

                Speech Scientist Position

Job Description:

As a member of a small team, participate in algorithmic development of
isolated-word and continuous large vocabulary speech recognition products.
Activities include:

        generating new algorithms,
        coding them,
        testing them against benchmark databases.
        assuring that algorithms included in the product are correct.

(Actual product coding is done by another group, in close consultation
with the research group; but the research group is responsible for helping
to check that the product implementation is correct.)

Areas of technical responsibility may range over the whole recognition
process; but are likely to focus on candidate selection, acoustic
representation, computation of acoustic scores, or search.

Required Qualifications:

        Ability to program in C and C++
        Masters or doctorate in computer science, electrical engineering,
                or related field

Desired Qualifications:

		    === EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY ===

DIRECTORSHIP OF IDIAP (an AI laboratory in Switzerland)

The "Institut Dalle Molle d'Intelligence Artificielle Perceptive" (IDIAP)
in Martigny, Switzerland is active in the following research areas:

- Image processing, with applications to object and handwriting recognition

- Neural network design and training, with applications to classification
and optical implementation

- Automatic speech recognition, with applications to vocal servers.

IDIAP is supported by the Dalle Molle Foundation along with public-sector
partners at the local and federal levels (in Switzerland).  The institute
maintains close contact with the University of Geneva and the Swiss Federal
Institute at Lausanne. IDIAP's computational facilities are Sun/UNIX based.
More information about the institute is available via the World Wide Web:
http://maya.idiap.ch/

The position of director of this institute is presently open. Candidates
should possess a Ph.D. or equivalent degree in computer science or a
related area.  They must be able to conduct research on the basis of solid
theoretical and applied knowledge, and be experienced in leading a team of
researchers. Salaries will be aligned with those offered by the Swiss
government for equivalent positions. Candidates are expected to begin
activity as soon as possible during 1995. The duration and renewal of
contracts is subject to negotiation.

A few words about the geographic location : the town of Martigny, offering
a variety of cultural activities, is situated in the south of Switzerland,
close to both France and Italy.  It is located in a scenic Alpine region
with some of the best skiing and hiking in Europe, and is well connected by
rail and highway to the rest of Switzerland.

To apply for a position at IDIAP please send the following documents in
plain ASCII format via electronic mail:

- a curriculum vitae
- a list of publications
- a description of the research program that the candidate wishes to pursue
- the names and addresses of three personal references.

Applications are due by March 1, 1995 and should be sent electronically
to "search@idiap.ch".

Subject: Job: Speech Recognition (Australia)

Research Engineer (Automatic Speech Recognition)
In The Department of Electrical Engineering
The University of Sydney.  AUSTRALIA

Position No. B02/04

The Speech Technology Research Group requires a suitably
qualified engineer or computer scientist with DSP experience
to work primarily on an ARC funded project on automatic
recognition of accented Australian English speech.  The Group
is one of Australia's largest in the area, and takes a
multidisciplinary approach to problems in automatic speech
recognition, speech synthesis, and speech understanding.

The successful applicant will have a Ph.D. or equivalent in a
suitable discipline, and research experience in DSP, automatic
speech recognition, preferably using Hidden Markov Models.
Advanced C programming experience, preferably in a UNIX
environment, good spoken and written English, and proven
ability to work cooperatively in a group are also essential.
Familiarity with Entropic/Waves software is desirable.

The position is available for 2 years commencing 1st February
1995, with the possibility of renewal, subject to need and
funding.  Membership of a University approved superannuation
scheme is a condition of employment for new appointees.

For further information contact Associate Prof. R.W. King
(+612 351 2239) or Dr. Julie Vonwiller (+612 660 4706).

to qualifications and experience)

above,including curriculum vitae, employment history, qualifications,
telephone number, and the names addresses and telephone numbers of two
referees, to The Personnel Officer, (Group B) Link Building
J13, The University of Sydney, Sydney NSW 2006


--------------------------------------------------------

APPLE-ISS RESEARCH CENTER

A US$10 million joint venture between Apple Computer Inc. and
the Institute of Systems Science of the National University of
Singapore, located in Singapore, is looking for:

A Senior Speech Scientist
-------------------------
The successful candidate will have research expertise in
computational linguistics, including natural language
processing and **English** AND **Chinese** statistical
language modeling.  Knowledge of state-of-the-art bigram and trigram
language models, cache language models, and part-of-speech
language models are required.

A Text-To-Speech Project Leader
-------------------------------
The successful candidate will have research expertise
expertise in two or more of the following areas:  computational
linguistics, including natural language parsing, lexical
database design, and statistical language modeling; text
tokenization and normalization; prosodic analysis.
Substantial knowledge of the phonology, syntax, and semantics of Chinese
is required.  Knowledge of acoustic phonetics and/or speech
signal processing is desirable.

Both candidates will have a PhD with at least 2 to 4 years of
relevant work experience, or a technical MSc degree with at
least 5 to 7 years of experience.  Very strong software
engineering skills, including design and implementation, and
productization are required in these positions.  Knowledge of
C, C++ and Unix are preferred.

A Unix & C Programmer
--------------------
We are looking for an experienced UNIX & C Programmer,
preferably with good industry experience, to join us in
breaking new frontiers.  Strong knowledge of UNIX Tools
(compilers, linkers, make, X-windows, E-mac, ...) and
experience in Matlab required.  SUN and Silicon Graphic
experience is an advantage.  Programmers with less than two
years industry experience need not apply.

These positions include interaction with scientists in the
National University of Singapore, and with Apple's speech
research and productization efforts located in Cupertino,
California.  Attendance and publication in international
scientific/engineering conferences is encouraged.

Benefits include an internationally competitive salary,
housing subsidy, and relocation expenses.

Send a complete resume, enclosing personal particulars,
qualifications, experience and contact telephone number to:

Mr Jean-Luc Lebrun
Center Manager
Apple-ISS Research Center, Institute of Systems Science
Heng Mui Keng Terrace, Singapore 0511
Tel  :  (65) 772-6571             Fax  :  (65) 776-4005
Email:  jllebrun@iss.nus.sg

Subject: Job: Hypercomputing and Design Project, Rutgers University

From: ellman@athos.rutgers.edu (Tom Ellman)
Subject: Programmer Position on Hypercomputing and Design Project
Date: Wed Feb 01 22:59:49 EST 1995
Organization: Rutgers University LCSR
Keywords: LISP Fortran C X Unix Programmer Job


The High-Performance Computing and Design (HPCD) Project in the
Laboratory for Computer Science at Rutgers University is looking
for a programmer to support research in artificial intelligence,
computer-aided design and numerical/scientific computation.

Duties:

Under the direction of faculty, the person filling this position is
responsible for the design, coding, maintenance, and documentation of
experimental computer programs; performs system maintenance and
administragive tasks, including installing and maintaining system
software; participates directly in coordinating code and coding
standards for research projects; and evaluates, installs and maintains
systems and application programs.

Qualifications:

Requires a bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, and
approximately two years experience in LISP and either C or FROTRAN
programming on Unix systems. Requires knowledge of X systems,
understanding of basic algorithms and data structures and their
perofrmance implications, ability to deal with complex and evolving
experimental programs, and effective interpersonal skills.  Knowledge
of numerical analysis, parallel systems programming, and computational
fluid dynamics is preferred.

Salary Range:  Approximagely.  $40,000-$55,000

The HPCD Project:

The HPCD Project is an ARPA-funded, multi-university,
multi-disciplinary research project, whose goal is to study the
application of Artificial Intelligence and other areas of Computer
Science, of Computational Science (especially Computational Fluid
Dynamics), and of high-performance computing to problems of design.
Design tasks we are currently working on include design of jet engine
inlets and nozzles, container ships, microprocessors, and
microlithography processes.  The HPCD Project is centered at Rutgers
University in New Brunswick, NJ, where the person hired for this
position would be located.

To apply:

Send (hard copy) resumes to
    Catherine Kelble
    Personnel Department
    Rutgers University
    New Brunswick, NJ 08903
    (908) 445-3020

Refer to "posting number 222 on 1/30/95".  (This is required
to officially apply for the job.)

In addition, I would appreciate a copy be sent to me by email
(preferred) at ellman@cs.rutgers.edu

or US mail at
    Prof. Tom Ellman
    Dept. of Computer Science
    Hill Center, Busch Campus
    Rutgers University
    Piscataway, NJ 08855-1089

or US mail address.

L'Universite de Moncton est le plus grand etablissement francophone
a l'exterieur du Quebec en Amerique du Nord.

Moncton est une ville bilingue au bord de l'Atlantique dans une region
avec une economie tres dynamique et des opportunites d'activite plein
air en toute saison. De parcs nationaux et provinciaux entourent la
region.

plusieurs laboratoires de PCs ainsi que des connexions INTERNET a
haute vitesse. La recherche est active dans plusieurs domaines:

- programmation logique (principal site de developpement du compilateur
  BinProlog)

- traitement de la langue naturelle (plusieurs projets d'envergure
  en collaboration avec L'Institut Canadien de Technologie
  Linguistique, situe sur le Campus de l'Universite de Moncton)

- architectures d'ordinateur, communications et reseaux, intelligence
  artificielle, programmation parallele et distribuee, infographie.

s'adresse aux citoyen(ne)s canadien(ne)s et resident(e)s permanent(e)s.

postes sont offerts egalement aux hommes et aux femmes.
