Subject: Job: OCR, NLP (Xerox)

From: benw@giddy.xis.xerox.com (Ben Wittner)
Subject: US-MA-Boston-Peabody  OCR algorithm and software developer, Xerox
Followup-To: benw@xis.xerox.com
Organization: Xerox Imaging Systems
Date: Fri Feb 03 13:34:07 EST 1995

                             Job Posting
               Xerox Imaging Systems / A Xerox Company
                          9 Centennial Drive
                           Peabody, MA 01960


Position Title:  Member of Technical Staff
  Reporting To:  Vice President, Technology
    Department:  Technology Development
          Date:  February 3, 1995


General Function:

  As a member of the technical staff you will investigate and develop
  algorithms and software to be used in Optical Character Recognition (OCR)
  and Document Analysis (DA) based products.  Techniques used to improve
  OCR and DA accuracy will come from fields such as pattern recognition,
  language modeling, natural language processing, computational
  linguistics, machine learning, constrained search, computer vision, image
  morphology, speech recognition, statistical decision theory, and more, yet
  must conform to commercial constraints of speed and memory.


Responsibilities:

  To generate and test ideas of how to improve OCR and DA software
  accuracy, speed and size;

  To deliver clear, well-designed code which integrates the ideas shown to
  be beneficial;

  To cooperate with other members of the team, sharing ideas and
  determining areas of responsibility;

  To keep abreast of advances in the fields of OCR, DA, pattern
  recognition, language models, and other appropriate appropriate fields.
  In particular, keeping abreast of relevant advances at Xerox PARC and
  other Xerox research facilities.


Contacts:

  Internal: fellow team members
            platform specific product engineering groups
            other Xerox researchers and developers
            marketing
            quality assurance
            documentation
            customer support

  External: researchers in OCR, DA, pattern analysis, language modeling, etc.
            customers


Position Requirements (Knowledge and Experience):

  M.S. or Ph.D. in area related to OCR, DA, pattern recognition, language
  modeling, natural language processing, computational linguistics, machine
  learning, constrained search, computer vision, image morphology, speech
  recognition, statistical decision theory, etc.

  Ability to work in a group and communicate well in English.

  Ability to write product quality C code.

  Experience working on part of a large software project is a plus.

  Experience with software system design is a plus.

  Experience with UNIX programming tools is a plus.


Please reply to:

  Ben Wittner
  Xerox Imaging Systems
  Peabody, MA 01960
  U.S.A.

  benw@xis.xerox.com
  fax: 508-977-2438

for the U.S. Department of Defense. The project will use SUN workstations,
C and C++, Motif, and a relational DBMS (Sybase).

Salary range is from US$40 - 60K. These are full-time positions with some
paid overtime.

Software Engineer II
B.S. in Computer Science or related field such as Math or EE, with at
least 3 years experience, advanced degree is a plus. Primary emphasis on
software design and development. Must be proficient in software design
methodologies, and a variety of operating systems and programming
languages. Object-oriented design and code is a plus. Must also have good
writing skills. Will perform as technical lead, providing technical
direction for 2-7 engineers.

Knowledge Engineer
B.S. in Computer Science or related field such as Math or EE, with at
least 3 years experience, advanced degree is a plus. Primary emphasis on
knowledge acquisition and knowledge representation. Must be proficient
with a variety of KBES tools and knowledge engineering methodologies.

Database Engineer
B.S. in Computer Science or related field such as Math or EE, with at
least 3 years experience, advanced degree is a plus. Primary emphasis on
relational DBMS concepts, schema development, and normalization. Must be
proficient with at least one commercial RDBMS. Sybase experience,
familiarity with additional RDBMS systems, and object oriented design and
code are a plus.

Interface Engineer
B.S. in Computer Science or related field such as Math or EE, with at
least 3 years experience, advanced degree is a plus. Primary emphasis on
user interface design concepts. Must be proficient with Motif and at least
one commercial GUI builder. Familiarity with object oriented design and
code is a plus.

CSI is an equal opportunity employer.

clearance), please e-mail or fax your resume, availability, and salary

                           The Netherlands

The Condorcet project is to be carried out at the Knowledge-Based
Systems Group, funded by the Technology Foundation (STW). It aims at
advanced methods for Information Retrieval of texts on engineering and
natural science. The project will involve:
- the development of concept systems, to be used as indexing
languages, and
- the development of a method to assign concepts used as indexing
terms to documents on the basis of semi-automatic analysis of title
and abstract.
Robust natural-language processing is one of the techniques that will
be used.

We offer positions in a challenging project in which several
international and Dutch companies have taken an active interest.

The project is foreseen to start on June 1, 1995, and is to run for
four years. Funding has been granted under the usual STW guidelines.
This means that funding is guaranteed for two years, while the
remaining two years will be funded on the basis of a positive
assessment of the accomplishments of the first 18 months.

The project will be led by dr. P.E. van der Vet and
prof.dr.ir. N.J.I. Mars. Four persons will be hired for the
project. We solicit applications for each of the positions described
below.


                      POST-DOC RESEARCHER (M/F)
                          Vacancy NET/95/035

TASKS: You will investigate knowledge representation languages
and knowledge representation systems and the interplay between
automated syntactic analysis of natural language, grammars, and
knowledge representation. Information retrieval systems will also be
investigated. In addition, you will be charged with daily
supervision of the project (in particular planning and monitoring
progress). The definitive list of responsibilities will be made in
accordance with the qualifications, experience, and interests of the
candidate.

QUALIFICATIONS: Ph.D. or equivalent degree in computer science or
linguistics, preferably with sizeable experience in knowledge
representation languages/systems or in language engineering, with in
both cases demonstrable experience in the other field; doctoral
dissertation on a relevant subject matter; familiar, or at least
willing to become familiar, with subjects in natural science; fluency
in English, both in speech and in writing; good social skills;
prepared to remain at the University for the duration of the project.

Your gross salary will depend on experience and qualifications and is
maximally Dfl 7002,-- per month.


           JUNIOR RESEARCHER IN LANGUAGE ENGINEERING (M/F)
                          Vacancy NET/95/036

TASKS: You will test and elaborate an available grammar for Condorcet
purposes. You will also contribute to the development of a
machine-readable lexicon and that of the modules for semantic and
discourse analysis of the texts. Your tasks are aimed at practical
results, and no Ph.D. thesis is foreseen.

QUALIFICATIONS: Masters or equivalent degree in language engineering;
familiar, or at least willing to become familiar, with subjects in
natural science; fluency in English, both in speech and in writing;
good social skills; prepared to remain at the University for the
duration of the project.

Your gross salary will depend on experience and qualifications and is
maximally Dfl 5989,-- per month.


          PH.D. RESEARCHER IN KNOWLEDGE-BASED SYSTEMS (M/F)
                          Vacancy NET/95/037

TASKS: You will investigate knowledge representation languages and
knowledge representation systems for indexing. You will also study the
use of such languages for the representation of background knowledge
and its storage in a knowledge base. In addition, you will design
modules for semantic and discourse analysis of the texts. You are
required to write a Ph.D. thesis.

QUALIFICATIONS: Masters or equivalent degree in computer science, with
emphasis on knowledge-based systems; familiar, or at least willing to
become familiar, with subjects in natural science; fluency in English,
both in speech and in writing; good social skills; prepared to remain
at the University for the duration of the project.

This position falls under the official Dutch regulations for Ph.D.
researchers (the so-called "AiO-stelsel").


                     SCIENTIFIC PROGRAMMER (M/F)
                          Vacancy NET/95/038

The Knowledge-Based Systems Group uses a network of Sun SPARC stations
connected to a fileserver. Programs are developed in Quintus Prolog
and C, under Unix. For demo programs, interfaces under X-Windows will
have to be developed.

TASKS: You will design and implement the system that is the main
practical product of Condorcet and interfaces for purposes of
demonstration. You will pay attention to maintainability and
portability. You will also make tools that are already available fit
for use in the project. You will be a full member of the project team.

QUALIFICATIONS: Relevant degree obtained at a polytechnic or
university; experience with the relevant programming languages and
environments; fluency in English, both in speech and in writing; good
social skills; prepared to remain at the University for the duration
of the project.

Your gross salary will depend on experience and qualifications and is
maximally Dfl 5452,-- per month.


                           MORE INFORMATION

More information is given in the information brochure, which can be
obtained through WWW at URL:

http://www_is.cs.utwente.nl:8080/kbs/condorcet/homepage.html

Alternatively, you can obtain the document through fax or ordinary
mail; requests are to be directed at
phone +31 53 89 36 90
fax   +31 53 33 96 05
with unambiguous identification of the fax number or address to which
the brochure is to be sent.


                        FOR ALL APPLICATIONS:

* In view of current regulations of the European Union, candidates who
are citizens of a European Union member state are preferred.

* The University of Twente is an equal opportunity employer.

* If you are interested, send an email with the vacancy code, your CV,
a list of publications, and names of two persons acting as references
as email message to vet@cs.utwente.nl or mars@cs.utwente.nl. At the
same time, send a letter with the same information to:

Drs. F.J. van der Avert
Dept. of Computer Science
University of Twente
P.O. Box 217
7500 AE Enschede
The Netherlands

or fax to the same person, fax nr. +31 53 33 38 85.

             Job advertising for a position at EFG GmbH

EFG is a wholly owned subsidiary of Siemens Nixdorf Informationssysteme AG.
Synapse-1 is one of the fastest dedicated neurocomputers in the
world. (Wirtschaftswoche No.4 / 1/19/1995 )
Currently the Application Developement Department at EFG is looking for
additional personnel. The person will be a part of the team involved in
building commercial applications primarily to be run on the Synapse platform.
There exist an opening for a person with some of the following
qualifications:

- C/C++          > 5 years of commercial software developement

- UNIX/Solaris   > 5 years  of experience

- neural network applications > 3 years of commercial software developement

- background in Computer Science, Physics, or Mathematics, Ph. D. preferred

- commercial and/or academic experience and good understanding of
  algorithms in at least one area among
      + Image processing
      + Signal Processing
      + Pattern Recognition

- good knowledge of MS-Windows software development environment

- working languages are German & English

Subject: AI opportunities
Date: Tue, 14 Feb 1995 15:45:19 -0500
From: "John D. Burger" <john@linus.mitre.org>


The MITRE Corporation is seeking candidates for the following
positions in our Artificial Intelligence Center in Bedford, MA:

A technical business/management leader to help grow our language-based
interaction effort. This position will have an emphasis on developing
new customer relationships, maintaining visibility in existing
research and customer communities (e.g. NSF, NLM, ARPA) and building
synergy across related technology areas including intelligent
tutoring, speech, human-computer interaction, collaborative computing,
and digital libraries.  This position requires prior experience in
successfully leading groups of technical professionals and
demonstrated expertise in one or more of the following areas:
speech/natural language processing; information retrieval;
human-computer interaction.  A PhD in a related field is strongly
desired as is a solid basis of knowledge in Computer Science and
language based interaction.  Previous accomplishment in identification
and development of new customer relationships is desirable as is a
significant publication record.

A Lead Scientist is needed to function as a an individual contributor
in our effort to develop and implement standards for intelligent
mutimodal interfaces.  This position requires thorough understanding
of the underlying issues in intelligent interface design and strong
familiarity with theory and implementation for more than one interface
component.  This might include speech interfaces, knowledge
representation, parsing, generation, multimodal graphical
presentation, and discourse.  Strength in trainable and corpus based
language and interface technologies to promote robustness and
portability is highly desirable.  This position requires a high level
of skill in LISP and C programming and experience with object oriented
models of client/server computing, such as CORBA.  The successful
candidate should have a MS (PhD preferred) in CS or a related field
and several years of experience in building large intelligent
interfaces.  The ability to express technical ideas clearly is vital.

A Member of the Technical Staff with a strong background in advanced
natural language processing and information extraction technologies is
being sought to pursue integration of information retrieval and
automated tagging approaches with natural language processing.  This
will include development of automatically trained modules for rapid
adaptation to new domains and languages.  This position requires a
high level of skill with LISP and C programming as well as experience
working with large corpora.  Background in trainable or corpus based
systems is a plus, as are excellent interpersonal and communication
skills.

The MITRE Corporation is a not-for-profit organization operating in
the public interest that conducts research and provides systems
engineering and acquisition support.  MITRE is responsible for
providing objective expertise and guidance to technology dependent
government agencies.  Working at corporate offices in Bedford, MA and
McLean, VA, and at various worldwide site locations, MITRE also plays
a key role in uniting existing and emerging technologies to meet the
nation's most complex electronic information needs.

For confidential consideration please forward your resume' by Fax to
(617) 271-3402, Attn.  David Gentes.

E-mail response should be submitted to dgentes@mitre.org.  

Mail response should be submitted to:  
	The MITRE Corporation
	Office of Human Resources; Section INET
	P.O. Box 857
	Bedford,   MA  01730 - 0857

MITRE is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer
and is committed to diversity in our workplace.  U.S. Citizenship is
required.

			  MULTIPLE OPENINGS
	     TEXT PROCESSING / NLP / OOP / MULTIPLATFORM


Tasc, Inc., a recognized leader in the field of Applied Information
Technology, has multiple positions open for computer science majors,
preferably with advanced degrees, in the text processing application
area.  Candidates should have backgrounds in artificial intelligence,
object oriented programming, and an interest in computational
linguistics.  We are looking for hands-on programmers and researchers,
who like to solve real problems.  Backgrounds in cross-platform
development with C, C++, Unix, and windows (X- and Microsoft)
programming in a client/server environment are very important.
U.S. citizenship required.

TASC, Inc. maintains a major research facility called The Information
Refinery (TM), where it develops products and deliverable systems
where text and multimedia processing are key components.  We are
looking for computer scientists who are interested in playing a
significant role in this fast-growing business area for TASC.

For consideration, submit resume (ASCII or PostScript format) and
salary history to Mr. Tram Smith (tnsmith@tasc.com), 12100 Sunset
Hills Road, Reston, VA  22090, (703) 834-5050.  TASC, Inc. is an equal
opportunity employer, M/F/D/V.  For further information about TASC,
Inc., check our home page at URL  http://www.tasc.com/

Subject: Job: NLP Faculty at Johns Hopkins
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: brill@peregrine.cs.jhu.edu (Eric Brill)
Subject: Faculty Position Open at Johns Hopkins, CS Dept, NLP
Date: Mon Feb 20 13:20:52 EST 1995
Organization: The Johns Hopkins University CS Department


                     The Johns Hopkins University

                    Department of Computer Science
                                 and
              Center for Language and Speech Processing


The Johns Hopkins University invites applications for a new faculty
position at the level of Assistant Professor in the Department of
Computer Science in conjunction with the Center for Language and
Speech Processing of the G.W.C. Whiting School of Engineering.

We are particularly interested in candidates with research interests
in an experimental area of natural language and speech processing,
such as machine learning techniques applied to language processing,
statistical language processing and modeling, discourse and dialogue,
machine translation, spoken language systems and information
retrieval.  The ability and desire to participate in collaborative
projects is essential.  In addition, candidates should have teaching
interests in more general areas of natural language processing and
computer science, such as statistical modeling, data compression or
cryptography.

This will be a tenure-track position in the Department of Computer
Science, which will include significant collaborative research
opportunities with the multidisciplinary Center for Language and
Speech Processing.

All applicants are expected to have an outstanding research record,
commitment to quality teaching and the ability and willingness to
develop a research program of the highest quality.  Applicants should
send a comprehensive cv, statement of research interests and the names
of at least three references via email.  Send plain text, Postscript,
or self-contained LaTex files to faculty_search_nlp@cs.jhu.edu.

The Johns Hopkins University is an equal opportunity, affirmative
action employer.  Minorities and women are strongly encouraged to
apply.

Subject: Inductive Logic Programming Research Position at UNSW
Date: Mon Feb 20 00:41:24 EST 1995
Organization: School of CompSci & Eng, Uni Of NSW, Oz
Keywords: machine learning, logic programming, dedcutive databases

              RESEARCH ASSOCIATE (Fixed Term)
        SCHOOL OF COMPUTER SCIENCE AND ENGINEERING
      University of New South Wales, Sydney, Australia
                         REF. 131

 ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 Salary: A$36,345 -- A$40,087 per annum (A$1 = US$0.75 approx).
 ---------------------------------------------------------------------

 The School of Computer Science and Engineering is seeking to employ a
 Research Associate for a project  funded by the Australian Research
 Council.  This project, based at School's Artificial Intelligence
 Laboratory, involves the development and evaluation of knowledge
 discovery tools (based on inductive logic programming) for databases.

 Duties will involve all aspects of the project: design and analysis of
 knowledge discovery tools, planning and running experiments, analysing
 results, assisting in the preparation of papers, and taking part in
 discussions and seminars.

 Applicants must have recently completed a PhD in Computer Science
 (preferably with specialization and publications in Machine Learning),
 and will be required to have excellent C and Prolog programming skills.
 Good communication skills, both written and oral and a knowledge and
 understanding of EEO/AA principles are required.  Familiarity with
 concepts and techniques of Logic Programming and Deductive Databases
 is desirable.

 The appointment is initially for a period of 12 months with further
 renewal up to three years, dependent on funding.


 Enquiries may be directed to Dr Arun Sharma on telephone +61-2-385-3938,
 email: arun@cse.unsw.edu.au; Assoc Prof Claude Sammut on telephone
 +61-2-385-3933, email: claude@cse.unsw.edu.au; or Dr John Shepherd
 on telephone +61-2-385-3969, email: jas@cse.unsw.edu.au.

 Applications close 8 March 1995.  Applications, mentioning the Reference
 number, should be sent to the following:

 The Recruitment Officer
 Human Resources Department
 The University of New South Wales
 Sydney, NSW 2052, Australia
 Fax: +61-2-662 2832

Date: Thu Feb 09 16:58:31 EST 1995

Speech & Handwriting Recognition Scientists

Lexicus, A Division of Motorola
Palo Alto, California

Lexicus, a division of Motorola, is involved in the research, development
and marketing of recognition technologies. The aim is to provide enabling
technologies for a new class of devices using innovative user interfaces.

Lexicus/Motorola is looking for talented scientists to develop the next
generation of pen and voice interfaces in a wide variety of devices,
ranging from communicators to personal computers.

Successful candidates will undertake state-of-the-art research and
development and join a multidisciplinary entrepreneurial team which takes
advanced technology to market rapidly.

Candidates should be creative and original thinkers, and have research
experience in the area of speech recognition, handwriting recognition
(on-line or off-line), signal processing or general pattern recognition.
Experience with Asian languages is a plus.

Dr. Ronjon Nag
Lexicus, A Division of Motorola
490 California Avenue, Suite 300
Palo Alto CA 94306

looking for highly mathematical engineers to build new software
products using neural networks and statistical techniques.

HNC Software builds neural network and statistical models for credit
card fraud detection and other applications in the financial industry.
HNC Software is a rapidly-growing $16 million company, currently
employing approximately 150 people, located in San Diego, CA.  If you
want to solve challenging problems in a stimulating environment with a
team of extremely bright people, contact us.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Job Title: Staff Scientist

Position number: 107 (Please include this number in your response to
ensure timely processing.)

Minimum Qualifications:

MS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, Statistics, or
related field.  2 years experience with some area of data analysis.
Some prior experience with neural networks or statistical modeling
techniques.  Strong mathematical problem-solving skills.  Strong oral
and written commuications skills, both in interactions with customers
and in interactions with co-workers.

Desired Qualifications:

Ph.D, winner of mathematics competitions, 5 years experience in some
area of data analysis, 2 years experience with neural networks or
statistical modeling techniques, 3 years C/Unix experience, some
experience with SAS or Splus, demonstrated excellence in developing
new algorithms.

Job Description:

Design, build and evaluate mathematical algorithms and neural network
models for various financial applications.  Interact with clients to
determine how to best meet their needs.

About HNC:

HNC provides a non-smoking work environment and comprehensive
benefits.  HNC is an equal opportunity employer.

COMPANY:  Carnegie Group, Inc.

Position:  Senior Engineer, R&D in Cognitive Engineering, HCI

LOCATION:	PITTSBURGH

POSITION REQUIRES:  PhD preferred

WORK EXPERIENCE:  2-4 years demonstrating innovative research and development
skills and ability to create advanced human-machine interfaces based on
Cognitive Engineering approaches. Solving HMI problems in application areas
that impose severe cognitive demands on the end-user, such as 
planning, scheduling, logistics, command and control, transportation, etc. 
Either academic or industry R&D experience is acceptable. 

SKILLS REQUIRED:
 
1. Substantial knowledge / training in Cognitive Engineering and
Human-Machine Interfaces. 
Knowledge of state-of-the-art research in these areas.
Publications in these areas highly desirable. 

2. Excellent analytic, problem definition and solving skills.
- Ability to analyze the application domain and to distill core
decision-making processes and challenges from often rich, semi-articulated
problem domains.
- Ability to identify and adapt applicable technologies found in academic and
industrial research.
- Ability to create/invent innovative HMI approaches and to
design them into successful decision-support solutions.

3. Ability & experience in writing and publishing technical papers.
Proposal-writing skills a plus. 

4. Solid programming skills. Ability to rapidly design and code functional
prototypes of HMI. 

Design and development of usable software in X/Motif in UNIX Workstation
(SUN preferred) environments.

5. Software engineering skills, knowledge of software methodology 
paradigms and CASE tools is a plus. Object Oriented Technology a plus.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

This researcher will join an R&D team dedicated to creation and early
investigation of advanced technologies for Decision Support System
applications in Logistics Planning, Battlefield Planning, Medical
Evacuation, and related domains.

The successful candidate will contribute to two current directions of
this R&D team:
  Primary responsibility -- development of novel Human-Machine interfaces
  supporting decision-making process in highly dynamic, stressful environment. 
  
  Supporting responsibility -- research and development of innovative
  approaches to reactive, dynamic planning and scheduling integrated with
  command and control processes;

This would range from initial technology creation and investigation through
rapid prototyping of proof of concept demonstrations.  This researcher may
also support the transition of promising technologies into DSS development
efforts conducted by a separate team. Publications of technical papers and
preparation of powerful, innovative proposals for Government R&D funding
will also be part of her/his responsibilities.


Contact:  Pauline Nadeau, nadeau@cgi.com
          (412) 642-6900, 642-6906 (fax)

Date: Thu, 23 Feb 95 13:58:25 EST
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Lectureships in Natural Language Engineering, Durham Univ.
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: Russell Collingham <R.J.Collingham@durham.ac.uk>
Date: Wed Feb 22 12:46:22 EST 1995
Organization: University of Durham, Durham, UK

*******************************************************************************
    4 LECTURESHIPS IN NATURAL LANGUAGE ENGINEERING AT DURHAM UNIVERSITY
*******************************************************************************

The Department of Computer Science at Durham University is looking to
recruit 4new lecturers in the field of Natural Language Engineering.
The 4 lecturerswill join the Laboratory for Natural Language
Engineering, one of the foremostcentres in this subject, and actively
collaborate on the LOLITA (Large-scale,Object-based, Linguistic
Interactor, Translator and Analyser) project.

We expect to recruit 2 experienced lecturers on the B scale, and 2
junior oneson the A scale.

The experienced lecturers will have an excellent research track-record
in thefield, with substantial publications, a good PhD supervision
success rate and ahealthy fund-raising portfolio.

The junior lecturers will be researchers of clear potential and dedication.

All the lecturers must have a PhD in Computer Science or related
areas, be veryhighly motivated, ready to work in a tightly knit group
on a long term project,and able to teach at the required 'excellent'
level. They would be expected totake up their posts as soon as
possible, but not later than October 1995.

We are looking in particular for the following areas of NLE:
planning(discourse and dialogue), learning (grammatical and semantical
rules, newconcepts, optimisations), applications (large scale systems,
front-end,user-defined modes), knowledge representation and
elicitation (concept mappingacross languages and domains, supervised
and automatic analysis of corpora,encyclopedic knowledge); however,
specialists in other areas of NLE are verywelcome to apply.

The LNLE is a thriving group of 22 researchers (reader, lecturers,
RA's andpostgrads).  Our central piece of work is the LOLITA system
(see below fordetails).  The LNLE is part of the Department of
Computer Science, a rapidlyexpanding and very successful department,
whose other main wing is theinternationally renown Centre for Software
Maintenance. At the last ResearchAssessment exercise we have been
awarded a grade 4. We have excellent computingfacilities, and we are
soon to move into a substantial newly-refurbishedlocation.

Formal advertisments will shortly appear in the Guardian and the Times HES.

Informal enquiries may be addressed to:

Dr. Roberto Garigliano,
Laboratory for Natural Language Engineering,
Computer Science Department,
University of Durham, South Road, Durham, DH1 3LE.
tel: (091) 374 2639     fax: (091) 374 2560
e_mail: Roberto.Garigliano@durham.ac.uk




*******************************************************************************                                THE LOLITA PROJECT

Here are a few facts about LOLITA:

- based on a conceptual graph of more than 100k nodes, compatible with WordNet;

- able to perform the fundamental morphological, grammatical,
semantical,pragmatical, discourse analysis and generation functions;

- under development for more than 8 years, at present a team of more
than 20 researchers working on it;

- mainly written in Haskell, a pure lazy functional language, with
high orderfunctions, polymorphic types and type classes (more than 45k
lines of code,corresponding to approx 450k lines in an imperative
language);

- can handle analysis of real text samples; prototype applications
includequery, dialogue, template extraction, translation and language
tutoring;

- advanced inference capabilities, including multiple inheritance,
relevantimplication, epistemic reasoning and plausible reasoning
(analogy, closedpersonal world assumption and plausible epistemic);

- processes English and Chinese; Italian and Spanish under development;

- very fast execution times (a parallel version under development);

- applications with Siemens Plessey, Rolls-Royce and other major
companies andgovernmental organisations;

- chosen by the Royal Society for its prestigious 1993 Soiree Exhibition;

- registered for the 1995 MUC-6 competition (sponsored by ARPA, the
AdvancedResearch Projects Agency of the USA).

*******************************************************************************

From: staffing@sri.com (Staff Recruiting)
Subject: USA-CA, Menlo Park-S/W/Systems Architect - SRI Int'l
Date: 23 Feb 1995 23:30:55 GMT
Organization: SRI International

SRI International is one of the world's largest contract research firms. 
We wre founded in 1946 in conjuction with Stanford University as the
Stanford Research Institute and later became fully independent as SRI
International.  Solving client technological and business problems is our
primary goal.

The Speech Technology and Research (STAR) Laboratory at SRI International
is currently seeking applicants for a Software/Systems Architect position. 
You will be responsible for the architecture, evolution, and maintenance of
SRI's state-of-the art DECIPHER (TM) Speech Recognition System.  You will
provide software engineering leadership for an outstanding team of
engineers and speech researchers. 

 Expertise required in Unix SW development.  Proficiency in C and
algorithim development required.  Experience with other Unix and
microcomputer platforms a plus.  A degree in Computer Scoence or
significant experience in large-scale software development required.




The STAR Laboratory has a staff of about 25, including engineers, computer
scientists, and linguists, offering a fine balance of the skills required
for leading-edge speech technology development: signal processing,
phonetics/phonology, mathematical modeling, and software engineering.  The
staff represents expertise and fluency in many foreign languages.

The STAR Laboratory maintains substantial facilities including about 70
networked UNIX workstations, digital signal processing hardware, signal
processing software tools, digital telephone interface capability, and
audio data capture, archival, and playback equipment. 

If you are interested in the above position please forward your resume to :

SRI International
Professional Staffing
Engineering Research Group

From: "Albert T. Corbett" <ac21+@andrew.cmu.edu>
Subject: US-PA-Pittsburgh Research Programmer
Date: Fri, 24 Feb 1995 09:31:38 -0500
Organization: Hci Institute, Carnegie Mellon, Pittsburgh, PA

                         RESEARCH PROGRAMMER POSITION

             The Pittsburgh Advanced Cognitive Tutor (PACT) Center
                         Carnegie Mellon University

The PACT Center at CMU is developing cognitive computer tutors for high
school mathematics.  We have developed and successfully deployed the
PUMP Algebra Tutor in three city high schools in conjunction with the
Pittsburgh Urban Math Project.

A full-time programmer is needed to assist in developing and evaluating
a cognitive computer tutor for 10th-grade math.  This tutor will
emphasize inductive and deductive reasoning in problem solving contexts,
with emphasis on geometry and statistics.

Responsibilities will include

  * programming a production system cognitive model of problem solving
      and mathematics knowledge,
  * problem-solving interface development,
  * data analysis, and
  * assistance in deploying and maintaining the computer tutors. 

BS or equivalent in cognitive science, cognitive psychology or computer
science and AI programming experience in Lisp is required.  Cognitive
modeling experience, production system programming, or prior job
experience in cognitive science research is desireable. 

The initial appointment is for one-year, but additional years are
anticipated.  We would like to hire immediately, although we can wait as
long as May for a particularly strong candidate.

Please send resumes to Albert Corbett (email:  corbett @cmu.edu, FAX:
268-5576, or Human Computer Interaction Institute, Carnegie Mellon
University, Pittsburgh, PA 15213).

Subject: Job: Statistical Language Modeling at CEDAR (SUNY at Buffalo)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: rohini@acsu.buffalo.edu (Rohini Srihari)
Organization: SUNY at Buffalo / Ctr for Document Analysis and Recog (CEDAR)
Date: Fri Feb 24 12:38:40 EST 1995

*************************************************************
         RESEARCH POSITION - Statistical Language Modeling

Center of Excellence for Document Analysis and Recognition (CEDAR)
State University of New York at Buffalo

*************************************************************

A Research Scientist position is available immediately
to work on a project where
statistical models of language (English) are used in recognizing
(i.e., reading) handwritten text.  CEDAR conducts research
and development work on all aspects of document
recognition/understanding and is situated on the campus of
SUNY at Buffalo.


REQUIRED BACKGROUND:
    Experience in statistical language modeling
    Experience with statistical NLP (e.g., part-of-speech
    tagging, stochastic parsing)
    Experience in OCR or speech recognition highly desirable
    Experience in corpus-based linguistic analysis for English
    C Programming
    Good written and verbal skills

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
    A Ph.D. or M.S. in Computer Science or Computational
    Linguistics with expertise in
    statistical language modeling is required.
    In the case of M.S., 2-3 years work experience in
    the above areas is required.

JOB DESCRIPTION
    To work on a project which integrates statistical
    language modeling techniques with
    on-line (pen-based), off-line (paper-based)
    and machine-print text recognition systems.
    Specific tasks include the development and testing of
    language models specific to each of the media described above,
    as well as accounting for domain influence.
    Will be working with a team of
    other researchers engaged in the recognition task.

SALARY
    Will be based upon qualifications and relevant experience.

Interested applicants should send a CV (including 3 references)
along with a letter describing background and research
interests to:

 Rohini K. Srihari
 CEDAR/UB Commons
 SUNY at Buffalo
 520 Lee Entrance, Suite 202
 Buffalo, NY 14228-2567

 e-mail: rohini@cedar.buffalo.edu
 Fax: (716)-645-6176

Note: preliminary submission of application through e-mail is
encouraged.

Several positions are currently open for Research Programmers at the
Field Robotics Center of the Robotics Institute, Carnegie Mellon
University.  All positions have a common set of minimum requirements
and preferred qualifications outlined below. In particular, we're
looking for candidates with a strong background in the following
areas:
 
- Real-time control systems / VMEBus / Embedded systems
- Network programming / TCP/IP /
- Computer vision
- Artificial intelligence
- Graphical simulation/animation
 
 
TITLE:          Research Programmer
DEPARTMENT:     Robotics
SALARY RANGE:   Negotiable
STARTING RANGE: Negotiable
FLSA STATUS:    Exempt
HOURS:          Full-time
 
This position is responsible for developing software for advanced
field robot prototypes.  Duties include working with scientists,
engineers and programmers to integrate, test and evaluate complete
robot systems; participating in group efforts of problem analysis,
preliminary and detailed design discussions and review integration;
developing software specification documents; engaging in code
development and debugging; document production; evaluating and testing
software developed by others.
 
Minimum qualifications:
 
B.S. in computer engineering or computer science or equivalent with
experience in software development in a project team setting or
completed software projects outside the classroom; strong UNIX, X11, and
C experience; strong math, analytical, oral and written communications
skills to write software documentation; ability to work under pressure
and meet inflexible deadlines required.
 
Preferred:
 
M.S. in computer engineering or computer science or equivalent with
one or more years in a non-academic position in a related field;
experience with modern software engineering methods including CASE
tools; experience with SunOS/Solaris/VxWorks real-time operating system.
Experience with IGRIP/TELEGRIP or WorldToolKit packages.

Received: by wotan.sics.se (5.65+bind 1.7+ida 1.4.2/SICSclient-1.1)
	id AA01718 (for wiren@sics.se); Fri, 3 Mar 95 09:37:07 +0100
Date: Fri, 3 Mar 95 09:37:07 +0100
From: wiren@sics.se
Message-Id: <9503030837.AA01718@wotan.sics.se>
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Jobs
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

The Swedish Institute of Computer Science (SICS) invites applications
for positions on its research staff for an initial period of 1--2 years
(with possibilities for extension) in the group for language
engineering and human-computer interaction. The successful candidates
will be expected to participate in existing research projects, perform
independent research and contribute to research contracts with
industrial and governmental sponsors.

The ideal candidates will have a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science,
Cognitive Science, Linguistics or a related discipline and will have
demonstrated strong potential for excellence in research. They will
have a solid background in language engineering and/or human-computer
interaction as well as experience in the development and implementation
of large systems (preferably using Prolog). People who like to work in
projects, and who like to take on responsibility for proposing and
driving their own research projects in areas relevant to the group, are
all encouraged to apply.

The research of the group focuses on user-adaptive interfaces,
multimodal communication, large-scale natural-language-processing
systems, application of statistical and machine-learning techniques to
natural-language processing, and text and document processing. Current
projects deal with user-adaptive help systems, speech-to-speech
translation, integration of natural-language and speech technology,
spoken-language interfaces to virtual realities, dialogue models for
voice-controlled telecom services, support systems for human
translation, and information filtering.

SICS is located just north of Stockholm and consists of over 50
professionals plus students and visitors. It is a non-profit research
foundation sponsored by the Swedish National Board for Technical and
Industrial Development and several major Swedish companies. In addition
to language engineering and human-computer interaction, SICS has a
strong position in distributed and parallel computer systems, logic
programming, high-speed networks, formal design methods, software
methodology, knowledge-based systems, neural networks and virtual
realities. SICS has close contacts with university- and institute-based
research both inside Sweden and in Europe, North America and Japan. More
information about SICS can be found at WWW site http://www.sics.se/.

Applications with CV and if possible addresses of two referees should
be sent (by mail, fax or e-mail) to the address below. SICS is firmly
committed to equal employment opportunity.

Information:
        
        Annika Waern or Mats Wiren
        Swedish Institute of Computer Science
        Box 1263
        S-164 28 Kista, Sweden
	
        E-mail: annika@sics.se, wiren@sics.se
        Phone:  +46 8 752 15 00
        Fax:    +46 8 751 72 30

resources/funding and reputation.

initiative, to design new products for new markets.

Flexible opportunity and fascinating projects for seasoned 
software engineers with advanced development backgrounds! 

Near NYC.  
============================================================  
  
BACKGROUND:  
 
An advanced technology lab with outstanding resources is   
developing a broad array of unique, PC-based, interactive,   
networked multimedia prototypes. The group needs an    
experienced software engineer with significant MS Windows 
development experience, capable of designing and prototyping user 
interfaces for innovative, leading-edge multimedia and networked 
retrieval projects. (Note: a human factors specialist will serve 
as a resource).

Prototypes are generally developed in Visual Basic, Toolbook, or 
an equivalent tool, with subsequent product development in C/C++ 
Windows. Experience with these tools is mandatory.

Experience in networking, multimedia, interactive products and 
evolving markets is especially valued.


QUALIFICATIONS:  
  
General requirements:  
  
. MS/CS with 5+ years software engineering experience preferred 
  (but flexible).  
. Experience with use of C/C++ MS Windows programming and  
  libraries -- *this is a mandatory requirement*.
. Experience with MS Windows and UNIX environments, especially  
  for GUI development. 
. Experience designing/building principled, attractive, highly 
  usable GUIs for Windows applications. 
. Excellent analysis and communications skills. Ability to  
  creatively develop applications based upon sketches,  
  discussions, and/or existing partial prototypes. 
 
Significant Pluses:  
  
. Experience with multimedia (e.g., video) development a plus.  
. Experience in client/server application development a plus. 
 
Comments: 
  
. Outstanding, well-funded group in **excellent** market  
  development position.  
 
ENVIRONMENT:  
  
Supportive, multiple small-team environment with excellent   
resources and facilities. Located within an hour or so of New 
York City. 

Unquestionably outstanding company and group!  
   
In compliance with new posting guidelines, I am compelled to say:
"Salary: US$55-90K, full-time position"
but in fact compensation varies quite widely with experience and 
skill. Salaries are *very* competitive.

 
RECRUITER'S NOTES and SUBMISSION PROCEDURES: 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
 
WHAT TO SEND: Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit a  
resume and an accompanying cover letter/note referencing this  
posting as:     NETPOST 95-03-03 02 
 
HOW TO SEND IT: If you can, digitally. In order of preference,  
submission options are: 
 
1)  Send materials via e-mail (ASCII ONLY PLEASE) to  
    > cthomas@access.digex.net < 
    with optional pretty-printed hardcopy via regular mail. 
 
    or 
 
2)  Send hardcopy via regular mail. 
 
3)  Fax it in FINE MODE if you simply must fax. (Faxes OCR  
    poorly; unless your life is already 2% garbled, please  
    don't send them if you have an alternative.) 
 
All submitted resumes are treated with strictest  
confidentiality. Your resume will *never* be released without  
your explicit consent, following verbal discussion of specific  
R&D opportunities -- we're a specialized, low volume,  
relationship-oriented firm, *not* a high volume resume mill. 
 
All respondents will be given careful consideration. However,  
depending upon response volume, I regret that I simply cannot  
guarantee a personal reply to all respondents.

Dear ........, 

     The Computer Systems and Communications Group of Tata Insti-
tute  of Fundamental Research is looking for inputs at  the  Post 
Doctoral and some senior levels to the Speech Synthesis  Recogni-
tion, Signal Processing, Script Recognition and Natural  Language 
Processing activities of the group.

     We offer scientists from outside India (non-Indians as  well 
as  those  of Indian origin) Visiting positions  to  start  with. 
These can be converted into continuing appointments depending  on 
mutual interest. We also welcome overseas scientists who wish  to 
spend their sabbatical here as `Visiting Professors'.

     As  our group is not very large, we are keen to add  to  our 
strength  in  areas in which we are already quite active  (or  in 
related areas). 

     I  enclose herewith our announcement regarding our  openings 
and  would  request you to give it wide publicity in  the  speech 
community (in your laboratory as well as at any other places  you 
deem  fit).  I have also sent herewith a write up describing  our 
activities; please give this to persons who are interested. 

     I  would  also request you to personally bring this  to  the 
attention of colleagues who may be interested in such openings. I 
am  counting  on your help to add to the strength of  our  group; 
your  familiarity with our group would be a positive  factor  for 
motivating those who might hesitate to come to India.

     With warm regards, 


Yours sincerely,

     Sd/-

( P.V.S. Rao )

Enclosure :

*******************************************************************

               VISITING POSITIONS FOR SPEECH RESEARCHERS 

               Computer Systems and Communications Group 
          Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Bombay, India. 

POSTS :   

     The Computer Systems and Communications Group is looking for 
researchers with bright academic record both at the post-doctoral 
and  senior  levels  to further strengthen  and  consolidate  its 
speech research programme. Positions of visiting fellow, visiting 
scientist  and  visiting professor are open for  scientists  from 
outside India (NRIs as well as others) based on their  experience 
and contributions to the field. These appointments may be  looked 
upon  either  as a) stepping stones to tenure  positions  in  the 
institute  (for those intending to stay back in India), or as  b) 
means  to establish personal links and interaction with TIFR  and 
other  Indian  groups (for those wishing to spend a year  or  two 
here  and  return to their home base). The  honorarium  paid  for 
vising  appointments  is more than adequate to  cover  all  local 
expenses and accommodation. 
     
THE GROUP :

     The CSC Group has been in existence for over forty years and 
has built India's first digital computer in the mid-fifties.  The 
group  has been active in the speech area since the early  seven-
ties  and  has  made contributions in  speech  synthesis,  speech 
recognition,  speech  perception  and speech coding.  It  is  now 
recognized as the Nodal Centre for Speech Technology research  of 
the  Knowledge Based Computing Systems (KBCS) project  funded  by 
the  United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and the  Depart-
ment of Electronics (DOE) of the Government of India. 

     The  research  activities of the group  include,  a)  speech 
recognition, b) speech synthesis, c) speech signal processing, d) 
search  algorithms,  e) natural language processing,  f)  cursive 
script recognition and synthesis, g) coding techniques, h) paral-
lel  processing  and development of  high-speech  interconnection 
network  i)  real-time systems, j)  development  of  architecture 
compiler and k) computer visualization. 

     The  group has extensive research facilities including i)  a 
cluster  of several Sparc 10 and Vax workstations and PC 486  and 
386s,  ii)  a speech data acquisition system and a  `KAY'  speech 
analysis  workstation. In addition, the researchers can make  use 
of  the institutes' central computing facilities including a  DEC 
Alpha cluster consisting of AXP 3000/800s and 4000/720s.

THE INSTITUTE :

     The Tata Institute of Fundamental Research in an  autonomous 
government  funded  research  institution  that  has  established 
itself  in the international arena in nuclear science,  mathemat-
ics,  computer  science, molecular biology, radio  astronomy  and 
science  education  over the last five decades and will  soon  be 
celebrating its Golden Jubilee. 

     The institute is located in the southern most tip of the the 
long island of Bombay and is surrounded by the sea on three sides 
and is only two miles from downtown Bombay (including the  finan-
cial,  business and cultural centres). The surroundings are  com-
pletely  free  of noise, pollution and crowds normally  found  in 
large  cities.  On-campus accommodation will  be  available  with 
modern amenities for the visiting scientists. The institute  runs 
free  bus services to downtown Bombay and the local  rail  termi-
nals. 

     Interested  researchers may please contact Dr.  P.V.S.  Rao, 
Senior  Professor and Head, Computer Systems  and  Communications 
Group, giving their curriculum vitae, names of referees and other 
details by, 

          Email : rao@tifrvax.tifr.res.in

          Fax : +91-22-2152110/2152181, or 

     Letter :  Prof. P.V.S. Rao
               Head, Computer Systems and Communications Group
               Tata Institute of Fundamental Research
               Homi Bhabha Road, Bombay - 400 005, India

     For  further  details  or enquiries  regarding  to  visiting 
positions, please contact Prof. P.V.S. Rao at the above address.

Subject: Job: Visiting Scholar, US Army War Collage
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

The Center for Strategic Leadership (CSL), U.S. Army War College, invites
applications from established faculty scholars for a one or two year
appointment as the U.S. Army War College Chair of Artificial Intelligence,
beginning April - September 1995.

Duties include teaching at least one course; assisting in the design of,
instruction of, and participation in senior leader development workshops
and seminars; and dealing with the use of modeling, simulation, and
artificial intelligence in national strategy development and strategic
military planning. Provides expertise and instruction for a three person
Knowledge Engineering Group (KEG), which is responsible for developing AI
and expert system applications to support the War College curriculum,
studies/analysis for other DoD agencies, and post functions.

Ph.D. in Computer Science with a concentration in Artificial Intelligence
(Expert Systems and Modelling & Simulation) required.  Applicants must be
U.S. citizens eligible for a Top Secret security clearance. Salary is
commensurate with experience.

The application deadline is 15 March 1995. Applications will be accepted
and reviewed under the Inter-governmental Personnel Act. Send letter of
application, resume, curriculum experience, and the names of three
references to:

   Director
   Center for Strategic Leadership
   U.S. Army War College
   Carlisle Barracks, PA 17013-5050

   Tel: 717-245-3017

Subject: Job: Statistical NLP at SUNY Buffalo (New York)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: geetha@acsu.buffalo.edu (Geetha)
Subject: Statistical Language Modeling - CEDAR/SUNY-Buffalo,NY,USA
Organization: SUNY at Buffalo / Ctr for Document Analysis and Recog (CEDAR)
Date: Mon, 6 Mar 1995 14:27:52 GMT



*************************************************************
         RESEARCH POSITION - Statistical Language Modeling

Center of Excellence for Document Analysis and Recognition (CEDAR)
State University of New York at Buffalo

*************************************************************

A Research Scientist position is available immediately
to work on a project where
statistical models of language (English) are used in recognizing
(i.e., reading) handwritten text.  CEDAR conducts research
and development work on all aspects of document 
recognition/understanding and is situated on the campus of
SUNY at Buffalo.


REQUIRED BACKGROUND:
    Experience in statistical language modeling
    Experience with statistical NLP (e.g., part-of-speech
    tagging, stochastic parsing)
    Experience in OCR or speech recognition highly desirable
    Experience in corpus-based linguistic analysis for English
    C Programming
    Good written and verbal skills

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE
    A Ph.D. or M.S. in Computer Science or Computational
    Linguistics with expertise in 
    statistical language modelling is required.
    In the case of M.S., 2-3 years work experience in 
    the above areas is required.

JOB DESCRIPTION
    To work on a project which integrates statistical 
    language modeling techniques with
    on-line (pen-based), off-line (paper-based) 
    and machine-print text recognition systems.
    Specific tasks include the development and testing of
    language models specific to each of the media described above,
    as well as accounting for domain influence.
    Will be working with a team of
    other researchers engaged in the recognition task.

SALARY
    Will be based upon qualifications and relevant experience.

Interested applicants should send a CV (including 3 references)
along with a letter describing background and research 
interests to:

 Rohini K. Srihari
 CEDAR/UB Commons
 SUNY at Buffalo
 520 Lee Entrance, Suite 202
 Buffalo, NY 14228-2567

 e-mail: rohini@cedar.buffalo.edu
 Fax: (716)-645-6176

Note: preliminary submission of application through e-mail is
encouraged.

Subject: Job: Expert Systems at NYNEX (White Plains, NY)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: randy@nynexst.com (Randall Pope)
Subject: US-NY-White Plains Expert System Development&Maintenance
Date: 6 Mar 1995 14:44:47 GMT
Organization: Nynex Science & Technology, Inc.


We are currently seeking someone to take over the responsibility for 
maintenance, support, and development of an expert system.  The expert
system is one of a set of three expert systems that perform network planning
for the NYNEX telephone network.  The position is a challenging one for
the following reasons.  

First, the expert system is unique in that it combines heuristic approaches with
optimization techniques.  Being able to maintain and enhance the code requires 
attention to detail and the ability to grasp a complex domain.  Second, the 
position entails providing run time support during four annual production runs.
This requires the ability to deal professionally with end users of varying 
technical experience with strict deadlines.  Third, the expert system is 
important to the company because of its impact on network quality and capital 
savings.  This is an opportunity for your work to be used on a real world
problem with significant impact.

The following qualifications are required for the position:
	- an MS or PhD in Computer Science/Engineering, or a related field
	- Substantial Lisp programming experience
	- Experience with Sun Workstations
	- Experience with Unix and shell scripts
	- Willingness to work with end users
	- Familiarity with Oracle, Kee, and C++ are a plus


If you feel you are qualified and interested, please send your resume to:

	Randy Pope
	NYNEX Science and Technology
	500 Westchester Avenue
	White Plains, NY  10604

	e-mail: randy@nynexst.com
	fax:    914-644-2404

You may send your resume as plain e-mail, PostScript, US Mail, or as a
fax.

NYNEX is the regional Bell operating company for the Northeast.
Science and Technology is the research and development organization of
NYNEX. We are located about 30 minutes north of New York City, in
suburban Westchester County.

Subject: Job: Machine Translation at Logos Corp (New Jersey)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: bates@kingfish.ho.att.com (00752-Jan Bates(HOR815)6891)
Subject: Bilingual or Multilingual Technical Support--New Jersey
Organization: Logos Corporation
Date: Mon, 6 Mar 1995 15:54:51 GMT



	Bilingual or Multilingual Technical Support--New Jersey

We are a natural language translation software company that develops and 
markets an integrated package of Computer Aided Translation (CAT) tools 
used to translate technical documentation in a variety of DTP and WP 
formats into French, Italian, German, and Spanish. Our tools include machine 
translation, translation memory and translation management tools, running on 
networked Sun SparcStations and WindowsNT servers with PC clients.

We are seeking technical support people to service our international
customer base.

Duties include:

-Preparing sample translations using Logos translation software.
-Postediting and proofreading in Italian, French, Spanish, German.
-Updating systems dictionaries in your target language.
-Creating and translating release, installation, and end user documentation.
-Installing and testing new software releases.
-Training end users and technical people at customer sites.
-Providing product support to sales and marketing.
-Handling customer support calls; assisting end users.
-Troubleshooting software and hardware problems.
-Working with systems and linguistic development to prioritize and track 
 bug fixes and enhancements spawned by customer support requests.

Required:

-Thorough knowledge of English grammar
-Thorough knowledge of Italian, French or Spanish grammar (Italian preferred, 
 then French, then Spanish. German knowledge would be a plus.)
-Technical documentation writing/production or technical translating
       experience
-Proficiency with DTPs: e.g., Interleaf, FrameMaker, SGML
-Proficiency using UNIX Operating System (SunOS), DOS, and Windows
-Familiarity with Sun system administration and server-client networking 
-Excellent interpersonal and communications skills
-Good problem-solving and analytical skills

Desired: 

-Proficiency with Sun system administration and server-client networking 
           (e.g., PCNFS, any TCP/IP packages) 
-Proficiency with window managers: e.g., OpenWindows, Motif, Xwin, WindowsNT
-Proficiency with WPs: e.g., MSWord, WordPerfect, AmiPro, troff
-Customer support experience
-Software training or  teaching experience
-Oracle DBMS, SQL
-German a plus

If you meet most of these requirements, and are looking for
a chance to put your language and computer skills to work in the 
exciting new field of machine translation technology and CAT tools, we'd like to 
talk to you. 
If you are not a native bilingual, but know UNIX system administration, 
server-client networking, advanced DTPs, software support and technical 
writing really well please do not hesitate to apply.


Please FAX or mail your resume to: 

K. Kearns
Logos Corporation
200 Valley Road, Suite 400
Mt. Arlington, New Jersey  07856
FAX: 201-398-6102

or send email to 

kkearns@logos-usa.com

environment using various front-end development and design tools. We are 
interested in people who get excited about delivering top quality 
software and seeing it implemented. If you have proven experience in GUI 
development and relational database technology, if you want to 
continually learn, and if you would like to apply new skills in one of 
the most rapidly changing and growing sectors of the U.S. economy, join 
Oxford Health Plans.

We don't follow standards.
We set them.
 
At Sprint, we believe extraordinary technology can do the work of
many people.  But no technology can have the impact of one
extraordinary person.  If you're an experienced IS professional
who thrives on change and likes the idea of contributing to the
success of a technology driven company, you owe it to your career
to explore the opportunities at Sprint.
 
We currently have openings at our Kansas City location for
proven, innovative IS professionals with the following
background:
 
Network Management Developers
 
We are seeking candidates to fill a range of development
positions from experienced software developers to development
managers.  These are exciting opportunities to work with the
latest state-of-the-art technology to address the next generation
of network management solutions for the Sprint network, including
SONET, ATM, SS7, and other support systems.
 
The successful candidates will have 2+ years development
experience in a UNIX environment.  Experience with a combination
of the following technologies: C, C++ or other Object
Technologies, Client/Server, [Distributed, SQL or Object
Databases] MOTIF, X11, CMIP, TCP/IP, TP4, ROSE, ACSE, Expert
Systems, ATM, SONET, Switching and SS7.  Previous experience in
Network Management Development and telecommunications is strongly
preferred.  A BS in Computer Science and/or Electrical
Engineering or equivalent experience is required.  A Master's
degree is a plus.
 
Sprint offers highly competitive salaries and a very attractive
benefits and relocation package.  If you have the talent and
desire to set new standards in technology, please send your
resume and salary requirements to:  Sprint, Dept. BG/OCC,
Mailstop #MOKCMT1201, 1200 Main, Kansas City, MO 64105.  We are
proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V.  Also, we maintain a
drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse
testing.

Subject: Job: Expert Systems at NYNEX Science & Technology
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: jml@nynexst.com
Subject: Expert Systems, Telephony, AIN
Date: Wed, 08 Mar 95 11:50:31 PDT
Organization: Nynex Science & Technology, Inc.


Job Description: Develop software tools to assist with rapid specification of 
new or enhanced network services.  These tools embed knowledge of the 
capabilities and limitations of the various systems composing the network to 
help assure that service specifications are complete, consistent, and 
unambiguous.  The user interacts with the tools through a windowed, graphical 
interface.

The position requires an ability to work independently to analyze needs and 
conceive solutions which satisfy them.  Tasks will range from analysis of 
network and operations systems and their inter-working in an AIN environment, 
through implementation of systems models representing the knowledge gained 
from that analysis.  The empahsis will be on delivering a workable product 
within the time alloted.

Qualifications: Broad systems analysis/software engineering experience, 
including evidence of keen analytical and creative design abilities, and 
familiarity with OOD, and at least one OOPL.  Experience with expert systems 
development (in particular, knowledge engineering) will be a plus.  In-depth 
knowledge of telephone network and operations systems (e.g. SN&M, OAM, AMA 
procuedures) will substitute for less extensive software engineering 
experience.

If you are interested in this postion please email your resume

                      Job Announcement
                      ================

We need to fill a position in algorithm and software development
in document image analysis. Specifically, the work involves working
with a small team to develop and code algorithms for line drawing
interpretation. The position needs to be filled as soon as possible.

Prerequisites:
==============
 o MS in CS, EE, or related field
 o Pertinent experience in document image analysis
 o Excellent C and Unix skills
 o Excellent communication skills

Preferred:
==========
 o PhD in CS, EE, or related field
 o Experience in line drawing interpretation, specially interpretation
   of utility company drawings
 o Experience in hand-printed or machine-printed character recognition
 o Experience working in a team of software developers using source
   code control
 o Experience with SunOS and Solaris
 o Knowledge of X/Motif

NYNEX is the Regional Bell Operating Company or RBOC (the local phone
company) for most of New York and New England. NYNEX Science & Technology
is the R&D division of NYNEX.

Subject: Job openings at the MIT Artificial Intelligence Laboratory

POSTDOCTORAL ASSOCIATE under MURI--2 positions; #95-0087C or #95-0088C

The Artificial Intelligence Laboratory at MIT has recently been
awarded an ONR grant for the Multidisciplinary University Research
Initiatives (MURI) to build trainable, modular vision systems.  Two
individuals needed to conduct research in computer vision with
emphasis on adaptability, learning, or evolutionary techniques.
Research is aimed at application areas such as face recognition;
intelligent highways; hand-eye coordination; or trainable object
recognition.

QUALIFICATIONS: PhD in Computer Science, Computational Vision,
Neuroscience, or related discipline is required. C and/or Lisp
programming and Unix experience are assumed.

NOTE: These positions are dependant on the arrival of anticipated
funding, with March 1 the probable start date.

Qualified applicants, send resume and cover letter referencing either
position to:

  Mr. James McCarthy, Personnel Officer
  Personnel Office
  Massachusetts Institute of Technology
  Building E19-238
  Cambridge, MA  02139

MIT is an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

                This is a non-smoking environment.


Research Scientist for MURI----Position # 95-0086R

The Artificial Intelligence Laboratory at MIT has recently been
awarded an ONR grant for Multidisciplinary University Research
Initiatives (MURI) to build trainable, modular vision systems.  A
Technical Coordinator is needed who will be responsible for
coordination and integration of vision research modules produced at
MIT (Artificial Intelligence Laboratory; Laboratory for Information
and Decision Systems; Technology, Management, and Policy Program;
Center for Biological and Computational Learning), Harvard University,
and Cal Tech.

Will be responsible for defining interface standards, system
conventions, and hardware compatibility.  Must integrate modules
produced according to the standards into a set of working
demonstrations.

QUALIFICATIONS: Project coordination experience necessary, as well as
C and Lisp programming, vision, and graphics.  MS or PhD in relevant
field required.

NOTE: This position is dependant on the arrival of anticipated
funding, with March 1 the probable start date.

Qualified applicants, send resume and cover letter referencing
position #95-0086R to:

  Mr. James McCarthy, Personnel Officer
  Personnel Office
  Massachusetts Institute of Technology
  Building E19-238
  Cambridge, MA  02139

MIT is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.
        This is a non-smoking environment.

invites applications for several full-time positions at the Master's and
Ph.D. levels, in areas such as:

 * Knowledge-Based Systems
 * Knowledge Acquisition
 * Intelligent Information Integration
 * Intelligent Agents
 * Human-Computer Interfaces
 * Electronic Commerce
 * Intelligent Computer Aided design
 * Intelligent CAI
 * Virtual Environments for Training
 * Machine Translation

research and/or construct large-scale, leading-edge systems.  Positions are
available for recent graduates as well as researchers with considerable
experience. Candidates must be able to work well in a cooperative research
environment and express their ideas clearly in presentations and in writing.

USC/ISI, located in Marina del Rey, California is part of the USC School of
Engineering and maintains close academic ties with the Department of Computer
Science. USC/ISI is a leading research laboratory with over 200 staff members
of whom 70 have advanced degrees, and 47 graduate students pursuing advanced
degrees. ISI provides an exciting environment that encourages publication and
guarantees a wide dissemination of research results.

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU

Subject: Job: Agent-Oriented Systems at AAII (Australia)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: burgos@aaii.oz.au (David burgos,,,)
Subject: Senior Software Developer - wanted
Organization: Australian Artificial Intelligence Institute
Date: Thu, 9 Mar 1995 07:37:44 GMT


------------------------------------------------------------------
Senior Software Developers - Agent-Oriented, Distributed Real-Time Systems

The Australian Artificial Intelligence Institute (AAII) is seeking to
appoint a Senior Software Developer to work on strategic, leading-edge
projects in the area of Distributed Real-Time Agent-Oriented Systems.

Candidates must have a solid grounding in Computer Science, possess
excellent C++ skills using Unix, and have a proven track-record in
software development, using object-oriented methodologies, preferably
the Booch methodology.

AAII performs strategic research and development in AI. Systems developed 
at AAII include a real-time fault diagnosis system for the space shuttle, 
an air traffic management system which ensures optimal runway usage under 
complex constraints, an intelligent telecommunications management system, 
and an advanced simulation system for the RAAF. These are all based on 
original research and product development carried out at AAII over the past 
six years. These projects have culminated in the development of a new, C++
based agent-oriented programming environment, dMARS.

In dMARS, agents are intelligent computer processes which have the capacity 
to reason about their goals, how to achieve them, when to abandon them, and 
so on. The dMARS system allows for many such agents to be distributed and
controlled transparently across multiple machines.

Because of the challenging nature of the work undertaken, AAII is seeking
world-class technical staff to tackle its new projects. You will be working 
on some of the most exciting and innovative projects being undertaken in 
Australia, and will be part of a highly-motivated team which has a diverse
range of skills. The Institute is a very dynamic environment with much
interaction between the members of the different projects, leading to a
valuable exchange of ideas.

The current role, requires extensive industrial/commercial experience in a
software engineering environment. As a guide, a minimum of 5 years in a lead
role would be expected. As well, substantial interpersonal skills are sought
as the role requires a mentoring/leading approach within a team environment.

Salary: negotiable, commensurate with the applicant's experience and ability.  
All applications will be treated in strictest confidence.

Written applications, including a current resume and names of two referees,
should be forwarded to the address shown below. Alternatively, you are welcome
to email your application to: jobs@aaii.oz.au.

	Personnel Department,
	The Australian Artificial Intelligence Institute,
	Level 6, 171 La Trobe Street,
	Melbourne 3000.

          10 Mar 95 16:06:09 EST
Date: Fri, 10 Mar 95 15:51:09 EST
From: Mark.Kantrowitz@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu, ai+lisp-jobs@cs.cmu.edu, 
    ai+prolog-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Admin: Subscription Requests
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

There was a bug in the mailing list filter that prevented it from
filtering out certain kinds of subscription requests. This bug has
been fixed.

Also, the mailing lists are large enough now (450 on AI-Jobs, 435 on
Lisp-Jobs, 152 on Prolog-Jobs) that I cannot track down mail bounces.
If mail to your email address bounces for any reason, the email
address will be removed from the mailing list. If, after a service
failure at your end, you find yourself no longer receiving job
announcements, try resubscribing. If your mailer tacks on a bad return
address, use the MAIL command to specify a reliable email address. For
example,  
   mail foo@cs.bar.edu
   subscribe ai-jobs John Foo, Bar University
will set up a subscription for foo@cs.bar.edu and send a confirmation
message to foo@cs.bar.edu.

Mark Kantrowitz
ai@cs.cmu.edu

A newly-funded venture, based in Los Angeles, CA, USA, is seeking

Natural Language Processing Research Scientist

Menlo Park, California

The Research and Development Group at PWTC has ongoing efforts in
object-oriented programming, expert systems, model-based reasoning, and
machine learning.  We are expanding our effort in the area of intelligent
information retrieval.  We are seeking a person with a Ph.D. or M.S. in
natural language processing or equivalent experience to play a key role
in this expanding effort.

Requirements:
* Proven ability to implement your ideas on problems of realistic scale
* Ability to work cooperatively as part of a diverse team
* Willingness to learn about and work in a MS Windows environment
* Interest in learning about and working in financial domains

Advantages (not required):
* Specific experience with MS Windows programming tools
* Specific experience in financial domains

environment is a small but growing research and development group backed
by the stability of a Big Six accounting firm.  Interested candidates

was sent via    | Subscribe/Unsubscribe             ai+query@cs.cmu.edu
the AI-JOBS     | Available mailing lists include
mailing list.   |    AI-JOBS, LISP-JOBS, PROLOG-JOBS, AI-POSTDOC, AI-PREDOC
Received: from GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU by A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU id aa04670;
          15 Mar 95 14:17:53 EST
Date: Wed, 15 Mar 95 13:50:41 EST
From: Mark.Kantrowitz@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu, ai+ai-postdoc@cs.cmu.edu, ai+ai-predoc@cs.cmu.edu, 
    ai+lisp-jobs@cs.cmu.edu, ai+prolog-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Admin: Replace lists with newsgroups?
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

A subscriber has suggested that the AI-related jobs mailing lists be 
replaced or augmented with a newsgroup or newsgroups. Since I do not
have the facilities for a bidirectional email/news gateway, nor do I have
the time to write one, this would probably mean replacement. 

Before there is any discussion of this proposal (and such discussion
will NOT take place on this list), I would like to hear the answers to
two questions. Please email your responses to me directly at mkant@cs.cmu.edu.

   1. Would a change from a mailing list to a newsgroup adversely
      affect any of the list subscribers? Are there any subscribers
      who do not have access to netnews, or who strongly prefer to
      receive the job announcements in email form? Are there any other
      good reasons to remain as a mailing list? 

   2. Are any of you willing to take responsibility for the RFD and CFV
      process? I do not have the time to do this myself, but would be
      available to review the RFD and CFV posts before they went out.

My interpretation of the proposal is that it would replace the mailing
lists with three (unmoderated) newsgroups:
   comp.ai.jobs
   comp.lang.lisp.jobs
   comp.lang.prolog.jobs
The charters for these newsgroups would be for job postings, graduate
fellowship announcements, and postdoctoral position announcements.
Some issues to be discussed in the RFD include: posting of resumes, and
minimal moderation (to remove irrelevant posts and ensure that subject
lines are properly formatted).

Also, if this proposal does go forward, I'd like to see a proposal for
creating the following (unrelated) newsgroups that I think would be
equally useful:
   comp.ai.announce.books         Announcements of new AI books & publications
   comp.ai.announce.conferences   Announcements of AI conferences
The latter is necessary because news.announce.conferences is
essentially defunct, and even when it wasn't, the newsgroup needed
splitting anyway.

Mark Kantrowitz
mkant@cs.cmu.edu

- very interesting salary (including coverage for social security)
- reimbursement of travel expenses to and from Belgium
- a stimulating environment to work in.

possible, before the end of March.
