From: colinb@ibm.net (Colin Brace)
Date: 15 Apr 1995 05:30:28 -0500

[Apologies if you get this posting more than once. Queries by email 
for additional information should go to: 100126@1262@compuserve.com]


      	      European Language Resources Association


                         Chief Executive


The newly formed European Language Resources Association  (ELRA)
invites applications for the position of Chief Executive.

ELRA was established in February 1995, with the encouragement of the
European Commission, to promote the development and exploitation of
Language Resources (LR) for the European languages.  The role of the
non-profit Association is to promote the production of LR and to
collect, validate, and make them available to users  It will gather
information on market needs and encourage the Commission and other
funding bodies to support the development of the LR most urgently
needed.  Language Resources include all data necessary for language
engineering, such as monolingual and multilingual lexica, text
corpora, speech databases and terminologies.

The Association has members drawn from every country in the European
Union and expects to attract subscribers from throughout the world. At
present, ELRA is financed from membership fees and grants; in the
future the Association will derive income from the sale of licences to
users world wide. After an initial start-up period of four years, it
is planned that the Association will be financially independent and
self-supporting.

The Association is seeking a Chief Executive to manage the activities
of the Association.  This person is likely to be an independent
individual who, after appointment, will recruit a small team. Or he or
she might be  part of an existing organisation such as his or her own
small company whose activities do not conflict with those of the
Association. As well as the small full-time team the Chief Executive
will be able to obtain advice from specialists.  He or she will report
to the ELRA Board.  The first task will be to recruit the team and
establish an office at a suitable location within the European Union,
and to start, without delay, on the priority activities for collecting
and distributing Language Resources.


Responsibilities

The Association is seeking  a Chief Executive to:

  * Oversee the day-to-day operations of the Association, and
    implement the business plan of the Board

  * Manage a small support team and create an infrastructure for the
    collection, validation, and licensing of LR.

  * Implement licensing agreements for Language Resources

  * Promote the Association world-wide

  * Interact with the relevant players (i.e.: producers, owners and
    users of LR who may be in the industrial, commercial or academic
    world;  and governmental and non-governmental agencies)


Qualifications

The successful candidate will have:

  * A proven record of running a small organisation

  * Extensive experience in marketing language resources, software or
    other forms of intellectual property

  * Knowledge of and experience with intellectual property issues

  * Citizenship of, or residency papers for an EU country

  * Ability to work in at least two European languages is essential

  * Experience in the domain of language engineering is desirable.

Terms and conditions of employment will be subject to negotiation but
will be commensurate with the responsibilities of the post, and will
include performance-based incentives.


Application

Further information is available about the Chief Executive post and
the Association from the Membership Secretary, contact: Sarah Houston
(Tel: + 352 46 91 61, Fax: + 352 46 91 61,
Email:100126@1262@compuserve.com).
Applicants should send a cover letter addressing the points listed
above, together with a current Curriculum Vitae, to:

   Brian Oakley
   Chairman of the Steering Committee
   120 Reigate Road, Ewell, Epsom, Surrey, KT17 3BX, UK
   Tel: + 44 181 393 4096
   Fax: + 44 181 393 0547

Closing date for applications: 7 June 1995.

Organization: Technet, Singapore

Building Tomorrow's Intelligent Systems Today ...

Our company is a software house based in Singapore, a clean, modern 
city. Being situated in the technology hub of the Asia-Pacific 
region provides us with a conducive environment for world-class 
research and development. We specialize in the application of 
Artificial Intelligence, object-oriented technologies, graphics and 
RDBMS to real-world problems. We undertake turnkey projects and 
consultancy for clients primarily in the transportation, manufacturing 
and communication-services sectors. The systems we have delivered 
make innovative use of current technology, including graphics 
capabilities, search and constraint-based optimization and other AI 
techniques, wireless communications and client-server architecture.

We are looking for highly motivated computer professionals who are 
flexible enough to carry out a wide range of tasks ranging from 
software research, analysis and design, implementation, documentation 
and testing to customer liaison, support and training. These positions 
offer excellent prospect for individual growth, providing you with 
challenging and beneficial experience in emerging technologies.

Are you the one we are looking for?

All interested candidates should possess the following: 

-  A degree or higher degree in Computer Science.
-  Sound knowledge of UNIX, C++ and object-oriented analysis and 
   design methodologies.
-  Effective written and oral communication skills.
-  At least 2 years of practical experience in software development.

In addition, the following skills are highly desirable for each of the 
following positions:

Software Engineers (Artificial Intelligence)

-  Working experience with Artificial Intelligence technologies, 
   constraint-based systems, ILOG SOLVER or expert systems would be highly 
   regarded.
-  Experience in implementing planning and scheduling systems, 
   especially in a transportation, manufacturing  or 
   communication-services environment, would be advantageous.

If so, and you wish to join us and enjoy the benefits of a dynamic 
working environment where you can excel to your full potential, send 
us a detailed resume. Please enclose your personal particulars, 
educational qualifications, working experience, contact telephone 
number and expected remuneration. (In real-time please.)


                  Knowledge Engineering Pte Ltd
          Changi Airport P.O. Box 8001, Singapore 9181
                       fax: (65) 543 2109
                  email: ke@solomon.technet.sg

          Only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

From: suran@ils.nwu.edu (Michelle Suran)
Subject: US-IL-CHICAGO (Evanston)- CLIM/C++/Visual Basic PROGRAMMER-INSTITUTE LEARNING SCIENCES, NORTHWESTERN UNIV
Date: Thu, 20 Apr 1995 10:00:09 -0500
Organization: The Institute for the Learning Sciences



AVAILABLE POSITION:  PROGRAMMER ANALYST


LOCATION:	 THE INSTITUTE FOR THE LEARNING SCIENCES
The Institute for the Learning Sciences is a leading research institute
developing innovative computer implementations of new ideas in areas of
training and education.


STATUS:  Full-Time, 40 hours per week


JOB FUNCTION:	 
This job involves programming for a project that is using qualitative
reasoning and analogical reasoning techniques to develop new kinds of
educational software.  The software to be built includes systems that
enable teachers to craft simulations and an intelligent learning
environment that teaches students to build models, both qualitative and
quantitative.  The target student populations range from elementary through
high school students.  This project is expected to last at least two years,
starting in June.
 

SKILLS/EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:
This project requires a dedication to creating robust, efficient, and
friendly software and excellent working knowledge of Common Lisp. 
Experience with CLIM, C++, and/or Visual Basic is also a plus, as is
experience with artificial intelligence work and interface design.  The
development and delivery platform will be Pentiums running Windows, so
familiarity with that environment is also an advantage.


Send resume with salary history to:
Dept E95-Programming-KF
Administrative Services
The Institute for the Learning Sciences - Northwestern University
1890 Maple Avenue
Evanston, IL  60201

Copies of resumes can be emailed to forbus@ils.nwu.edu
Copies of resumes can be faxed to 708-491-5258

For additional information, please email or call (email preferred) Ken
Forbus at 708-491-7699.


EEO/AA Employer.  Employment eligibility verification required upon hire.

Company: Applied Language Technologies ("ALTech") is a fast-growing, 
         high-tech start-up company based in Cambridge, MA.  Founded in
         May of 1994, ALTech is a spin-off from MIT.  The company
         develops and sells speech understanding systems for
         automating telephone-based transactions and services.   

Job Title: Software Engineer

Responsibilities:

        - participate in the development of the company's core 
          speech recognition and understanding software.

        - develop tools and associated infrastructure to allow the
          technology to be rapidly deployed in a number of new applications

        - porting of the software to a number of different deployment
          platforms, including DSPs and Intel PCs.

        - optimization of code to reduce both memory and processing
          needs

        - work with in-house application developers to respond to 
          customer requirements.

Requirements:

   Education: Bachelors degree preferred.

   Programming Experience: 
        Significant experience in C programming required. Experience 
        in speech technology, Unix, Windows, assembly language
        programming, natural language processing, or digital signal 
        processors a plus. 

   Skills: 
        Desire to work in fast-changing, growing company. 
        Ability to work with minimal oversight. Ability and willingness to 
        take on diverse job assignments. Ability to forecast and meet 
        deadlines.

       SOFTWARE ENGINEER POSITION OPEN AT COGNITION CORPORATION

Cognition Corporation located in Bedford, MA is currently seeking a
skilled UNIX C/C++ software engineer to lead the design and
development of their Costlink product.  The job responsibilities
include the design, implementation, testing and maintenance of the
entire Costlink product.

Costlink provides an interface between Cognition Corporation's Cost
Advantage, an Expert System for providing Cost and Manufacturability
data early on in the design cycle of a manufactured product, and
various Feature-based CAD solid modelers, such as Parametric
Technology Corporation's Pro Engineer.

The desired candidate should possess:

        o a minimum of 5 years industry-level software development
          experience with at least 3 years working in C and/or C++
          in a UNIX environment
          (required) 
 
        o experience in the total life-cycle of a product, from the
          analysis and design phase, through implementation, testing
          and maintenance (required)
 
        o excellent written and verbal communication skills (required)

        o project leadership ability (required)

        o Lisp experience (preferred)
 
        o familiarity with the CAD industry in general and
          Feature-based solid modeling in particular (preferred)
 
        o familiarity with language-design issues including experience
          with parsers and parser-generators (preferred)
 
        o experience interacting with customers to handle training and 
          support issues (preferred)

Cognition Corporation is an 8 year old privately-held small company
with a generally informal and friendly work environment, providing
competitive salary, excellent benefits, a 401K program, and stock
options.

Interested parties should forward a copy of their resume to:

Cognition Corporation
209 Burlington Rd
Bedford, MA  01730
Attn: Human Resources

Fax: 617-271-0813

Email: personnel@ci.com

Received: from GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU by A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU id aa04399;
          26 Apr 95 14:23:27 EDT
Date: Wed, 26 Apr 95 14:21:54 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Research Programmer on Soar Project (Pittsburgh, PA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: rempel+@cs.cmu.edu (Allan Rempel)
Organization: School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon
Date: Wed Apr 26 10:58:51 EDT 1995

The Soar Project at Carnegie Mellon University has an opening for a
Research Programmer.  One of the primary tasks of this position is
to maintain Soar, an AI architecture written in C.  Maintenance includes
fixing existing known bugs as well as new bugs that come up, making
enhancements, releasing new versions when a critical mass of fixes has
been made, and installing versions of Soar locally.

Another task is being a system administrator for the machines used by
people on the Soar project.  These duties include dealing with random
hardware and software failures, managing machines, memory and project
disk space, creating and deleting accounts, managing mailing lists,
maintaining Soar WWW pages, upgrading and installing software, and
dealing with users' problems and questions.

This position entails a wide range of responsibilities and considerable
autonomy.  The person is expected to be able to deal with a large range
of problems simultaneously and work independently.  The person is also
expected to be able to apply existing knowledge to solve unforeseen
problems and to answer users' questions and requests efficiently and
courteously.

Required Qualifications:
- Bachelors degree in computer science or closely related field
- 1 year's experience working with large software systems and understanding
  of software engineering principles
  - Soar is currently about 42,000 lines of code, including comments and
    whitespace.  However, the addition of Tcl has made it considerably larger.
- 1 year's experience working on code written by others, possibly poorly
  written or documented
  - Soar contains code written by several different people.
- some experience supporting a user community
- Understanding of C, unix, WWW, Tcl
- Must be able and willing to work with research programmers at other
  sites, splitting up workload
- Must be responsible, self-motivated, capable of recognizing and correcting
  small problems before they become big problems, with excellent time
  management and communication skills
- Interest in AI and cognitive science and in gaining experience at one of
  the top schools in the world
- Must not object to military funding or working on projects with direct
  military applications
- Must be willing to travel to and attend Soar workshops (1 weekend every year)  as well as attend weekly project meetings, hacker's lunches, and meetings
  with the Principal Investigator

Additional Preferred Qualifications:
- Masters degree in computer science or closely related field
- Systems administrative experience
- Experience working with Mach, SunOS, IRIX, Ultrix, OSF/1 (Alphas), Solaris,
  Macs, PCs, Lisp, Kerberos, AFS, RCS
- Familiarity with AI issues, cognitive architectures, Soar


The position is available as of June 1, 1995.  Please send a curriculum
vitae, with references, to:

        Allan Rempel
        School of Computer Science
        Carnegie Mellon University
        5000 Forbes Ave.
        Pittsburgh, PA 15213-3891

        rempel@cs.cmu.edu

COMPANY:  Carnegie Group, Inc.
POSITION:  Sr. Engineer ; Planning/Scheduling Algorithms R&D
LOCATION: Pittsburgh, PA

POSITION REQUIRES:
 * experience in innovative research and development of advanced
   algorithms in planning, scheduling, logistics, transportation.
 * experience as Principal Investigator or primary technical contributor in
   Government-funded R&D projects
 * Solid programming skills -- hands-on design and coding of functional
   research prototypes. 
 * Proposal-writing skills
 * PhD preferred
 * Publications highly desirable. 

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

  This researcher will join an R&D team dedicated to creation and early
investigation of advanced technologies for Decision Support System
applications in Logistics Planning, Battlefield Planning, Medical Evacuation,
and related domains.

  The successful candidate will contribute to two current directions of
this R&D team:
    Primary responsibility -- research and development of innovative
approaches to reactive, dynamic planning and scheduling integrated with
command and control processes;
    Supporting responsibility -- development of novel Human-Machine interfaces
supporting decision-making process in highly dynamic, stressful environment. 

This would range from initial technology creation and investigation through
rapid prototyping of proof of concept demonstrations.  This researcher may
also support the transition of promising technologies into DSS development
efforts conducted by a separate team. Publications of technical papers and
preparation of powerful, innovative proposals for Government R&D funding
will also be part of her/his responsibilities.

ANNOUNCEMENT

Two Job Openings
----------------

Multimedia company is looking to hire two knowledgeable programmers for an 
important project.  The positions offer a high level of responsibility and 
personal freedom; we will be working together in a small group to design
and implement the next generation of multimedia authoring tools.  
If you have been looking to get into multimedia then this is your chance!  
We offer a highly attractive compensation package.  The positions will be 
located in Cleveland, Ohio; and relocation assistance is available.

YOU ARE---
highly motivated
love to program
thrive on problem solving
individualistic
research minded


Job Requirements
----------------
MS or PhD in Computer Science or related field

Working knowledge in one or more of these research areas:
	Artificial Intelligence
		Fuzzy Logic
		Expert Systems
		Neural Networks
		Natural Language Processing
		Knowledge Representation
	Computer Graphics specifically 3D modelling and animation
	Network protocols
	Distributed algorithms
	Speech Synthesis
	
Working knowledge in these practical areas:
	Programming Languages - C, C++, Objective-C
	Operating Systems - NEXTSTEP, UNIX, Windows 95/NT
	GUIs - WIN32, OpenStep, X Windows
	PC hardware configuration

Pluses:
	Digital video and audio
	Artistic design
	Multimedia title production

Please email intent to apply to scottc@agora.rdrop.com, be sure to include 
your email address and US mailing address.  You will be sent a small test 
with a series of questions that you should answer and return as soon as 
possible.  This is not a questionaire!!  Answer these questions as 
truthfully and thoroughly as you can; we use this test to help us gauge 
your working knowledge in various areas of computer science.  Though we 
prefer email, we will accept US mail at this address:

Scott Christley
2014 NW Glisan #211
Portland, OR  97209

Message-Id: <199505041453.KAA08848@central.cis.upenn.edu>
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
cc: bonnie@central.cis.upenn.edu
Subject: Postdoctoral Fellowship announcement
Date: Thu, 04 May 1995 10:53:53 EDT
From: Bonnie Webber <bonnie@central.cis.upenn.edu>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

POSTDOCTORAL FELLOWSHIP
University of Pennsylvania, Philadelpha PA

TraumAID is a joint project of the University of Pennsylvania, Medical College 
of Pennsylvania and University of Delaware, that aims at providing real-time 
decision support during the initial definitive management of multiple trauma
in Emergency Centers. The project is seeking a post-doctoral fellow in
NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING to begin in the Summer or Fall of 1995.

TraumAID is an on-going, multi-disciplinary project that has involved expert
system reasoning, planning, plan recognition, natural language generation,
physics-based modelling and computer animation. The post-doctoral fellow will
be expected to contribute to a newly-funded study of how computer-generated
decision-support can be effectively communicated to clinical personnel so that 
it influences their decisions and actions; this differs significantly from
otherwork on decision-support interfaces in that the clinical personnel are
attending to patients and not to a computer screen. We are seeking a
fellow with  experience in at least one area central to the project and
willingness to gain experience in others. Relevant areas include observational
studies of human communication, Natural Language generation, speech synthesis,
and discourse processing.

The Research Associates will interact closely with faculty and graduate
students, and will be able to take advantage of all resources of the
University, including close ties with Penn's Institute for Research in
Cognitive Science. Initial appointments will be for one year, but we expect
the position to be renewable for a second year as well.

Applicants should send a vita, including the names of at least three
references, by e-mail to bonnie@central.cis.upenn.edu. If e-mail is
impossible, hard-copies may be mailed to:

	Professor Bonnie Lynn Webber
	Dept of Computer & Information Science
	University of Pennsylvania
	200 South 33rd Street, 5th floor
	Philadelphia PA 19104-6389

Applications will be accepted until the position is filled. The University
of Pennsylvania is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer.

For more information about TraumAID, potential applicants are referred to
the TraumAID Home Page 
           http://www.cis.upenn.edu/~traumaid

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Computer Vision/Robotics at CMU Robotics Institute
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: ssingh@frc2.frc.ri.cmu.edu (Sanjiv Singh)
Subject: Computer Vision/Robotics
Date: 05 May 1995 02:46:31 GMT
Organization: Field Robotics Center



POSITION OFFERED:

	Research Programmer

LOCATION:

	The Field Robotics Center
	The Robotics Institute
	Carnegie Mellon University
	Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

GROUP DESCRIPTION:

The Field Robotics Center (FRC) was formed to build fieldworthy
robotic systems capable of operating in outdoor, unstructured
environments.  The goal of the center is to improve safety, reduce
costs, and increase productivity through automation.  Applications
include hazardous waste site characterization and cleanup, nuclear
inspection and servicing, planetary exploration, construction,
excavation, mining, and reconnaissance.  The FRC is a diverse group of
highly-motivated people, including faculty, technical and
administrative staff, and graduate and undergraduate students with
expertise in robotics; computer science; and civil, electrical, and
mechanical engineering.

JOB DESCRIPTIONS:

We are looking for a highly qualified individual to develop software
to automate excavating machines for use in surface mines and quarry
operations.  The programming tasks will include processing laser
rangefinder and/or radar images to build terrain maps of the soil,
recognize trucks and other equipment, and safeguard the machine.
Programming tasks may also include developing planning algorithms to
select digging strategies and collision-free trajectories; and
simulating site activity for the purpose of validating algorithms and
displaying the results.

Practical experience is sought, but not required, for all
candidates. Mathematics and physics skills are also desirable,
especially as related to kinematics and dynamics of physical systems.
All candidates should have excellent problem solving skills as well as
good oral and written communication skills.

Necessary attributes include:

	- B.S. in computer engineering, computer science, or
	  electrical engineering with experience in software
	  development in a project team setting

	- strong UNIX, X, and C experience

	- experience with modern software engineering methods
	  including CASE tools

Preferred attributes include:

	- knowledge of computer vision and image processing
	  techniques, particularly range data processing for object
	  recognition, obstacle detection, and map building


TO APPLY:

Resumes will be accepted either via electronic or physical mail.

	Anthony Stentz
	Field Robotics Center
	5000 Forbes Ave
	Pittsburgh, PA 15213
	E-mail: tony+@cmu.edu

--
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sanjiv Singh                                    ssingh@ri.cmu.edu
System Scientist 
Field Robotics Center                           voice/fax: 412.268.6577
Carnegie Mellon University

Subject: Job: Applications of AI to Parallel Prog., HPC, and Scientific Comp.
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: decker@serd.cscs.ch (Karsten M. Decker)
Subject: SWITZERLAND-CSCS: Research Position in Applied AI
Date: 2 May 1995 14:51:46 GMT
Organization: Swiss Scientific Computing Center CSCS

Centro Svizzero di Calcolo Scientifico (CSCS), located in  Manno,
Ticino,  part  of  the  Swiss  Federal Institute of Technology in
Zurich has an immediate opening for a

                        RESEARCH SCIENTIST

with background in Artificial Intelligence (AI).

The main part of the work consists in research and support in the
application  of  AI  to  parallel  programming,  high-performance
computing, and scientific computing.

In the framework of the Priority Program Informatics  (SPPIF)  of
the  Swiss National Science Foundation, the CSCS conducts applied
research on a project on intelligent programming environments for
massively  parallel  programming.   The  basic  idea  consists in
combining domain-oriented  specification  formalisms,  artificial
intelligence  methods,  and  program  synthesis techniques into a
high-level   programming   environment   with    user-transparent
parallelization of applications. The project started in late 1992
and it is the responsibility of the new collaborator to  continue
the AI part of the project.

Other duties include support and consulting for other projects at
CSCS.  Artificial Intelligence has been identified as a strategic
direction for CSCS. It is the new  collaborator's  responsibility
to  build  up  competence  in  AI (in particular intelligent user
interfaces,  knowledge-  based   software   engineering,   expert
systems,  and data mining), to consult developers in the field of
embedding AI  into  their  applications,  and  to  establish  and
maintain  contacts  with  related institutions in Switzerland and
abroad.

CSCS is looking for a skilled and experienced computer  scientist
with   solid  education  and  experience  in  AI.   Autonomy  and
initiative are considered  as  key  aspects  of  the  candidate's
personality.  Good  programming  knowledge (preferably C/C++) and
familiarity with rule-based expert system shells  are  mandatory.
Knowledge of parallel programming is a plus, but not required.

CSCS offers excellent working conditions.

Please send cover letter and resume to:

        Mrs. Carla Parini-Nart
	Ufficio del Personale
	Centro Svizzero di Calcolo Scientifico
        Via Cantonale
        CH-6928 Manno
        SWITZERLAND

The closing date for application is May 19, 1995.

Karsten Decker

Subject: Job: Speech Processing at Wildfire Communications (Lexigonton, MA)
Date: Fri, 05 May 95 16:38:23 -0400
Message-ID: <10396.799706303@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>
From: Mark Kantrowitz <AI_Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU


From: greg@agog.com (Greg Cockroft)
Organization: Agog, Inc.
Date: Mon May 01 18:30:33 EDT 1995


                        Speech Processing Engineer


Wildfire Communications Inc. of Lexington, MA is an entrepreneurial
company developing a new class of personal communication assistants.
Wildfire's first product, recently announced, is a communications
assistant which coordinates all the telephone communications for a set of
mobile professionals.  The Wildfire assistant performs such tasks as
placing outgoing calls, screening incoming calls, managing users contact
lists, voice mail messages, schedules and reminders by responding to
dialogs spoken by a user from any phone.

The Wildfire server is comprised of a set of software assistants which
communicate with available devices abstracted by a virtual machine.  All
persistent data for both the runtime agent environment and the
subscriber's personal data is stored in an object oriented database. The
product is written in C++  and runs a version of UNIX system 5 release
4.2.  Wildfire packages the agent software along with the hardware, an
Intel Pentium based computer which includes line interface, line
processing and speech recognition cards which communicate across a
high-speed communications bus.

Wildfire is looking for an energetic and self-motivated speech engineer to
join our team. This person will be responsible for integrating third party
and in house developed speech recognition software into the Wildfire
Platform.  This will include measuring and helping to improve the
performance of these systems. We are looking for someone with 2+ years of
experience with speech processing. They must have a demonstrated ability
to understand and analyze the operation of digital speech recognition or
coding systems. Specific experience in the development of speech
recognizers or speech coding systems is desired.

Job Responsibilities:
=====================
* Create a working cross development environment & learn target embedded
  system environment
* Port existing speech recognition algorithms to embedded telephony
platform
  - port code to the DSP environment
  - work on glue between host
  - develop algorithms to manage speech recognition resources better
* Generate reports which help identify speech recognition problems in
systems
  running in the field
* Act as a liaison to speech software vendors
* Profile and optimize the performance of our speech recognizers
* Assist in the development of in house speech processing software and
tools

Specific Requirements:
======================
* 2+ years working in the field of speech processing
* Background in digital signal processing
* Development experience with C and C++
* Experience with UNIX and tools
* Experience with embedded development systems
* At least a Bachelors degree in EE or CS


Contact:
--------
Richard Miner, Director Engineering - miner@wildfire.com
Wildfire Communications Inc.
20 Maguire Road
Lexington,  MA 0274
(work) 617-674-1750
(fax) 617-674-1501

--
Greg Cockroft                       greg@wildfire.com
Wildfire Communications
617-674-1722

Wanted: We're looking for professionals who can apply techniques in data
        analysis, machine learning and decision-theoretic reasoning to
        real-world industrial applications.  A Masters or PhD in computer
        science or equivalent experience is preferred.  An ability to interact
        with clients to determine their needs would be very helpful.
        Top-notch programming ability is a definite plus.

==============================================================================

"Some of the world's greatest software developers work at Harlequin."

We are world leaders in symbolic processing, electronic publishing and
related software applications.  We write in C, C++, Dylan, Lisp, ML,
Postscript, Prolog, and whatever else it takes.  Including English.

Harlequin's Electronic Publishing Division specialises in
Postscript-compatible technology, producing versions of its own software
for previewing images and text on screen or printing them either directly
to hard copy or indirectly through a pre-press system.

The Symbolic Processing Division develops software that helps to raise the
level at which computers appear to operate by enabling computers to
represent, change, manipulate, and communicate ideas, relationships, plans,
and implications.  From this environment come Harlequin's powerful software
development tools, such as LispWorks, Knowledgeworks and CLIM, together
with our unique application delivery tool, Transducer, as well as
Harlequin's own vertical market applications.

"We promise not to train you, but be ready to learn fast.  And never be
afraid to ask how, or why, or why not."

What do you get if you take a bunch of compiler writers and application
programmers, add some special hardware developers, and mix together with
color imaging technologists, technical authors, customer support officers,
product managers (and product marketing managers), QA administrators, sales
and marketing, and a liberal smattering of other talented people?  You get
a global computing company that works together (in harmony mostly, but not
always) to produce the world's finest software.

Harlequin started life in Cambridge, UK in 1986.  Today we have two offices
in Cambridgeshire, one in Manchester, an office in Sydney, Australia, and
three U.S. facilities in Cambridge, MA, Menlo Park, CA, and Seattle, WA.
Further operations are planned as we grow to some 250 staff world wide.

Please respond to: Ahearn@Harlequin.com, or fax (617) 252-6505 attn:  Amy
Ahearn, or snail to Harlequin, Inc., One Cambridge Center, Cambridge, MA
02142, Attn:  Amy Ahearn

Subject: US-PA-Pittsburgh Machine Translation Language Developer (French), CMU
Date: 8 May 1995 02:35:53 GMT
Organization: Carnegie-Mellon University, School of Computer Science

US-PA-Pittsburgh Machine Translation Language Developer (French), CMU

French Technical Leader, Machine Translation Applications

The CATALYST project at the Center for Machine Translation, Carnegie
Mellon University, is seeking a talented and energetic individual for
the position of French Technical Leader.

CATALYST is a large-scale MT application for commercial document
delivery in the domain of heavy machinery. Each Target Language
Technical Leader is responsible for the following tasks:

 * Work with project leaders to define workplan and schedule for
   target language module development, deployment and maintenance

 * Supervise and participate in the development and maintenance of each
   knowledge source for the application (lexicon, grammar,
   interpretation rules, etc.)

 * Integrate system knowledge sources into a run-time delivery module

 * Participate actively in requirements definition and QA

 * Maintain a responsive and professional relationship with customer
   personnel

The successful applicant must have the following qualifications:

 * Native or near-native fluency in French

 * M.S. in Computer/Information Science (or related field),
   or equivalent experience

 * Strong programming skills in Lisp and Unix

 * Experience communicating and working productively within a
   development group

 * Experience in designing and implementing multi-module software systems

The following skills are also desirable:

 * Coursework in linguistics or computational linguistics

 * Experience in developing machine translation software or other
   types of language processing software

 * Experience with commercial software development and system
   engineering

 * Fluency in German, Spanish, Portuguese, Russian, Italian

 * Some familiarity with PERL, C++ 
 
Full-time Salaried Position, Starting Range: $30,000 to $33,000 USD

Occasional Travel Required

          9 May 95 21:27:18 EDT
Date: Tue, 9 May 95 21:26:17 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Speech Recognition at Cambridge University
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: pcw@eng.cam.ac.uk (Phil Woodland)
Date: Sat May 06 16:54:27 EDT 1995
Organization: Cambridge University Engineering Department, UK

             Research Assistant/Associate in

             Large Vocabulary Speech Recognition


Applications are invited for the post of Research Assistant or Research
Associate to work on an EPSRC-sponsored project. The project is
aimed at enhancing the HTK-based large vocabulary speaker independent
continuous speech recognition system developed by the Cambridge University
Engineering Department Speech Group. The appointment will be for 18 month,
in the first instance, starting as soon as possible.

The HTK-based large vocabulary continuous speech recognition system
has a vocabulary of up to 65,000 words, uses cross-word context dependent
HMM models and N-gram language models. The current project is working
on increasing the robustness of the system.  Aspects of this work include
speaker adaptation, noise and channel compensation and adaptive language
modelling.

Candidates should have a good first degree in a relevant discipline and
preferably have a higher degree. The post requires experience of HMM based
speech recognition, especially the aspects mentioned above, C programming,
and use of a UNIX environment. Familiarity with HTK is a distinct
advantage.

Further details and an application form can be obtained from Mavis Barber,
Engineering Dept, Trumpington Street, Cambridge, Tel:  +44-1223-332752,
Fax: +44-1223-332662 or email: mavis@eng.cam.ac.uk. The closing date
for applications is 31st May 1995.

Prospective candidates are also encouraged to contact me directly if they
wish to discuss the project further.

Phil Woodland                                 Email: pcw@eng.cam.ac.uk
Cambridge University Engineering Dept              Tel: +44-1223-332654
Trumpington Street                                 Fax: +44-1223-332662
Cambridge, CB2 1PZ, England

Subject: SPEECH RECOGNITION SPECIALIST
Date: Wed, 10 May 1995 07:56:18 -0500
Organization: GTE LABORATORIES

Telecommunications Engineers

At GTE Laboratories, we have assembled one of the strongest groups of
researchers and developers in the world to support GTEs
telecommunications businesses. We are the largest local exchange telephone
company and the second largest mobile service provider in the U.S. We
currently seek Telecommunications Engineers in a variety of specialties. 

Speech Recognition Specialist
Part-Time

This is an excellent part-time opportunity for a graduate student with
interest in speech, signal processing and software implementation.
Specifically, you will participate in research and development related to
speech recognition systems and applications. This will involve working
with other members of our project team on the implementation and
development of various speech and signal processing capabilities. To
qualify, candidates must have an MS in Electrical Engineering or related
field and experience with speech processing and speech technology.
Knowledge of UNIX and C programming is a must..
Box CBM2 

We offer an outstanding benefits package, including an on-site fitness
facility, medical/ life/dental insurance, pension, savings and investment
plans. Please send your resume to the Employment Department, indicating
appropriate Box Code, GTE Laboratories Incorporated, 40 Sylvan Road,
Waltham, MA 02254. (617) 446-2164. An equal opportunity employer, M/F/D/V.

From: dante@netcom.com (DANTE ASSOCIATES)
Subject: US-CA-Palo Alto Senior Scientist/Researcher/UNIX/AI techniques/Engineering 
Organization: NETCOM On-line Communication Services (408 261-4700 guest)
Date: Wed, 10 May 1995 01:07:07 GMT

Job#	RS-641180 - RS-641184

Senior Scientist/Researcher/UNIX/AI techniques/Engineering 

Apply professional and scientific knowledge to the development
and implementation of intelligent software systems, especially in
the manufacturing and design domains.  Lead a small software
development team or provide direction and assistance to other co-
workers on the asigned project.  Coordinate with supervisory and
principle investigators of related projects to facilitate
completion of work.  Keep supervisory personnel informed on
status of all phases of assigned projects on concurrent
engineering, design and manufacturing automation, virtual
manufacturing, etc.  Requires six or more years of experience
developing object-oriented systems on a UNIX platform.  Strong
programming skills in C and C++ is a must.  Highly desirable: 
experience with Multimedia, Virtual environments and 3D 
visualization, Electronic Commerce and Human-Computer interface.

Education:  MS or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering or
related area with substantial Computer Science courseware.

Rate:  based upon experience

*WHO ARE WE?


The Research and Software Technology Divisions of a Fortune 20
Company are seeking bright and talented Software professionals to
add to their workforce on a Full-time and on a Contract basis.
We have had an influx of project work and have both junior and
senior positions available.  If you are a recent graduate, and 
interested in working in a research setting, we want to talk with 
you if you have several years of proven programming skills!


*WHAT IS OUR WORKPLACE LIKE?

We are researchers in an entrepreneurial environment.  You will
have flexibility to make a lot of your own goals - and work with
other talented people in nice offices in Palo Alto.  U.S.
Citizenship or Permanent Resident status is required for all
Full-time positions, a Green Card is required for contract positions.

*HOW TO REACH US?

For immediate consideration, fax or Email your resume. 
Please remember to reference the job number and let us know the best 
times and places to reach you.  We will review your background and 
contact you to discuss the positions available.

Send your resume via Email to:          Susan Troccolo
(ASCII or WinWord format)               DANTE Associates
                                        DANTE@Netcom.com

Via FAX on HIGH RES to:                 (415) 326-5969
						or
					 (415) 354-5235

No phone calls please.  Principals only.

Date: Thu, 11 May 95 16:13:23 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Document Image Understanding (Atlanta, GA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: cthomas@access.digex.net (Chad Thomas)
Subject: US-GA-Atlanta: DOCUMENT IMAGE UNDERSTANDING, Senior Tech Lead
Date: 9 May 1995 20:05:35 GMT
Organization: FrontRunners, Inc.

==========================================================
POSITION SUMMARY:

An established advanced technology development unit has an 
extremely attractive, newly created position open for a 
senior candidate with proven expertise in DOCUMENT IMAGE 
PROCESSING. Operating as part of a larger image processing 
group, this individual will lead new commercial product 
development efforts and champion corporate-wide, high-
profile document image processing applications.

Flexible, well funded environment of multiple small teams.

Location: Atlanta. 
==========================================================

BACKGROUND:

This group as a whole has the mission of applying leading 
edge technologies to corporate thrusts within product 
divisions. Multiple well-funded projects are already 
underway involving advanced image understanding, image 
processing, and tracking techniques. However, corporate 
divisions also have a critical interest in DOCUMENT IMAGE 
UNDERSTANDING applications in particular; although there is 
an enormous need for robust item processing techniques, the 
development group is missing a senior champion for existing 
document IU technologies, both to lead efforts in augmenting 
the existing technology base, and to aid product divisions 
in applying existing solutions. E.g., early prototypes of 
some core solutions have been created, but have not been 
tuned or tested for robustness.


QUALIFICATIONS:

* Advanced degree in CS/EE or related discipline, or a BS 
with excellent experience.
	
* 3+ years of applied document image understanding 
experience, preferrably in real world applications. A 
broad background in image understanding and image 
processing techniques is highly desirable.

* Significant team leadership skills/experience

* Creativity combined with pragmatism: emphasis is on 
demonstrating workable solutions and on 
application/adaptation of existing technology in new 
areas.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

* To lead the technical team in developing a range of 
document IU projects, including several custom projects 
to handle forms processing for insurance, banking, and 
government.

* This is a initially a technical lead position focused on 
cooperative concept development and prototyping. However, 
with growing familiarity with company, responsibilities 
are expected to rapidly evolve from technical leadership 
into project management. Will eventually be responsible 
for championing Document IU technologies corporate-wide. 
Initiative is recognized and highly valued within the 
mother group.


COMMENTS:

* This is an outstanding opportunity for a high-energy 
individual to move into a senior, project management 
position rapidly. Further, the current market situation 
is such that any initiatives within the document image 
understanding area are likely to be fully internally 
funded.

* Work permit required.


RECRUITER'S NOTES and SUBMISSION PROCEDURES: 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ 
 
WHAT TO SEND: Qualified candidates are encouraged to submit 
a resume and an accompanying cover letter/note referencing 
this posting as:     NETPOST 95-05-09 01
 
HOW TO SEND IT: If you can, digitally. In order of 
preference, submission options are: 
 
1)  Send materials via e-mail (ASCII ONLY PLEASE) to  
    > cthomas@access.digex.net < 
    with optional pretty-printed hardcopy via regular mail. 
 
    or 
 
2)  Send hardcopy via regular mail. 
 
3)  Fax it in FINE MODE if you simply must fax. (Faxes OCR  
    poorly; unless your life is already 2% garbled, please  
    don't send them if you have an alternative.) 
 
All submitted resumes are treated with strictest  
confidentiality. Your resume will *never* be released 
without your explicit consent, following verbal discussion 
of specific R&D opportunities -- we're a specialized, low 
volume, relationship-oriented firm, *not* a high volume 
resume mill. 

All respondents will be given careful consideration. 
However, depending upon response volume, I regret that I 
simply cannot guarantee a personal reply to all respondents. 
 
CONTACT INFORMATION: 
 
Chad Thomas
FrontRunners, Inc. 

8409 Lake Crest Terrace 
Suite B 
Fairfax Station, VA  22039-2678 
 
(703) 643-2226 voice 
(703) 643-2665 fax 1 
(703) 643-0712 fax 2 
 
cthomas@access.digex.net 
 
FrontRunners, Inc. specializes in Interactive and Networked 
Multimedia, Human-Computer Interface, Artificial 
Intelligence, and related research and development 
positions.

FrontRunners is located in the greater Washington, D.C. 
metropolitan area but recruits for a nationwide client base.

Received: from GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU by A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU id aa15637;
          11 May 95 16:16:02 EDT
Date: Thu, 11 May 95 16:15:10 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Applications of AI to parallel programming (Zurich)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: decker@cscs.ch (Karsten M. Decker)
Subject: SWITZERLAND-CSCS: Research Position in Applied AI
Date: 8 May 1995 11:38:10 GMT
Organization: Swiss Scientific Computing Center CSCS

Centro Svizzero di Calcolo Scientifico (CSCS), located in  Manno,
Ticino,  part  of  the  Swiss  Federal Institute of Technology in
Zurich has an immediate opening for a

                        RESEARCH SCIENTIST

with background in Artificial Intelligence (AI).

The main part of the work consists in research and support in the
application  of  AI  to  parallel  programming,  high-performance
computing, and scientific computing.

In the framework of the Priority Program Informatics  (SPPIF)  of
the  Swiss National Science Foundation, the CSCS conducts applied
research on a project on intelligent programming environments for
massively  parallel  programming.   The  basic  idea  consists in
combining domain-oriented  specification  formalisms,  artificial
intelligence  methods,  and  program  synthesis techniques into a
high-level   programming   environment   with    user-transparent
parallelization of applications. The project started in late 1992
and it is the responsibility of the new collaborator to  continue
the AI part of the project.

Other duties include support and consulting for other projects at
CSCS.  Artificial Intelligence has been identified as a strategic
direction for CSCS. It is the new  collaborator's  responsibility
to  build  up  competence  in  AI (in particular intelligent user
interfaces,  knowledge-  based   software   engineering,   expert
systems,  and data mining), to consult developers in the field of
embedding AI  into  their  applications,  and  to  establish  and
maintain  contacts  with  related institutions in Switzerland and
abroad.

CSCS is looking for a skilled and experienced computer  scientist
with   solid  education  and  experience  in  AI.   Autonomy  and
initiative are considered  as  key  aspects  of  the  candidate's
personality.  Good  programming  knowledge (preferably C/C++) and
familiarity with rule-based expert system shells  are  mandatory.
Knowledge of parallel programming is a plus, but not required.

CSCS offers excellent working conditions.

Please send cover letter and resume to:

        Mrs. Carla Parini-Nart
	Ufficio del Personale
	Centro Svizzero di Calcolo Scientifico
        Via Cantonale
        CH-6928 Manno
        SWITZERLAND

The closing date for application is May 19, 1995. 

-- 
Yours Sincerely,

Karsten Decker

+----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| PD Dr. Karsten M. Decker                      phone:      +41 (91) 50 8357 |
| Director of Research and Development          secretary:  +41 (91) 50 8356 |
| Swiss Scientific Computing Center CSCS        fax:        +41 (91) 50 8383 |
| Via Cantonale  CH-6928 Manno  SWITZERLAND     e-mail:       decker@cscs.ch |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

Job# 	JS-641169

LISP/C++/AI specialist/ Knowledge Representation

For a concurrent design and engineering application, we are looking 
for a top programmer with a minimum of 5 yrs. experience doing 
programming and design.  New grads are not appropriate for this 
position.  To qualify you must have:  LISP and C/C++ programming 
skills, a solid background in Object-oriented programming and an AI 
background.  Specifically, you must be knowledgeable in the area of 
knowledge representation.  Nice-to-haves are:  some database 
experience (Oracle,Sybase) and background in agent-based 
architectures.  

Education:  Full-time applicants must have B.S. in Computer Science 
+ 5 yrs. experience or a M.S. in Computer Science with proven 
industry experience.  Contractors may also be appropriate for this 
position.  Length of assignment:  6 mos. to 1 yr.

Salary/Rate:  depending upon experience


*WHO ARE WE?


The Research and Software Technology Divisions of a Fortune 20
Company are seeking bright and talented Software professionals to
add to their workforce on a Full-time and on a Contract basis.
We have had an influx of project work and have both junior and
senior positions available.  If you are a recent graduate, and interested 
in working in a research setting, we want to talk with you if you have 
several years of proven programming skills!


*WHAT IS OUR WORKPLACE LIKE?

We are researchers in an entrepreneurial environment.  You will
have flexibility to make a lot of your own goals - and work with
other talented people in nice offices in Palo Alto.  U.S.
Citizenship or Permanent Resident status is required for all
Full-time positions, a Green Card is required for contract positions.

DURATION: full-time, temporary for approx. 6 month
PAYMENT:  Hourly wage, no benefits 
LOCATION: Pittsburgh, PA

POSITION REQUIRES:
 * BS or BA in Computer Science or Mathematics
 * knowledge of statistical techniques
 * report writing skills
 * some familiarity with neural net technology helpful but not required

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

  This researcher will join an R&D team working on applying neural net
techniques to diagnostics of jet engines. She/he will be working under the
direction of experienced neural net researchers and will conduct extensive
computational experiments with multiple NN models based on commercially
available neural net shells. Some (but not extensive) programming in Basic
on PC will be required to manipulate and process the experimental data.

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+lisp-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Computational Linguistics at Univ. of Pennsylvania
Cc: ai+ai-jobs@CS.CMU.EDU
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: mark@central.cis.upenn.edu (Mark Foster)
Subject: LISP/Unix Programmer, Univ of Pennsylvania, Philadelphia
Date: 12 May 1995 20:49:17 GMT
Organization: University of Pennsylvania


		Research and Systems Programmer
	    Institute for Research in Cognitive Science
		University of Pennsylvania
    -------------------------------------------------------

Duties:

    Research Projects Participation
        Provide programming support for ongoing research projects
        in Computational Linguistics using Common Lisp, C, and various
        UNIX system tools.

    Technical Consulting, System Administration
	Assist in solving specific technical problems that are beyond
	the scope of the normal user.  Perform basic installation and
	routine updates of some software packages.  Primary platforms
	are Sun SPARCstations and Xterminals.  Provide ongoing support
	of LaTeX.

Qualifications:

    BS in CS or related field required.  MS preferred.  3 years
    experience using UNIX systems (may be concurrent with education),
    fluency in Common Lisp and C, and  1 year prior UNIX system
    administration necessary.  Knowledge of more than one Common Lisp 
    dialect (e.g., Allegro, Lucid) is essential.  Experience writing with
    LaTeX and knowledge of the X window system are important.  Ability
    to work independently, and good interpersonal and organizational
    skills required.

This position provides a unique opportunity to combine some systems work
with programming support in a research environment.  Congenial work
atmosphere.

This is a full-time salaried position with generous health, education, and
retirement benefits.  Salary to 40's. 

Candidates should be interested in being part of a multi-disciplinary
research effort.  The individual filling this position will work with
the co-director of IRCS, several other CIS Dept. system programmers,
and the manager of CIS Research Computing.

The University of Pennsylvania is an Affirmative Action/Equal
Opportunity Employer.

Interested individuals should send a resume to:

    Mark Foster
    CIS Department
    University of Pennsylvania
    200 South 33rd Street
    Philadelphia, PA 19104-6389

    mark@cis.upenn.edu

Subject: Positions open for China Information Processing related business
Date: 14 May 1995 14:48:07 +0800
Organization: Hong Kong SuperNET

                           POSITION ANNOUNCEMENT

                     China Business Resources Co., Ltd
                        Suite 3103 Hong Kong Plaza
                     188 Connaught Road W., Hong Kong
                   Tel: +852 2559-1399, Fax: +852 2540-8379


(I) THE COMPANY

Through merging and consolidating existing business operations in China and Hong Kong, China Business Resources Co., Ltd. (hereafter "CBR") was founded in Hong Kong. CBR is specialized in providing ready and customized business solutions to the business communities around the world. At present, its activities cover such areas as data and market research, publication, software and database development, machine translation and information distribution. 

Due to our rapid growth, we have multiple opennings for qualified professionals at our offices in Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai, Shenzhen and Singapore (open soon). At CBR, we offer you challenging, career-oriented jobs with a great potential and with competitive salary package in an English-Chinese bilingual, smoking-free and energetic environment.


(II) POSITIONS

1. TEAM LEADER

JOB: You will lead a high-calibre and motivated team to develop a state-of-art in-house integrated Chinese document processing and machine translation system.

QUALIFICATIONS: You will have an advanced degree, preferably Ph.D in  Computer Sciences or Applied Lingustics and with at least five years's (for Ph.D  degree holder) or eight years's (for M.S. degree holder) experiences in systems  development and applied research in machine translation, language  processing and  document processing.

2. SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER (two positions):

JOB1: You will work on a project developing an advanced English-Chinese text  database and retrieval system.

QUALIFICATIONS: You will have a BS or MS degree in Computer Sciences,  Electrical Engineering from a recognized university with at least 3-5 years working  experiences. Proficiency in C/C++, object-oriented systems is essential, and  experiences in text database and information retrieval will have clear advantages.

JOB2: You will join in a project team developing an advanced multi-lingual,  multimedia user interfaces for information systems.

QUALIFICATIONS: You will have a BS or MS degree in Computer Sciences,  Electrical Engineering from a recognized university with at least 3-5 years working  experiences. Proficiency in C/C++ is essential, and experiences in advanced user   interfaces and multimedia sytems are preferred.


3. RESEARCH SCIENTIST:

JOB: You will work in a project team to develop and research into a state-of-art  integrated Chinese document processing and machine translation system.

QUALIFICATIONS: You will have an advanced degree, preferably Ph.D in  Computer Sciences or Applied Lingustics. For M.S. degree holder, you are  expected to have at least two years' experiences in systems development and  applied research in machine translation, language processing and document  processing.


4. SENIOR INDUSTRIAL ANALYST (Several Positions):

JOB: You will lead a small team working on client-funded market and industrial   research project. In this highly visiable position, you are expected to travel within  the region, and meet with our multinational clients and coordinate with CBR  partners in China

QUALIFICATIONS: You will have an advanced degree, preferably MBA or Ph.D  in Applied Economics, Market Research, or Industrial Management from a  recoginized university. In addition, you must have at least 3 years' relevant  experiences working in multinational companies or a regional research firm in at  least on of the following areas: telecommunciations, information techonology,  chemical & petrochemical, building materials, transportation & aviation, food &  beverage, electrical power and distribution,
 retail.

5. EDITORS (Several Positions):

JOB: You will work directly under our publishing director and resposible to source  materials (with the backing from our China offices), edit and publish industrial  research reports, newsletters all in English on select key industrial sectors. 

QUALIFICATIONS: You will have a degree (preferably advanced degrees) in  Applied Economics, Business or Industrial Management from a recoginized  university. In addition, you should have relevant experiences working in publishing  and research environment in China or overseas on ecomonics or one of our  focused industrial sectors.

6: SHORT-TERM INTERNSHIP:

CBR welcomes applications from graduate students who want to work with us on  our short-term or summer training program in one of our core business activities as  listed above.

QUALIFICATIONS: You must be mature, self-independent, and interested in  working in the English-Chinese bilingual environment. Preferably, you will have  carreer interest in working in the dynamic Asia-Pacific region. You must at least  have two month working time.

CONDITIONS: You are advised to be prepared to cover your own living and  traveling expenses, though CBR can offer you opportunities to make money or  may consider some living allowances. CBR can offer you the opportunity to work  at one of our offices listed above and a friendly working environment to learn  and/or enhance your Chinese language and culture while gaining working  experiences.

(III) BENEFITS

(a) In all the positions listed, we offer you a competitive salary package according to the industrial standards in the regions we oeprate. Under special circumtances, we may consider equality arrangements together with an attractive salary package.

(b) Since CBR's working environment is bilingual, except for the summer trainees, you are expected to be profecient in both Chinese (mandrin) and English.

(IV) METHOD OF APPLICATION

(a) For prompt reply, you should address your application to:

 Ms. Mary Ma, Admin Manager
 Suite 3103, Hong Kong Plaza
 188 Connaught Road West
 Hong Kong
 
(b) We prefer you to send your written applications via postal mail.

(c) In the application, please provide us (i) a recent photo, (ii) your salary   expectation, (iii) a copy of your recent resume preferably with salary history, (iv)  at least two references (one for summer trainee) and finally (v) your preference of  the job location.

Subject: Position: Kurzweil AI Transcriptionist
Date: 1 May 1995 15:36:51 GMT

KURZWEIL APPLIED INTELLIGENCE, INC

                        HIRING REQUISITION
Full-Time/Temporary/Summer Intern Position for June, July, August 1995


General Description:
Kurzweil AI is looking for a summer student to help create speech
recognition vocabularies for new, specialized applications.
The main activity is producing phonetic transcriptions of words not
already in our dictionary.

General Responsibilities:
To produce broad phonetic transcriptions of  medical, legal,
office-automation application terms, and general English words for use
in  Kurzweil AI's products.  These transcriptions are in a system close to
the "ARPABET".

Other Responsibilities to Include:
Spellchecking wordlists utilizing electronic tools to ensure correctness and
consistency with prior vocabularies.

Interacting with Knowledge Engineering or outside parties as necessary to
determine correct pronunciation.

Checking automatically-generated transcriptions for correctness.

Updating online dictionaries.

Maintaining a vocabulary database.

Possible linguistic analysis of medical terms
(ie. Greek and Latin terminology) and
subsequent programming in C, to enhance the automatic
transcription generation process for our medical vocabularies.

Qualifications:
Have written phonetic transcriptions in some context. Knowledge of
UNIX tools essential, ability to program in C and knowledge of
PC tools helpful.

Salary:
$14 per hour.

E-Mail resume to:
adelef@spock.kurz-ai.com

Send resume to:
Adele Fontana
Kurzweil Applied Intelligence Inc.
411 Waverley Oaks Road
Waltham, MA 02154

(617-893-5151x327)

		CAREERS IN SPEECH RECOGNITION AT VOICE CONTROL SYSTEMS



	If you're looking for a career in speech processing, watch the 
positions offered in dfw.jobs and misc.jobs.offered.  Voice Control Systems, 
Inc., one (well two actually) of the pioneers in speech recognition is growing 
its staff!  Voice Control Systems (VCS) is the result of the merger of Scott 
Instrument and Voice Control Systems, two companies involved in speech reco 
since the late '70s.  (Geez, we're getting old.)
	VCS provides speaker dependent and speaker independent speech 
recognition and speaker verification technology to many commercial users of 
speech recognition including Oki Semiconductor (OKI VRP single chip speech 
recognizer), Dialogic Corporation (VR/40, VR/160, VR Soft and software for the 
new Anteres SCSA product, Intervoice, NEC-UK, Silicon Graphics, McCaw Cellular  
(VoiceTouch), and 1-800-COLLECT.  We offer continuous, isolated, and phonetic 
dictionary recognition based on propriatery speech technology.  VCS has 
fielded more than 250K speech recognizers in over 40 countries.  Our libraries  


cover more than 46 languages.
	If you want a commercial career in speech reco. watch for postings or 
forward a resume for our file.

 Voice Control Systems   +214.386.0300  voice
 Dallas, TX  USA 75244   +214.386.5555 fax

From: ehn+@CS.CMU.EDU (Eric Nyberg)
Subject: US-PA-Pittsburgh Machine Translation Lexicographer, CMU
Date: 21 May 1995 18:53:24 GMT
Organization: Carnegie-Mellon University, School of Computer Science

US-PA-Pittsburgh Machine Translation Lexicographer, CMU

Lexicographer, Machine Translation Applications

The CATALYST project at the Center for Machine Translation, Carnegie
Mellon University, is seeking a talented and energetic individual for
the position of Lexicographer.

CATALYST is a large-scale MT application for commercial document
delivery in the domain of heavy machinery. The Lexicographer is
responsible for the following tasks:

 * implementation of lexicon refinement/enhancement/maintenance tasks,
   in support of source and target language lexicon development.

The successful applicant must have the following qualifications:

 * M.A. in linguistics, M.S in computational linguistics or a related field

 * Native or near-native fluency in English

 * Experience developing knowledge sources for language software,
   preferably large-scale, multi-lingual lexicons for machine translation
   in technical domains

 * Understanding of the principles of lexicography and terminology
   management, especially as they relate to semantic accuracy and
   translatability 

 * Demonstrated ability to proactively identify and quantify lexical
   issues that arise during development/refinement, with special
   attention paid to issues which span multiple knowledge sources (e.g.,
   domain model, TL lexicons, etc.). 


Skill and experience in these areas are preferred but not required:

 * Fluency in any of French, Spanish, German, Italian, Portuguese, Russian

 * Experience with manual translation in technical domains


Full-time Salaried Position, Starting Range: $27,000 to $30,000 USD

Occasional Travel Required

Contact:	Eric Nyberg				Phone: (412) 268-7281
		Center for Machine Translation		Fax:   (412) 268-6298
		Carnegie Mellon University		EMail: ehn+@cs.cmu.edu
		Pittsburgh, PA 15213
		USA

Candidates should send a letter of application, a current vita, at
least three letters of reference, and representative samples of their
work. Resumes, cover letters, etc. may be submitted via EMail, in
ASCII or Postscript form. Resumes may also be submitted by fax or
regular mail, but EMail is preferred. Letters of recommendation must
be faxed or mailed. Applicants from abroad may wish to consider
express mail to ensure a timely submission.

From: jobs@espan3.use.com (jobs@espan)
Subject: IN:ITT AEROSPACE/COMM DIV,ITT Aerospace
Organization: IQuest Network Services
Date: Sat, 20 May 1995 00:04:49 GMT

Reference: E-Span JobSearch #13033
Title: ITT AEROSPACE/COMM DIV,ITT Aerospace
Employer: ITT Aerospace                 
Location: IN
 
ITT AEROSPACE/COMMUNICATIONS DIVISION
 
ITT Aerospace/Communications Division (A/CD), headquartered in Fort
Wayne, Indiana, is a unit of ITT Defense and Electronics.  A/CD is a
world leader in three major high-technology business areas:
 
FORWARD AREA BATTLEFIELD COMMUNICATIONS
 
With the U.S. Army, A/CD developed the current standard combat net radio
for the Army and Marine Corps, the Single Channel Ground and Airborne
Radio System (SINCGARS).  SINCGARS is now entering its fourth generation
in manpack, vehicular and airborne configurations.  The radios are
produced in ITT's world-class Fort Wayne manufacturing facility.  The
plant has earned the U.S. Army Communications-Electronics Command's
contractor performance certification and the internationally-recognized
ISO-9001 registration for the design, production and repair of
communications equipment.
 
ITT SINCGARS' frequency-hopping VHF technology makes it virtually
jam-proof.  During the 1991 Middle East conflict U.S. Marine Corps
communicators reported ITT SINCGARS was the only combat net radio that
could not be jammed by hostile forces.
 
The system has consistently performed well beyond U.S. Army
specifications  under combat conditions in Desert Shield/Desert Storm,
Operation Just Cause in Panama and the Korean demilitarized zone.
According to U.S. Department of Defense reports the radios "...displayed
an astounding 7,000 hours
mean time between failure (MTBF) during Desert Storm."  U.S. Army
specifications require 1,250 hours MTBF.
 
About 75,000 SINCGARS have been built for the U.S. Army and Marines and
national defense forces in Asia, the Middle East and Europe.  Its latest
generation, the SINCGARS TCS, is a data-capable communications system
with the ability to interface with a wide variety of US communications
systems.
 
SATELLITE SYSTEMS
 
A/CD develops and produces high-performance satellite systems.  The
company's Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer and High Resolution
Infrared Radiation Sounder provide quality meteorological imagery and
data from the low-Earth orbit NOAA Advanced TIROS-N satellites.
 
ITT Imagers and Sounders are the heart of the latest NOAA Geostationary
Operational Environmental Satellite series - GOES-Next.  A/CD also
manages the navigation packages for all U.S. Global Positioning System
satellites.
 
SPEECH TECHNOLOGIES
 
ITT A/CD's San Diego engineering center is internationally recognized
for research and development in speech recognition and speaker
verification technologies.
 
ITT's SPEAKERKEY(TM) speaker verification system is being licensed for a
wide variety of applications, notably as a low-cost, reliable home
incarceration monitoring system.  SPEAKERKEY is also useful in
safeguarding computer networks and long-distance telephone systems.
 
For more information, please contact:
 
ITT Aerospace/Communications Division
Attn: Mike Evans
P.O. Box 3700
Fort Wayne, Indiana 46801-3700
 
Telephone: (219) 487-6000
Facsimile: (219) 487-6124
 
Equal Opportunity Employer
 
Copyright (C) 1995 E-Span, Inc. - 800.682.2901

Subject: Job: Computer Vision at JPL
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: petitjea@loria.fr (Sylvain Petitjean)
Subject: (P) CV - Pasadena, CA
Date: 18 May 1995 07:21:35 GMT
Organization: CRIN (CNRS) & INRIA Lorraine - Nancy - FRANCE

Date: Wed, 10 May 1995 22:59:50 -0700
From: Larry Matthies <lhm@robotics.jpl.nasa.gov>
Subject: Research position available

The Robotic Vehicles Group at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL)
invites applications for a research position in computer vision.

As NASA's lead center for solar system exploration, JPL conducts
research, development, and mission operation of unmanned spacecraft
for exploration of the Earth, other planets, asteroids, and comets.
JPL also conducts research and development of robotic vehicles,
microelectronics, simulation and visualization systems, and a variety
of other technologies for other federal agencies.  Current projects
within the Robotic Vehicles Group include a planetary rover for the
1996 "Pathfinder" mission to Mars, autonomous navigation of unmanned
ground vehicles for Earth-based applications, robotic excavation, and
autonomous rendezvous and docking/landing of spacecraft.  Within these
projects, research on computer vision includes algorithm development,
real-time implementation on commercially available computing hardware,
and design of VLSI chips for integrating imaging and low-level image
processing functions.

Candidates must have a Ph.D. in computer science, electrical
engineering, applied physics, or a related field.  The successful
applicant will contribute to one or more of the following currently
active research areas: stereo vision, self-calibration, terrain
classification, obstacle detection and avoidance, visual tracking and
motion estimation, and pose estimation.  Applicants should have
facility with stochastic modeling, signal theory, computer graphics,
and "C" language programming under Unix.  Experience with the VxWorks
operating system, Datacube image processing hardware, and general
exposure to algorithms for robotic path planning and control is an
asset.

Compensation will be commensurate with experience.  Interested
individuals should reply to:

          Larry Matthies         
          Mail stop 107-102

          4800 Oak Grove Drive

Received: from GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU by A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU id aa20067;
          26 May 95 14:40:26 EDT
Date: Fri, 26 May 95 14:38:43 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Intelligent Tutoring Systems 
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: ads@cee.hw.ac.uk (Andrew David Steele)
Subject: Job[UK] : Intelligent Tutoring Systems
Organization: Dept of Computing & Electrical Engineering, Heriot-Watt University, Scotland
Date: Wed, 24 May 1995 15:05:41 GMT

We are looking for a researcher with experience in Intelligent
Tutoring Systems or Industrial Training to join our team working on an
EPSRC funded project on Model Based Industrial Training (MOBIT).  This
is a collaborative project consisting of Scottish Nuclear, Digital
Equipment, Scomagg and Heriot-Watt University, a description of the
project is attached.  The project is now half way through its 3 year
programme. Prospects for further projects in this area are good.  The
work is undertaken within the Intelligent Systems Laboratory of the
Department of Computing and Electrical Engineering, Heriot-Watt
University.  A description of the Lab and of its members is available
on http://www.cee.hw.ac.uk.

***
Please contact Roy Leitch (0131 451 3353; leitch@cee.hw.ac.uk) or
Keith Brown (0131 451 3351; keb@cee.hw.ac.uk) for further information
***




MOBIT (MOdel Based Intelligent Training)

Introduction

The Mobit project is part of the Intelligent Systems Integration
Programme, ISIP, and comprises four partners, Scottish Nuclear,
Digital, Scomagg and Heriot Watt University.

Background

Traditional computer based training, CBT, systems are currently being
used for some training tasks but they have many disadvantages. CBTs
are very inflexible and cannot cope well with incremental changes in
system operation, nor are they suitable for some complex tasks. MOBIT
sets out to tackle some of the problems of CBTs by creating both a
flexible and a widely applicable system.

Interacting models of the domain, the trainee and a domain expert are
used. If any changes to the system or to the training requirements of
the system are required then the appropriate models can be adjusted to
give the updated system without a complete redevelopment of the
system. This model based approach also permits a flexible training
program to allow training to be performed at the appropriate pace for
each trainee or for targetted retraining. Successful completion of the
project will provide a powerful flexible system.

The project objectives are to

   Develop a generic model based training system
   Produce a supporting specification methodology
   Produce a set of software tools
   Identify and support multiple representations of the domain expertise
   knowledge
   Construct two demonstrator systems .

Prior to building the demonstrators a demonstrator prototype PROMO is
being constructed.
--
--
Andrew D.Steele         Intelligent Systems Laboratory
                        Dept. of Computing and Electrical Eng.
                        Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh EH14 4AS.

Neural Applications Corporation, a pioneer in applying neural network technology
to process optimization, seeks highly qualified individuals for the following
positions:
 
    SOFTWARE ENGINEER: Be part of the development of the next generation of
    our industry-redefining neural network products. Requires BSCS or MSCS
    with 3+ years POST-college work experience, exceptional C/C++ or C/FORTRAN
    skills, good communication skills, extensive 80x86 development experience,
    and some low level drivers and I/O experience. Neural Network/Intelligent
    Systems experience preferred.
 
    APPLICATIONS ENGINEER: Responsible for all phases of installation including
    troubleshooting electrical and software problems, tuning, testing, and
    performance logging. Requires BSEE (MSEE preferred) with 6+ years INDUSTRIAL
    work experience, excellent communication and organizational skills, as well
    as proven leadership abilities. Applicant should be willing to travel
    extensively. Neural Network/Intelligent Systems experience preferred.
 
Neural Applications Corporation's premiere product, the Intelligent Arc Furnace
Controller, is a neural network based regulator and closed loop supervisory system
for the steel melting process. This product was one of six to receive the
prestigious Outstanding Engineering Achievement award by the National Society of
Professional Engineers in 1991. Our technology has been extended to several other
processes such as the food, chemical, automotive, and medical industries.
 
Neural is located near the University of Iowa Campus and Iowa City. The community
offers excellent schools and recreational activities in a small city atmosphere.
We offer a competitive compensation package, a full range of benefits, and real
opportunity for growth.

Dept., Neural Applications Corporation, 2600 Crosspark Road, Coralville, IA 52241.

Macintosh Software Engineer.  This person will play a significant 
role in working on state-of-the-art speech recognition systems, and
will work on design and implementation of the next generation of 
applications.

        * At least 5 years in industry 
        * C/C++
        * Regular use of class library
        * MacApp, TCL, or PowerPlant
        * Object Oriented Design
        * MAC Toolbox
        * AppleEvent
        * 68K/Power PC assembler
        * Sound Manger(a plus)

SALARY: To low 60s

If you are interested in this position, please send your resume to me 
at Technology Profiles, Inc.(TPI).  TPI is a technical placement firm  
that helps software engineers find jobs with companies in the greater 
Boston, MA area.
