          2 Jun 95 17:56:06 EDT
Date: Fri, 2 Jun 95 17:55:04 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Speech Recognition (Berkeley, CA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: bilmes@anchorsteam.icsi.berkeley.edu (Jeff Bilmes)
Subject: Speech Recognition Systems Position Available, Berkeley CA
Date: 26 May 1995 23:17:30 GMT
Organization: ICSI/U.C. Berkeley

        Speech Recognition Systems Position Available

           International Computer Science Institute

                        Berkeley CA


The International Computer Science Institute (ICSI) in Berkeley,
California now has a position available in the Realization Group.  This
is a staff position with a focus on speech recognition system design.
The job will involve both research and development. Applicants should
have several years of experience in designing and writing speech
recognition software, and have an interest in developing recognizers
that incorporate results from basic research within the group. It would
be best if the applicant also had experience in speech research as
well, although development experience is the more important
qualification.  Ordinarily, applicants will have a Ph.D., although
strong professional experience can substitute for this requirement.

The Realization group at ICSI does a combination of hardware, software,
and algorithms for research and development of systems for speech
processing and other machine implementations of human signal processing
and pattern recognition.  In the past, much of the emphasis has been on
hybrid neural network/ hidden Markov model based speech recognition,
robust recognition in the context of additive and convolutional noise,
study of robust properties of the human auditory system, and research
into the interaction of statistical sequence recognition with robust
signal processing.  Hardware and software tools also continue to be
developed in the group, leading to strong capabilities for training
with computationally intensive algorithms.  The group includes a strong
group of Berkeley CS and EE graduate students, as well as by fruitful
collaborations with other researchers (including Greenberg from
Berkeley, Bourlard from Belgium, Hermansky from OGI, Cohen and Franco
from SRI, and Robinson from Cambridge U). The group is led by Nelson
Morgan.

ICSI is an independent, non-profit basic research institute affiliated
with the University of California campus in Berkeley, California, and
is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


For further information, please contact:

        Dr. Nelson Morgan
        International Computer Science Institute
        1947 Center St., Suite 600
        Berkeley, CA. 94704
        (415) 642-4274 x131
        morgan@icsi.berkeley.edu
--
----------------------------------------------------------
Jeff A. Bilmes
Computer Science Division      International Computer Science Institute
Dept. of EECS                  1947 Center St.  Suite 600
U.C. Berkeley                  Berkeley CA, 94704-1198
Berkeley CA, 94720             <bilmes@icsi.berkeley.edu> FAX: +1 510 642 6865
<bilmes@cs.berkeley.edu>       <http://www.icsi.berkeley.edu/~bilmes>

From: wedgingt@kronos.arc.nasa.gov (Will Edgington)
Subject: F/T AI/C++/WWW position @ NASA/AmesRC, SF Bay, CA, USA
Organization: NASA/ARC Computational Sciences Division
Date: Mon, 5 Jun 1995 16:32:20 GMT


  Full time position at NASA in south San Francisco Bay Area


This individual will support the Advanced Interaction Media group in
integrating Artificial Intelligence technology with state-of-the-art
hypertext and electronic documentation systems.  The person will be
responsible for (1) integrating the C++ version of our adaptive technique
into the Hyperman document viewing system used by flight controllers at the
Johnson Space Center's mission control center; (2) integrating our adaptive
technique with the Mosaic World Wide Web document viewer; and (3) studying
how to apply our adaptive technique to computer-based training application
in the context of intelligent performance support systems.  These tasks
require both to interface our software with other existing software, as well
as to redesign part of the user interface.

Required Skills:

MS in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering (with major in CS); 2-3
years work experience; strong C++ programming skills; experience with Unix;
knowledge of Object oriented design, database and client-server programming;
experience in large software project management; good social and
communication skills.

Desirable Skills:

Knowledge of hypertext, information retrieval, multimedia, artificial
intelligence, tutoring systems, computer-based training systems, performance
support systems, intelligent user interfaces, adaptive systems; experience
with the Macintosh environments.


Please send a cover letter and resume to (in ascii or postscript):

        allen@ptolemy.arc.nasa.gov

If you do not have access to e-mail, you can send a hard copy to

John Allen
MS 269-2
NASA Ames Research Center
Moffett Field, CA 94035

[Note that email to any other address may be delayed or lost.]

Subject: US-IA-Engineering Positions at Neural Applications Corporation
Organization: Online Career Center
Date: Mon, 5 Jun 1995 13:13:25 GMT

 
Neural Applications Corporation, a pioneer in applying neural
network technology to process optimization, seeks highly
qualified individuals for the following positions:
 
    SOFTWARE ENGINEER: Be part of the development of the next
    generation of our industry-redefining neural network
    products. Requires BSCS or MSCS with 3+ years POST-college
    work experience, exceptional C/C++ or C/FORTRAN skills,
    good communication skills, extensive 80x86 development
    experience, and some low level drivers and I/O experience.
    Neural Network/Intelligent Systems experience preferred.
 
    APPLICATIONS ENGINEER: Responsible for all phases of
    installation including troubleshooting electrical and
    software problems, tuning, testing, and performance logging.
    Requires BSEE (MSEE preferred) with 6+ years INDUSTRIAL
    work experience, excellent communication and organizational
    skills, as well as proven leadership abilities. Applicant
    should be willing to travel
    extensively. Neural Network/Intelligent Systems experience
    preferred.
 
Neural Applications Corporation's premiere product, the
Intelligent Arc Furnace Controller, is a neural network based
regulator and closed loop supervisory system for the steel
melting process. This product was one of six to receive the
prestigious Outstanding Engineering Achievement award by the
National Society of Professional Engineers in 1991. Our
technology has been extended to several other processes such
as the food, chemical, automotive, and medical industries.
 
Neural is located near the University of Iowa Campus and Iowa
City. The community offers excellent schools and recreational
activities in a small city atmosphere.

We offer a competitive compensation package, a full range of
benefits, and real opportunity for growth.
 
Qualified applicants should send a resume with salary
requirements to: Personnel Dept., Neural Applications
Corporation, 2600 Crosspark Road, Coralville, IA 52241.
Or email: hrdept@neural.com.
 
Neural Applications Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

HNC Software Inc.

	Job No. 109 
 
Position Title:			Staff Scientist 
Status:				Regular full-time, exempt 
Department:			Payment Systems 
Supervisory Responsibilities:	No 
Education:	MS in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, EE,  
or related field 
 
Duties/Job Description: 
Design, build, and evaluate neural network models for various applications in the financial  
industry.  Specific responsibilities will vary by project but may also include working with  
customers to obtain data, analyzing data to determine suitability for modeling, analyzing  
performance, and reporting results to customers. 
 
 
Required Qualifications (Experience/Skills): 
MS in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or relate field.   
Minimum two years experience in some area of data analysis. Good oral and written  
communcation skills, both in terms of interacting with customers and with co-workers.   
Some prior experience with neural networks or statistical modeling techniques.  Strong  
mathematical background and aptitude. 
 
 
Preferred Qualifications (Experience/Skills): 
Ph.D. in related field of study. Five years industry experience in some form of data  
analysis.  Two years experience designing neural network and/or statistical models for  
some real-world application. Comfortable with C and UNIX. Some knowledge of SAS or  
S-Plus.

opportunities with HNC, please ask them to fax or send resumes immediately to:

From: david@pharlap.CI.COM (David B. Kuznick)
Subject: US-MA-Boston-Bedford - UNIX C/C++ Developer - Cognition Corporation
Date: 7 Jun 1995 11:54:07 -0500
Organization: Cognition Corporation

   SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER POSITION OPEN AT COGNITION CORPORATION

Cognition Corporation located in Bedford, MA is currently seeking a
skilled UNIX C/C++ software engineer to lead the design and
development of their Costlink product.  The job responsibilities
include the design, implementation, testing and maintenance of the
entire Costlink product.  This is not an entry-level position.

Costlink provides an interface between Cognition Corporation's Cost
Advantage, an Expert System for providing Cost and Manufacturability
data early on in the design cycle of a manufactured product, and
various Feature-based CAD solid modelers, such as Parametric
Technology Corporation's Pro Engineer.

The desired candidate should possess:

        o a minimum of 5 years INDUSTRY-LEVEL software development
          experience with at least 3 years working in C and/or C++
          in a UNIX environment (required)

        o experience in the total life-cycle of a product, from the
          analysis and design phase, through implementation, testing
          and maintenance (required)
 
        o excellent written and verbal communication skills (required)

        o a minimum of 2 years project leadership experience (required)

        o familiarity with the CAD industry in general and
          Feature-based solid modeling in particular (preferred)
 
        o Lisp experience (preferred)
 
        o familiarity with language-design issues including experience
          with parsers and parser-generators (preferred)
 
        o experience interacting with customers to handle training and 
          support issues (preferred)

Cognition Corporation is an 8 year old privately-held small company
with a generally informal and friendly work environment, providing
competitive salary, excellent benefits, a 401K program, and stock
options.

Interested parties should forward a copy of their resume to:

Cognition Corporation
209 Burlington Rd
Bedford, MA  01730
Attn: Human Resources

Fax: 617-271-0813

Email: personnel@ci.com

Subject: Job: Lexicographer/Machine Translation at CMU (Pittsburgh, PA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: ehn+@CS.CMU.EDU (Eric Nyberg)
Subject: US-PA-Pittsburgh Machine Translation Lexicographer, CMU
Date: 7 Jun 1995 19:09:14 GMT
Organization: Carnegie-Mellon University, School of Computer Science

US-PA-Pittsburgh Machine Translation Lexicographer, CMU

Lexicographer, Machine Translation Applications

The CATALYST project at the Center for Machine Translation, Carnegie
Mellon University, is seeking a talented and energetic individual for
the position of Lexicographer.

CATALYST is a large-scale MT application for commercial document
delivery in the domain of heavy machinery. The Lexicographer is
responsible for the following tasks:

 * implementation of lexicon refinement/enhancement/maintenance tasks,
   in support of source and target language lexicon development.

The successful applicant must have the following qualifications:

 * M.A. in linguistics, M.S in computational linguistics or a related field

 * Native or near-native fluency in English

 * Experience developing knowledge sources for language software,
   preferably large-scale, multi-lingual lexicons for machine translation
   in technical domains

 * Understanding of the principles of lexicography and terminology
   management, especially as they relate to semantic accuracy and
   translatability 

 * Demonstrated ability to proactively identify and quantify lexical
   issues that arise during development/refinement, with special
   attention paid to issues which span multiple knowledge sources (e.g.,
   domain model, TL lexicons, etc.). 


Skill and experience in these areas are preferred but not required:

 * Fluency in any of French, Spanish, German, Italian, Portuguese, Russian

 * Experience with manual translation in technical domains


Full-time Salaried Position, Starting Range: $27,000 to $30,000 USD

Occasional Travel Required

Contact:	Eric Nyberg				Phone: (412) 268-7281
		Center for Machine Translation		Fax:   (412) 268-6298
		Carnegie Mellon University		EMail: ehn+@cs.cmu.edu
		Pittsburgh, PA 15213
		USA

Candidates should send a letter of application, a current vita, at
least three letters of reference, and representative samples of their
work. Resumes, cover letters, etc. may be submitted via EMail, in
ASCII or Postscript form. Resumes may also be submitted by fax or
regular mail, but EMail is preferred. Letters of recommendation must
be faxed or mailed. Applicants from abroad may wish to consider
express mail to ensure a timely submission.

                 Resource Technologies Limited (RTL)

      RTL is an exciting young high-tech firm specialising in
  intelligent resource management software development.  Our company is
  based in Hong Kong.  We perform turn-key system development and
  consulting in embedded-AI, resource allocation, personnel timetabling,
  reactive scheduling, and other constraint-based systems.  Our clients
  are some of HK's largest corporations in the transportation and
  shipping industries.

      We are currently seeking highly motivated individuals who are
  interested in taking on any of the following challenging
  responsibilities:

  Software Development

      This person should have experience in designing and implementing
      constraint-based scheduling algorithms, graphic user interfaces,
      or RDBMS interfaces.  He/she should have a solid background in C++
      and Unix.  Previous experience with constraint programming
      languages, ILOG tools, or expert system development in the
      transportation, manufacturing, or telecommunications industries
      is a plus.  Relevant thesis research in scheduling is ideal.

  Marketing

      This person should have good knowledge of marketing high-tech
      software and services to RTL's target industries.  He/she
      will be responsible for developing and executing marketing
      strategies for RTL's services in the Hong Kong area.  He/she will
      organise seminars and exhibitions, explore new leads and markets,
      and develop marketing tools and material.

  Software QA and Documentation

      This person will be responsible for testing RTL's software and
      to ensure software meets client's functional specification.
      He/she will develop and document testing procedures, and design
      and write user manuals for RTL's turn-key systems.  All
      documentations will be in English.

      If you think RTL is the company for you, please send your resume
  and expected salary to:

specification, design and integration of software-intensive image  
processing and distributed database systems; image or signal  
processing algorithm development; MS, IR, EO, or SAR sensor data  
processing; database management systems and GIS; photogrammetry;  
artificial intelligence; information agents; model-based extraction  
and/or LAN's and protocols.  
  
GIS SPECIALISTS  
  
BS CS required.  MS preferred.  Must be well versed in the 
representation, storage and retrieval of spatial data.  Knowledge of 2D, 
3D and N-dimensional implementations is required.  Understanding of 
topology and related issues as applied to spatial data is also required. 
Preferred experience includes GIS, commercial tools for GIS and DBMSs and 
remote sensing applications.   
  
US citizenship is required for most of the above openings  
  
Seeking applicants who have or are willing to undergo a Single Scope  
(10 yr.) Background Investigation (SSBI).  Most applicants selected  
will be subject to a security investigation and must meet eligibility  
requirements for access to classified information.  
  
See our Web page at http://www.gdesystems.com  
  
Submit resume and salary history in confidence to:    
GDE Systems, Inc.  
PO Box 509008, 
Mail Zone 6101-H, REF-81  
San Diego, CA  92150-9008  
  
or fax to 619-592-5733, addressed to REF-81.    
  
Resumes may also be sent to love@GDESystems.com with REF-81 listed 
on the subject line.

	statistics required.

	development/use.

you if you have several years of proven programming skills!

have flexibility to make a lot of your own goals - and work with
other talented people in nice offices in Palo Alto.  U.S.
Citizenship or Permanent Resident status is required for all
positions.

products for converting raster images of line drawings into
intelligent databases.  The SmartMaps Automated Conversion System
(SmartACS) is a leading-edge software product that has been engineered
to be configurable for drawings from power and communication utilities
as well as for municipal maps.  The SmartMaps Intelligent Database
Editor (SmartEdit) provides a graphical user interface to the
intelligent databases created by SmartACS.

Customization Engineer.  CE's are responsible for programming SmartACS
and SmartEdit for specific customers, as well as developing new tools
and GUI's to assist in the process.  The ideal candidate will have a

MTS-8/9/10, System Administrator; Supervisor: M. Power; Location:
Pasadena, CA - JPL. Description of Duties:  Handle internal user requests
for assistance and resources.  Perform user account activities including
creation, modification and deletion of users and will maintain user
account schema.  Prepare/maintain uniform backup scheme for all CPUs. 
Perform computer security duties including creating, installing, and
maintaining procedures.  Implement ECS security, and perform functions of
DPISM.  Install, maintain, configure, order, and assist users with COTS
and OS.  Maintain software upgrade contracts, develop cost estimates, and
handle renewals records by maintaining license DB by machine/users and
maintaining a documentation file for each machine.  Install, maintain,
consult with users, monitor performance, perform capacity planning,
configure and order networks and hardware.  Maintain hardware upgrade
contacts, prepare cost estimates, renewals, and records by maintaining an
inventory DB by machine/users, and maintaining a documentation file for
each machine.  Maintain physical security, document and plan environment,
develop power requirements, capacities, and configuration. 
Qualifications:  System administrator with at least 4 years of UNIX SA
experience.  Additionally, should have experience working with VMS,
Macintosh, and PC platforms.  Silicon Graphics IRIX and Sun OS experience
preferred. (JPL Sol 297).  Job #PAT  300 - Posting Date 3-8-95.

MTS-9/10, Software Development Engineer; Supervisor: M. Power; Location:
Pasadena, CA - JPL. Description of Duties:  Specify, design, build and
test high performance and high fidelity models of the Cassini spacecraft
hardware as part of a crack team developing cutting-edge Multi-mission
spacecraft simulators for various JPL missions.  The simulators are
developed on and operate on single and multi-processor UNIX platforms.
Qualifications:  MA/MS + 6 years or BA/BS + 8 years relevant experience in
Computer Science or Electrical Engineering.  Experience developing
embedded system software written in C or C++; experience working with
HW/SW interfaces; C++ skill and experience; skill and experience writing
Bourne shell scripts; experience using UNIX as platform for program
development and as a program execution target. Related Skills:  Experience

programs that operate on a Multi-thread/Multi-processor shard-memory
platform; exposure to Formal Methods; exposure to component-based software
architectures. (JPL Sol 273).  Job #PAT  312 - Posting Date 3-8-95.

                          INTELLIGENCE

qualities The MITRE Corporation seeks because they're the qualities 
we offer our clients who rely on us for technological solutions and  
guidance in defense, intelligence, air traffic control, information, 
communication, and other vital areas.  If these are qualities you can 
offer our technically advanced environment, the following position is
available:

                    MEMBER OF TECHNICAL STAFF

This position supports the development of AI projects for defense 
intelligence problems, including signals intelligence analysis and 
automated traffic analysis. Working with rule-based co mputation and 
reasoning under uncertainty will also be essential. The successful 
candidate will work with intelligence analysts to design and prototype 
new applications and extend existing prototypes. A BS (MS preferred) 
in Computer Science or Artificial Intelligence and work in AI for 
defense/intelligence-related projects are required. Proficiency in one 
or more of the following is desired: Lisp, C, UNIX, RDBMS and X-Windows
Interfaces under C and Lisp.

Job# 	JS-641169

Knowledge Representation and AI

For a concurrent design and engineering application, we are looking 
for a top researcher/programmer/designer with a minimum of 5 yrs. experience 
doing programming and design.  New grads are not appropriate for this 
position.  To qualify you must have:  LISP and C/C++ programming 
skills, a solid background in Object-oriented programming and an AI 
background.  Specifically, you must be knowledgeable in the area of 
knowledge representation (KL-ONE, NIKL, Loom).  Nice-to-haves are:  some 
database experience (Oracle,Sybase) and background in agent-based 
architectures.  

Education:  Full-time applicants must have B.S. in Computer Science 
+ 5 yrs. experience or a M.S. in Computer Science with proven 
industry experience.  Contractors may also be appropriate for this 
position.  Length of assignment:  6 mos. to 1 yr.

Salary/Rate:  depending upon experience


*WHO ARE WE?


The Research and Software Technology Divisions of a Fortune 20
Company are seeking bright and talented Software professionals to
add to their workforce on a Full-time and on a Contract basis.
We have had an influx of project work and have both junior and
senior positions available.  If you are a recent graduate, and interested 
in working in a research setting, we want to talk with you if you have 
several years of proven programming skills!


*WHAT IS OUR WORKPLACE LIKE?

We are researchers in an entrepreneurial environment.  You will
have flexibility to make a lot of your own goals - and work with
other talented people in nice offices in Palo Alto.  U.S.
Citizenship or Permanent Resident status is required for all
Full-time positions, a Green Card is required for contract positions.

*HOW TO REACH US?

For immediate consideration, fax or Email your resume. 
Please remember to reference the job number and let us know the best 
times and places to reach you.  We will review your background and 
contact you to discuss the positions available.

Send your resume via Email to:          Susan Troccolo
(ASCII or WinWord format)               DANTE Associates
                                        DANTE@Netcom.com

Via FAX on HIGH RES to:                 (415) 326-5969
						or
					 (415) 354-5235

No phone calls please.  Principals only.

Subject: Admin: Lists Useful?
Date: Fri, 16 Jun 95 19:59:01 -0400
Message-ID: <26892.803347141@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>
From: Mark Kantrowitz <Mark_Kantrowitz@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Every so often I receive a thank you email message from someone who
got a job "because" of one of the AI-related jobs lists.

In addition to the statistics I keep on the number of subscribers and
the number of job postings, I would like to keep statistics on the
number of people who saw a post and ultimately got hired for the position.

If you got hired for a job that you first heard about through one of
these lists, please send an email message to ai+got-job@cs.cmu.edu
with the name of the list (AI-Jobs, Lisp-Jobs, Prolog-Jobs,
AI-PostDoc, AI-PreDoc). Only summary counts for each list will be made
public. 

Mark Kantrowitz
mkant@cs.cmu.edu

The newly refurbished Hubble Space Telescope, the cornerstone of NASA's 
astrophysics programs, now placed 380 miles above the Earth's surface, 
continues to open a new chapter in the history of astronomy. You can contribute 
to this effort.

We have an immediate opening for a versatile software engineer to join our 
Software Support Team. The position involves requirements analysis, design, 
development and testing of software to support observation preparation, 
planning and scheduling on the Hubble Space Telescope.

Requirements:

+ Masters in Computer Science or equivalent experience and training

+ Experience with OOD/OOP, Lisp and at least one UNIX Scripting Language (Tcl/
Tk preferred)

+ Ability to learn new Technologies, Programming Languages and Problem Domains 
quickly and to work independently in a fast-paced environment

+ Familiarity with several of the following: Scheduling Algorithms, Constraint 
Satisfaction Problems, Expert Systems, Artificial Intelligence, GUI 
Development, TCP/IP Sockets, Client/Server Architecture, SQL DBMS

+ An interest in Satellites and Space-Based Astronomy

The Space Telescope Science Institute (STScI), located on the Johns Hopkins 
University campus, offers competitive salaries and benefits package as well as 
a stimulating work environment. Minorities and females are strongly encouraged 
to apply. 

Qualified candidates are requested to send resume and salary history to:

Human Resources Office
Space Telescope Science Institute
3700 San Martin Drive
Baltimore, MD 21218

EEO/AA/M/F/D/V

Date: Tue, 20 Jun 95 14:06:21 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Intuitive Interfaces to Information at MCC (Texas)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: mack@maximillion.mcc.com (Melanie Mack)
Subject: US-TX-PROJECT MANAGER-INTERFACES-MCC
Organization: MCC Corporate Computing
Date: Tue, 13 Jun 1995 17:10:00 GMT

                  Intuitive Interfaces to Information 
              Systems Project--The Role of Human Language

Information systems now occupy a position of central importance 
in our economy, and successful business competition depends 
critically on effective and efficient processing of information.  
The importance of information processing and of the development of a 
National Information Infrastructure (NII) is acknowledged throughout 
industry, and the importance of a strong NII to the nation's 
well-being is recognized and strongly supported at top levels of 
government.  But, in order to provide full benefit from and full 
access to these information services, significant advances are needed 
in ease-of-use.  Natural and intuitive interfaces are required to 
empower the user, to exploit the potential of information services, 
and to bring information access to everybody.

Human language is clearly the medium and human language technology 
is the key to fulfill this need.  A host of potential application 
areas require human language interfaces.  Generic examples include 
information retrieval based upon natural language queries, machine 
translation of text from one language to another, automatic 
extraction of information from text for creating databases, 
dictation of text by voice, and domain-specific spoken language 
understanding for natural interactions with information systems.  
These applications represent a wave of potential services that will 
be enabled by natural intuitive interfaces using human language 
technology.  The I3S study was created to support and foster this 
vital development.

              PROJECT  MANAGER  GENERAL  RESPONSIBILITIES 

1. Technical leadership
   - Provide the technical direction necessary to develop plans for 
     studies/projects which respond customer needs.
   - Serve as a senior technical contributor to the study/project.
   - Establish responsibilities for subordinate staff in a manner which 
     maximizes the use of available technical talent.
   - Formulate plans for follow-on consortia projects or product 
     developments as appropriate.
2. Business Development
   - Identify, qualify, and take the steps necessary to close deals 
     with potential study/project sponsors.
   - Prepare proposals and "white papers" for government contracts 
     which represent new business opportunities or ways to gain 
     additional leverage for existing projects.
3. Administrative Management
   - Recruit, develop, and retain a competent and motivated staff.
   - Monitor and control project expenditures to insure adherence 
     to budget.
   - Develop contingency plans modifying staffing levels, project 
     deliverables, and other direct costs as necessary to respond 
     to changing financial conditions.
   - Ensure that MCC policies are understood by the project staff 
     and followed.
4. Customer Satisfaction
   - Ensure the timeliness and quality of study findings and project 
     deliverables.
   - Contribute to effectively reporting findings and transferring 
     technology to sponsors.
   - Maintain close liaison with sponsors to understand changing 
     needs and expectations.

Send resume' to: MCC
                 ATTN: Human Resources Department
                 P.O. Box 200195
                 Austin, Texas  78720
        E-mail:  vallen@mcc.com
*************************************************************
The Microelectronics and Computer Technology Corporation

Information technology is advancing at break-neck speeds.
Competition is going global. Business success demands innovation,
agility, and the right strategic partners working together to
get further faster and at less expense.

It was this philosophy-the value of cooperation-that led ten
major U.S. corporations to launch MCC more than a decade ago,
and it continues to be MCC's guiding philosophy today. Shrinking
margins and limited resources make consortial research more
valuable today than ever before, providing a proven strategy for
accelerating technology development and leveraging scarce R&D
resources.

Today's MCC is a rich environment for multidisciplinary
research and development, technology integration, and
alliance-building, with a pervasive commitment to accelerating
the creation, commercialization, and adoption of innovation in
information technologies and advanced electronics. MCC's objective
is to enhance the ability of member companies to harness the
power of information technology to attain sustainable competitive
advantage.

Founded by major computer and semiconductor manufacturers, MCC's
membership has diversified to include a broad range of high-profile
corporations from electronics, computers, aerospace, semiconductors,
and related industries, as well as major end users of advanced
technology. MCC's membership reflects the full range of companies
that are vital to the life cycle of information technology and
advanced electronic products. Active involvement of small- and medium-
sized manufacturers, along with well-established alliances with
government research and development agencies and leading universities,
allows MCC's partners to make cost-effective use of R&D resources.

To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: InfoSleuth at MCC (Texas)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: mack@maximillion.mcc.com (Melanie Mack)
Subject: US-TX-PROJECT MANAGER-INFOSLEUTH-MCC
Organization: MCC Corporate Computing
Date: Tue, 13 Jun 1995 17:23:00 GMT

               of Information using Semantic Agents

              Project Manager Position Description

Project summary:
InfoSleuth is developing and deploying new technologies for 
finding information in both corporate and external networks, 
such as those based on the emerging National Information 
Infrastructure (NII).  The InfoSleuth research is based on 
MCC's acclaimed Carnot technology, developed in a collaborative 
project over the last 4 years.  Carnot has been successfully 
used to integrate heterogeneous corporate information resources.  
The InfoSleuth Project will investigate the use of Carnot 
technology in a more dynamically changing environment, such as 
the Internet, where new information sources are constantly being 
added and for which there is no formal control of the registration 
of new information sources.  In this type of environment, traditional 
techniques for expressing and optimizing database queries are 
inadequate because of the rapidly changing schema information and 
the fuzzy nature of the queries.  InfoSleuth will build on Carnot's 
semantic modeling capabilities to enable "deep" descriptions of 
available information sources, and InfoSleuth will deploy semantic 
agents to carry out distributed, coordinated, self-adapting search 
algorithms.

TECHNICAL  REQUIREMENTS 

- Extensive knowledge of both research and commercial products in 
  a number of the following technology areas: agent-based computing, 
  database management, information retrieval, object-oriented programming 
  languages, distributed processing, and artificial intelligence

- Established track record as an innovative researcher in the 
  project area.

- Demonstrated ability to lead a world class research team made 
  up of MCC personnel, personnel at sponsoring companies, university 
  professors and students, and collaborators at other companies.

- Ability to market current and proposed programs to potential sponsors.
  The InfoSleuth Project will be expanded with new sponsors throughout 
  1995 and early 1996. There is a potential for initiation of additional 
  MCC projects related to InfoSleuth in late 1995 and beyond.

- Experience in the management of consortium projects. Sponsors of 
  the InfoSleuth Project will be a diverse group of companies and 
  government agencies with diverse goals for their return on investment 
  as a result of their sponsorship of the project. Sponsors will 
  include both users of InfoSleuth technology who want to improve 
  their organizational productivity in the short term while waiting 
  for commercial InfoSleuth products to emerge and organizations that 
  will be developing commercial InfoSleuth products. 

PROJECT  MANAGER'S  GENERAL  RESPONSIBILITIES 

1. Technical leadership
   - Provide the technical direction necessary to develop 
     plans for studies/projects which respond customer needs.
   - Serve as a senior technical contributor to the study/project.
   - Establish responsibilities for subordinate staff in a manner 
     which maximizes the use of available technical talent.
   - Formulate plans for follow-on consortium projects or product 
     developments as appropriate.
2. Business Development
   - Identify, qualify, and take the steps necessary to close 
     deals with potential study/project sponsors.
   - Prepare proposals and "white papers" for government contracts 
     which represent new business opportunities or ways to gain 
     additional leverage for existing projects.	
3. Administrative Management
   - Recruit, develop, and retain a competent and motivated staff.
   - Monitor and control project expenditures to insure adherence 
     to budget.
   - Develop contingency plans modifying staffing levels, project 
     deliverables, and other direct costs as necessary to respond 
     to changing financial conditions.
   - Ensure that MCC policies are understood by the project staff 
     and followed.
4. Customer Satisfaction
   - Ensure the timeliness and quality of study findings and project 
     deliverables.
   - Contribute to effectively reporting findings and transferring 
     technology to sponsors.
   - Maintain close liaison with sponsors to understand changing 
     needs and expectations.

Send resume' to: MCC
                 ATTN: Human Resources Department
                 P.O. Box 200195
                 Austin, Texas  78720
        E-mail:  vallen@mcc.com

The Microelectronics and Computer Technology Corporation

Subject: Job: Constraint-based Scheduling, Expert Systems at RTL (Hong Kong)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: ifca@hk.net (Resource Technologies Limited)
Subject: Job Offer [HongKong] - CSP, Scheduling, C++
Date: 7 Jun 1995 02:40:12 GMT
Organization: Resource Technologies Limited

                 Resource Technologies Limited (RTL)

      RTL is an exciting young high-tech firm specialising in
  intelligent resource management software development.  Our company is
  based in Hong Kong.  We perform turn-key system development and
  consulting in embedded-AI, resource allocation, personnel timetabling,
  reactive scheduling, and other constraint-based systems.  Our clients
  are some of HK's largest corporations in the transportation and
  shipping industries.

      We are currently seeking highly motivated individuals who are
  interested in taking on any of the following challenging
  responsibilities:

  Software Development

      This person should have experience in designing and implementing
      constraint-based scheduling algorithms, graphic user interfaces,
      or RDBMS interfaces.  He/she should have a solid background in C++
      and Unix.  Previous experience with constraint programming
      languages, ILOG tools, or expert system development in the
      transportation, manufacturing, or telecommunications industries
      is a plus.  Relevant thesis research in scheduling is ideal.

  Marketing

      This person should have good knowledge of marketing high-tech
      software and services to RTL's target industries.  He/she
      will be responsible for developing and executing marketing
      strategies for RTL's services in the Hong Kong area.  He/she will
      organise seminars and exhibitions, explore new leads and markets,
      and develop marketing tools and material.

  Software QA and Documentation

      This person will be responsible for testing RTL's software and
      to ensure software meets client's functional specification.
      He/she will develop and document testing procedures, and design
      and write user manuals for RTL's turn-key systems.  All
      documentations will be in English.

      If you think RTL is the company for you, please send your resume
  and expected salary to:

      Resource Technologies Limited
      1/F, 223 Tung Choi Street,
      Mongkok, Kowloon,
      Hong Kong

      fax: (852)-2337-2275

      email: albert%ifcauucp.uucp@hk.net

Date: Wed, 21 Jun 95 14:54:53 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Computer Vision at ECRC (Munich, Germany)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Date: Tue, 13 Jun 1995 14:45:57 GMT
From: hiring@ecrc.de (Hiring committee)
Subject: Job openings at ECRC, Munich, Germany
Organization: European Computer-Industry Research Centre GmbH, Munich, Germany


                             JOB OPENINGS
                             June 13, 1995


The European Computer-Industry Research Centre (ECRC) seeks talented
computer scientists/engineers to support two major European
Commission-funded research projects in augmented reality.  The
positions are available immediately.

Job Description:

The candidate will be a member of the User Interaction and
Visualization group, which conducts research and develops advanced
systems that incorporate interactive graphics, computer vision, and
multimedia.  The candidates will implement various computer
graphics/image processing algorithms required for the EC projects.
They will also develop the applications needed to demonstrate the
projects' results.  These positions stress technical knowledge,
creativity, and self-sufficiency, as well as a desire to investigate
new technologies and problem solutions.  The current EC-funded
projects will explore augmented reality for use in design and
construction.

Education:

Masters degree (or equivalent, e.g., German Diploma) in Computer
Science/Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Bachelor's level candidates with appropriate work experience will also
be considered.

Experience:

A strong programming background in C++ and Unix is required.
Programming knowledge of real-time devices or interactive systems is
also desirable.  The ideal candidate will have experience in one or
more of the following areas:

        1) Pixel/image processing,
        2) Interactive 3D graphics, with a working knowledge of one
           or more graphics libraries, such as GL, OpenGL, or XGL,
        3) Numerical analysis/computing
        4) Support for C++ development environments, including device
           interfaces, and software management, configuration and
           installation.

How to Apply:

To apply, send a resume, the names and addresses of at least three
references, your telephone number and e-mail address to the address
listed below.  Only written applications will be considered.

ECRC is an international research centre supported by a consortium of
companies and also strongly supported by the European Commission.  Its
mission is to conduct research and to develop advanced applications
which are of strategic importance to industry.  Active research areas
include distributed computing and communication, user interaction and
visualization (augmented reality), and advanced information access and
retrieval.  Approximately 40 researchers from 20 different nations
work at the centre.  ECRC offers competitive salaries and excellent
benefits.  English is the working language of the centre.

ECRC is located in Munich, Germany.  Munich and its surroundings is
one of Europe's high-tech centres, with numerous computer and
manufacturing companies, and a major technical university located in
the area. Munich is also a great place to live. It is home to the
world famous Oktoberfest and numerous other festivals, close to the
Alps and surrounded by numerous lakes.  Culturally, Munich offers a
variety of museums, art galleries, and concert venues.  Munich is also
centrally located for travel to other parts of Europe.


Write to:

        Recruiting Committee
        European Computer-Industry Research Centre
        Arabellastrasse 17
        D-81925 Munich
        Germany

WWW address: http://www.ecrc.de/

Recruiting Committee
European Computer-Industry Research Centre      tel.  : +(49)(89) 92699-0
Arabellastrasse 17                              fax.  : +(49)(89) 92699-170

Building Tomorrow's Intelligent Systems Today ...

Our company is a software house based in Singapore, a clean, modern
city. Being situated in the technology hub of the Asia-Pacific
region provides us with a conducive environment for world-class
research and development. We specialize in the application of
Artificial Intelligence, object-oriented technologies, graphics and
RDBMS to real-world problems. We undertake turnkey projects and
consultancy for clients primarily in the transportation, manufacturing
and communication-services sectors. The systems we have delivered
make innovative use of current technology, including graphics
capabilities, search and constraint-based optimization and other AI
techniques, wireless communications and client-server architecture.

We are looking for highly motivated computer professionals who are
flexible enough to carry out a wide range of tasks ranging from
software research, analysis and design, implementation, documentation
and testing to customer liaison, support and training. These positions
offer excellent prospect for individual growth, providing you with
challenging and beneficial experience in emerging technologies.


Are you the one we are looking for?


All interested candidates should possess the following:

-  A degree or higher degree in Computer Science.
-  Sound knowledge of UNIX, C++ and object-oriented analysis and
   design methodologies.
-  Effective written and oral communication skills.
-  At least 2 years of practical experience in software development.

In addition, the following skills are highly desirable for each of the
following positions:


Software Engineers (Artificial Intelligence)

-  Working experience with Artificial Intelligence technologies,
   constraint-based systems, ILOG SOLVER or expert systems would be highly
   regarded.
-  Experience in implementing planning and scheduling systems,
   especially in a transportation, manufacturing  or
   communication-services environment, would be advantageous.


Software Engineers (Computer Graphics)

-  Good working knowledge of X Windows, Motif, ILOG VIEWS or Interviews.
-  Familiarity with RDBMS.

If so, and you wish to join us and enjoy the benefits of a dynamic
working environment where you can excel to your full potential, send
us a detailed resume. Please enclose your personal particulars,
educational qualifications, working experience, contact telephone
number and expected remuneration. (In real-time please.)

Incorporated in 1984, Carnegie Group, Inc. is an advanced software systems
integrator focusing on applying knowledge-based technologies within a client-
server architecture.  

The company was founded by four widely respected computer scientists from
Carnegie Mellon University, to apply knowledge-based technology in the 
commercial arena.  

Carnegie Group's systems enable clients to automate critical, re-engineered
business processes within their organizations to improve productivity ,
product quality, customer service -- and ultimately, the bottom line.  
Because they process not only numerical data but information and know-how as 
well, these systems are especially well-suited to problems that are now solved
manually (if at all) but that require scarce or expensive knowledge, skills
and expertise. 

Carnegie Group currently has an opening for a Database engineer on our
TRAC2ES team.  TRAC2ES is a decision support system for mass casualty
evacuation from natural disasters and military arenas.  This revolutionary
system will be built with user-interactive and GUI technologies, linked to
worldwide transportation/medical data networks and quickly deployable in 
emergency situations.  

We offer the ideal professional setting for the innovative engineer who is 
seeking a career in a world-class development environment.  As a member of 
our team, you'll enjoy a competitive compensation package, relocation
assistance and significant opportunities for growth.  Interested?
Please see the below postion description to see if you qualify.

If you do, please send your resume, letter of qualifications and salary
history/expectations to:

Carnegie Group, Inc.
5 PPG Place 
Pittsburgh, PA 15222	fax: 412-642-6906	resumes@cgi.com

Incorporated in 1984, Carnegie Group, Inc. is an advanced software systems
integrator focusing on applying knowledge-based technologies within a client-
server architecture.

The company was founded by four widely respected computer scientists from
Carnegie Mellon University, to apply knowledge-based technology in the
commercial arena.

Carnegie Group's systems enable clients to automate critical, re-engineered
business processes within their organizations to improve productivity ,
product quality, customer service -- and ultimately, the bottom line.
Because they process not only numerical data but information and know-how as
well, these systems are especially well-suited to problems that are now solved
manually (if at all) but that require scarce or expensive knowledge, skills
and expertise.

Carnegie Group currently has two openings for a GUI Engineer on our KBLPS
team.  KBLPS is a decision support system that assists logisticians in planning
allocation and transportation of virtually every resource required to sustain
a large scale military course of action at the corps level.  It is built
with a robust knowledge representation technology for modeling complex
organizations, powerful planning and scheduling algorithms for over-constrained
distribution problems, and a decision-centered GUI.

We offer the ideal professional setting for the innovative engineer who is
seeking a career in a world-class development environment.  As a member of
our team, you'll enjoy a competitive compensation package, relocation
assistance and significant opportunities for growth.  Interested?
Please see the below postion description to see if you qualify.

history/expectations to:

_____________________________________________________________________________
POSITION TITLE:		Engineer or Sr. Engineer I/II (GUI)
DIVISION:		Operations/KBLPS
LOCATION:		Pittsburgh

POSITION REQUIRES:
-----------------
     B.S. (or M.S.) Computer Science (software engineering/development),
	Engineering, or related field.

WORK EXPERIENCE:
---------------
	At least 2-3 years software development experience (logistics,
	production, or transportation planning/scheduling applications
	preferred).  Code development in UNIX Workstation (SUN preferred)
	environments.

	Experience with building Graphical User Interfaces.

	Design and development of usable software in C and C++, utilizing
	Object Oriented Design technology.

	Use of CASE tools during software design and implementation a plus.

	X/Motif graphics systems desirable.

SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED:
------------------------
	Excellent analytic and problem-definition and problem-solving skills
	and experience.

	Strong software engineering and programming skills.

	Demonstrated ability to take user functional requirements and 
	design and implement modular well-structured software.

	Experienced in Structured Analysis and Structured Design Methodology
	and software documentation.

	Very good interpersonal & communications skills.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
------------------------
	Design, code, and test modifications & extensions to U.S. Army-funded
	Logistics Planning (KBLPS) software. 

	Develop & implement software in C/C++, utilizing "Teamwork" CASE
	tool, X/Motif and other applicable tools.

X-Vmsmail-To: @JOBS.DIS
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Incorporated in 1984, Carnegie Group, Inc. is an advanced software systems
integrator focusing on applying knowledge-based technologies within a client-
server architecture.

The company was founded by four widely respected computer scientists from
Carnegie Mellon University, to apply knowledge-based technology in the
commercial arena.

Carnegie Group's systems enable clients to automate critical, re-engineered
business processes within their organizations to improve productivity ,
product quality, customer service -- and ultimately, the bottom line.
Because they process not only numerical data but information and know-how as
well, these systems are especially well-suited to problems that are now solved
manually (if at all) but that require scarce or expensive knowledge, skills
and expertise.


Carnegie Group currently has an opening for a Technical lead/Project
Manager on ourTRAC2ES team.  TRAC2ES is a decision support system for mass
casualty evacuation from natural disasters and military arenas.  This
revolutionary system will be built with user-interactive and GUI technologies,
linked to worldwide transportation/medical data networks and quickly
deployable in emergency situations.

We offer the ideal professional setting for the innovative engineer who is
seeking a career in a world-class development environment.  As a member of
our team, you'll enjoy a competitive compensation package, relocation
assistance and significant opportunities for growth.  Interested?
Please see the below postion description to see if you qualify.

If you do, please send your resume, letter of qualifications and salary
history/expectations to:

Attn: ILD/95

Carnegie Group, Inc.
5 PPG Place
Pittsburgh, PA 15222

fax: 412-642-6906	resumes@cgi.com

______________________________________________________________________________
POSITION:		Team Lead, GPMRC (Sr. Engineer/Project Manager)
DIVISION:		Operations/TRAC2ES
LOCATION:		Pittsburgh


POSITION REQUIRES:
=================

	-B.S. Computer Science, SW Engineering or related field.  MS desirable.
	Prior  experience in leading/managing state of the art software
	development teams.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:
=====================

	-Lead/Manage the GPMRC team on the TRAC2ES project.  Provide the
	technical vision and overall leadership needed to motivate a
	leading-edge team of developers.  Maintain the pace, motivation, and
	leading edge processes that have come to characterize the project.
	Continue to design and deliver the highest quality decision support
	features to the customer based on Decision Centered/User Centered
	design processs.


WORK EXPERIENCE:
===============

	-Prior experience leading a software development team
	using formal methodologies and modern tools.

	-Proven experience leading a team in all phases of a formal
	methodology from development through installation and support.

	-Experience with Command and Control (Decision Aid) systems,
	preferably those involving complex GUI components.

	-Prior experience with C/C++ (or equivalent)
	intensive software projects.

	-Prior experience handling the day to day "admin" duties such
	as personnel management; including performance reviews, objective
	setting, timesheet administration, and other general personnel issues.


SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED:
========================

	-Excellent verbal and writing skills

	-Excellent team building, interpersonal, and leadership
	skills.  The proven ability to work with peers and superiors, the
	customer, and motivate subordinates.

	-Experience with large scale DBMS applications is essential.

	-Awareness/Involvement in the SEI CMM process.

	-Experience in a CASE-assisted formal software engineering
	methodology.


ADDITIONAL SKILLS RECOMMENDED:
============================

	-Additional experience with Relational, Object Oriented, and
	Distributed DBMS's would be very valuable

	-Experience in Object Oriented Methodologies a definite plus.

Date: Sat Jun 24 23:15:20 EDT 1995
Organization: University of Aizu, Fukushima, Japan

A faculty position is open in the Language Processing Systems Lab at
the University of Aizu, Japan at the equivalent to Assistant or
Associate Professor depending on qualifications and experience.
Current research interests within the
lab include natural language processing, logic and functional
programming, parallel processing and parallel processing languages.
Anyone with research interests in the broad area of language
processing including - but not necessarily limited to these areas -
is encouraged to apply. Teaching duties, no matter what the research
interests, must include the ability to teach basic compiler
techniques and programming languages. Being able to teach in
Japanese is an important asset but not a necessity. The working
language of the Lab as well as most of the University is English.
Conditions of
employment are identical to those described in the original
advertisement for the University which appeared in the April, 1992
issue of the Communications of the ACM (page 154).

Information about the
University of Aizu may be found at the following location on the WWW:

http://www.u-aizu.ac.jp/

Applications will be initially accepted until July 7th and a
selection process will be begun immediately. It is not likely that
any interviews will take place before September. If suitable
candidates are not found from those applying, the post will be
readvertised.

Please send three copies of your resume and a list of three
referees (hard copy only!) to

Chairperson
Software Department Faculty Search Committee
University of Aizu
Aizu Wakamatsu 965-80 Japan

Send a message to search@u-aizu.ac.jp saying that you are applying
and sending your resume. Other inquiries to this e-mail address.
Do NOT send resumes via e-mail!


Please re-post this advertisement to anyone or to any newsgroup
which might be applicable.

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Computational Linguist at Univ. of Tuebingen (Germany)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: light@arbuckle.sfs.nphil.uni-tuebingen.de (Marc Light)
Date: Mon Jun 26 08:55:10 EDT 1995
Organization: sns

                         UNIVERSITY OF TUEBINGEN
                        DEPARTMENT OF LINGUISTICS
                  DIVISION OF COMPUTATIONAL LINGUISTICS

                RESEARCH POSITION FOR A COMPUTATIONAL LINGUIST

We are advertising a research position in the VERBMOBIL project, which
is funded by the German Ministry for Education and Research (BMBF).
VERBMOBIL is concerned with the development of a portable
speech-to-speech translation system for "face-to-face"-communication.

The VERBMOBIL-subproject at the Department of Computational
Linguistics in Tuebingen is concerned with Semantic Evaluation and
Transfer for Machine Translation between German and English, in
particular:

- the semantic repraesentation, disambiguation and translation of
  temporal expressions

- the semantic repraesentation, disambiguation and translation of
  complex words

- the computational modelling of these empirical domains, and

- and the implementation of a working subsystem of VERBMOBIL in
  collaboration with other VERBMOBIL sites.

Candidates should have experience in computational linguistics
(particularly in unification-based formalisms) or computer science.
Knowledge of German and experience in Machine Traslation,
NL-Syntax/Semantics (particularly in Head-Driven Phrase Structure
Grammar, Discourse Representation Theory and in the semantics of tense
and aspect), Logic, or Prolog-Programming is highly desirable.  The
successful candidate will be expected to work both on theoretical
issues and practical implementation.

The project started in 1993 and will last until December 1996, with
the possibility of extension depending on funding.  The successful
candidate would be expected to take up the position as soon as
possible.  The position is at the rank of "Wissenschaftlicher
Mitarbeiter" (salary on the German payscale of BAT IIa; minimum of
65 000 DM per year).

Applications should include CV and an outline of research experience
and interests.  Names and addresses of references would be helpful.
Applications should be sent by mail or email to the address below.

Applications received by July 15th, 1995 will receive full
consideration.


Prof. Dr. Erhard W. Hinrichs
Seminar fuer Sprachwissenschaft
Abt. Computerlinguistik
Eberhard-Karls Universitaet Tuebingen
Kleine Wilhelmstr. 113
D-72074 Tuebingen
Germany

hinrichs@sfs.nphil.uni-tuebingen.de

Subject: NW-Linguistic R&D 

 QuickMessenger Mail
NW-Linguistic R&D
Primary responsibilities include designing and building a system to analyze
unrestricted natural language; taking input text;and moving from
lexical/morphological analysis through syntax, semantics, and eventually
pragmatics and discourse; and developing and maintaining the morphological
rules and data for one of the following languages:  Japanese, German,
Spanish or Chinese.   Additional responsibilities include checking,
updating, and maintaining the information in an on-line lexicon andknowledge
base for that language; and testing the analysis and generation systems in
various ways.  Qualifications should include experience in linguistic
research and on-line dictionary development, programming experience, and a
keen interest in lexical issues.   Native proficiency in the language of
choice required. A practical orientation  desirable. A BA/BS degree in
Linguistics or a closely related discipline and a PhD degree linguistics
and/or significant programming experience is preferred. Base plus bonus plus
stock options.

Please refer to JO# 4389.DAR in your response

Commercial software developers should register with Scientific Placement,
Inc.  We specialize in jobs for software engineers, SQA, product managers,
etc.  Our client companies are nationwide, and range from small start-ups to
major 'BLUE CHIPS'.  They offer competitive salaries, excellent benefits,
and often relocation assistance.  These companies develop and publish
commercial software products for Windows, NT, Macintosh, OS/2 and Unix based
platforms.

Scientific Placement, Inc. is dedicated to providing quality confidential
services to the individuals we represent.  We can offer constructive
suggestions to assist in finding the ideal job for you.  Our offices are
located in Boston, the San Francisco Bay Area, Austin, and our corporate
headquarters is located in Houston.

We accept resumes by fax at 713-496-0373, by email in plain ascii text at
dar@spi.com, or by regular mail at P.O. Box 19949, Houston, TX  77224-9949.

Senior Engineer-MA

is now embarking on a new endeavor with extraordinary possibilities and

determination.  And with our increasingly expanding line of cutting edge
products and services, we are moving into the future with limitless
opportunities. 
 
The Position: 
Senior Engineer 
Individual contributor implementing the software architecture for a new
technology. The individual is responsible for the development, verification
and documentation of the software components used for the product. 
The position requires an individual with a broad base of software
engineering experience including: good oral and written communication
skills, top-down and modular design techniques, network protocols, previous
development in multi-threaded operating system environments, and knowledge
in AI-based or robotics software design. Strong debugging skills and
experience with scripting languages necessary. The individual must be
self-motivated and capable of working within an aggressive product
development team.

of security algorithms, AI-based software, enterprise management a plus.

Flexible Spending Medical and Dependent Care Reimbursements Accounts; 22
paid leave days and 11 paid holidays in the first year; Maternity/Paternity
Leave of Absence; 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan; an Employee Stock Purchase
Plan; Tuition reimbursement; and Flextime Work Schedules.  
 
Company paid relocation!

Subject: Modeling and Forecasting R&D Position (Baltimore)
Date: 27 Jun 1995 21:12:43 GMT
Organization: Express Access Online Communications, USA

MODELING AND FORECASTING

Key Words:	
	physics, mathematician, math, mathematics, applied math, applied
	physics, statistics, modeling, forecasting, artificial intelligence, AI

Job Description/Responsibilities:

	High-level research position offers an exciting opportunity for a highly
       intelligent and motivated individual in a successful, growing AI company in
       Maryland.  The company specializes in the R&D and application of forecasting,
       classification, and modeling technologies involving statistics, statistical
       pattern recognition, neural networks, genetic algorithms, fuzzy logic, chaos
       and fractal theory, expert systems, and hybrid systems.  Current projects
       include credit card activation modeling, site selection, fraud detection,
       biomedical pattern recognition applications, financial forecasting (stocks,
       currency, etc.), and portfolio optimization.  Responsibilities include
       involvement in the R&D, testing, and verification of all models and modeling
       systems developed for internal use and for clients.

Salary:

	The position offers an excellent salary and benefits commensurate with
       experience.

Requirements:

	MS or above (Ph.D. preferred) in Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related
       fields such as Biostatistics with at least 2 years experience.

Other Desirables:

	Experience with C/C++ programming, database programming, familiarity with
       statistical packages (e.g. SPSS, S-Plus), econometrics, applied mathematics and
       optimization.

Alternate Mail Contact:
	PO Box 387, Sparks, MD 21152 or fax to (410)-823-4601 or (410)-823-6864.

clients involving knowledge-based solutions.

of C, C++, Lisp and object oriented methods.  Mandatory is prior experience with 
artificial intelligence software tools such as ART, ART-IM, ART Enterprise, 
CLIPS, Pro Kappa, Kee, AIONDS, Level 5, etc.  Also important are GUI 
experience (X/Motif/Windows) as well as relational databases such as ORACLE 
or SYBASE.

Advanced degrees (MSCS or a PhD in CS) are preferred, but most important is 
industry (not academic) experience.

Excellent salary and benefits package, relocation available for the right people.

Please FAX your resume to Dalia Miller, Rod Asher & Associates, 818/905-9895, 
or email to dalia@asher.com

Date: Wed, 28 Jun 1995 13:13:38 GMT


Raytheon Electronic Systems' COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE continues to
foster aggressive growth and expansion with both national and
international contracts. We are looking for a number of qualified
individuals to join our company. Our software development
methodology is world class and we achieved SEI Level 3 in 1991. We
have also won the 1995 IEEE Software Process Improvement Award. 


SOFTWARE ENGINEERS

College graduates or experienced professionals with a
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Math or Electrical
Engineering, with areas of specialization in the following are
encouraged to apply:

Real-Time Simulation - Develop real-time simulation software for
use in Hardware in-the-Loop test facilities, Fortran, C, Ada or
High Order Languages.

Digital Signal Processing - Develop digital signal processing
software for use in embedded systems.

Real-Time Software Development Engineer - Real-time embedded
software development in either commercial or defense applications.
Ada and C/C++ developers with experience in any of the following:
object oriented design, X-Windows, RATIONAL/APEX, Software
Through Pictures, UNIX, OSF/MOTIF, GUI development or real-time
applications. Applications in air traffic control, air defense
systems, satellite communications and command/control systems. 

Software Test Engineer (Verification and Validation) -
Develop/Conduct/Analyze/Document tests of real-time embedded
software systems. Areas of interest are military communications
(TADIL-A,B,J); Command and Control; Data Fusion. Experience with
DOD-2167A methodology, Interleaf, and UNIX desirable.

Data Base Architects - Develop relational/object-oriented data base
for imaging, simulation, and distributed applications for
workstations, PCs and MACs.

Advanced Software Technologies - Artificial Intelligence, Neural
Networks, Distributed Interactive Simulation. 

CAE Developers - CAD/CAM software and methodology development,
UNIX, C and C++.

Network Engineer - Install, develop, maintain, support and
troubleshoot local and site networks. Determine requirements,
design and interface with users. Experience with ULTRIX, SUN, SGI,
DEC Alpha, HP, Vines, Internet, Wellfleet, Apple Talk desirable.
2+ years' mixed with Unix Networking. Ethernet, TCP/IP, C.


Configuration Management - Maintain configuration control of
software development in a UNIX, C/ADA environment. Ideal candidate
will have Scripting and ClearCase experience.

Computer and Information Security - Develop, integrate and evaluate
trusted computer systems and multilevel secured databases and
systems.

Command and Control Systems - Design, code test and integration of
real-time satellite communication software. Perform and document
technical studies, evaluate existing programs and make
modifications to software. Requires at least 2 years of Fortran
with 2167A experience. Work will be performed on D.G. equipment.

UNIX System Administrators - Two plus years' experience in UNIX
System Administration and with large installations of 20+ systems.
Requires network administration, hardware/software installation and
support experience. Should have detailed knowledge of Solaris or
SunOS and experience administering Sun Sparc systems.

Software Integration (Transportation Systems) - To perform
regression test of our baseline product and to integrate and test
product enhancements prior to shipment and delivery to our
customers. UNIX and C experience are required.

X-Windows Applications (Transportation Systems) - Application
development using X and commercial GUI tools. Must have C and UNIX
experience.

SYSTEMS ENGINEERS

We are seeking professionals with a minimum of 3 years' experience,
and a BS (MS preferred) in Electrical Engineering, Physics,
Computer Science, Math, Mechanical Engineering and Aeronautical
Engineering for the following positions.

Command, Control, Communication Engineers - Perform systems level
design and analysis of command and control systems. Develop
communications hardware and software requirements and evaluate
overall C3 and C4 performance. 

Operation Analysis - Perform weapon systems studies to establish
requirements and evaluate effectiveness. Experience with
large scale simulations and DIS desired.

Simulation Design - Develop six-degree-of-freedom digital and
hardware in the loop models of aerodynamics, mechanics, and signal
processing for closed loop systems. AD100, VAX or Silicon Graphics
experience desired. 

Guidance and Control Engineer - Control system design and analysis;
modeling and simulation of linear and nonlinear systems. Experience
with design of guidance systems and state estimators.

Aerodynamics - Define airframe requirements and establish design
configuration for wings and control surfaces. Plan wind tunnel
tests and analyze data to develop aerodynamic models.

Besides providing a dynamic work environment, Raytheon offers a
competitive salary and benefits program. All positions requires
U.S. Citizenship. Interested candidates, please respond via e-mail
to: kathleen=e=riley@msd.ray.com, or fax resume to: 508-858-5183.


An Equal Opportunity Employer.

From: sai@bnr.ca (Sairam Subramanian)
Subject: position in the wireless performance group
Date: 28 Jun 1995 17:26:25 -0500
Organization: Bell-Northern Research, Richardson, TX



Bell Northern Research (BNR) is looking for exceptional candidates to
join its Wireless Performance group. BNR, located in Dallas Texas, is
the R&D subsidiary of Northern Telecom (NORTEL) a leading edge
developer of communications equipment.

The Wireless Performance group at BNR is responsible for long-term
research and planning and providing consultancy services such as
capacity assessment, performance analysis etc., in the area of
wireless communications.

Job description
================

You would be a part of the team involved in algorithm development for
wireless systems using the state of the art in combinatorial
optimization, expert systems, and adaptive learning strategies.

Your responsibilities would include: Helping in the design and
prototyping of new algorithms and tools for engineering wireless
systems and in validating their efficacy. You would also be involved
in overseeing the actual development of the algorithms into design
tools and products.

Qualifications
==============

The position requires an Sc.M in Computer Science with an expert
knowledge of C and Unix, and a good grounding in basic algorithms and
data structures. Exceptional candidates with a BS, who otherwise
qualify, will also be considered. 

Knowledge of C++, Object Oriented Design, Graph Algorithms,
Combinatorial Optimization, Expert Systems, and Artificial
Intelligence techniques is a plus.

Highly developed written and oral communication skills as well as
excellent interpersonal skills are required. The ideal candidate
should be self-motivated and self-managing and should have a desire to
learn and experiment with new ideas and concepts.

The Work Environment
=====================

BNR offers an informal yet challenging work environment. At BNR, you
will have an opportunity to work with highly motivated people on
leading-edge real-life research problems. Our group is a highly
visible group that has a direct impact on the design and development
of new products.

BNR offers competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and exciting career
growth.

If your qualifications and interests coincide with our requirements please
send a copy of your resume to:

Dr. Sairam Subramanian
Wireless Performance
BNR INC.
Mail Stop D0207
P.O Box 833871
Richardson, TX-75083-3871

We have several positions open in computational chemistry.  Note 
particularly the jobs in database mining/knowledge discovery and 
protein structure prediction/analysis which may be of interest to 
AI researchers.


OPPORTUNITIES IN COMPUTATIONAL CHEMISTRY/MOLECULAR MODELING

SmithKline Beecham, a worldwide leader in pharmaceutical research
has a number of openings in our Physical & Structural Chemistry
Department.


Scientific Programmer

As a member of an established group, the selected candidate will
assist in the development of state-of-the-art software.
Qualifications include BS/MS in computer science or electrical
engineering (with experience or course work in chemistry) or
BS/MS in chemistry with demonstrated abilities in scientific
computer programming.  Excellent programming skills and knowledge
of UNIX, C and FORTRAN are needed.  Experience with Silicon
Graphics workstations and computational chemistry software are
desirable.  Refer to Job Code #H0117.


Protein Modeling

This individual will be responsible for the development and
application of methods to assign structure and function to genome
sequence information.  Qualifications required include a Ph.D. in
chemistry, biophysics or bioinformatics with extensive experience
in biopolymer sequence analysis and protein modeling.  Other
requirements include excellent computer skills and the ability to
develop computer programs and new algorithms.  A knowledge of DNA
sequencing methods and molecular biology is desirable.  Refer to
Job Code #H0118.

Combinatorial Chemistry/ Molecular Diversity

The selected individual will join with other team members to
develop and apply methods for the design of combinatorial
chemical libraries and the analysis of diversity in chemical
databases.  The necessary qualifications include a Ph.D.  in
chemistry or a related field and extensive experience in
computational chemistry.  Excellent computer skills and
communication skills are also necessary.  Experience in pattern
recognition or chemical diversity methods is desirable.  Job Code
#H00M.

Database Mining

The appropriate individual will have a Ph.D. in chemistry or
biochemistry or computer science (or related field) with
extensive experience in pattern recognition, machine learning or
chemometrics.  Excellent communication and computer skills,
including the ability to develop new algorithms, are required.
Experience in chemical or biological database analysis is
desirable.  Job Code #H00L.


Located in our state-of-the-art research facility in suburban
Philadelphia, SmithKline Beecham offers an excellent
compensation/benefits/relocation package.  Interested candidates
should send resume with salary requirements indicating desired
Job Code, to: 
SmithKline Beecham Pharmaceuticals, Job Code ____
P.O. Box 2645 
Bala Cynwyd, PA 19004.  
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V.

Subject: Position for Experienced Natural Language Developer at NYNEX
Date: Fri Jun 30 16:22:17 EDT 1995
Organization: Nynex Science and Technology
Keywords: natural language, NLP, linguistics, software

                             Position for
                Experienced Natural Language Developer

The Speech Services Technology Group at NYNEX Science & Technology has an
opening for a developer with significant experience in building Natural
Language Understanding systems.

The Speech Services Technology Group designs and deploys state-of-
the-art interactive speech recognition and language understanding
systems.  Our spoken language systems combine a recognition framework
with natural language and discourse modelling capabilities to provide
the uninitiated caller with an elegant, powerful, and easy-to-use
interface to various applications, using a standard telephone.
Opportunities for applying this technology to multimedia and to text
processing may also arise.

Qualifications are:

  o At least an MS in Computer Science, Linguistics, or a related field.

  o At least 3 years experience, either commercial or academic, directly
    involved in the development of robust natural language systems.

  o Significant software development experience, most preferably in C or C++.

  o Experience with relevant statistical techniques.

  o Familiarity with related fields, such as speech recognition, signal
    processing, relevant real-time programming issues, and user interface
    design for speech & language systems, are all plusses.

  o Experience and maturity in conceptualization, software design, and
    software engineering.

  o Ability to work in a cohesive team.

  o Strong motivation to excel.

Work will involve combining probabilistic training with knowledge-based
approaches to achieve the most robust performance possible. Since this is
a software development effort, candidates should anticipate working in a
team environment, sharing their experience and expertise with other
developers from different backgrounds.

If you feel you are qualified and interested, please send your resume to:

    Hong C. Leung
    Speech Recognition & Language Understanding Services Laboratory
    NYNEX Science & Technology, Inc.
    500 Westchester Avenue
    White Plains, NY  10604

    E-mail:     hcl@nynexst.com
    Fax:        914-644-2211

You may send your resume as plain e-mail, PostScript, paper mail, or
as a fax.

NYNEX is the regional Bell operating company for the northeastern
United States.  Science & Technology is the research and development
organization of NYNEX.  We are located about 30 minutes north of New
York City, in suburban Westchester County.
