Visual C++ Programmers!  

Our research project has an immediate opening for a savvy, self-directed, 
and experienced Visual C++ programmer.  If you or someone you know has the 
qualifications listed below and is interested in joining our team, please 
send resume and 3 rec. letters to:  

Suite 664
1025 W. Johnson St.
Madison WI 53705.

LOCATION:  Madison, WI

POSITION:  Programmer Analyst/Sr. Programmer Analyst			
Appt Type:  Academic Staff			
Full-time Salary:  Minimum, $32,000 (full-time equivalent) depending on 
qualifications			
Percent Appt:  50% - 100%
Date Pos Available:  Immediately			
End of initial Appt:  Jan 31, 1996, with possibility of renewal			
Application Deadline to Insure Full Consideration:  July 15, 1995 (may be 
extended)

Degree and Area of Specialization:  BS in Computer Science or related field 
required.  Graduate work strongly preferred.  Minimum number of years and 
type of relevant work experience:  At least 3 years of professional 
programming experience is required.  Must have completed major programming 
projects in the past.  Experience in the following areas is required:  DOS, 
Microsoft Windows, C++, and Object-oriented programming/system design, though 
appropriate coursework may substitute for experience in one 
of these areas.  Knowledge or experience with at least three of the 
following is highly desirable:  Visual C++, database design, multimedia 
technologies, networking, Macintosh applications, intelligent tutoring 
technology, and Bayesian inference nets.  Interest in design of intelligent 
educational environments is essential.   

Principal Duties:  This position will involve assuming lead programming 
responsibilities on a federally-funded research project.  Currently in its 
third year, it is expected that the project 
will be renewed for at least two more years.  The work funded is for 
furthering development of an intelligent instructional system for training 
basic problem-solving skills and for conducting basic research 
on tutorial strategy.  Version 1.1 of the instructional system currently 
runs with Microsoft Windows and is designed for use with 486 (and above) 
PC-compatible machines.  The person in this position should be 
self-motivated, creative, and capable of working independently, as well as 
collegially, to help meet project goals of fielding and testing a more 
advanced, stand-alone version of the system.  The goals of the position are: 

Work with research psychologist, graduate-student staff, and one additional 
programmer to facilitate continued design, development, and field testing of 
an advanced instructional system.  Write system documentation and assist 
faculty and research staff in writing project-related reports and articles 
for publication.  Perform training and troubleshooting at field test sites.  
Occasional out-of-state travel to implementation sites may be necessary.

From: Jeffrey Edison <100613.2650@compuserve.com>
To: CMU AI Repository <ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu>
Subject: Job: NLP for Financial Institutions (Brussels, Belgium)
Message-ID: <950706081822_100613.2650_BHL26-1@CompuServe.COM>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

JOB OFFER
CSE is looking for 3 talented analyst-programmers.
Please provide the following information to whom it may concern 
within your organisation.

COMPANY PRESENTATION
Cognitive Systems Europe s.a. (CSE) develops and markets 
software that combines the latest advances in conventional 
computing and Artificial Intelligence. Innovative solutions to 
information processing issues are designed and implemented by 
the Company. CSE focuses its development efforts on the 
application of Knowledge Base Systems and Natural Language 
Processing in the Financial domain.

PRODUCT LINE
CSE provides consultancy services and advisory studies in the 
domain of straight-through processing of financial messages. 
CSE's international reputation is built from the very strong 
quality of its standard products and from the innovative 
solutions it develops.
CSE designs, implements, installs and maintains products and 
customised applications from standard software modules.  CSE 
products are dedicated to the automated repair of SWIFT 
individual and mass payments, intelligent EDIFACT translators 
and development tools for cost-effective implementation of 
straight-through processing applications. CSE is also active in 
lexical analysis and automatic merge of data bases.

JOB DESCRIPTION
A team of 10 knowledge engineers focus their efforts on the 
development of natural language processing applications.
The average age of the development team is about 27 years.

From: pitrelli@eros.nynexst.com (John Pitrelli)
Subject: US-NY-Natural language processing position available-NYNEX
Date: 6 Jul 95 09:28:34
Organization: Speech Recognition & Language Understanding Lab, NYNEX Sci. &



                             Position for
                Experienced Natural Language Developer

The Speech Services Technology Group at NYNEX Science & Technology has an
opening for a developer with significant experience in building Natural
Language Understanding systems.

The Speech Services Technology Group designs and deploys state-of-
the-art interactive speech recognition and language understanding
systems.  Our spoken language systems combine a recognition framework
with natural language and discourse modelling capabilities to provide
the uninitiated caller with an elegant, powerful, and easy-to-use
interface to various applications, using a standard telephone.
Opportunities for applying this technology to multimedia and to text
processing may also arise.

Qualifications are:

  o At least an MS in Computer Science, Linguistics, or a related field. 
  
  o At least 3 years experience, either commercial or academic, directly
    involved in the development of robust natural language systems.
  
  o Significant software development experience, most preferably in C or C++.
  
  o Experience with relevant statistical techniques.
  
  o Familiarity with related fields, such as speech recognition, signal
    processing, relevant real-time programming issues, and user interface
    design for speech & language systems, are all plusses.
  
  o Experience and maturity in conceptualization, software design, and
    software engineering.
  
  o Ability to work in a cohesive team. 
  
  o Strong motivation to excel.

Work will involve combining probabilistic training with knowledge-based
approaches to achieve the most robust performance possible. Since this is
a software development effort, candidates should anticipate working in a
team environment, sharing their experience and expertise with other
developers from different backgrounds.

If you feel you are qualified and interested, please send your resume to:

    Hong C. Leung 
    Speech Recognition & Language Understanding Services Laboratory
    NYNEX Science & Technology, Inc.
    500 Westchester Avenue
    White Plains, NY  10604
    
    E-mail:     hcl@nynexst.com
    Fax:        914-644-2211

You may send your resume as plain e-mail, PostScript, paper mail, or
as a fax.

NYNEX is the regional Bell operating company for the northeastern
United States.  Science & Technology is the research and development
organization of NYNEX.  We are located about 30 minutes north of New
York City, in suburban Westchester County.

Member of Technical Staff-Speech & Language Technology

SBC Communications, Inc. (SBC) is a leader in the telecommunications
industry.  Our research subsidiary, SOUTHWESTERN BELL TECHNOLOGY
RESOURCES, currently has an opening for a Member of Technical Staff to
work in the area of speech and language technology.

General Requirements

Qualified candidates must have the ability to rapidly prototype,
demonstrate and then deploy innovative voice technology based
communications applications.  These applications will be developed
through the integration of new and emerging hardware and software
technologies in a telecommunications environment using structured design
and distributed computing techniques.  Experience with object oriented
programming and object-oriented languages is desirable.  Suitable
candidates must demonstrate strong self motivation and leadership in
complex multi-year projects dependent on changing problem definitions and
customer requirements.  Candidates should be flexible as to assignments
in different technology areas and have a willingness to learn new
technologies as our clients requirements change.

Required Technical Experience

	- System engineering, development and deployment of software based
applications 
	- Expertise in the design, coding, integration, testing and delivery of
high quality and complex software systems 
    (actual deployed systems must be cited)
	- Three or more years system development in a UNIX environment and
programming in C language
	- Education:  MSCS, MSEE, or equivalent

Additional Technical Experience desired:

- Speech & Language Technology
- Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR)
- Text to Speech (TTS)
- Speaker Identity Verification (SIV)
- Speech coding
- Speech Database Development

Software Experience

- Real-time digital signal processor programming
- SQL databases (Sybase, Unify, or others)
- Communication networking experience (TCP/IP and NFS)
- Background in object oriented programming (C++, others)
- Provide maintenance, support, and enhancement of a major software
system in operational mode
- Quality assurance and benchmark testing


Desirable Experience and Skills

- Telephony
- Technical leader of a group of application programmers for a complex
software project.
- Excellent presentation skills and software documentation experience
- Select and manage software contractors or vendors
- Evaluate and recommend commercial products for in-house software
development

From: Blackboard Technology Group <bbtech@bbtech.com>

Subject: JOB: Lisp Programmer at Blackboard Technology Group (Amherst, MA)
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Date: Wed, 12 Jul 1995 16:34:06 -0400 (EDT)
X-Mailer: ELM [version 2.4 PL23]
Content-Type: text
Content-Length: 2365      
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Blackboard Technology Group, Inc.  is seeking a talented, energetic
software developer to join an R&D team working on agent-based
technologies and individual application projects.

Job title:  
     Staff Programmer
            
Qualifications:
     A BS or MS in Computer Science and strong Common Lisp/CLOS skills
     are required.  The candidate will be expected to have:

       -- the ability to write efficient, understandable code
       -- the ability to work within a large application both as
          a member of a team and independently, with minimal 
          supervision
       -- substantial experience programming in ANSI Common Lisp
       -- familiarity with Common Lisp environments and tools (such
          as Franz Allegro, Harlequin LispWorks, Mac CL, etc.)

     Experience with GBB, TCP/IP, object-based protocols, and
     integration of distributed applications is a plus.

Job function:  
     Primary responsibilities will be design, programming, and testing in
     conjunction with advanced R&D efforts in agent-based technologies
     and individual application projects.

Qualified candidates should send their resumes including salary history to:

   Human Resources                                                          
   Blackboard Technology Group, Inc.
   401 Main Street
   Amherst, MA  01002
   
or by fax to:

   (413) 256-3179

or contact:

   human-resources@bbtech.com

No telephone calls, please.  Agency resumes will be accepted after
August 15, 1995.

Blackboard Technology Group is the world's leading vendor of development
tools and expertise for building blackboard-based software systems.  Our
products include the Generic Blackboard Builder, GBB; NetGBB, a
network-based extension to GBB that facilitates the development of
client-server and peer-to-peer blackboard-based problem-solving nodes;
and ChalkBox, a user interface toolkit.  Blackboard Technology Group also
consults and performs contract work with customers building blackboard
applications, and conducts research involving the use of blackboard
technology.  Our customers include major corporations, government
agencies, software developers and contractors, research organizations,
and universities worldwide.

Additional information on Blackboard Technology Group and the Amherst
area can be found on our WWW server (http://www.bbtech.com).

Subject: NW-Linguistic R&D 

 QuickMessenger Mail
NW-Linguistic R&D

Advanced Technology, Microsoft Research Reporting to Senior Researcher
Primary responsibilities include designing and building a system to analyze
unrestricted natural language; taking input text;and moving from
lexical/morphological analysis through syntax, semantics, and eventually
pragmatics and discourse; and developing and maintaining the morphological
rules and data for one of the following languages:  Japanese, German,
Spanish or Chinese.   Additional responsibilities include checking,
updating, and maintaining the information in an on-line lexicon andknowledge
base for that language; and testing the analysis and generation systems in
various ways.  Qualifications should include experience in linguistic
research and on-line dictionary development, programming experience, and a
keen interest in lexical issues.   Native proficiency in the language of
choice required. A practical orientation  desirable. A BA/BS degree in
Linguistics or a closely related discipline and a PhD degree linguistics
and/or significant programming experience is preferred. Base plus bonus plus
stock options.

Please refer to JO# 4389.DAR in your response

Commercial software developers should register with Scientific Placement,
Inc.  We specialize in jobs for software engineers, SQA, product managers,
etc.  Our client companies are nationwide, and range from small start-ups to
major 'BLUE CHIPS'.  They offer competitive salaries, excellent benefits,
and often relocation assistance.  These companies develop and publish
commercial software products for Windows, NT, Macintosh, OS/2 and Unix based
platforms.

Scientific Placement, Inc. is dedicated to providing quality confidential
services to the individuals we represent.  We can offer constructive
suggestions to assist in finding the ideal job for you.  Our offices are
located in Boston, the San Francisco Bay Area, Austin, and our corporate
headquarters is located in Houston.

We accept resumes by fax at 713-496-0373, by email in plain ascii text at
dar@spi.com, or by regular mail at P.O. Box 19949, Houston, TX  77224-9949.

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Speech Recognition at Univ. of London
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: Geoff Williams <gw@soas.ac.uk>
Subject: Vacancy on Speech Recognition project
Date: 4 Jul 1995 14:50:17 GMT
Organization: SOAS


          Signal Analysis /Pattern Recognition Specialist
                    Programmer, Systems Designer

     The HAL Trust is a research and development project
     funded to implement a speech recognition system that
     incorporates a cognitive-based-phonological strategy.
     The project has implemented the cognitive strategy and
     produced encouraging results.  The approach seems to
     yield a highly efficient and effective back end to a
     recognition system.

     We are currently seeking to obtain greater expertise
     in the fields of signal processing, programming and
     computational science.  We anticipate hiring at least
     one full-time researcher-developer.  The near term
     objective is to expand and complete the development of
     a full pilot system.  To accomplish this we seek the
     expertise required for the development of traditional
     front ends to recognition systems, such as knowledge
     of (acoustic) signal processing techniques.  In
     particular we seek a strong creative ability to tailor
     front-end development to the pattern requirements of
     the cognitive-based strategies.  We are open to
     exploration of traditional methodologies such as
     hidden Markov models but would also value ideas on
     alternative approaches.  Programming skills and
     computational sophistication are highly desirable.

     We envision an intense research and development effort
     over the next 6-12 months.  The position would provide
     the opportunity to make a significant research
     contribution to the overall design of the system.  In
     addition, the objective of the project is to develop
     a commercial product.  The trust has significant
     managerial expertise involved in the project.  This
     creates an opportunity for growth and long term
     involvement for a suitably qualified individual.

     At present the project is based at the University of
     London.  The position is for an initial period of 6-12
     months at the University facilities with the potential
     for a longer term commitment at the end of one year.
     The position is available immediately.  Salary is
     commensurate with expertise and the cost of living in
     London.  For further information please contact:

               Professor Jonathan Kaye
               or Geoff Williams
               Department of Linguistics
               SOAS, University of London
               Thornhaugh St.
               London, UK WC1H OXG
               JK@soas.ac.uk or
               GW@soas.ac.uk
               +44-171-323-6362 (tel. and fax)

	New Brunswick Community College - Miramichi

	Community College Instructor (2 positions)
	Learning Technologies Department

The Miramichi College, a leader in new instructional technologies,
located in New Brunswick's newest city, is expanding its instructional
staff to  support its rapid growth in new technologies.
Responsibilities will include the preparation and delivery of courses
relating to several of the programs.  We seek talented individuals who
have the right combination of education and experience, together with
the drive and passion necessary to the development of a brand- new
computer-related industry.  These are full time instructional
positions on the first program assortment of its kind in Canada.

Position requirements:

#1 - Individuals with significant animation experience are invited to
submit a resum and cover letter.  A college or university education
in a related field, together with considerable knowledge in the design
of computer games are required.  Experience with such tools as 3D
Studio, Animator Pro, Lightware 3D, Alias, and SoftImage products
would be a definite asset.

#2 - Individuals with a BSc or MSc in Computer Science, with courses
and/or experience in AI, neural networks, expert systems, and/or EPSS
are invited to submit a resum and covering letter.  Preference may be
given to candidates with experience in the integration of AI into
business, industry and learning applications, along with experience in
LISP, PROLOG, and other AI languages.

For both positions:

Applicants should forward a complete transcript of courses taken, AND
INDICATE ON THEIR APPLICATION WHICH OF THE 2 POSITIONS THEY ARE
INTERESTED IN.  An equivalent combination of training and experience
may be considered for each position.  Written and spoken competence in
English is required.

Note:  Where the successful candidates are not teacher qualified,
pedagogical training will be provided.  When qualified, instructors
are eligible for a two-month non-instructional period annually.

ensure your application is received on or before  August 2, 1995  by:
Dan Fraser, Director of Administration, NBCC-Miramichi, P.O. Box 1053,
Miramichi, NB, E1N 3W4.

Subject: US-NY-212 Director of Development, WWW Firm
Date: 17 Jul 1995 18:39:15 -0400
Organization: Forum Systems Group, New York City

For more job descriptions, visit our World Wide Web site at 
http://www.brainlink.com/~forum

COMPANY: A leading NYC Internet media and technology firm pioneering 
next-generation information services using the Internet. The Company is 
seeking experienced, talented and creative individuals to help design and 
create its new technologies.

POSITION: Director of Development to lead an Internet software 
development team.

QUALIFICATIONS: 3+ years experience leading software developers and 
cutting-edge projects; ability to assume a key leadership role in 
building a high-tech venture; familiarity with intelligent agents, AI, 
SQL databases; skilled programmer as well as inpiring team manager; 
well-rounded education in computer science; understanding of 
business/marketing issues in high-tech industry; experience developing 
commercial online or information services (or equivalent); hands-on 
expertise in C/C++ and HTML (knowledge of Perl and LISP helpful); 
knowledge of Internet technology, infrastructure and culture; desire to 
work in an informal, high-energy, entrpreneurial environment.

COMPENSATION: Commensurate with experience.

--
For confidential consideration, please forward your resume to one of our 
email addresses. Use an Internet address unless you are mailing from 
CompuServe or AOL. Please indicate the relevant position in the subject 
heading. Word 6.0 is preferred if you wish to send a formatted version.

The minimum response you should receive is an acknowledgement of your 
submission. Most positions require US citizenship or permanent residency. 
You must be available for personal interviews.

RADSS  Technologies is a new company with experience developing  
artificial intelligence solutions for difficult transportation and  
optimization problems.  With this background and a proven track record,  
we intend to be the software supplier of choice for transportation  
companies.  Our success with our first product - a railcar allocation  
optimization model - has created the need to add a new member to our  
team in Calgary.

With a post-graduate degree in computing that has given you a good  
appreciation of optimization problems - and artificial intelligence  
approaches to solving them -  you are interested in getting in on the  
ground floor of an innovative software company. Your academic foundation  
has been augmented by your industrial track record, ambition,  
independence, and your desire to be on the leading edge.  In addition,  
you like working in teams, and have no qualms about wearing different  
hats as the need arises.

Product manager

As a product manager working with an existing optimization product, you  
will be measured on how well you service the needs of your  
clients.  You will develop the product to meet (but usually anticipate)  
the needs of your stakeholders, and you will put in mechanisms to build  
a strong user community.  You will be on top of research in the field  
to help you direct the products evolution.  In addition, you will  
assist marketing by providing demonstrations and presentations of the  
product to a wide audience.

You have experience in ORACLE database development (including Pro-C,  
Forms 3 and 4.x), C, C++, customer support, AIX, and X emulation  
software.  When the client base grows, you will be expected to undertake  
recruitment and leadership roles to fit the needs of this unit.  You are  
comfortable managing a budget and being measured on results, and have an  
exceptional ability to communicate and listen.

If you are interested, and can work in Canada, please send a resume to

RADSS Technologies
505 - 2nd Street S.W.
Calgary, CANADA
T2P 2P5

or email to radss@awp.com

We would like to thank all applicants in advance, and will be contacting  
short-list candidates only.

Subject: Job: GUI at Carnegie Group, Inc.
X-Vmsmail-To: @JOBS.DIS

Incorporated in 1984, Carnegie Group, Inc. is an advanced software systems
integrator focusing on applying knowledge-based technologies within a client-
server architecture.

The company was founded by four widely respected computer scientists from
Carnegie Mellon University, to apply knowledge-based technology in the
commercial arena.


Carnegie Group's systems enable clients to automate critical, re-engineered
business processes within their organizations to improve productivity ,
product quality, customer service -- and ultimately, the bottom line.
Because they process not only numerical data but information and know-how as
well, these systems are especially well-suited to problems that are now solved
manually (if at all) but that require scarce or expensive knowledge, skills
and expertise.

Carnegie Group currently has two openings for a GUI engineer on our
TRAC2ES team.  TRAC2ES is a decision support system for mass casualty
evacuation from natural disasters and military arenas.  This revolutionary
system will be built with user-interactive and GUI technologies, linked to
worldwide transportation/medical data networks and quickly deployable in
emergency situations.

We offer the ideal professional setting for the innovative engineer who is
seeking a career in a world-class development environment.  As a member of
our team, you'll enjoy a competitive compensation package, relocation
assistance and significant opportunities for growth.  Interested?
Please see the below postion description to see if you qualify.


If you do, please send your resume, letter of qualifications and salary
history to:

Attn: IGUI/95

Carnegie Group, Inc.
5 PPG Place
Pittsburgh, PA  15222

fax: 412-642-6906	resumes@cgi.com

____________________________________________________________________________
POSITION TITLE:	Engineer/Sr. Engineer I
DIVISION:	Operations/Government/TRAC2ES
LOCATION:	Pittsburgh


  RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
  ------------------------
  	Design, code, and test prototype user interfaces for U.S. Transcom 
	Medical Evacuation Planning software application.

	Maintain integration of third-party mapping tool (MATT) into TRACES
	decision support system.  Integrate detailed map coverage of selected
	areas as they are identified and become available.

  	Prepare and deliver project status review (User Interface component)
  	presentations to customer and interested third parties.

  	Travel during project will be modest. 
  
  POSITION REQUIRES:
  -----------------
       B.S. Computer Science (software engineering/development), Software
  	Engineering, or related field.
  
  WORK EXPERIENCE:
  --------------- 
  	At least 2-3 years software development experience;  Code development
  	in UNIX Workstation (SUN preferred), X-Windows / Motif environments.
  
	Familiarity (preferably experience) with Object-Oriented Data Base
	technology.  Versant OODB a plus.

  	Use of 'wysiwyg' interface development tool (e.g.,XBUILD, VUIT,
  	BuildXcessory) a plus.
  
  SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED:
  ------------------------
    	Excellent problem-definition and problem-solving skills
  	and experience.
  
  	Understanding of, and sensitivity to, user command and control
  	(thru the screen) needs, ergonomic (visual, information formats
  	and relations) design considerations.
  
	Strong object-oriented design and programming skills.
  	(C/C++ X/Motif experience)

  	Demonstrated ability to take user functional requirements and 
  	design and implement modular well-structured software.
  
  	Flexibility in responding to evolving user/customer requirements.
   
  	Very good interpersonal & communications skills.
  
     OPPORTUNITIES for ADVANCEMENT include assuming responsibility for leading
     design & coding efforts of follow-on planning and scheduling applications.

Incorporated in 1984, Carnegie Group, Inc. is an advanced software systems
integrator focusing on applying knowledge-based technologies within a client-
server architecture.

The company was founded by four widely respected computer scientists from
Carnegie Mellon University, to apply knowledge-based technology in the
commercial arena.

Carnegie Group's systems enable clients to automate critical, re-engineered
business processes within their organizations to improve productivity ,
product quality, customer service -- and ultimately, the bottom line.
Because they process not only numerical data but information and know-how as
well, these systems are especially well-suited to problems that are now solved
manually (if at all) but that require scarce or expensive knowledge, skills
and expertise.


Carnegie Group currently has an opening for a Technical lead/Project
Manager on ourTRAC2ES team.  TRAC2ES is a decision support system for mass
casualty evacuation from natural disasters and military arenas.  This
revolutionary system will be built with user-interactive and GUI technologies,
linked to worldwide transportation/medical data networks and quickly
deployable in emergency situations.

We offer the ideal professional setting for the innovative engineer who is
seeking a career in a world-class development environment.  As a member of
our team, you'll enjoy a competitive compensation package, relocation
assistance and significant opportunities for growth.  Interested?

If you do, please send your resume, letter of qualifications and salary
history/expectations to:

Attn: ILD/95

Carnegie Group, Inc.
5 PPG Place
Pittsburgh, PA 15222

fax: 412-642-6906	resumes@cgi.com

______________________________________________________________________________
POSITION:		Team Lead, GPMRC (Sr. Engineer/Project Manager)
DIVISION:		Operations/TRAC2ES
LOCATION:		Pittsburgh


POSITION REQUIRES:
=================

	-B.S. Computer Science, SW Engineering or related field.  MS desirable.
	Prior  experience in leading/managing state of the art software
	development teams.

POSITION DESCRIPTION:
=====================

	-Lead/Manage the GPMRC team on the TRAC2ES project.  Provide the
	technical vision and overall leadership needed to motivate a
	leading-edge team of developers.  Maintain the pace, motivation, and
	leading edge processes that have come to characterize the project.
	Continue to design and deliver the highest quality decision support
	features to the customer based on Decision Centered/User Centered
	design processs.


WORK EXPERIENCE:
===============

	-Prior experience leading a software development team
	using formal methodologies and modern tools.

	-Proven experience leading a team in all phases of a formal
	methodology from development through installation and support.

	-Experience with Command and Control (Decision Aid) systems,
	preferably those involving complex GUI components.

	-Prior experience with C/C++ (or equivalent)
	intensive software projects.

	-Prior experience handling the day to day "admin" duties such
	as personnel management; including performance reviews, objective
	setting, timesheet administration, and other general personnel issues.


SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED:
========================

	-Excellent verbal and writing skills

	-Excellent team building, interpersonal, and leadership
	skills.  The proven ability to work with peers and superiors, the
	customer, and motivate subordinates.

	-Experience with large scale DBMS applications is essential.

	-Awareness/Involvement in the SEI CMM process.

	-Experience in a CASE-assisted formal software engineering
	methodology.


ADDITIONAL SKILLS RECOMMENDED:
============================

	-Additional experience with Relational, Object Oriented, and
	Distributed DBMS's would be very valuable

	-Experience in Object Oriented Methodologies a definite plus.

*************************
JapanNet Job Listings
*************************

Company Name: Japanese Language Services
Position Title: Localization Engineer
id#: jl001
Language: Japanese

Date Posted: 7/10/95

Japanese Language Services, Inc., a leader in Japanese technical translation
and localization, is looking for a Japanese localization engineer.
Responsibilities will include engineering of client software for
double-byte, particularly Japanese environments as well as development of
localization tools.

Qualifications:
* Working knowledge of Japanese.
* Two years experience in localization, either in-house or with localization
vendor.
* Experience with major localization tools.
* UNIX, C, C++; Lisp experience a plus.

The position is full time at our Cambridge, MA office. Compensation depends
on experience.

****************************************


How do I inquire about a position posted in the Japan-Net job listings?

Send an email to dbowen@mindspring.com with the position id# in the
subject line of your inquiry and  your resume in the body of the message. 
For each position you are interested in please send a separate email. 
This inquiry and resume will be forwarded directly to the company while
they are subscribing to our service.  IF YOU DO NOT FOLLOW THIS PROCEDURE
YOUR RESUME WILL NOT BE FORWARDED TO THE COMPANY!

What is Japan-Net?

Japan-Net is a clearing house for Japan related jobs.  We publish Japan
related job listings via Email,FTP & WWW Page. We also maintain and
distribute a resume book of Japanese speaking professionals.  All of these
services are FREE to individuals looking for Japan Related Jobs.

WWW Page:       http://www.asia-net.com
Ftp Site:       ftp://ftp.asia-net.com
email:          Jobs@asia-net.com

How to get on the Mailing list (In case you don't already know)

Send an email to Majordomo@lists.mindspring.com with subscribe japan-net 
as the body of your message.  If you want to unsubscribe send an email with
unsubscribe japan-net [your address] as the body of your message. 

How do I put a resume in the Japan-Net Resume Book?

Resumes may be submitted to the Resume Book via regular post or fax (high
resolution please).  (We recommend that you mail us a laser copy of your
resume, it looks best.)  Please write the following sentence (exactly) on
the cover letter of the fax or letter, "I give Japan-Net permission to
distribute my resume to any company or individual".  SIGN and date under
this sentence.  IF THIS PROCEDURE IS NOT FOLLOWED EXACTLY THE RESUME WILL
NOT BE PLACED IN THE BOOK.

The Resume Book is distributed to businesses seeking individuals with
Japanese skills.  We try to give our resume book the broadest circulation
possible so if you are concerned about confidentiality, do not submit a
resume for inclusion in the Resume Book.   Please limit resumes to one
page.

Fax(408)469-0782
P.O. Box 66855
Scotts Valley, CA
95067

From: bobb@teknowledge.com (Teknowledge Staffing)
Subject: US-CA-Palo Alto / SW Engineer & Architect Positions @ Teknowledge
Date: 20 Jul 1995 01:52:58 GMT
Organization: Teknowledge Corp.

Teknowledge Corporation is a leading high-tech systems engineering
company located in Palo Alto, CA. We are looking for contributors 
to work on commercial and government projects in:

   *  Distributed Systems Development
   *  Collaborative Command and Control
   *  Configuration Systems
   *  Intelligent Computer-Aided Instruction for K-12

We are seeking talented contributors who are motivated by the 
challenge of new projects, leading edge technology, and small 
group environments. All positions require:

   *  hands-on software implementation experience, and continued
      participation in implementation, in an iterative development
      /delivery environment
   *  excellent written and verbal communication skills
   *  U.S. citizenship, and ability to obtain a security clearance.

Job Openings include:

   *  Senior Project Leaders
   *  Senior Software Architect
   *  Junior and Senior Software Engineers (C++/Unix)
   *  WWW Guru / Programmer

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 

[*] Senior Project Leaders:

We are looking for one or two persons with a track record of delivering
useful and innovative software projects to customers on time and within
budget. The position requires strong computer-science technical skills
(advanced degree preferred), including object-oriented design and
programming (preferably C++) in a UNIX environment. The person must be 
able and willing to be an individual contributor, as well as be able to 
lead a team. Strong interpersonal skills are needed, to operate collab-
oratively in a small, dynamic company environment, and to brief and 
interact with senior technical customers. This position also requires 
the ability to take a leadership role in creating proposals.


[*] Senior Software Architect:

We are seeking an individual contributor with 10-20 years experience
creating high quality, reusable architectures for complex distributed
systems. This position requires proven ability to take a leadership 
role in a diverse technical community of customers and other architects. 
We require a strong understanding of object-oriented design methodologies, 
proven programming background in C++ in a UNIX environment, and knowledge 
of OODBMS and distributed object standards (CORBA, DCE, OLE-2, etc.). 
A PhD is desirable.


[*] Software Engineers (junior and senior):

Junior and Senior positions require solid C++ design and programming
experience in a UNIX environment, and excellent documentation skills.
Strengths in one or more of the following areas are required:

   *  distributed computing -- CORBA, DCE, OLE-2, etc.
   *  database systems, especially OODBs
   *  GUI development -- X Windows, Tcl/Tk, etc.
   *  system administration and related programming support to 
      projects - Unix required; Mac and PC desirable


[*] WWW Guru / Programmer (junior or senior Software Engineer):

We are looking for a software engineer with an extensive working 
knowledge of WWW client and server implementations (code) and HTML 
authoring tools. Candidate must be able to take a lead role in 
specifying, designing, and implementing tools and applications that 
make use of and extend WWW technology.

* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * 

Teknowledge is a public company, in business since 1981. To apply 
for any of the above positions, or to receive additional information 
on any of our other openings in - 

   *  Unix system administration
   *  C++ Software Engineering
   *  Web Architecture Development
   *  Distributed Systems Development
   *  Collaborative Command and Control
   *  Intelligent Computer-Aided Instruction for K-12

interest and how your skills match the requirements stated above) or 
contact for additional info (in complete confidence):

      Bob Bachtold

      1810 Embarcadero Rd.

      (415) 424-0500 x535 TEL

POSITION:		Oracle Database Administrator -
			Senior Support Engineer I
LOCATION:		Pittsburgh
APPROVAL DATE:		June 5, 1995

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
	Database administration, including user support and some programming.
	The individual will be responsible for internal database systems as well
	as aiding projects with database design and tuning (as time permits).
	Oracle will be the primary RDBMS, but other secondary systems are 
	likely.

	The individual will be asked to significantly contribute to defining
	a corporate infrastructure, staying abreast of emerging database and
	related technologies, and mentoring others in the area of DBA.

	The individual will be asked to perform DBA functions for the corporate
	infrastructure (as it is created), including the new timesheet and
	financial systems.


POSITION REQUIRES:  
	BS (or MS) in appropriate discipline and 5 years DBA experience 
	with a heavy emphasis on Oracle (additional RDBMSs are a plus).

	Ability to work well with others, and effectively collect user 
	requirements.

	Ability to work with minimal supervision, and follow standard 
	procedures.

	Minimum 3 years experience using Unix (either HP UX and/or SunOS).


WORK EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:
	At least minimal experience developing database applications, although
	the position is targeting database administration.

	Experience supporting PC client-based applications using a Unix server.
	Experience supporting Mac client-based applications a plus.

	Experience in DBA as well as decision support tools.

	Experience with accounting systems.

	Exposure to expert system and other advanced technologies a plus.

	Knowledge or experience in data warehousing and data mining a plus.


SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED:  
	Under minimum direct supervision, must be able to work independently 
	and effectively manage time.

	Must be well organized and able to maintain accurate records.

	Must have professional work habits.

	Ability to trouble-shoot and solve problems a necessity.

	Good oral and written communication skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:  
	Primary responsibility for administrating internal databases.

	Tuning internal databases for optimal performance (this will also 
	apply to project databases, as time permits).

	Aid in defining, developing and deploying internal applications.

	Aid in defining a new corporate infrastructure, and aiding in the long
	term objective of providing decision support systems utilizing the
	corporate infrastructure. 

	As time permits, aid external projects with their use of Oracle RDBMS.
	This entails tuning, consulting on database design, and perhaps even
	minimal development.


Interested?

From: david@pharlap.CI.COM (David B. Kuznick)
Subject: US-MA-Boston-Bedford - UNIX C/C++ Developer - Cognition Corporation
Date: 21 Jul 1995 19:31:28 -0500
Organization: Cognition Corporation

   SENIOR SOFTWARE ENGINEER POSITION OPEN AT COGNITION CORPORATION

Cognition Corporation located in Bedford, MA is currently seeking a
skilled UNIX C/C++ software engineer to lead the design and
development of their Costlink product.  The job responsibilities
include the design, implementation, testing and maintenance of the
entire Costlink product.  This is not an entry-level position.

Costlink provides an interface between Cognition Corporation's Cost
Advantage, an Expert System for providing Cost and Manufacturability
data early on in the design cycle of a manufactured product, and
various Feature-based CAD solid modelers, such as Parametric
Technology Corporation's Pro Engineer.

The desired candidate should possess:

        o a minimum of 5 years INDUSTRY-LEVEL software development
          experience with at least 3 years working in C and/or C++
          in a UNIX environment (required)

        o experience in the total life-cycle of a product, from the
          analysis and design phase, through implementation, testing
          and maintenance (required)
 
        o excellent written and verbal communication skills (required)

        o a minimum of 2 years project leadership experience (required)

        o familiarity with the CAD industry in general and
          Feature-based solid modeling in particular (preferred)
 
        o Lisp experience (preferred)
 
        o familiarity with language-design issues including experience
          with parsers and parser-generators (preferred)
 
        o experience interacting with customers to handle training and 
          support issues (preferred)

Cognition Corporation is an 8 year old privately-held small company
with a generally informal and friendly work environment, providing
competitive salary, excellent benefits, a 401K program, and stock
options.

Interested parties should forward a copy of their resume to:

Cognition Corporation
209 Burlington Rd
Bedford, MA  01730
Attn: Human Resources

Fax: 617-271-0813

Email: personnel@ci.com

development, knowledge of telecommunications industry, and customer
interaction.

and use cases.

incorporating CGI technologies.

ordering complex telecommunication services.

and managing design and coding efforts of follow-on telecommunications
business process automation projects.

Subject: job: Knowledge Engineer, OO Design, C++, CORBA (Westlake Village, CA)
Date: Wed, 26 Jul 1995 14:43:28 -0700
From: Richard Myers <rmyers@isx.com>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU


ISX Corp has open positions at our Westlake Village, CA office for
software developers with backgrounds ranging from recent graduates to
experienced software engineers and technical leaders.  We are looking
for enthusiastic and highly skilled people to join our closely knit
team of professionals.

Current openings include:

  Job title: (2 positions)
     Software Engineer

  Project:
     Planning Tool in Preventive Medicine Domain (code 95WL03).
     Crisis Abatement in a Law Enforcement Domain (code 95WL12)

  Qualifications:
     A BS or MS in Computer Science with strong OO programming skill.

        Additional skills required include:

        o strong written and verbal communication skills
        o the ability to work independently with minimal supervision
        o clear and concise coding style
        o good understanding of object oriented programming techniques

     Experience with C, C++, AI/planning, distributed processing,
     Unix, CORBA, SOM/DSOM and OS2, GUI development is a plus.

  Job function:

     Primary responsibilities will include the design, implementation
     and testing of distributed applications that incorporate
     knowledge based systems.  Projects will include work with agent
     based architectures, heterogeneous databases and knowledge
     representation systems.

     Reference the job code listed above (95WL03 or 95WL12) in any
     correspondences.

-------

  Job title:
      Technical Lead

  Initial Project:
     Information Integration of Advanced Fighter Design Engineering Data.

  Qualifications:

     A BS (MS preferred) plus 2-5 years experience in Computer Science
     with strong C/C++ programming skills and experience in technical
     leadership.

        Additional skills required include:

        o strong written and verbal communication skills
        o the ability to work independently with minimal supervision
        o clear and concise coding style
        o 2-3 years programming experience
        o strong team programming skills
        o Lisp experience

     Experience with information integration, knowledge representation
     languages, database systems and GUI design a plus.  Current
     security clearance also helpful.

  Job function:

     We have a specific position opening for a self motivated worker
     in the field of information integration to be the technical lead
     in an effort in the domain of design engineering for the
     advanced fighter aircraft. The position includes technical leadership
     as well as primary responsibility for system implementation.

     Reference the job code: 95WL13 in any correspondences.

-------

Positions offer highly competitive salaries, excellent benefits, and
impressive growth opportunities.  EOE/AO

U.S. Citizenship required.

Qualified candidates should send their resumes to: (reference job code)

 Christine Moore
 ISX Corporation
 4353 Park Terrace Drive
 Westlake Village, CA 91361

or email information to:

 resume01@isx.com

or by fax to:

 (818) 706-2056

ISX provides Advanced Technology Management and builds deliverable
Intelligent Systems that leverage advanced computing technology to
solve real-world operational problems. This practical focus
distinguishes us from other advanced technology companies that are
research centers, and from other engineering companies that sell
conventional systems services and solutions.  ISX has experience and
ongoing projects in the fields of Health Care, Logistics, Education,
Command and Control, and Law Enforcement Domains.

Additional information on ISX Corp can be found on our WWW server
[http://www.isx.com].

Marie desJardins

-----------------------------

SRI International's Applied Artificial Intelligence Technology Program
has an opening for a computer scientist.  SRI is a nonprofit research
institution that receives funding from government and commercial
clients to perform a wide range of scientific research.

The AAITP is located at SRI's main office in Menlo Park, California,
near downtown Menlo Park, Palo Alto, and Stanford University.  We are
a small group (currently 6 people) that does research in planning and
scheduling, machine learning, uncertain reasoning, education and
training.  We apply state-of-the-art techniques in these areas to such
diverse areas as military planning, oilspill response planning,
network management, and interactive learning environments.

A job description and contact information follows.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  Development of AI applications:  Design and
implement complete systems (including conventional software) or
advanced prototypes to apply to a variety of commercial and/or
military problems.  Apply technology in one or more of the following
areas: planning and scheduling, reasoning with uncertain information,
education/training, and network management.

OTHER DUTIES:  Work on-site with end users of technology to elicit
requirements and implement these in knowledge-based systems.  Support
field demonstrations and exercises.  Perform integration of developed
systems with existing software infrastructures.  Maintain software
versions and documentation.

EXPERIENCE: Minimum 4 years past Bachelor's.  Experience in working
with clients required, including some experience in presenting
briefings and demonstrations.  Experience in developing software
systems including AI components.  Experience with LISP required; C++
familiarity desired.  UNIX background required.  Familiarity with
graphical user-interface development (e.g., Motif or CLIM) preferred.

EDUCATION/DISCIPLINE PREFERRED: MS in Computer Science required--PhD
preferred.

REMARKS:  Must be a U.S. Citizen.


Please send a resume or c.v. to:
    Marie Bienkowski
    SRI International
    333 Ravenswood Ave.
    Menlo Park CA 94025
    	(415) 859-5485
    	email: bienk@erg.sri.com

POSITION:		Oracle Database Administrator -
			Senior Support Engineer I
LOCATION:		Pittsburgh
APPROVAL DATE:		June 5, 1995

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
	Database administration, including user support and some programming.
	The individual will be responsible for internal database systems as well
	as aiding projects with database design and tuning (as time permits).
	Oracle will be the primary RDBMS, but other secondary systems are 
	likely.

	The individual will be asked to significantly contribute to defining
	a corporate infrastructure, staying abreast of emerging database and
	related technologies, and mentoring others in the area of DBA.

	The individual will be asked to perform DBA functions for the corporate
	infrastructure (as it is created), including the new timesheet and
	financial systems.


POSITION REQUIRES:  
	BS (or MS) in appropriate discipline and 5 years DBA experience 
	with a heavy emphasis on Oracle (additional RDBMSs are a plus).

	Ability to work well with others, and effectively collect user 
	requirements.

	Ability to work with minimal supervision, and follow standard 
	procedures.

	Minimum 3 years experience using Unix (either HP UX and/or SunOS).


WORK EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:
	At least minimal experience developing database applications, although
	the position is targeting database administration.

	Experience supporting PC client-based applications using a Unix server.
	Experience supporting Mac client-based applications a plus.

	Experience in DBA as well as decision support tools.

	Experience with accounting systems.

	Exposure to expert system and other advanced technologies a plus.

	Knowledge or experience in data warehousing and data mining a plus.


SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED:  
	Under minimum direct supervision, must be able to work independently 
	and effectively manage time.

	Must be well organized and able to maintain accurate records.

	Must have professional work habits.

	Ability to trouble-shoot and solve problems a necessity.

	Good oral and written communication skills.


RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:  
	Primary responsibility for administrating internal databases.

	Tuning internal databases for optimal performance (this will also 
	apply to project databases, as time permits).

	Aid in defining, developing and deploying internal applications.

	Aid in defining a new corporate infrastructure, and aiding in the long
	term objective of providing decision support systems utilizing the
	corporate infrastructure. 

	As time permits, aid external projects with their use of Oracle RDBMS.
	This entails tuning, consulting on database design, and perhaps even
	minimal development.


Interested?

To BS/MS candidates:

I work for the Director of Research and Development of Electronic Data
Systems.  EDS is a 79,000 person company based in Plano, Texas, with
offices around the world.  The primary business of EDS is Information
Technology.  EDS Research & Development is currently seeking Computer
Science and Electrical Engineering majors who will receive one of the
following degrees:  BS or MS candidates who will graduate in the top of
their class and complete their degrees by the end of December of 1995. 
Those hired will participate in our Research Systems Engineering
Development (RSED) program.

The RSED program assumes a high level of technical expertise, and further
develops the technological, methodological, and business skills necessary
to contribute to R&D's projects involving Digital Signal Processing,
Inferencing, and Parallel Computing.  Upon completion of the program, the
hires will be assigned to a position in our Austin, Texas laboratory.

EDS R&D sets high standards to create the highest quality of research.  We
are seeking individuals with experience in Lisp, Prolog, C, and C++, whose
G.P.A. exceeds 3.80.  If you meet these qualifications, and would like to
receive more information about EDS Research and Development, please visit
our Web site at http://www.edsr.eds.com/edsr/ and then mail, fax, or email
a resume to me.

Subject: US-PA Computational Chemistry/Molecular Modeling
Organization: Online Career Center
Date: Sat, 22 Jul 1995 12:14:02 GMT


SmithKline Beecham

SmithKline Beecham, a worldwide leader in
pharmaceutical research, has a number of openings in
our Physical and Structural Chemistry Department.

Scientific Programmer

As a member of an established group, the selected
candidate will assist in the development of state-of-
the-art software. Qualifications include BS/MS in
computer science or electrical engineering (with
experience or course work in chemistry) or BS/MS in
chemistry with demonstrated abilities in scientific
computer programming. Excellent programming skills and
knowledge of UNIX, C and FORTRAN are needed. Experience
with Silicon Graphics workstations and computational
chemistry software are desirable. Refer to Job Code
H0117-I.

Protein Modeling

This individual will be responsible for the development
and application of methods to assign structure and
function to genome sequence information. Qualifications
required include a Ph.D. in chemistry, biophysics or
bioinformatics with extensive experience in biopolymer
sequence analysis and protein modeling. Other
requirements include excellent computer skills and the
ability to develop computer programs and new
algorithms. A knowledge of DNA sequencing methods and
molecular biology is desirable. Refer to Job Code
H0118-I.

Combinatorial Chemistry/Molecular Diversity

The selected individual will join with other team
members to develop and apply methods for the design of
combinatorial chemical libraries and the analysis of
diversity in chemical databases. The necessary
qualifications include a Ph.D. in chemistry or a
related field and extensive experience in computational
chemistry. Excellent computer skills and communications
skills are also necessary. Experience in pattern
recognition or chemical diversity methods is desirable.
Refer to Job Code H00M-I.

Database Mining

The appropriate individual will have a Ph.D. in
chemistry, biochemistry or computer science (or related
field) with extensive experience in pattern
recognition, machine learning or chemometrics.
Excellent communication and computer skills, including
the ability to develop new algorithms, are required.
Experience in chemical or biological database analysis
is desirable. Refer to Job Code H00L-I.

NMR Spectroscopist

Working with the industry's most advanced equipment
(two 500 MHz NMR spectrometers and a series of UNIX,
SGI and Sparc workstations), this individual will work
with the development of multidimensional NMR techniques
and its application to drug discovery research.
Requirements include a Ph.D. in Physics, Chemistry or
Biochemistry and a sound knowledge of NMR theory with
a strong experimental background in multidimensional
NMR techniques. Experience in application of NMR
methods to biological problems including determination
of protein and nucleic acid structure is preferred.
Refer to Job Code H0223-I

Located in our state-of-the-art research facility in
suburban Philadelphia, SmithKline Beecham offers an
excellent compensation/benefits/relocation package.
Interested candidates should send resume with salary
requirements indicating desired Job Code, to:
SmithKline Beecham Pharmaceuticals, Job Code ____, P.O.
Box 2645, Bala Cynwyd, PA 19004. Please be sure to
mention that you saw this ad on the Online Career
Center. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V.

From: met@think.com (Thinking Machines Corporation)
Subject: Commercial Apps Researchers/Developers
Date: Tue, 25 Jul 1995 16:26:17 +0000
Organization: Thinking Machines Corporation

For more than a decade, Thinking Machines Corporation has been one of the
world's leading computer companies in advancing the capability and use of
high performance computing.  Through its unique expertise in parallel
process technology it has developed three generations of world-class
hardware, software, and complementary support systems.  Now we are
beginning a new and exciting growth strategy to open up our technology to
new hardware platforms and application environments.  Thinking Machines is
uniquely positioned to deliver state-of-the-art, cost effective systems on
standard industry platforms.  Join us as we unleash the power of parallel
processing software.  

Thinking Machines Corporation has several openings for talented engineers,
including:




Commercial Applications Researcher/Developers

Design, implementation and support of software for commercial applications
involving machine learning  (Neural Nets, CART, MBR, GA), statistics (SAS),
and parallel processing of massive databases.

Requirements:  MS/PhD in CS/EE or equivalent.  Expertise in C/UNIX, HPC and
commercial databases (SQL, Oracle, etc.)

If you are interested in this position or want information on other
openings that are currently available, please send your resume to:

Rick Pitman
Thinking Machines Corporation
245 First Street

From: mcintosh@maximillion.mcc.com (Valerie McIntosh)
Subject: TX-AUSTIN-SOFTWARE DEVELOPER
Organization: MCC Corporate Computing
Date: Wed, 26 Jul 1995 17:10:00 GMT

               Member of Technical Staff
                  POSITION  AVAILABLE

MCC is one of the nation's leading technology development and 
commercialization consortia.  Its mission is to strengthen and 
sustain the competitiveness of its nearly 100 member organizations 
and customers that share common technical and product requirements 
in electronics and information technology.  MCC conducts a wide 
range of activities intended to accelerate the development and 
commercialization of advanced technology in the areas of advanced 
electronic systems, information management, intelligent systems, 
and distributed systems management.

The Microelectronics and Computer Technology Corporation (MCC) is 
a research and development consortium serving the electronics and 
computer industries. Our focus is information technologies and 
advanced electronics. With a membership and customer base of 
nearly 100 corporations, public and non-profit agencies, and 
universities, MCC provides a forum where industry, government 
and academia can collaborate, leveraging investments - and 
expertise - in the development of high-risk, high-impact technology 
while reducing costly duplication of efforts. This collaborative 
environment provides an opportunity to cooperate on projects that 
are inherently multi-company or multi-industry. 

The specific opportunity available is described below:

             InfoSleuth:  Networked Exploitation 
             of Information using Semantic Agents
                 Member of Technical Staff 

PROJECT SUMMARY 

InfoSleuth is developing and deploying new technologies for
finding information in both corporate and external networks, 
such as those based on the emerging National Information 
Infrastructure (NII).  The InfoSleuth research is based on 
MCC's acclaimed Carnot technology, developed in a collaborative 
project over the last 4 years.  Carnot has been successfully 
used to integrate heterogeneous corporate information
resources.  The InfoSleuth Project will investigate the use 
of Carnot technology in a more dynamically changing environment, 
such as the Internet, where new information sources are 
constantly being added and for which there is no formal control 
of the registration of new information sources.  In this type 
of environment, traditional techniques for expressing and optimizing 
database queries are inadequate because of the rapidly changing 
schema information and the fuzzy nature of the queries. InfoSleuth 
will build on Carnot's semantic modeling capabilities to enable 
"deep" descriptions of available information sources, and 
InfoSleuth will deploy intelligent agents to carry out distributed, 
coordinated, self-adapting search algorithms.

More information on Carnot and InfoSleuth can be found on the 
World Wide Web at:
   http://www.mcc.com/projects/carnot
   http://www.mcc.com/projects/infosleuth

THE OPPORTUNITY

To participate in challenging research aimed at constructing 
practical solutions for finding, accessing, browsing, investigating, 
and updating information residing in a distributed system of 
structured (data bases) and unstructured (text documents) 
information sources. The specific problems are: integration of 
DBs based on semantic domain models, data mining, document retrieval 
and extraction of information from text. The work is conducted in 
the form of application partnerships with organizations funding 
the project. This collaboration grounds the research in real 
problems encountered at large companies and institutions.

The position involves programming in various languages (some of 
them non-orthodox) and working on systems (design and implementation) 
consisting of many different components of two types: commercially 
available ones and those developed within the framework of the project.

QUALIFICATIONS

Excellent programming skills (on the designing and coding levels), 
a passion towards programming, and the tendency to view work more 
as a source of pleasure and happiness than as a routine duty are 
the most valuable qualifications expected.  Specific languages 
include, but are not limited to:
                                 - C++
                                 - Tcl/Tk
                                 - Lisp

Require knowledge and experience in more than one of the 
following areas:
         - modeling of information and knowledge representation
         - databases
         - natural language processing
         - developing graphical interfaces

Master's in Computer Science or Computer Engineering required.

Send resume' to: MCC
                 ATTN: Human Resources Department
                 P.O. Box 200195
                 Austin, Texas  78720
        E-mail:  vallen@mcc.com

                Equal Opportunity Employer

Subject: Job: Knowledge-based Systems & Machine Learning at Univ. of Portsmouth
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: sgt@sis.port.ac.uk (Simon Thompson)
Subject: A.I. Research Fellowships/Senior Fellowships
Date: 25 Jul 1995 13:57:40 GMT
Organization: University of Portsmouth

                       UNIVERSITY OF PORTSMOUTH   

                    DEPARTMENT OF INFORMATION SCIENCE

             RESEARCH FELLOWSHIP/SENIOR RESEARCH FELLOWSHIP

               IN KNOWLEDGE BASED SYSTEMS/MACHINE LEARNING

Salary up to 24,000 pounds per annum

As part of a major programme of expansion entitled 'Investing in
Research Excellence', the University of Portsmouth is inviting
applications for Research Fellows/Senior Research Fellows in
either of the above areas.

Appointments at both levels are being offered with earmarked
support for five years which, following successful completion,
could lead to a subsequent position as Senior or Principal
Lecturer, Reader or Professor.

Fellows will join the Artificial Intelligence Research Group in
the Department of Information Science, which is the largest and
most active of the Department's research groups. Its activities can
be broadly divided into two areas: Knowledge Based Systems and
Machine Learning. Fellows will be expected to make a substantial
contribution to one of these areas.

Successful candidates will conduct research under the direction
of Professor Max Bramer who is the leader of the AI Research Group
and Head of the Department of Information Science. Professor Bramer
has been actively involved in research in Artificial Intelligence
since the early 1970s and since 1988 has been chairman of the BCS
Specialist Group on Expert Systems (SGES), a member organisation of
ECCAI. His current research interests include inductive learning,
case-based reasoning, model-based approaches to diagnostic
reasoning and methodologies for knowledge engineering.

Other leading members of the group include Professor Tom Addis,
who also has over 20 years involvement in the field and is a
former chairman of the Artificial Intelligence Professional Group
of the Institution of Electrical Engineers. He is currently
conducting research into graphical programming interfaces and
into theoretical aspects of the representation and use of
knowledge.

Fellows will normally need to have a PhD degree as well as a
track record of successful published research in either Machine
Learning or Knowledge Based Systems. They will be expected to
have an active area of ongoing research which fits closely with
the Department's current interests. In addition they will be
expected to contribute to the overall development of the
Department's research culture. Specifically, they will:

  - Undertake and publish research in their chosen subject area

  - Maintain expertise in their discipline and disseminate it to
    others


  - Support and facilitate the research of other members of the AI
    Research Group

  - Contribute to the Department's PhD training program for its AI
    cohort of research students

  - Prepare bids for funding from UK and European Union research
    initiatives and from industry in collaboration with other       
    members of the AI Research Group as appropriate. 

Further particulars are available from: The Personnel Office,
University of Portsmouth, University House, Winston Churchill
Avenue, Portsmouth PO1 2UP  England. Telephone +44-(0)1705-843421
(24-hour answer phone). Quote Reference RF1G. NOTE: THE CLOSING
DATE IS AUGUST 7th 1995.

For an informal discussion prior to application, contact 

Professor Max Bramer on +44-(0)1705-844444 
(email: bramerma@csovax.portsmouth.ac.uk) 

or

Simon Thompson on +44-(0)1705-844097 (email: sgt@sis.port.ac.uk).

Further information about the AI Research Group and the appointment
is also available on the World-Wide Web at:

HTTP://WWW.SIS.PORT.AC.UK/FELLOWSHIP.HTML

Subject: Job: Vision, Speech at Univ. of Surrey (Guildford, UK)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: Norbert Glaser <Norbert.Glaser@loria.fr>
Subject: [JOB] Various Research Fellowships - Surrey, GB
Date: 27 Jul 1995 10:59:26 +0200
Organization: CRIN & INRIA-Lorraine - Nancy - FRANCE



              RESEARCH FELLOW VACANCIES                    
              -------------------------

          VISION, SPEECH AND SIGNAL PROCESSING GROUP
      Department of Electronic and Electrical Engineering

                 UNIVERSITY OF SURREY 
                 GUILDFORD, U.K.

The Vision, Speech and Signal Processing Group, headed by Professor Josef
Kittler, has several Research Fellow Vacancies. The group comprises about
40 members working  in the image, vision and pattern recognition
areas. It has extensive computing resources including SUN and DEC alpha
workstations as well as specialised image processing, image communication 
and range data analysis equipment. The Department of Electronics has an
international research reputation and was one of only six Departments
in the UK to receive the highest ``grade 5'' research rating in the 
most recent UFC Research Selectivity Exercise.
Vacancies exist for research fellows in the following areas:

   - Image Coding
   - Range Data Analysis 
   - Document Analysis
   - Automatic Inspection
   - Neural Networks

Brief outlines of  each post including number of vacancies, duration of
posts, salary scale etc  and a contact 
member of staff for informal enquiries are given in the sections below.  
For all vacancies, applications in the form of a CV (3 copies) including 
names and addresses of two referees should be sent to the Personnel 
Office (JLG), University of Surrey, Guildford, GU2 5XH, Surrey, 
United Kingdom. by 1 September 1995. 



Research Fellow - Image Coding 
==============================

Two Research Fellows and one Senior Research Fellow are required for  
EPSRC and European Union funded projects in Image Coding. 

The successful candidates will be required to develop, implement in software
and experimentally evaluate relevant algorithms. 
One of the posts will also involve porting the algorithms developed onto 
DSP hardware. Experience in Unix, C, C++, motion analysis and image coding, 
and DSP chip programming will be an advantage.

The appointments will initially be  for a period of  2 years. 
on the RA salary scales. Further information may be obtained from 
Dr M Bober  on 01483 300800 Ext 2357.


Research Fellow in Range Data Analysis
======================================

Applications are invited for a post of Research Fellow on a
two year EPSRC funded project concerned with the use of range data to
inspect the solder printing process used with surface mount device
technology. The project involves collaboration with two other 
University groups and four industrial partners. 
It is intended to produce a prototype system that uses inspection results 
as one input to a neuro-fuzzy adaptive control module that will perform 
online control of a solder printing machine. The project is funded as part 
of the EPSRC Electronic Product Design and Manufacturing Initiative. 

The Research Fellow will be expected to research and develop algorithms for 
analysis of depth/range data derived from solder paste boards. The algorithms
will have to perform at high data rates on a dedicated DSP architecture.
They will  extract information for both online
pad by pad classification of potential defects and longer term
changes which characterise the goodness of process parameters and settings. 

Candidates should have a good honours degree in a relevant area.
Evidence of industrial and/or research experience, such as a PhD, is desirable.
Applicants should have a background in at least one of the following areas:
mathematics, engineering, algorithm development, software development
or real-time system engineering.
Informal enquiries may be made to: Dr John Illingworth (tel: 01483 259835
or email: J.Illingworth@ee.surrey.ac.uk).

The project will last for two years with salary on the RA1A scale, 
dependent on age and experience.



Research Fellow in Document Analysis
====================================


Applications are invited for a post of Research Fellow on a
EPSRC funded project concerned with the use of Hidden Markov Models
for off-line recognition of hand-written characters.

The Research Fellow will be expected to research, develop and evaluate
algorithms for recognition of handwriting. The approach adopted will build on
existing work which exploits Hidden Markov Models, HMMs, for printed character
recognition. HMMs have the potential for simultaneously segmenting and
recognising character strings and this has proven to be a key limitation
of existing systems.

Candidates should have a good honours degree in a relevant area.
Evidence of research experience, such as a PhD, is desirable.
Applicants should have a background in one or more of the following areas:
image processing, pattern recognition, document analysis or software
engineering. Informal enquiries may be made to: 
Dr John Illingworth (tel: 01483 259835 email: J.Illingworth@ee.surrey.ac.uk).

The project will last for three years with salary on the RA1A scale, 
dependent on age and experience.



Research Fellow -  Automatic Inspection
=======================================

A Research Fellow is required for a project in Automatic Inspection.
The successful candidate will be required to develop, implement in software
and experimentally evaluate relevant algorithms.  In particular, the Fellow
will be responsible for the development of techniques for defect detection 
in the colour texture of ceramic tiles and for the tile appearance grading. 
Experience in Unix, C and  image processing will be an advantage.

The  appointment will be  for a period of 12 months on the RAIA salary scales. 
Further information may be obtained from Professor J Kittler on 0483 2599294.



Research Fellow - Neural Networks 
=================================

A Research Fellow is required for a project in Neural Network design.
The successful candidate will be required to develop, implement in software
and experimentally evaluate relevant algorithms.  In particular, the Fellow
will be responsible for the development of methodology for neural net 
architecture design and training. Experience in Unix, C  neural net and 
pattern recognition will be an advantage.

The  appointment will be  for a period of 18 months on the RAIA salary scales.
Further information may be obtained from Professor J Kittler on 0483 2599294.
------- End of forwarded message -------

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Planning, Scheduling, Uncertain Info at SRI International (CA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: Norbert Glaser <Norbert.Glaser@loria.fr>
Subject: [JOB] Computer Scientist - SRI, California
Date: 28 Jul 1995 08:15:59 +0200
Organization: CRIN & INRIA-Lorraine - Nancy - FRANCE


SRI International's Applied Artificial Intelligence Technology Program
has an opening for a computer scientist.  SRI is a nonprofit research
institution that receives funding from government and commercial
clients to perform a wide range of scientific research.

The AAITP is located at SRI's main office in Menlo Park, California,
near downtown Menlo Park, Palo Alto, and Stanford University.  We are
a small group (currently 6 people) that does research in planning and
scheduling, machine learning, uncertain reasoning, education and
training.  We apply state-of-the-art techniques in these areas to such
diverse areas as military planning, oilspill response planning,
network management, and interactive learning environments.

A job description and contact information follows.


ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:  Development of AI applications:  Design and
implement complete systems (including conventional software) or
advanced prototypes to apply to a variety of commercial and/or
military problems.  Apply technology in one or more of the following
areas: planning and scheduling, reasoning with uncertain information,
education/training, and network management.

OTHER DUTIES:  Work on-site with end users of technology to elicit
requirements and implement these in knowledge-based systems.  Support
field demonstrations and exercises.  Perform integration of developed
systems with existing software infrastructures.  Maintain software
versions and documentation.

EXPERIENCE: Minimum 4 years past Bachelor's.  Experience in working
with clients required, including some experience in presenting
briefings and demonstrations.  Experience in developing software
systems including AI components.  Experience with LISP required; C++
familiarity desired.  UNIX background required.  Familiarity with
graphical user-interface development (e.g., Motif or CLIM) preferred.

preferred.
