From: knichols@bbn.com (BBN in Cambridge)
Date: 28 Jul 1995 18:22:40 GMT

Job Openings in Speech and Language Processing
BBN Systems and Technologies, 
Cambridge, MA

The Speech and Language Processing Department at Bolt Beranek and 
Newman Inc. has several exciting positions in speech recognition, 
language understanding and character recognition.  To apply send your
resume and indication of which position you are interested in to
Karen Nicholson (knichols@bbn.com)
Positions:

Algorithm Developer  
   Work with a research team designing and implementing algorithms for
large vocabulary continuous speech recognition, systems incorporating
voice input and output such as spoken language systems, and optical
character recognition.  Requirements include Master's in computer
science, mathematics, engineering, or related field or equivalent
expereince and excellent programming skills in C/C++ and UNIX.
Background in one or more of the following areas desirable:
statistical modeling, pattern recognition, speech processing,
character recognition.  Knowledge of LISP, SPlus, and Perl a plus.

Applied Computational Linguist
   Work with a research team to develop fieldable technology including
advance prototypes and products in information extraction systems,
including name recognition and template fill from newswire.
Experience in applying computational linguistics to real applications,
excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp, and degree in computer
science or related field required.  U.S. Citizenship and willingness
to get a DoD clearance required.

Statistical Computational Linguist
   Reserach and development of new techniques and software for
processing large corpora, including languages other than English, and
language modeling for speech and NL systems.  Masters or PhD in
computer science or related area, strong math/stat background, strong
C programming skills required. Experience in Lisp, Splus, Perl
a plus.  U.S. Citizenship and fluency in a second language desirable.

Applications Engineer
   Design and implement applications at the cutting edge of speech and
language technology, such as medical dictation, reading and language
learning assistants, transcription of telephone speech for deaf
listeners, topic identification from video, voice mail transcription,
information extraction systems.  Requirements: Extensive experience in
advance technology software systems, including product-level code and
documentation; master level programmer in C/C++, with at least one
year's experience each in Unix and MS Windows; experience in graphical
user interfaces; Bachelor's or Masters degree in computer science.
Lisp experience helpful.  Experience in fields related to speech and
natural language a plus.  U.S. Citizenship and willingness
to get a DoD clearance desirable.

Entry Level Researcher
   Participate in a research group developing algorithms and building
systems for advanced speech and language technologies, provide support
by implementing algorithms, running experiments, collecting and
analyzing data.  Bachelor's level in computer science, engineering, or
related field, excellent undergraduate GPA, experience in university
research lab or summer internship, and programming skills in C/C++ and
UNIX required.  Some experience in speech or language technology a
plus.  U.S. Citizenship and willingness to get a DoD clearance
desirable.


The Speech and Language Processing Department of BBN Systems and
Technologies, a subsidiary of Bolt Beranek and Newman Inc. (NYSE:BBN),
has been a world leader in computer-based speech and language research
and development for 25 years.  The department continues to make
cutting-edge advances in the areas of speech recognition, speaker and
language identification, natural language understanding, interactive
spoken language systems, and data extraction from text.
 


****************************************************************************
***

These positions are DC-based.

The department is involved in a number of projects emphasizing high tech
approaches to understanding natural language, including English, Spanish,
German, and Chinese.  The projects range from basic research through
advanced development, and from demonstrations to products.  We are looking
for a few exceptional people.


APPLIED COMPUTATIONAL LINGUIST

Work within a team to develop information extraction systems, 
including name recognition and template fill from newswire, and from
transcribed speech.  
Requirements:
	Two years experience in applying computational linguistics to real
		applications 
	Excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp
	Experience with statistical approaches is a plus.
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


MASTER PROGRAMMER

Work within a team to design and implement applications at the cutting edge
of speech and 
language technology, such as information extraction systems, document
handling technology, and topic identification from video.
Requirements:
	Master level programmer in C/C++
	Breadth of programming tasks, including product-level code and
		documentation 
	At least one year's experience each in Unix and MS Windows.
	Experience with delivery of operational systems.
	Experience in implementing graphical user interfaces
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


ENTRY LEVEL RESEARCHER

Provide support to a team by running experiments, implementing algorithms,
and analyzing performance. 
Requirements:
	Bachelor's or Masters degree in computer science
	Excellent C, C++ programming ability
	Lisp programming ability
	At least eight computer science courses
	High undergraduate GPA (3.6 or above)
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


STATISTICAL LANGUAGE MODELER

Research and development of new techniques for statixitcal modeling of
language.  Processing large corpora, including languages other than English.
Requirements:
	Two years experience in applying statistical techniques to
		language  processing.
	Excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp.
	Strong statistics/pattern recognition background.
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance




Desirable qualifications for all of the above, if available:

	Strong desire to excel, not just succeed
	Type A personality
	Security Clearance of TS SI with lifestyle polygraph 
	Level 3 reading ability in reading a second language (e.g., Chinese,
		Thai, Spanish, 	Arabic, or Japanese) 
	Experience with a programming team, not just one-person projects

Karen Nicholson

10 Moulton St.

From: JCMA@ai.mit.edu (John C. Mallery)


       The Artificial Intelligence Laboratory at the
          Massachusetts Institute of Technology
               seeks a Research Scientist
                    Position 95-0553

The Intelligent Information Infrastructure Project seeks a programmer
to maintain, integrate, and develop a variety of large Common Lisp
systems in the areas of intelligent network services, machine
learning, natural language understanding, and knowledge
representation.  A keen sense of program abstraction and system
modularity are essential.  The individual will work with a team on
information infrastructure projects as well as state of the art
artificial intelligence systems.  The position also involves
contributing to the maintenance of the project's computational
infrastructures and teaching programming to students working on the
project.  Most work will be done on Symbolics Lisp machines, with some
ancillary work on UNIX platforms.

For a description of the project, see:

URL: http://www.ai.mit.edu/projects/iiip/home-page.html

Qualifications: B.S. or M.S. in computer science or related
field, and a demonstrated ability to conceptualize and complete
software engineering projects.  Must be fluent in ANSI Common Lisp,
including the Common Lisp Object System and the Common Lisp Interface
Manager.  Experience with Genera operating system and development
environment on Symbolics Lisp Machines is important.  Familiarity with
operating systems on the Apple MacIntosh, DEC Alpha, and UNIX are a
plus.  Other relevant skills or experience include: transaction-controlled,
persistent-object object systems; database programming; Internet
protocols (e.g., HTTP, SMTP, NNTP, Z39.50).

Qualified applicants, please send a resume to:

Mr. James McCarthy, Personnel Officer
MIT--Personnel Office
77 Massachusetts Avenue, Bldg. E19-238
Cambridge, MA  02139

             This is a non-smoking environment.

From: jones@greg.cs.usu.edu (Greg Jones)
Date: 28 Jul 95 16:19:31 MDT
Organization: USU CS Department

                             Job Announcement 
                           Lecturer(s) Position 
 
The Computer Science Department at Utah State University will hire one or two
temporary lecturers for the 1995-96 academic year.  There is a possibility that
these positions will continue through the 1996-97 academic year.

Applicants must have at least a BS in Computer Science.  A MS or PhD in Computer
Science or some closely related discipline is preferred.  Prior teaching
experience is desirable.

Lecturers have a 9-month contract and teach up to 3 classes in each of the Fall,
Winter and Spring quarters.  They supervise graders and laboratory assistants
assigned to work with those classes.  They hold office hours to meet with
students at least 3 times per week.  They attend department faculty meetings,
and undertake occasional departmental duties.  In lieu of teaching some time may
be allocated for participation in departmental research projects.

Applicants must be able to teach a broad range of undergraduate courses.
Adequate background to teach a beginning graduate course in Software Engineering
or Artificial Intelligence is desirable.

Lecturers are paid $22,000-26,000 for 9 months and receive a generous benefits
package.

Utah State University is located in Logan, Utah, about 85 miles north of Salt
Lake City.  Logan is a beautiful city with about 40,000 residents, located in a
rural area with excellent access to outdoor recreation throughout the state and
in neighboring Idaho and Wyoming.

Review of applications will begin on August 24, 1995 and will continue until the
position(s) are filled.  Applicants should send a resume and the names and
telephone numbers of three professional references to:


                      jones@greg.cs.usu.edu (e-mail) 
      
                                    or 
 
                             Hiring Committee 
                      Department of Computer Science 
                          Utah State University 
                           Logan, UT 84322-4205 
 
                                    or 
 
                          fax to (801) 797-3265  
 
 
USU is an AA/EOE employer.

-- 
Greg Jones			            (801)797-3267
Department of Computer Science	    jones@greg.cs.usu.edu
Utah State University, Logan  UT  84322-4205

		RESEARCH ASSISTANTSHIP VACANCY
		==============================


DEPARTMENT OF ELECTRONIC ENGINEERING
QUEEN MARY & WESTFIELD COLLEGE
MILE END ROAD
LONDON E1 4NS


We have a vacancy for a research assistant on a DTI-EPSRC 
funded project on intelligent agents. The project, called 
ADEPT, has 18 months to run and the salary will be in the 
range 16,500 pounds to 18000 pounds (depending on experience
and age). The project is a collaborative 
venture involving QMW, BT Research Labs, ICI Engineering 
and Loughborough University of Technology. It aims to 
develop a number of intelligent negotiating agents for 
business process management. Further concern is for methods
of knowledge interchange between such autonomous agents.
More details of the project and the Group at QMW are available
at the following URL: http://www.elec.qmw.ac.uk/dai/

We are looking to recruit somebody with a strong AI background who
has good software skills (CLIPS, C and C++) and is able to work 
in a collaborative environment. Knowledge of the field of multi-agent
systems or intelligent agents would also be preferred.

To apply for this position send a CV to Dr Nick Jennings. 
For further information please telephone 0171-975-5349 
or email N.R.Jennings@qmw.ac.uk

---------------------------------26582895114857--

Subject: !!!SPEECH RECOGNITION OPENINGS!!!
Date: Sat, 29 Jul 1995 17:52:30 -0500
Organization: PETER FOSTER INVESTMENTS, INC.

		VOICE CONTROL SYSTEMS,INC. HAS 18 JOB OPENINGS 


	VCS is a leading firm in the business of developing and applying 
automatic speech recognition (ASR).  VCS has been involved in the speech 
business since 1978 and is the commercial benchmark for speaker-independent 
speech recognizers.  VCS has fielded more than 250,000 speaker-independent 
recognizers in over 40 languages, worldwide.  VCS is a publicly traded company 
and is growing more than 40% annually.  Today VCS provides phonetic-based 
continuous and discrete speech recognition in speaker-independent, speaker-
dependent, and speaker-adaptive variations as well as speaker verification 
(voice-printing).  
	VCS technology is at work in many commercial applications of ASR today.  

VCS provides the technology for the Oki Semiconductor single chip speech 
recognizer.  VCS is the ASR technology in the 1995 Mercedes-Benz voice 
activated cellular phone.  VCS is the automation technology behind 1-800-
Collect, the cellular voice dialing technology in VoiceTouch at Cellular One 
(McCaw Cellular) and the manufacturer of the VCS2060 home voice dialing 
system.
	VCS is searching for individuals who will enjoy the fast paced, dynamic 
environment provided by this fast track leader in the industry.  Some of the 
openings include:

	Vice-President of Marketing - Location: DAL-TX.  VCS is seeking an 
experienced executive capable of leading the product marketing, marketing 
communications, trade show co-ordination and product development. Software or 
telecommunications backgrounds a must.  Degree required.

	Software Development Managers - Several openings for experienced 
software managers.  BSEE or BSCS reqd.  Experience in speech processing or 
telecommunications a plus.  Experience in real time systems and programs 
helpful.

	Software QA Manager - Location:DAL-TX. Working directly for the Vice-
president of Software Development, this working manager will direct a small 
but growing department, tasked with maintaining VCS quality reputation.

	DSP Development Engineers  - DAL-TX. Several openings exist for 
programmers skilled in mathmatical programming in assembler and C.  Real time 
systems experience a must.  BSEE or BSCS please.  Programs for speech 
recognition are underway at VCS in Intel, TI, Oki, and Motorola environments.  


	Technical Writers - DAL-TX.  Two openings for technical writers. 
Responsibilities include applications notes, training literature, product 
documentation, technical sales information and proposal response.  3-5 years 
experience and some programming a requirement.  BSEE or BSCS preferred.

	Sales Account Managers - DAL-TX, GERMANY, SAN JOSE-CA.  Sales account 
managers to sell and support VCS customers.  BSEE/BSCS or equilavent reqd.


Other openings soon.  VCS offers competitive saleries, great benefits 
including medical and dental, 401k, 125 Cafeteria and employee stock plans.  
Please respond by e-mail or fax.  We offer a great working environment where 
you can see your work used in products people buy.

	





Mari Tanner - Mgr of HR   E-mail:  m_tanner@vcsi.com
Voice Control Systems, Inc.
14140 Midway Rd., Dallas, TX 75244
214-386-0300    Fax: 214-386-5555

Subject: Job: Text Analysis software at Interactive Search (Los Angeles)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Fast growing start-up company near LAX is adding  a key person to its
development staff.  This person will have responsibility for  the on-going
design and development of the text analysis portion of a document
processing system.  The work will be done in both C Language and PERL and
will run in a Unix environment.  Our technical approach stresses the use of
document structure and features to aid in text analysis, thereby minimizing
the need for full natural language understanding.    If you have worked in
this area, and believe that a pattern matching approach can be a pragmatic
method of extracting information from predictably formed text documents, we
have a great opportunity for you!

The company is creating a system to analyze documents and extract
information.  The information is made available through either a local or a
WWW browser.  In addition to our text analysis work, we are pushing on
technology boundaries in the areas of object-relational multi-media
databases, multi- engine voting OCR systems, and Web publishing.  Are you
interested in this type of work in a dynamic, young company? If so, and if
your background qualifies you, send, fax, or e-mail your resume to me, Dot
Ringer, so we can start a discussion.

Candidates must be immediately available and in the Los Angeles area
(sorry, we cannot relocate).

E-mail to:  job14@i-search.com

Fax to: (310)641-1676

Send to:
Interactive Search, Inc.
5959 W. Century Blvd. #1122
Los Angeles, CA 90045

Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: ehn+@CS.CMU.EDU (Eric Nyberg)
Subject: US-PA-Pittsburgh Research Programmer (UNIX/LISP/C++), CMU
Date: 4 Aug 1995 11:18:24 GMT
Organization: Carnegie-Mellon University, School of Computer Science

US-PA-Pittsburgh Research Programmer (UNIX/LISP/C++), CMU

Research Programmer, Machine Translation Applications

The CATALYST project at the Center for Machine Translation, Carnegie
Mellon University, is seeking a talented and energetic individual for
the position of Research Programmer.

CATALYST is a large-scale MT application for commercial document
delivery in the domain of heavy machinery. The open Research
Programmer position will be responsible for the following tasks:

 * Maintain functional specifications and programmer documentation for
CATALYST software modules and knowledge bases (e.g., syntactic parser,
semantic interpreter, grammar, lexicon, etc.)

 * Analyze customer problem reports and perform regular update, test,
and delivery of module software (primarily in LISP)

 * Participate in the design and implementation of new support tools
and modules (LISP/C++)

 * Provide general programming / UNIX support for other members of the
research team

 * Maintain a responsive and professional relationship with customer
   personnel

The successful applicant must have the following qualifications:

 * B.S. in Computer/Information Science (or related field),
   or equivalent experience

 * Strong programming skills in Unix, Lisp and C++. Most important is
   proven proficiency in Lisp, with at least 3 years experience
   in large scale projects written in Common Lisp.

 * Experience communicating and working productively within a
   development team, coupled with the ability to work with minimal
   supervision on implementation and coding tasks

 * Experience in designing and implementing multi-module software
   systems


The following skills are also desirable:

 * Coursework in linguistics or computational linguistics

 * Experience in developing machine translation software or other
   types of language processing software


Full-time Salaried Position

Occasional Travel Required

Contact:	Eric Nyberg				Phone: (412) 268-7281
		Center for Machine Translation		Fax:   (412) 268-6298
		Carnegie Mellon University		EMail: ehn+@cs.cmu.edu
		Pittsburgh, PA 15213
		USA

Candidates should send a letter of application, a current vita, at
least three letters of reference, and representative samples of their
work. Resumes, cover letters, etc. may be submitted via EMail, in
ASCII or Postscript form. Resumes may also be submitted by fax or
regular mail, but EMail is preferred. Letters of recommendation must
be faxed or mailed. Applicants from abroad may wish to consider
express mail to ensure a timely submission.

From: Norbert Glaser <Norbert.Glaser@loria.fr>
Subject: [JOB] Fellowship in KBS & Machine Learning - Portsmouth, UK
Date: 4 Aug 1995 08:48:48 +0200
Organization: CRIN & INRIA-Lorraine - Nancy - FRANCE



                       UNIVERSITY OF PORTSMOUTH   

                    DEPARTMENT OF INFORMATION SCIENCE

             RESEARCH FELLOWSHIP/SENIOR RESEARCH FELLOWSHIP

               IN KNOWLEDGE BASED SYSTEMS/MACHINE LEARNING

Salary up to 24,000 pounds per annum

As part of a major programme of expansion entitled 'Investing in
Research Excellence', the University of Portsmouth is inviting
applications for Research Fellows/Senior Research Fellows in
either of the above areas.

Appointments at both levels are being offered with earmarked
support for five years which, following successful completion,
could lead to a subsequent position as Senior or Principal
Lecturer, Reader or Professor.

Fellows will join the Artificial Intelligence Research Group in
the Department of Information Science, which is the largest and
most active of the Department's research groups. Its activities can
be broadly divided into two areas: Knowledge Based Systems and
Machine Learning. Fellows will be expected to make a substantial
contribution to one of these areas.

Successful candidates will conduct research under the direction
of Professor Max Bramer who is the leader of the AI Research Group
and Head of the Department of Information Science. Professor Bramer
has been actively involved in research in Artificial Intelligence
since the early 1970s and since 1988 has been chairman of the BCS
Specialist Group on Expert Systems (SGES), a member organisation of
ECCAI. His current research interests include inductive learning,
case-based reasoning, model-based approaches to diagnostic
reasoning and methodologies for knowledge engineering.

Other leading members of the group include Professor Tom Addis,
who also has over 20 years involvement in the field and is a
former chairman of the Artificial Intelligence Professional Group
of the Institution of Electrical Engineers. He is currently
conducting research into graphical programming interfaces and
into theoretical aspects of the representation and use of
knowledge.

Fellows will normally need to have a PhD degree as well as a
track record of successful published research in either Machine
Learning or Knowledge Based Systems. They will be expected to
have an active area of ongoing research which fits closely with
the Department's current interests. In addition they will be
expected to contribute to the overall development of the
Department's research culture. Specifically, they will:

  - Undertake and publish research in their chosen subject area

  - Maintain expertise in their discipline and disseminate it to
    others


  - Support and facilitate the research of other members of the AI
    Research Group

  - Contribute to the Department's PhD training program for its AI
    cohort of research students

  - Prepare bids for funding from UK and European Union research
    initiatives and from industry in collaboration with other       
    members of the AI Research Group as appropriate. 

Further particulars are available from: The Personnel Office,
University of Portsmouth, University House, Winston Churchill
Avenue, Portsmouth PO1 2UP  England. Telephone +44-(0)1705-843421
(24-hour answer phone). Quote Reference RF1G. NOTE: THE CLOSING
DATE IS AUGUST 7th 1995.

For an informal discussion prior to application, contact 

Professor Max Bramer on +44-(0)1705-844444 
(email: bramerma@csovax.portsmouth.ac.uk) 

or

Simon Thompson on +44-(0)1705-844097 (email: sgt@sis.port.ac.uk).

Further information about the AI Research Group and the appointment
is also available on the World-Wide Web at:

HTTP://WWW.SIS.PORT.AC.UK/FELLOWSHIP.HTML

Subject: Job: NLP & SOAR at Carnegie Mellon University (Pittsburgh, PA)

Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: jef+@ANKYLO.SOAR.CS.CMU.EDU (Jill Fain)
Subject: NL job available
Date: 3 Aug 1995 15:19:21 GMT
Organization: Carnegie Mellon University

School of Computer Science, Carnegie Mellon University, Pittsburgh, PA

Position: Research Assistant or Post-doctoral fellow, effective May 1, 1995.

Contact: Dr. Jill Fain Lehman
         School of Computer Science
         Carnegie Mellon University
         Pittsburgh, PA 15213-3891

         by email: jill.lehman@cs.cmu.edu

Description: Two-year position working on natural language processing
within the Soar project.  Our main focus will be to extend the current
models of comprehension and generation (NL-Soar) within the context of
military simulations.  In particular, the current system is oriented
toward real-time dialog behavior between intelligent agents (e.g.
pilot, wing, air controller) participating in simulated engagements in
the tactical air domain. Although this work will continue under the
current position, we will also be responsible for providing a
real-time, incremental language capability between these agents and
command level agents also built within the Soar framework.

The natural language project consists of 1 faculty member, 3 graduate
students and a post-doc. In addition to the applications mentioned above,
current research using NL-Soar includes issues in language acquisition,
speech recognition, and simultaneous translation. The language project
exists within a larger Soar community (about 15 members at CMU, about 100
active researchers throughout the world). A person filling this position is
expected to make significant contributions to the design and implementation
of the system, as well as contribute to the intellectual life of the community.

Qualifications: Applicants should have a B.S.,  M.S. or  Ph.D. in computer
science or computational linguistics. THIS IS A SYSTEM-BUILDING POSTDOC, so a
very strong background in building systems is required.  Experience in both
language generation and comprehension is preferred. Basic knowledge of
machine learning techniques helpful. APPLICANT MUST BE ABLE TO START WORK
BY SEPTEMBER 1.

To apply: send a resume and names of three references to physical or
e-mail address above. Please have recommendations letters specifically
address the system building strengths and weaknesses of the applicant.

CMU is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer.

The Rover Technology Research Program at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory,
California Instite of Technlogy, is looking for a real-time systems
programmer.  This is a research program to build prototype Mars rovers
and develop technology and capabilities for upcoming missions to Mars.
For instance, our current efforts are in building Rocky 7, a 10kg
fully autonomous, rough terrain mobile robot.  Rocky 7 has a
3U VME chasis with 68040, A/D, DIO, framegrabber, peripheral LM629
motor control, 13 actuators, 6 cameras, etc.  Please see
http://robotics.jpl.nasa.gov/tasks/rovertech/homepage.html for more.

From: pete@voice.com (Peter J. Foster)
Subject: Speech Recognition Openings at VCS
Date: Sat, 29 Jul 1995 17:28:41 -0500


                VOICE CONTROL SYSTEMS,INC. HAS 18 JOB OPENINGS


        VCS is a leading firm in the business of developing and applying
automatic speech recognition (ASR).  VCS has been involved in the speech
business since 1978 and is the commercial benchmark for speaker-independent
speech recognizers.  VCS has fielded more than 250,000 speaker-independent
recognizers in over 40 languages, worldwide.  VCS is a publicly traded company
and is growing more than 40% annually.  Today VCS provides phonetic-based
continuous and discrete speech recognition in speaker-independent, speaker-
dependent, and speaker-adaptive variations as well as speaker verification
(voice-printing).
        VCS technology is at work in many commercial applications of ASR today.
VCS provides the technology for the Oki Semiconductor single chip speech
recognizer.  VCS is the ASR technology in the 1995 Mercedes-Benz voice
activated cellular phone.  VCS is the automation technology behind 1-800-
Collect, the cellular voice dialing technology in VoiceTouch at Cellular One
(McCaw Cellular) and the manufacturer of the VCS2060 home voice dialing
system.
        VCS is searching for individuals who will enjoy the fast paced, dynamicenvironment provided by this fast track leader in the industry.  Some of the
openings include:

        Vice-President of Marketing - Location: DAL-TX.  VCS is seeking an
experienced executive capable of leading the product marketing, marketing
communications, trade show co-ordination and product development. Software or
telecommunications backgrounds a must.  Degree required.

        Software Development Managers - Several openings for experienced
software managers.  BSEE or BSCS reqd.  Experience in speech processing or
telecommunications a plus.  Experience in real time systems and programs
helpful.

        Software QA Manager - Location:DAL-TX. Working directly for the Vice-
president of Software Development, this working manager will direct a small
but growing department, tasked with maintaining VCS quality reputation.

        DSP Development Engineers  - DAL-TX. Several openings exist for
programmers skilled in mathmatical programming in assembler and C.  Real time
systems experience a must.  BSEE or BSCS please.  Programs for speech
recognition are underway at VCS in Intel, TI, Oki, and Motorola environments.

        Technical Writers - DAL-TX.  Two openings for technical writers.
Responsibilities include applications notes, training literature, product
documentation, technical sales information and proposal response.  3-5 years
experience and some programming a requirement.  BSEE or BSCS preferred.

        Sales Account Managers - DAL-TX, GERMANY, SAN JOSE-CA.  Sales account
managers to sell and support VCS customers.  BSEE/BSCS or equilavent reqd.


Other openings soon.  VCS offers competitive saleries, great benefits
including medical and dental, 401k, 125 Cafeteria and employee stock plans.
Please respond by e-mail or fax.  We offer a great working environment where
you can see your work used in products people buy.




Mari Tanner - Mgr of HR   E-mail:  m_tanner@vcsi.com
Voice Control Systems, Inc.
14140 Midway Rd., Dallas, TX 75244
214-386-0300    Fax: 214-386-5555

MODELING AND FORECASTING

Key Words:   physic, mathematician, math, mathematics, applied math, applied
             physics, statistics, modeling, forecasting, artificial intelligence, AI

Job Description/Responsibilities:

      High-level research position offers an exciting opportunity for a highly
      intelligent and motivated individual in a successful, growing AI company in
      Maryland.  The company specializes in the R&D and application of forecasting,
      classification, and modeling technologies involving statistics, statistical
      pattern recognition, neural networks, genetic algorithms, fuzzy logic, chaos
      and fractal theory, expert systems, and hybrid systems.  Current projects
      include credit card activation modeling, site selection, fraud detection,
      biomedical pattern recognition applications, financial forecasting (stocks,
      currency, etc.), and portfolio optimization.  Responsibilities include
      involvement in the R&D, testing, and verification of all models and modeling
      systems developed for internal use and for clients.

Salary:

     The position offers an excellent salary and benefits commensurate with
     experience.

Requirements:

     MS or above (Ph.D. preferred) in Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related
     fields such as Biostatistics with at least 2 years experience.

Other Desirables:

       Experience with C/C++ programming, database programming, familiarity with
       statistical packages (e.g. SPSS, S-Plus), econometrics, applied mathematics and
       optimization.

Subject: Job: AI Applications to Education in Lisp at Univ. of Pittsburgh (PA)
Cc: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: suthers+@pitt.edu (Daniel D Suthers)
Subject: US-PA-Pitt: AI Programming (Lisp), Computer-based Learning, LRDC
Date: 31 Jul 1995 15:02:18 GMT
Organization: LRDC, University of Pittsburgh

==============================================================================
Systems Analyst Position: AI applications to Education in Lisp
Coaching, Explanation, etc. in Networked Computer-based Learning Environment
LRDC, University of Pittsburgh, Pittsburgh PA.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Position Description:

"Systems Analyst II", full time, 2 year position (assuming adequate
performance during 6 month provisional period) with possible renewal
contingent on funding.  ARPA funded project: "Collaboration, Apprenticeship,
and Critical Discussion: Groupware for Learning," Alan Lesgold, Sandy Katz,
Dan Suthers, and Arlene Weiner principal investigators.  Supervisor: Dan
Suthers. Start in September or October 1995.

The successful candidate will design, implement, and test various applications
of Artificial Intelligence techniques to education, including automated
coaches, problem solvers, explanation facilities, tutoring strategies, and
user modeling techniques. Work will most likely involve writing Common LISP
applications in a Unix environment. The functionality provided by these
applications will be made available by a server to client interfaces
implemented by other programmers on Mac or PC platforms. Hence interaction
with external programs and careful attention to memory management will be
required. Some implementation of AI functionality in other languages suitable
for client platforms may be required in cases where server-based functionality
is infeasible (e.g., for simulation engines which control real-time displays).
Ability to work well with other programmers who will be implementing the
server and user interfaces is essential.  Flexibility and quick response are
requisites, since this project is committed to revision and redesign as
needed, and to producing quick prototypes and usable systems in a relatively
short time.  Robustness of software will be achieved by group design
discussions, empirical testing, and scrutiny and possible revision of code by
others. Lone hackers need not apply.

Minimum Knowledge/Education: M.S. in Computer Science or equivalent
experience.

Minimum Experience Level: Prior experience with Common LISP and Artificial
Intelligence techniques is essential.  Successful participation in a
substantial multi-programmer software project.

Preferred Additional Experience: Prior experience in developing Intelligent
Tutoring Systems. Background in cognitive science, education, or the
psychology of learning.  Experience with CGI and/or client/server
communications.

Salary Range for Systems Analyst II: minimum 25,320, "control point" (beyond
which significant justification is required) 35,460. Excellent benefits.

We are also hiring for two other Systems Analyst positions. We reserve the
right to reallocate assignments and rewrite job descriptions to fit successful
candidates' qualifications and experience. Hence, if your background does not
match this description exactly but you have other experience that may be
relevant, you should read the other job postings.  If there is a match,
indicate in your application that your experience is relevant to a mixture of
the positions.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Duties, responsibilities, performance standards, and percentages of time:

 PLANNING: 20%
 Meet with project members to design the software and coordinate work with
other aspects of the project.
 Related Performance Standard: Ability to interact well with project members
from diverse backgrounds, including computer scientists, educators, and
psychologists, to evaluate needs, design systems, coordinate implementation,
and coordinate installation of the software in school sites.  Sufficient
understanding of software design techniques and project goals to contribute to
planning and design.

 PROGRAMMING: 50%
 See "Position Description."
 Related Performance Standard: Proficiency in Common Lisp and familiarity with
Artificial Intelligence techniques.  Use of modular, object oriented design
techniques.  Use of a code version control tool.  Be able to manage one's own
software development activities such that prototype modules and subsequent
improvements are available when they are needed for testing by other project
members.  Prioritize tasks and identify and discuss potential problems before
they impact on delivery deadlines.

 TESTING: 20%
 Thorough testing of implemented functionality under a variety of scenarios.
 Related Performance Standard: Ability to maintain test suites and conduct
tests in a systematic manner.

 DOCUMENTATION AND WRITING: 10%
 Code must be well documented. May be asked to write short reports on the
status, design, implementation, and testing of code.
 Related Performance Standard: Programming habits that include documentation
during the development process. Basic familiarity with word processing
software and willingness to learn new word processor. Ability to write clear,
concise documentation.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Further Information

WWW References:

  Project Home Page (new):      http://www.pitt.edu/~advlearn/
  LRDC:                         http://www.lrdc.pitt.edu/
  University of Pittsburgh:     http://www.pitt.edu/

About LRDC:

Since its founding in 1963, the Learning Research and Development Center
(LRDC) at the University of Pittsburgh has emerged as the leading research
institution for cognitive science and technology applied to education.  LRDC
faculty serve on numerous national advisory bodies, edit a number of scholarly
journals, and have served as officers of the leading scholarly associations in
their fields.  LRDC researchers helped introduce such ideas as individualized
instruction; criterion-referenced testing; using technology to enhance,
individualize and manage learning; and the student as an active learner who
constructs his or her own knowledge much as a scientist constructs socially
shared knowledge.  Today, LRDC researchers are leaders in many areas of
research and development, including basic processes of learning, learning in
the workplace, subject matter learning in school, and the improvement of
schooling.  Approximately $11 million worth of sponsored research projects are
managed by LRDC.

The Center has its own building, a nine-story facility.  The building is fully
networked with local Ethernet interconnected to the University backbone, which
is connected to the Internet with T3 bandwidth.  LRDC houses more than a dozen
high-end workstations and more than 200 personal computer systems.  In
addition to the shared University-wide file service (AFS), LRDC maintains four
very large Novell file servers on its premises, along with about a dozen
high-speed network printers.  Within the Center's building, sound and video
studio facilities permit authoring and editing of multimedia presentations,
including mastering of CD-ROM disks.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Applications:

Send queries and applications to:

                Dan Suthers

                Learning Research & Development Ctr.
                3939 O'Hara Street
                University of Pittsburgh
                Pittsburgh, PA  15260

                email: suthers+@pitt.edu
                voice: 412-624-7036
                fax: (412) 624-9149

individuals whom we may contact for references.  If you decide to become a
formal applicant, you MUST also submit an application to:

                Office of Human Resources, Employment Section
                200 S. Craig St.
                University of Pittsburgh
                Pittsburgh, PA  15260

CALL 412-624-8040 TO OBTAIN THE JOB NUMBER for this position (not assigned at
the time of this posting). PLACE THE JOB NUMBER ON THE UPPER RIGHT HAND CORNER
of your cover letter and resume. It is recommended that you also obtain and
fill out a "staff employment application": this will ensure that you are
considered for *any* relevant positions in the University.

Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: i.d.watson@surveying.salford.ac.uk (Ian Watson)
Date: Wed, 02 Aug 95 15:30:55 GMT
Organization: University of Salford

There is a vacancy for a lectureship in IT applied to construction at the
University of Salford UK.

Briefly, the person should have a background in civil engineering, surveying
or architecture and research interests in expert systems, neural nets,
case-based reasoning, virtual reality or OOPS.

More details are attached.
BEGIN -- Cut Here -- cut here
                      UNIVERSITY OF SALFORD

                     DEPARTMENT OF SURVEYING

                       M E M O R A N D U M


                   LECTURER IN CONSTRUCTION IT


Applications are invited from suitably qualified academics and/or
professionals for a post in this 5A research rated department.
A person with IT experience ideally combined with a strong
construction background is sought to teach at both postgraduate
and undergraduate level, especially in the area of strategic IT
management. Candidates should have research experience and a
publishing track record.  Further particulars and application
forms available from the Personnel Office, University of Salford, Salford, M5 4W
T. UK

Closing Date 18th August 1995



                      UNIVERSITY OF SALFORD
                     Department of Surveying

          Chairman of Department: Professor P S Barrett

APPOINTMENT OF LECTURER IN CONSTRUCTION IT

A Construction IT professional, with energy and enthusiasm for
education and research, is required to join the team of lecturers
in the Surveying Department.

A strong construction background with some practical experience
would be ideal and familiarity with one or more of the following
is sought, STEP and other classification systems, expert systems, case-based rea
soning, neural networks, Virtual Reality, applications software such as AutoCADor Superproject.

Applicants should preferably possess a good Honours degree in an
appropriate discipline and will probably have a postgraduate
qualification. Evidence of research experience and a publication
track record is sought.


The Post

The successful applicant will be expected to contribute to
undergraduate and postgraduate teaching in IT in Construction and
to join a multi-disciplinary research group. Teaching duties will
be geared, as far as possible, to the successful candidate's own
particular specialisms and most courses within the Department
have a large IT element.

Beyond teaching, a range of skills is required to encompass
research and publication and postgraduate supervision, as the
Department has large numbers of full-time and part-time research
postgraduates many of whom have an IT focus.


The Department

The Department of Surveying was established in August 1990 having
previously been a division within the Department of Civil
Engineering.  In August 1991 the Department expanded to
accommodate the Construction Management Unit.

The Chairman of the Department is Professor P S Barrett.
There are 2 other Professors
                    -    Professor P S Brandon
                    -    Professor G Brown
and 19 full time Academics.

There are  4 undergraduate courses in the Department:

     a)   BSc(Hons) in Building Surveying

     b)   BSc(Hons) in Construction Management (fully sponsored
          course)

     c)   BSc(Hons) in Quantity Surveying

     d)   BSc(Hons) in Property Development & Asset Management


and in addition there are two specialist Construction IT
postgraduate courses

     (i)  MSc in IT for Property and Construction - mainly full
     time for individual students

     (ii) MSc in Construction IT (IGDS) - mainly part time for
     company sponsorship.


The Department is situated in the newly refurbished Bridgewater
Building which is on the Meadow Road complex adjacent to the
River Irwell and separated from the main campus by a 5 minute
walk through the park.

The Department has well developed links with industry which
provides input to the undergraduate courses and the research
activity currently undertaken.  It presently works with over
eighty firms.

The University merges with University College Salford, which is
on an adjacent campus, on 1st August 1996.  The Department of
Construction and Surveying at the College offer only part-time
degree courses and following merger the Department of Surveying
will offer its four existing full time undergraduate courses plus
the part-time courses currently offered by the College.


Undergraduate Courses

The Quantity and Building Surveying courses were validated for
a further 7 years in 1993 by the Royal Institution of Chartered
Surveyors and afford graduates full exemption from the
Institution's examinations.  The Department holds RICS Accredited
Centre status.  The Construction Management course is recognised
by the Chartered Institute of Building for exemption purposes.

All courses in the Department became modularised in October 1993
and in common with the rest of the University follow a pattern
of 2 semesters which currently fit into the 3 term pattern still
followed by year 4 of the old schemes.  Modularised Surveying
courses can be either a full time 3 year or 4 year integrated
sandwich course whilst the Construction Management Course is a
4 year 'thin' sandwich course with 6 months of each of the first
three years spent with the sponsoring contractor.  The Property
Development course is a 3 year full time course and gains
exemption from the general practice professional examinations of
the RICS.


Postgraduate Courses and Programmes

In 1990 an MPhil programme for building surveyors was launched
supported by 28 firms and this programme takes around 15
graduates per year mainly on a part time basis the success of
this has led to similar MPhil programmes for Construction
Management and Quantity Surveying.  In the same year the
University launched a fully self-funded Master's Degree Course
in Information Technology for Property and Construction with a
substantial grant from Unisys.  This course provides exemption
from Part 1 of the British Computer Society examination.

The number of full time postgraduate students has grown
considerably in recent years and there are presently well over
100 postgraduates working in the Department including Research
Fellows, Research Assistants, Research Students and students on
the taught Postgraduate courses.  In October 1995 the new IGDS
(Integrated Graduate Development Scheme) in Construction IT takes
its first delegates onto its part-time modular masters programme.


International Activities

International activities are wide and varied and many countries
are requesting assistance from, or collaboration with, the
Department, particularly in the areas covered by the Department's
work in Construction IT.  It has one of the strongest research
and postgraduate groups in the world in this area of academic
expertise.

The Department has featured significantly in the technical press
and is represented strongly on regional national and
international committees.


Departmental Research Activities

The Department was awarded a 5A research rating in the 1992 UFC
Research Selectivity Exercise the highest possible rating,
indicating a world class research programme.

A recent development has been the formation of the National
Centre of Excellence for Construction IT which is a government
authorised implementation body for national strategy based in the
Department. It is a collaborative venture between Industry &
Research Institutions to develop a research work plan for the UK
Construction Industry.

Over the past 3 years the Department has received research grants
from a variety of bodies such as EPSRC, DTI, DoE,  European
Commission and others.  Its research has been particulary strong
in the area of Property and Construction Information Technology
but there are other research strengths in Facilities Management,
Building Management and Economics European Occupational Health
& Safety Law, Materials Science and Management of Construction
Organisations.

The University has formed 6 Research Institutes under the
leadership of Professor Peter Brandon, the former Chairman of
this Department, who has been appointed to the position of Pro-Vice-Chancellor (
Research).  These cross former Departmental
boundaries and the TIME (Technology, Information Management and
Economics) Research Institute is the one in which most members
of this Department belong within the Research Centre for the
Built and Human Environment. Associate membership of any of the
other Research Institutes is encouraged. The Construction IT
group has existing strengths in Virtual Reality, Case based
reasoning, Knowledge based expert systems, Integration, IT
Management and Process Modelling.  An applicant with interests
in these or other related areas would be particularly welcome.



END -- Cut Here -- cut here

From: John Paisley <J.M.Paisley@ncl.ac.uk>
Subject: Assistant Professorships in Cognitive neuroscience, neural networks or behavioural ecology
Date: Tue, 01 Aug 1995 13:29:29 +0100
Organization: University of Newcastle (UK)

                  UNIVERSITY OF NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE

                      DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHOLOGY

         Assistant Professorships in Cognitive neuroscience, 
              neural networks or behavioural ecology 


Applications from suitably qualified and experienced scientists are invited for 
two lectureships in this enthusiastic and expanding department. Candidates 
should have a good honours degree, a doctorate, knowledge of computing and 
multivariate data analysis, and a record of research activity in published 
papers and research support. Applicants who will contribute to three of our 
areas of research: cognitive, sensory and systems neuroscience, 
neural network computing, and behavioural ecology are particularly encouraged.
Excellent research facilities and support will be provided. Salary will 
be on the Lecturer Grade A/B Scale (to GBP26,430), at a position determined 
by qualifications and experience. 

The Department of Psychology at Newcastle is broadly-based and rapidly growing.
All undergraduate courses offered by the Department are heavily over-subscribed
and the Department's postgraduate research community is the fastest growing of 
any in the university. Staff have research programs in cognitive neuroscience, 
behavioural ecology, and applied, occupational, health, social and cognitive 
psychology. The Department is also the home of the Neural Systems Group, an 
interdisciplinary centre for research in sensory, systems, computational and 
cognitive neuroscience, and neural network computing. The members of the Neural 
Systems Group are drawn from the Departments of Psychology, Physiological 
Sciences and the School of Neurosciences. Further details of the department and 
the Neural Systems Group can be found on the WWW at 

http://york37.ncl.ac.uk/www/psychol.html

No forms of application will be issued. Applications should take the form of a 
covering letter and three copies of the applicant's full curriculum vitae, 
with details of present salary and the names and addresses of three referees.
Informal enquiries may be made to Prof. Malcolm Young (0191-222-7525, 
mpy%crunch@ncl.ac.uk). Applications should be sent to: the Director of 
Personnel, University of Newcastle upon Tyne, NE1 7RU.

From: alison@dcs.gla.ac.uk (Alison Cawsey)
Subject: 2 RA Posts (Scotland): AI in Patient Education
Organization: Computing Science Dept., Glasgow University, Glasgow, Scotland
Date: Tue, 1 Aug 1995 16:21:46 GMT


			RA Positions
	
	Departments of Computing Science and Public Health
	             University of Glasgow

Two 3 year research associate posts are available to work on on
an EPSRC funded project looking at the use of text planning
and user modelling techniques in the provision of interactive
personalised health education materials. The starting dates
will be negotiable, but will be between October 1995 and April 1996.

One post is available on the UK RA 1A scale (around 16000 pa,
according to age and experience), and the other on the RA 1B
scale (around 14300 pa). Candidates for the 1A post will normally
have a higher degree in a relevant area, and will be expected to
work mainly on the development of the techniques for the appropriate
selection and presentation of interactive personalised
health information. The ideal candidate would have experience
in Lisp programming, and in developing practical natural language
generation or explanation systems.

Candidates for the 1B post will normally have 
a good honours degree in Computing Science or a Health related
area, and preferably an MSc in a relevant area (e.g., HCI, AI, Medical
Informatics or Public Health). Some medical knowledge would be
an advantage, but is not essential. The 1B RA  will be expected to 
collaborate with health professionals in the development and evaluation 
of prototype systems. There may be opportunities to register for a higher 
degree.

The closing date for applications is 1st September.

Some further details of the posts and the project are
available from "http://www.dcs.gla.ac.uk/~alison/job.html"
or by emailing alison@dcs.glasgow.ac.uk.

Letters of application should be sent together with a copy of a recent
CV to:

        Dr Alison Cawsey,
        Department of Computing Science,
        University of Glasgow,
        Glasgow, G12 8QQ.
        Email: alison@dcs.glasgow.ac.uk

Subject: Job: Speech Recognition, NLU, OCR at BBN (Cambridge, MA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: knichols@bbn.com (BBN in Cambridge)
Subject: Positions in Speech and Natural Languages
Date: 1 Aug 1995 18:28:42 GMT
Organization: Bolt Beranek & Newman


Job Openings in Speech and Language Processing
BBN Systems and Technologies
10 Moulton St. 
Cambridge, MA  02138

The Speech and Language Processing Department at Bolt Beranek and 
Newman Inc. has several exciting positions in speech recognition, 
language understanding and character recognition.  To apply send your
resume and indication of which position you are interested in to
Karen Nicholson (knicholson@bbn.com)


Positions:

Algorithm Developer  
   Work with a research team designing and implementing algorithms for
large vocabulary continuous speech recognition, systems incorporating
voice input and output such as spoken language systems, and optical
character recognition.  Requirements include Master's in computer
science, mathematics, engineering, or related field or equivalent
expereince and excellent programming skills in C/C++ and UNIX.
Background in one or more of the following areas desirable:
statistical modeling, pattern recognition, speech processing,
character recognition.  Knowledge of LISP, SPlus, and Perl a plus.

Applied Computational Linguist
   Work with a research team to develop fieldable technology including
advance prototypes and products in information extraction systems,
including name recognition and template fill from newswire.
Experience in applying computational linguistics to real applications,
excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp, and degree in computer
science or related field required.  U.S. Citizenship and willingness
to get a DoD clearance required.

Statistical Computational Linguist
   Reserach and development of new techniques and software for
processing large corpora, including languages other than English, and
language modeling for speech and NL systems.  Masters or PhD in
computer science or related area, strong math/stat background, strong
C programming skills required. Experience in Lisp, Splus, Perl
a plus.  U.S. Citizenship and fluency in a second language desirable.

Applications Engineer
   Design and implement applications at the cutting edge of speech and
language technology, such as medical dictation, reading and language
learning assistants, transcription of telephone speech for deaf
listeners, topic identification from video, voice mail transcription,
information extraction systems.  Requirements: Extensive experience in
advance technology software systems, including product-level code and
documentation; master level programmer in C/C++, with at least one
year's experience each in Unix and MS Windows; experience in graphical
user interfaces; Bachelor's or Masters degree in computer science.
Lisp experience helpful.  Experience in fields related to speech and
natural language a plus.  U.S. Citizenship and willingness
to get a DoD clearance desirable.

Entry Level Researcher
   Participate in a research group developing algorithms and building
systems for advanced speech and language technologies, provide support
by implementing algorithms, running experiments, collecting and
analyzing data.  Bachelor's level in computer science, engineering, or
related field, excellent undergraduate GPA, experience in university
research lab or summer internship, and programming skills in C/C++ and
UNIX required.  Some experience in speech or language technology a
plus.  U.S. Citizenship and willingness to get a DoD clearance
desirable.


The Speech and Language Processing Department of BBN Systems and
Technologies, a subsidiary of Bolt Beranek and Newman Inc. (NYSE:BBN),
has been a world leader in computer-based speech and language research
and development for 25 years.  The department continues to make
cutting-edge advances in the areas of speech recognition, speaker and
language identification, natural language understanding, interactive
spoken language systems, and data extraction from text.
 


****************************************************************************
***

These positions are DC-based. 


The department is involved in a number of projects emphasizing high tech
approaches to understanding natural language, including English, Spanish,
German, and Chinese.  The projects range from basic research through
advanced development, and from demonstrations to products.  We are looking
for a few exceptional people.


APPLIED COMPUTATIONAL LINGUIST

Work within a team to develop information extraction systems, 
including name recognition and template fill from newswire, and from
transcribed speech.  
Requirements:
	Two years experience in applying computational linguistics to real
		applications 
	Excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp
	Experience with statistical approaches is a plus.
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


MASTER PROGRAMMER

Work within a team to design and implement applications at the cutting edge
of speech and 
language technology, such as information extraction systems, document
handling technology, and topic identification from video.
Requirements:
	Master level programmer in C/C++
	Breadth of programming tasks, including product-level code and
		documentation 
	At least one year's experience each in Unix and MS Windows.
	Experience with delivery of operational systems.
	Experience in implementing graphical user interfaces
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


ENTRY LEVEL RESEARCHER

Provide support to a team by running experiments, implementing algorithms,
and analyzing performance. 
Requirements:
	Bachelor's or Masters degree in computer science
	Excellent C, C++ programming ability
	Lisp programming ability
	At least eight computer science courses
	High undergraduate GPA (3.6 or above)
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


STATISTICAL LANGUAGE MODELER

Research and development of new techniques for statixitcal modeling of
language.  Processing large corpora, including languages other than English.
Requirements:
	Two years experience in applying statistical techniques to
		language  processing.
	Excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp.
	Strong statistics/pattern recognition background.
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance




Desirable qualifications for all of the above, if available:

	Strong desire to excel, not just succeed
	Type A personality
	Security Clearance of TS SI with lifestyle polygraph 
	Level 3 reading ability in reading a second language (e.g., Chinese,
		Thai, Spanish, 	Arabic, or Japanese) 
	Experience with a programming team, not just one-person projects
********************
Karen Nicholson
knicholson@bbn.com

                        NATURAL LANGUAGE DEVELOPER
                               (New York)

U.S. or Canadian citizenship required, or U.S. permanent residency.
Unfortunately, we are unable to assist persons requiring visa sponsorship.

The Speech Services Technology Group has an opening for a developer 
with significant experience in building Natural Language Understanding 
systems.

This group designs and deploys state-of-the-art interacive speech 
recognition and language understanding systems.  Spoken language 
systems combine a recognition framework with natural language and 
discourse modeling capabilities to provide the uninitiated caller with 
an elegant, powerful, and easy-to-use interface to various 
applications, using a standard telephone.  Opportunities for applying 
this technology to multimedia and to text processing may also arise. 

Qualifications:

At least an MS in Computer Science, Linguistics, or related field.

At least 3 years experience, either commercial or academic, directly 
involved in the development of robust natural language systems.

Significant software development experience, most preferably in C or 
C++.

Experience with relevant statistical techniques.

Familiarity with related fields, such as speech recognition, signal 
processing, relevant real time programming issues, and user interface 
design for speech and language systems, are all pluses.

Experience and maturity in conceptualization, software design, and 
software engineering.

Ability to work in a cohesive team.

Strong motivation to excel.

            ** Minimum 3 years on-the-job experience required**

Unreasonable Ambitions?

Easily satisfied visions have no place at Hewlett-Packard's Corporate Research
Centre in Bristol, UK . Here, more than two hundred researchers from all
over Europe (and beyond) work together to achieve research goals which
will lead to new products for the company in three to five years time.

The Model Based Systems Department is one research group within this
organisation. We are currently looking for a number of new people to help us
shape the future of personal computation and communication. Mobile
communications technology combined with portable computation provides a rich
environment for supportingc distributed teamwork. As a department we aim to
provide software support to give such teams the functionality they need.

The MBSD contains projects working on advanced services for specific domains
(healthcare and financial), and is forming projects which will focus on
developing appropriate technologies to be used across domains. One of these
will focus on the technologies required to support the computational
requirements of advanced services.

Our goal is to support the work of teams of professionals by providing
easy and effective access to personalised communication and computation.
Since we believe that in general people will still want to use a variety
of types of terminal (from pagers to PCs), we aim to ensure that users no
longer view their devices (phone, laptop, pc, etc.) as separate, but
instead as different access tools on a single workspace. Both unstructured
and structured data will be communicated, and structured data will be
manipulated by applications within the user's personal workspace. We believe
that agent technologies may have an important contribution to make to the
fulfilment of this vision.

We aim to combine development of short-term solutions to
problems with a longer-term research programme, looking at the issues which
arise from the work. We anticipate that Agent based programming will provide
some insights into these issues. In particular, the concept of an "agent as
proxy", acting on behalf of an individual who is "away", will be very
important.


Job Description

We are looking for a software architect - a graduate with
several years experience of prototype development in a high level programming
language. This person will take responsibility for the design and
implementation of a series of prototype services and applications in
different domains. Experience with Smalltalk would be preferred, although
enthusiasm for the project and willingness to learn a new language is also
acceptable.

In return for your commitment and creativity we offer the opportunity to work
with some of the best technical people in multi-disciplinary teams. You will
have access to excellent resources, and will be a part of an extremely
successful and diverse multi-national company, with all the attendant
opportunities for personal growth and development. Our salary and benefits
package will meet the expectations of the highest calibre people.

For more information, or to discuss the possibilities further, please contact
Janet Bruten (jlb@hplb.hpl.hp.com, 0117-922-8700). Alternatively, contact our
Human Resources Recruitment Specialist, Alison Pritchett, at the address below,
with your CV and a covering letter.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hewlett-Packard Labs  |         0117-922-8700 direct
Filton Road           |  FAX:   0117-922-8972

Subject: Job: Expert Systems at Resource Management Software, Inc. (Tacoma, WA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: Resource Management Software <rmsoft@halcyon.com>
Subject: C/C++ programmer wanted
Date: 9 Aug 1995 04:45:57 GMT
Organization: Northwest Nexus Inc.

                         RECRUITMENT BULLETIN

                     POSITION: Programmer Trainee
                   SALARY RANGE: $16,000 to $23,000

                  PROMOTION POTENTIAL TO: Programmer
                   SALARY RANGE: $24,000 to $29,000

COMPANY DESCRIPTION: Resource Management Software, Inc.  is a
Tacoma-based firm producing expert system software in the human
resource/personnel management area which includes, among others, the
following capabilities: occupational and pay level analysis, generation
of position descriptions, job analysis, recruitment criteria, employee
development plans, and performance expectations.  RMS's primary market
is in the federal sector with state and local governments as secondary.
RMS clients include a wide array of federal agencies using our systems
on an agency-wide scale.

DUTIES OF THE POSITION: This position is designed as part of a broader
career ladder of positions which provide RMS with the technical
programming skills and capability to provide a broad array of products
and services in the HR field.  The position will initially perform in
an assistant capacity and advance as skills and knowledges are acquired
and performance dictates.  The position will perform the following
duties:

 - Aid in designing expert systems software in the human
   resources/personnel management area.
 - Programming expert systems software in the human resources/personnel
   management area using the C/C++ programming languages with MS-DOS and
   Microsoft Windows as the target environment.
 - Testing prototype software and revising the software for the final
   version.
 - Developing user manuals and training and marketing materials.
 - Providing one-on-one customer support.
 - Marketing of human resources/personnel management software to potential
   clients including federal government agencies by attending conferences,
   symposia, and on-site installation visits.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum requirements include attainment of a
baccalaureate degree or higher in either Computer Engineering, Computer
Science, Mathematics, Engineering OR the substitution of education for
experience may be permitted in cases where the applicant can
demonstrate substantive skill in programming.  Minimum qualifying
experience must show ability to: analyze problems, gather pertinent
data, and recognize/design solutions; apply sound judgement; plan and
organize work; and effectively communicate orally and in writing.

FACTORS WHICH WILL BE CONSIDERED IN EVALUATING QUALIFIED CANDIDATES:

 - Knowledge of computer requirements and techniques pertinent to systems
   analysis and computer programming.
 - Knowledge of object-oriented application development theories,
   principles, and techniques.
 - Ability to program using the following computer programming languages:
   C and C++ in the MS-DOS and Microsoft Windows environment.
 - Ability to communicate, both orally and in writing, with confidence and
   poise, in developing information and solutions to problems or questions
   relating to work, in documenting complex details clearly, and in
   documenting judgements regarding the selection of appropriate guides or
   precedent decisions.
 - Ability to gather facts and use effective, analytical, and evaluative
   methods to accurately assess information, and make sound
   recommendations.
 - Ability to work in rapidly changing environments in which the
   organization serviced, technology used to accomplish work, and
   deadlines, assignments, and priorities change quickly.
 - Ability to actively listen to the needs of others, evaluating
   information and situations, and provide feedback which is constructive
   and enhances work products and relationships.

RECRUITMENT PROCESS:

1.  Applicants should submit a resume and/or SF 171 with the following
information clearly outlined in the submittal:

 ...educational background
 ...work experience in the software development field
 ...salary history
 ...at least three work related references with current telephone numbers

2.  Submittals will be screened and qualified applicants will be
contacted to respond to the recruitment criteria outlined above through
a structured, supplemental, written application process.  Applicant
references will be contacted after submittals are screened and before
applicants are invited to participate further in the process.
Applicants will be required to submit samples of written work products
with their supplemental application.

3.  Supplemental applications and work samples will be reviewed to
select the applicants invited to interview in the phase one interview.

4.  Following analysis of the phase one interview results, selected
applicants will be invited to the phase two interview/assessment
process.  Final selections will be made from this group of applicants
based upon the phase two results.

OTHER IMPORTANT FACTS ABOUT THE POSITION:

Travel Requirement of 10-25% within the U.S.
Location: Tacoma, Washington
Tour of Duty: Permanent Full Time
Probationary Period: One year, Subject to Extension Based Upon
   Performance
Health and Retirement Benefits Generally Subject to Successful
Performance in the First Year
Promotion Potential to Programmer within Two Years
	
HOW TO APPLY:

Submit your resume and/or SF 171 to:
Resource Management Software, Inc.
Attention: Office Manager
9500 Front Street, Suite 210
Tacoma, Washington 98409

If you have inquiries regarding this recruitment, please submit them in
writing with your resume.

DEADLINE FOR RESUME AND/OR SF 171 SUBMISSIONS IS AUGUST 25, 1995

POSITION TARGETED FILL DATE IS SEPTEMBER 1,  1995


Resource Management Software, Inc.  is an equal opportunity employer.
RMS strives to be an employer of choice, offering its workforce an
opportunity to be considered and selected based upon merit and advanced
based upon performance.  The RMS human resource philosophy embodies the
concepts of shared power, leadership, and vision with an emphasis on
providing substantive and substantial value to its customers in every
product and service we deliver.  RMS believes that each employee is an
integral part of our service delivery and that each makes unique
contributions which, through team efforts, provides value to the client
organizations we serve.  We hope you will consider this opportunity to
join in our efforts.

Subject: Job: Knowledge-based AI at NASA Ames (Moffett Field, CA)
Cc: ai+lisp-jobs@CS.CMU.EDU
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: lowry@minkowski.arc.nasa.gov (Michael Lowry)
Subject: NASA Ames S/W Engineer for Automatic Programming Project
Organization: NASA/Ames Information Sciences
Date: Wed, 9 Aug 1995 03:20:52 GMT


Background:

The goal of the Amphion project is to make knowledge-based software
enginnering (KBSE) a reality for NASA. KBSE uses techniques from
artificial intelligence and formal methods to raise the level at which
users program to the specification level (what is the problem to be
solved) rather than the detailed code level (how to solve a problem). 
Programs are generated automatically from specifications.

The Amphion system is a general-purpose KBSE system that has been
applied to several NASA domains: space science observation geometries
(Amphion/NAIF), space shuttle navigation (Amphion/TOT), and
computational fluid dynamics (Amphion/CFD). The most mature of these
applications - Amphion/NAIF - has generated software currently in
use by space scientists. One example is a visualizer for the 1995/1996 
Saturn Ring crossing, when Saturn's rings appear edge-on to the earth,
thus providing unique observation opportunities. 

More information can be found on the WWW at 
       http://ic-www.arc.nasa.gov/ic/projects/amphion/index.html

We are currently expanding Amphion from a research system to a robust
industrial-quality system that will be distributed to various NASA 
user communities.

Job Description and Requirements:

We are seeking an experienced software engineer who has had
significant system-building and customer support responsibilities on 
software projects. The major job responsibilities will be to continue
development and refinement of the user interfaces; system building,
robustifying, and maintenance; and working directly with
customers. In the next year customers will mostly be space
scientists and engineers working on unmanned missions such as 
Galileo (Jupiter), Cassini (Saturn), and Mars Surveyor, and New
Millennium. Secondary responsibilities will be to support and 
participate in research aimed at next-generation KBSE systems.

The base qualification for this job is previous project experience 
building and maintaining UNIX-based software systems, and subsequent
customer support. Experience with Lisp and X-Windows is a plus.
Good candidates should be well organized, highly motivated, and able
to learn quickly. This job offers significant technical growth.
The following is a partial list of sciences and technologies that are 
relevant to this job; we expect most of these to be learned on the job
(please mention previous training or experience):

Solar System Astronomy, celestial mechanics, automated theorem proving,
knowledge representation and acquisition, formal specification languages,
Lisp, CLOS (common lisp object system), user interface technologies 
including Garnet, Motif, HTML (Word Wide Web) and X-WIndows, 
and application languages including Fortran and C++.

Salary will be commensurate with experience and education.
This is a full-time permanent position, available immediately.
US citizenship or green card status is required. The bulk of 
the work will be performed on site at NASA Ames Research Center
in Silicon Valley (the south San Francisco bay area).

To apply:

Please send an electronic copy of a cover-letter and resume
or curriculum vitae (ASCII or Postscript) to

        lowry@ptolemy.arc.nasa.gov

If you are unable to send email, a hardcopy of your resume can be 
mailed to:

Dr. Michael Lowry
MS 269-2
NASA Ames Research Center
Moffett Field, CA 94035

Preliminary interviews will be held either by telephone, in the
Silicon Valley area, or at IJCAI'95.

From: occ@iquest.net (OCC Remote 1)
Subject: US-CA - Software Engineer/Windows Dev - Wonderware
Organization: Online Career Center
Date: Tue, 8 Aug 1995 12:15:53 GMT

SOFTWARE ENGINEER
Windows Developer
 
Wonderware is the leading supplier of industrial automation
software for use within manufacturing environments.  Our man-
machine interface (MMI) products run on IBM PC and compatible
computers in industrial and process automation applications.
 
Our Rubicon Technology Division currently comprises only three
people, but is poised for substantial growth due to the extreme
success of our product InSupport and its massive future potential.
 
This presents a "being in the right place at the right time, best
of both worlds" opportunity, in that you will be working in a
closely-knit, extremely entrepreneurial, non-bureaucratic environ-
ment, but with the backing and support of one of the fastest
growing software companies in the country.
 
Working closely with the original developers of the product, you
will "jump right in" on the development of a major rewrite of
InSupport.  InSupport is a Windows based diagnostics and
documentation tool, used for supporting industrial processes and
equipment.
 
On a day-to-day basis, you will work in C++ with MFC, to develop an
embeddable, easily extensible, portable expert systems engine that
access a relational database.  You will also create tools that
allow development end users to embed their existing documents in
our product or vice versa.  The overall strategy is to move in the
direction of general connectivity from our system to a host of
multimedia authoring tools.
 
To be considered for this position, you will need to have: at least
3 years of C++ and Windows based software development background;
experience in all aspects of development including designing the
architecture, user interfaces, document formats, etc.; and good
oral and written communication skills.
 
For more information, send your resume with salary history to:
Wonderware, Human resources Dept. EB/SE/JT, 100 Technology Drive,
Irvine, CA 92718.  FAX: 714-453-6778.  
 
E-mail: ernieb@wonderware.com.  EOE.

Immediate Openings for Computer and Engineering Professionals

CAEtech is a fast growing engineering consultancy. We have doubled during the past year and continue accelerating growth. We need experienced personnel for the following positions.

**********************************************************************************
Title: Knowledge Engineer

Description: Conduct knowledge acquisition; design and implement expert systems; do testing and technical documentation.

determination.  And with our increasingly expanding line of cutting edge
products and services, we are moving into the future with limitless
opportunities. 
 
The Position: 
Senior Engineer 
Individual contributor implementing the software architecture for a new
technology. The individual is responsible for the development, verification
and documentation of the software components used for the product. 
The position requires an individual with a broad base of software
engineering experience including: good oral and written communication
skills, top-down and modular design techniques, network protocols, previous
development in multi-threaded operating system environments, and knowledge
in AI-based or robotics software design. Strong debugging skills and
experience with scripting languages necessary. The individual must be
self-motivated and capable of working within an aggressive product
development team. 
 
Required Skills 
Degree: minimum BSEE or BSCS. 
Software Design Experience: 6+ years. 
Operating Systems: Windows 3.1, OS/2 or NT required-Win95, Unix a plus.
Language requirements: 2+ C++, 5+ C. 
Other: experience with DDE, OLE, GUI, network protocols required-knowledge
of security algorithms, AI-based software, enterprise management a plus.
