Medical, Dental, Short- and Long-term Disability, and Life Insurances;
Flexible Spending Medical and Dependent Care Reimbursements Accounts; 22
paid leave days and 11 paid holidays in the first year; Maternity/Paternity
Leave of Absence; 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan; an Employee Stock Purchase
Plan; Tuition reimbursement; and Flextime Work Schedules.  
 
Company paid relocation!

Subject: Job: Lisp/NLP Team Leader at Citibank (Wall St, NYC)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU


Citibank, N.A.
Global Finance Operations and Technology
Funds Transfer Network Systems and Technology
111 Wall Street, New York, NY 10043

Position:  
   Artificial Intelligence/LISP Application Developer/Team Leader

We are looking for an individual with a background in AI and 
Natural Language Processing application development to lead 
our team of AI technologists. The Funds Transfer Network Systems 
and Technology group creates and maintains the open distributed 
systems used for Citibank's electronic funds transfer activities 
and consists of DEC VAXs running VMS, and Sun/Unix applications. 

FTN S&T has been using NLP applications in production since 
1986 for reading and repairing funds transfer messages.  Our
applications include the ATRANS message processing system
from Cognitive Systems as well as several others built in-house.

The position will have three primary areas of responsibility:

1. Lead a group of AI/LISP developers in a role as lead technologist and 
   team leader
2. Design and implement new functionality in new and existing AI applications
3. Support installed AI applications in production

The application work will include development using UNIX and VMS operating 
systems. The ideal candidate will have the following skills and professional
experience: 

  5+ years of AI/Natural Language Processing application development 
  2+ years of team and project management
  Strong LISP programming skills
  Strong interpersonal and communication skills
  Expertise with Unix and/or VMS

Although not required, experience in any of the following areas would 
represent a major plus:

  Financial applications background
  Client/Server application development
  X-Windows/Motif
  Object oriented design and analysis
  Experience with OLTP applications

The salary range is variable, from $45K to $100K depending on
experience.

This announcement is coming from the FTN S&T Project Managers,
not from Citibank Human Resources.  We're happy to answer any
questions about the department, the job, what it's like to work
for a bank (for instance, we don't wear suits) and most of all
we would like to see resumes (including salary requirements) from
interested parties.

Contact:                 Greg Parkinson
e-mail:			 glp@fig.citib.com
Telephone:               212-657-7814

Contact:                 Sharon Seevers
e-mail:			 seevers@fig.citib.com
Telephone:               212-657-7405

NW-Test Lead/NLP Group

natural human languages.  This work could eventually revolutionize how
people interact with computers. 
Primary responsibilities for the test lead position include creating and
executing test plans to test Natural Language deliverables on Windows and
Macintosh platforms.  This includes leading the design and development of
automation test strategy; participating in ongoing design and product code
reviews; and providing direction and leadership to NL test team.

demonstrated knowledge of C/C++, and preferably knowledge of OLE 2.0,
previous experience in shipping software, lead experience and a solid
understanding of software testing.  Strong background with windows
interfaces,  experience with MS Test/Visual Basic, and MAC experience
preferred.    A BA/BS degree in Computer Science is preferred. Base plus
bonus plus stock options.

Inc.  We specialize in jobs for software engineers, SQA, product managers,
etc.  Our client companies are nationwide, and range from small start-ups to

commercial software products for Windows, NT, Macintosh, OS/2 and Unix based
platforms.

a client-server environment.
Salaries for above between $55K and $75K.

Please, only those with relevant work experience. Having a recent
degree and no experience will only be a waste of your time and
mine. We agree it's unfair, but our clients want what they want.

Also, only those who have the right to work in the United States.
No foreign students without green cards, please!

Subject: software engineer wanted
Date: 23 Aug 1995 10:23:31 GMT
Organization: ULB

                       Software Engineers wanted
    C++ / constraint programming / OO / Unix / Brussels

The Service de Mathematiques de la Gestion (SMG) of the
Universite Libre de Bruxelles (ULB) is currently looking for
software engineers.

The environment

The SMG is a department of the Universite Libre de Bruxelles (ULB)
devoted to research in Operations Research and Decision Aid Systems.
Around september 95, it will start an applied research project in the
field of long term human resources scheduling in collaboration with
two private companies. This project will involve constraint-based
reasoning techniques, object-orientation and advanced GUI design.
We are currently looking for flexible software specialists who can
perform activities ranging from research, analysis, design and
implementation to support and training. These positions offer the
opportunity to gather experience with innovative technologies and to
apply it to practical problems in the industry.

Applicant's profile

The applicants will have:
- a degree or PhD in Computer Science or a related topic
- a good knowledge of Unix, C++, object-oriented design and analysis
- a strong interest for problem-solving software
- a significant work experience in software development (at least 2 years)
- good communication skills in at least two of the following languages:
  English, Dutch, French.

The following skills are also desired:
- working experience in constraint-based reasoning or related AI techniques
- knowledge of ILOG SOLVER and ILOG VIEWS C++ class libraries
- experience in scheduling systems and combinatorial problems
- knowlegde of RDBMS

If you wish to join our team, send your resume. Please, enclose detailed
information about your education, work experience, language fluency,
expected remuneration, etc.

Universite Libre de Bruxelles
Service de Mathematiques de la Gestion
c/o Pierre Jacques
CP 210/01
boulevard du Triomphe
1050 Brussels
Belgium
Fax: +32 2 240 07 91
email : pjacques@ulb.ac.be

Subject: Job: AI/Machine Learning/Prolog at Lockheed Data Mining Group 
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: JOBS@LMSC.LOCKHEED.COM (Lockheed Staffing)
Subject: AI jobs/Recon/Lockheed Martin Research Labs
Date: 25 Aug 1995 23:48:47 GMT
Organization: Lockheed Martin Missiles & Space

The Lockheed Martin Data Mining Group is growing rapidly.  Now 
is the time to get involved in this terrific growth 
opportunity.  In addition to doing contract research in data 
analysis techniques and systems, the Data Mining Group is 
developing the Recon Data Mining System (see article by 
Simoudis, Livezey and Kerber in Proceedings of Knowledge 
Discovery in Databases '94, or the chapter by the same authors 
in Intelligent Hybrid Systems edited by Goonatilake & Kebal).  
Recon combines deductive database technologies, symbolic 
induction, and data visualization to support the abstraction of 
symbolic models from large quantities of data.  Recon is being 
deployed for internal Lockheed Martin applications and external 
commercial and government applications, ranging from data 
cleaning to retail marketing.

Employment opportunities exist in several disciplines.  We seek 
highly motivated programmers, researchers, and data analysts 
from new graduates to seasoned professionals.  Desired skills 
include:  machine learning, applied statistics, SAS 
programming, deductive databases, data visualization, Prolog 
programming, relational database management systems, UNIX and C 
programming and GUI development in Tcl/Tk.

The Data Mining Group is part of the Lockheed Martin Artificial 
Intelligence Center located in Palo Alto, California adjacent 
to the Stanford campus at the foot of the Santa Cruz 
mountains.  The AI Center provides a dynamic work environment 
with numerous opportunities to excel. Our salaries are very 
competitive and will depend upon experience.

Interested parties should send their resumes for immediate 
consideration to:

Electronic mail:        jobs@lmsc.lockheed.com
                        Attn:  S. Troccolo
                        Source code:  ST/Recon

or FAX on fine mode to: (408) 742-6194

Please remember to use the source code and let us know the best 
times and place to reach you!

Lockheed Martin Missiles & Space is an Equal Opportunity 
Employer.

(UPDATED,  8/17/95)


EarthWeb is currently interviewing for the following full-time positions 
in our New York City office:

* Director of Development
* HTML Graphic Designer/Illustrator
* Internet Network/Systems Administrator
* Internet Software Developer
* AI Software Designer/Developer
* Account Representative
* Administrative Assistant
* Human Resources Manager

(please see below for more details about each position)...





     "At EarthWeb, we are building a new dimension of Internet services 
      and technology..."
                          ---Jack D. Hidary, CEO, EarthWeb, LLC.

     "What is the Net becoming? How can we help it evolve? That's what 
      fascinates us! That's why we're here."
                          ---Nova Spivack, V.P. Strategic Development, 
 			     EarthWeb, LLC.


EarthWeb, LLC, <http://www.earthweb.com> a premier provider of high-end 
Internet publishing services and advanced technologies development, has a 
number of full-time opportunites in New York City.  At EarthWeb, we are 
building the next-generation of Internet publishing and marketing 
technology. We also serve a range of Fortune 500 companies, leading 
cultural institutions, content providers, many non-profits, and others in 
their Internet work.  

We are seeking CREATIVE and INNOVATIVE hackers to join our venture. Only 
*REAL* programmers need apply---you must be able to work in C++ and PERL, 
you might need to know some SQL and maybe even some LISP, and you *must* 
be willing to learn HotJava and make it do all sorts of surprising 
things.  We also have a number of other positions, and a few are even 
"non-technical" so read below...

EarthWeb offers an innovative, fast-paced work environment which is ideal 
for highly entrepreneurial, multi-talented, creative individuals. 
Applicants should be able to work as integral members of an growing 
venture. We provide a good benefits package and incentives, as well as 
fast growth potential. Our main office is located on Park Avenue, New 
York City. 

If you are interested in applying for one of the positions below, please 
visit our site and fill out our online application form if possible, or 
email a brief coverletter, detailed resume (text format only please), 
your present salary requirements (as we are a growing quickly, we hope 
you are flexible on salary), and your URLs, to jobs@earthweb.com. 
EarthWeb is an equal opportunity employer. All applications are 
confidential. No phone calls please.

(Please note: EarthWeb already works with a group of headhunters; we do 
not accept unsolicited email from headhunters!)  For you non-headhunters 
out there, thank you for your interest and please see below...


Director of Development: 3 years experience managing innovative software 
development team. Talented and inspired software designer with a highly 
inventive and entrepreneurial focus. Must be familiar with artificial 
intelligence and database technology. Hands-on understanding of C/++, 
PERL, SQL, LISP, HTML, CGI scripts, system design, software design, user 
interface design. Must be familiar with technical infrastructure of 
Internet. Degree in computer science preferred.  Excellent interpersonal 
skills; able to work well creating collaboration among programmers. Must 
be able to work both with developers and marketers to meet common goals.


HTML Graphic Designer/Illustrator: Will be importing and laying out Web 
pages for major cultural institutions and large corporations. Must be an 
exceedingly organized, professional, fast, and creative graphic designer 
in HTML on the Mac. Expertise in Photoshop, Quark, Illustrator, Fractal 
Design. Excellent sense of layout. Illustration skills a big plus. Must 
be available for full-time work for major clients. Experience with PERL a 
plus.

Internet Network/Systems Administrator: Must have at least 2 years 
professional experience as a Network Admin, or equivalent academic 
experience. Must be able to configure and maintain SUN and Intel 
platforms. Solaris, Linux, NT, Windows, Windows95 operating systems. 
Novell, Ethernet, Appletalk LANs. Expert with Internet routing, dial-ins, 
dial-outs, T1 lines, configuring and maintaining co-located servers. 
Install & maintain HTTP servers, SQL database servers. Mac, ISDN 
experience also helpful. 

Internet Software Developer: Will develop new technologies that work with 
HTTP servers and clients. Strong expertise in C and/or C++. Familiarity 
with object oriented design. Fluency in HTML. Familiarity with technical 
infrastructure of Internet. Able to develop UNIX applications that 
interface with WWW servers (experience developing CGI applications in C 
and PERL) and databases (SQL and others). Must know PERL real well. 
Experience programming in small teams. Experience designing, specifying, 
and implementing  development projects. Experience managing own 
development time to meet deadlines. Strong troubleshooting abilities. 
Should be highly creative, yet reliable and professional. Must have 
degree in computer science or equivalent professional experience.


AI Software Designer/Developer:  Will work on new technology projects 
(For this position we are seeking a very precise set of skills. Please do 
not apply if you do not match). Strong background in information 
filtering science including neural, statistical, genetic, semantic, and 
heuristic approaches. Excellent C/++ and LISP skills. Familiarity with 
SQL and other databases. Knowledge of AI algorithms for learning and 
searching large information spaces. Understanding of distributed 
computation. Experience applying AI concepts to real-world problems. Must 
enjoy writing code as well as designing systems. Understanding of 
Internet, HTML, and general Internet infrastructure. MS or PhD in AI 
related field, or equivalent professional experience required.


Account Representative. Will represent EarthWeb to existing client 
accounts as well as to new prospects. Must have excellent presentation 
and interpersonal skills. Powerful sales, marketing, and writing 
abilities. Able to make inspiring pitches to major organizations, 
understand client needs, technical feasibility issues, design effective 
solutions, and manage the client relationship over time.  Must have a 
detailed understanding of the World Wide Web, as well as HTML, and the 
process of Web site design, development, and promotion. Should have a 
creative and innovative approach to problem solving. Must be able to 
interface effectively between clients and EarthWeb design teams; able to 
generate new business by exploring leads, as well as to building on 
present business. Familiarity working in start-up environments, or a 
strong urge to do so, preferred. College degree and 2 years professional 
experience required.


Administrative Assistant/Receptionist: Duties will include general office 
projects and special projects, such as answering phone calls and email, 
office logistics, and assistance on proposals and market research. 
Professional and efficient organizer. Fluent with Macintosh computers 
including Microsoft Office and Quark Express. Fast starter who either 
knows how to use the Internet or wants to learn. Excellent writing and 
phone presentation skills. Highly reliable, friendly, positive 
disposition. Must speak English fluently and professionally. Must enjoy 
interacting with clients and helping to build a new business.


Human Resources Manager: Duties will include coordinating human resources 
operations such as hiring & interviewing, healthcare & benefits, 
incentive programs, corporate culture, and employee relations. To be 
considered, candidate must have 4 years professional experience, and at 
least 3 years professional human resources experience. Must be seasoned, 
professional, personable, good communicator. Must be organized, 
efficient, and proactive. Must enjoy working in hi-tech venture 
environment with creative, somewhat flamboyant techies. Must be able to 
fulfill multiple duties, run multiple projects, and wear many hats.Should 
be able to use email fluently.

Subject: Job: Data Mining at SmithKline Beecham (Pennsylvania)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: occ@iquest.net (OCC Remote 1)
Subject: US-PA Computational Chemistry/Molecular Modeling
Organization: Online Career Center
Date: Mon, 21 Aug 1995 12:22:17 GMT


SmithKline Beecham

SmithKline Beecham, a worldwide leader in
pharmaceutical research, has a number of openings in
our Physical and Structural Chemistry Department.

Scientific Programmer

As a member of an established group, the selected
candidate will assist in the development of state-of-
the-art software. Qualifications include BS/MS in
computer science or electrical engineering (with
experience or course work in chemistry) or BS/MS in
chemistry with demonstrated abilities in scientific
computer programming. Excellent programming skills and
knowledge of UNIX, C and FORTRAN are needed. Experience
with Silicon Graphics workstations and computational
chemistry software are desirable. Refer to Job Code
H0117-I.

Protein Modeling

This individual will be responsible for the development
and application of methods to assign structure and
function to genome sequence information. Qualifications
required include a Ph.D. in chemistry, biophysics or
bioinformatics with extensive experience in biopolymer
sequence analysis and protein modeling. Other
requirements include excellent computer skills and the
ability to develop computer programs and new
algorithms. A knowledge of DNA sequencing methods and
molecular biology is desirable. Refer to Job Code
H0118-I.

Combinatorial Chemistry/Molecular Diversity

The selected individual will join with other team
members to develop and apply methods for the design of
combinatorial chemical libraries and the analysis of
diversity in chemical databases. The necessary
qualifications include a Ph.D. in chemistry or a
related field and extensive experience in computational
chemistry. Excellent computer skills and communications
skills are also necessary. Experience in pattern
recognition or chemical diversity methods is desirable.
Refer to Job Code H00M-I.

Database Mining

The appropriate individual will have a Ph.D. in
chemistry, biochemistry or computer science (or related
field) with extensive experience in pattern
recognition, machine learning or chemometrics.
Excellent communication and computer skills, including
the ability to develop new algorithms, are required.
Experience in chemical or biological database analysis
is desirable. Refer to Job Code H00L-I.

NMR Spectroscopist

Working with the industry's most advanced equipment
(two 500 MHz NMR spectrometers and a series of UNIX,
SGI and Sparc workstations), this individual will work
with the development of multidimensional NMR techniques
and its application to drug discovery research.
Requirements include a Ph.D. in Physics, Chemistry or
Biochemistry and a sound knowledge of NMR theory with
a strong experimental background in multidimensional
NMR techniques. Experience in application of NMR
methods to biological problems including determination
of protein and nucleic acid structure is preferred.
Refer to Job Code H0223-I

Located in our state-of-the-art research facility in
suburban Philadelphia, SmithKline Beecham offers an
excellent compensation/benefits/relocation package.
Interested candidates should send resume with salary
requirements indicating desired Job Code, to:
SmithKline Beecham Pharmaceuticals, Job Code ____, P.O.

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Research Asst: Neural Networks at Cambridge Univ. (England)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: rwp@eng.cam.ac.uk (Richard Prager)
Subject: Research Position for 1 Year Cambridge UK
Date: 15 Aug 1995 09:33:15 GMT
Organization: Engineering Department, Cambridge University, England.


                            Euro-PUNCH Project

                 Research Assistant Position for One Year

Under the terms of a grant recently awarded to the Euro-PUNCH Project we
expect to offer a one year's Research Assistant position in Cambridge to
investigate the use of:

          Neural Networks in the Prediction of Risk in Pregnancy

Euro-PUNCH is a collaborative Project funded by the Human Capital and
Mobility Programme of the Commission of the European Communities.  Thus,
the post is available only to a citizen of a European Union Member State
(but not British), who wishes to come to work in the United Kingdom.

From the obstetrical point of view, the principal focus of the Euro-PUNCH
Project lies in the use of patient-specific measurements of an
epidemiological nature (such as maternal age, past obstetrical history,
etc.) as well as fetal heart rate recordings, in the forecasting of a
number of specific Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes.

From the neural network point of view, the Project involves the design of
pattern-processing and classification systems which can be trained to
forecast problems in pregnancy.  This will involve continuation of work on
pattern-classification and regression analysis, using neural networks
operating on a very large database of about 1.2 million pregnancies from
various European countries.  Challenging components of the project include
dealing with missing and uncertain variables, sensitivity analysis,
variable selection procedures and cluster analysis.

Many leading European obstetrical centres are involved in the Euro-PUNCH
project, and close collaboration with a number of these will be an
essential component of the post offered.

Candidates for this post are expected to have a good first degree and
preferably a post-graduate degree in a relevant discipline.  Come
familiarity with medical statistics and neural networks is desirable but
not essential.

Salary (on the RA scale) will depend on age and experience, and is likely
to be in the range of #14,317 to #15,986 per annum.  Appointment would be
subject to satisfactory health screening.

Applications will close on 23rd August 1995.

Interviews will be held in Cambridge and are likely to be on Wednesday 30th
August 1995.

Applications (naming two referees) should be submitted to:

	  Dr Kevin J Dalton PhD FRCOG
	  Division of Materno-Fetal Medicine, Dept. Obstetrics & Gynaecology
	  University of Cambridge, Addenbrooke's Hospital
	  Cambridge  CB2 2QQ
		  Tel: +44-1223-410250   Fax: +44-1223-336873 or 215327
		  e-mail: kjd5@cus.cam.ac.uk

Informal enquiries about the project should be directed to:
   (Obstetric side)   Dr Kevin Dalton   kjd5@cus.cam.ac.uk
   (Engineering Side) Dr Niranjan       niranjan@eng.cam.ac.uk
   (Engineering Side) Dr Richard Prager rwp@eng.cam.ac.uk

From: knichols@bbn.com (BBN in Cambridge)
Subject: Washington DC -- Programmers
Date: 15 Aug 1995 13:53:25 GMT
Organization: Bolt Beranek & Newman

The Speech and Natural languages Department at BBN has several leading edge 
opportunities available.  These positions are Washington DC-based. 


The department is involved in a number of projects emphasizing high tech
approaches to understanding natural language, including English, Spanish,
German, and Chinese.  The projects range from basic research through
advanced development, and from demonstrations to products.  We are looking
for a few exceptional people.


APPLIED COMPUTATIONAL LINGUIST

Work within a team to develop information extraction systems, 
including name recognition and template fill from newswire, and from
transcribed speech.  
Requirements:
	Two years experience in applying computational linguistics to real
		applications 
	Excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp
	Experience with statistical approaches is a plus.
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


MASTER PROGRAMMER

Work within a team to design and implement applications at the cutting edge
of speech and language technology, such as information extraction systems, 
document handling technology, and topic identification from video.
Requirements:
	Master level programmer in C/C++
	Breadth of programming tasks, including product-level code and
		documentation 
	At least one year's experience each in Unix and MS Windows.
	Experience with delivery of operational systems.
	Experience in implementing graphical user interfaces
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


ENTRY LEVEL RESEARCHER

Provide support to a team by running experiments, implementing algorithms,
and analyzing performance. 
Requirements:
	Bachelor's or Masters degree in computer science
	Excellent C, C++ programming ability
	Lisp programming ability
	At least eight computer science courses
	High undergraduate GPA (3.6 or above)
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance


STATISTICAL LANGUAGE MODELER

Research and development of new techniques for statistcal modeling of
language.  Processing large corpora, including languages other than English.
Requirements:
	Two years experience in applying statistical techniques to
		language  processing.
	Excellent skills as a programmer in C/C++/Lisp.
	Strong statistics/pattern recognition background.
	U.S. citizen able to get a high-level DoD security clearance




Desirable qualifications for all of the above, if available:

	Strong desire to excel, not just succeed
	Type A personality
	Security Clearance of TS SI with lifestyle polygraph 
	Level 3 reading ability in reading a second language (e.g., Chinese,
		Thai, Spanish, 	Arabic, or Japanese) 
	Experience with a programming team, not just one-person projects


Please reply to: 
BBN Systems and Technologies
10 Moulton St.
Cambridge, MA  02138
ATTN: Karen Nicholson

or email: knichols@bbn.com

or FAX: 617-873-3457

From: occ@iquest.net (OCC Remote 1)
Subject: US-VARIED-Software/System Engnrs-Raytheon 
Organization: Online Career Center
Date: Sun, 27 Aug 1995 12:17:05 GMT


Raytheon Electronic Systems' COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE continues to
foster aggressive growth and expansion with both national and
international contracts. We are looking for a number of qualified
individuals to join our company. Our software development
methodology is world class and we achieved SEI Level 3 in 1991. We
have also won the 1995 IEEE Software Process Improvement Award. 


SOFTWARE ENGINEERS

College graduates or experienced professionals with a
Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science, Math or Electrical
Engineering, with areas of specialization in the following are
encouraged to apply:

Real-Time Simulation - Develop real-time simulation software for
use in Hardware in-the-Loop test facilities, Fortran, C, Ada or
High Order Languages.

Digital Signal Processing - Develop digital signal processing
software for use in embedded systems.

Real-Time Software Development Engineer - Real-time embedded
software development in either commercial or defense applications.
Ada and C/C++ developers with experience in any of the following:
object oriented design, X-Windows, RATIONAL/APEX, Software
Through Pictures, UNIX, OSF/MOTIF, GUI development or real-time
applications. Applications in air traffic control, air defense
systems, satellite communications and command/control systems. 

Software Test Engineer (Verification and Validation) -
Develop/Conduct/Analyze/Document tests of real-time embedded
software systems. Areas of interest are military communications
(TADIL-A,B,J); Command and Control; Data Fusion. Experience with
DOD-2167A methodology, Interleaf, and UNIX desirable.

Data Base Architects - Develop relational/object-oriented data base
for imaging, simulation, and distributed applications for
workstations, PCs and MACs.

Advanced Software Technologies - Artificial Intelligence, Neural
Networks, Distributed Interactive Simulation. 

CAE Developers - CAD/CAM software and methodology development,
UNIX, C and C++.

Network Engineer - Install, develop, maintain, support and
troubleshoot local and site networks. Determine requirements,
design and interface with users. Experience with ULTRIX, SUN, SGI,
DEC Alpha, HP, Vines, Internet, Wellfleet, Apple Talk desirable.
2+ years' mixed with Unix Networking. Ethernet, TCP/IP, C.


Configuration Management - Maintain configuration control of
software development in a UNIX, C/ADA environment. Ideal candidate
will have Scripting and ClearCase experience.

Computer and Information Security - Develop, integrate and evaluate
trusted computer systems and multilevel secured databases and
systems.

Command and Control Systems - Design, code test and integration of
real-time satellite communication software. Perform and document
technical studies, evaluate existing programs and make
modifications to software. Requires at least 2 years of Fortran
with 2167A experience. Work will be performed on D.G. equipment.

UNIX System Administrators - Two plus years' experience in UNIX
System Administration and with large installations of 20+ systems.
Requires network administration, hardware/software installation and
support experience. Should have detailed knowledge of Solaris or
SunOS and experience administering Sun Sparc systems.

Software Integration (Transportation Systems) - To perform
regression test of our baseline product and to integrate and test
product enhancements prior to shipment and delivery to our
customers. UNIX and C experience are required.

X-Windows Applications (Transportation Systems) - Application
development using X and commercial GUI tools. Must have C and UNIX
experience.

SYSTEMS ENGINEERS

We are seeking professionals with a minimum of 3 years' experience,
and a BS (MS preferred) in Electrical Engineering, Physics,
Computer Science, Math, Mechanical Engineering and Aeronautical
Engineering for the following positions.

Command, Control, Communication Engineers - Perform systems level
design and analysis of command and control systems. Develop
communications hardware and software requirements and evaluate
overall C3 and C4 performance. 

Operation Analysis - Perform weapon systems studies to establish
requirements and evaluate effectiveness. Experience with
large scale simulations and DIS desired.

Simulation Design - Develop six-degree-of-freedom digital and
hardware in the loop models of aerodynamics, mechanics, and signal
processing for closed loop systems. AD100, VAX or Silicon Graphics
experience desired. 

Guidance and Control Engineer - Control system design and analysis;
modeling and simulation of linear and nonlinear systems. Experience
with design of guidance systems and state estimators.

Aerodynamics - Define airframe requirements and establish design
configuration for wings and control surfaces. Plan wind tunnel
tests and analyze data to develop aerodynamic models.

Besides providing a dynamic work environment, Raytheon offers a
competitive salary and benefits program. All positions requires
U.S. Citizenship. Interested candidates, please respond via e-mail
to: kathleen=e=riley@msd.ray.com, or fax resume to: 508-858-5183.


An Equal Opportunity Employer.

Subject: US-TX-Austin: MTS-Speech & Language Technology-Southwestern Bell
Date: 28 Aug 1995 23:37:29 GMT
Organization: Southwestern Bell Technology Resources


Member of Technical Staff-Speech & Language Technology

SBC Communications (SBC) is a leader in the telecommunications industry. 
Our research subsidiary, SOUTHWESTERN BELL TECHNOLOGY RESOURCES,
currently has an opening for a Member of Technical Staff to work in the
area of speech and language technology.

General Requirements:
Qualified candidates must have the ability to rapidly prototype,
demonstrate and then deploy innovative voice technology based
communications applications.  These applications will be developed
through the integration of new and emerging hardware and software
technologies in a telecommunications environment using structured design
and distributed computing techniques. Suitable candidates must
demonstrate strong self motivation and leadership in complex multi-year
projects dependent on changing problem definitions and customer
requirements.  Candidates should be flexible as to assignments in
different technology areas and have a willingness to learn new
technologies as our clients' requirements change.

Educational Requirements:
MSCS, MSEE, or equivalent

Technical Experience Requirements:
	- System engineering, development and deployment of software based
applications 
	- Expertise in the design, coding, integration, testing and delivery of
high quality and complex software systems (actual deployed systems must
be cited)
	- Three or more years system development in a UNIX environment and
programming in C language

Technical Experience Desired:
- Speech & Language Technology
- Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR)
- Text to Speech (TTS)
- Speaker Identity Verification (SIV)
- Speech coding
- Speech Database Development

Software Experience Desired:
- Real-time digital signal processor programming
- SQL databases (Sybase, Unify, or others)
- Communication networking experience (TCP/IP and NFS)
- Background in object oriented programming (C++, others)
- Provide maintenance, support, and enhancement of a major software
system in operational mode
- Quality assurance and benchmark testing

Additional Experience and Skills Desired:
- Telephony
	- Technical leader of a group of application programmers for a complex
software project
	- Excellent presentation skills and software documentation experience
	- Select and manage software contractors or vendors
	- Evaluate and recommend commercial products for in-house software
development


AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

For consideration, please mail, fax or E-mail your resume as noted below.

Southwestern Bell Technology Resources
Human Resources Department
9505 Arboretum Boulevard
Austin, Texas 78759

E-mail: sjohnson@sbctri.sbc.com
Fax: (512) 372-5591

From: ellman@cs.rutgers.edu (Tom Ellman)
Subject: Artificial Intelligence Programming Position
Date: 24 Aug 1995 16:38:18 -0400
Organization: Rutgers University LCSR



Subject: Programmer Position on Hypercomputing and Design Poject
Keywords: LISP C Fortran X Unix Programmer Job

          ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE PROGRAMMER POSITION

The High-Performance Computing and Design (HPCD) Project in the
Laboratory for Computer Science at Rutgers University is looking
for a programmer to support research in ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE,
COMPUTER-AIDED DESIGN and NUMERICAL/SCIENTIFIC COMPUTATION.

Duties:

Under the direction of faculty, the person filling this position is
responsible for the design, coding, maintenance, and documentation of
experimental computer programs; performs system maintenance and
administragive tasks, including installing and maintaining system
software; participates directly in coordinating code and coding
standards for research projects; and evaluates, installs and maintains
systems and application programs.

Qualifications:

Requires a bachelor's degree in computer science or related field, and
approximately two years experience in LISP and either C or FROTRAN
programming on Unix systems. Requires knowledge of X systems,
understanding of basic algorithms and data structures and their
perofrmance implications, ability to deal with complex and evolving
experimental programs, and effective interpersonal skills.  Knowledge
of numerical analysis, parallel systems programming, and computational
fluid dynamics is preferred.

Salary Range:  Approximagely.  $40,000-$55,000

The HPCD Project:

The HPCD Project is an ARPA-funded, multi-university,
multi-disciplinary research project, whose goal is to study the
application of Artificial Intelligence and other areas of Computer
Science, of Computational Science (especially Computational Fluid
Dynamics), and of high-performance computing to problems of design.
Design tasks we are currently working on include design of jet engine
inlets and nozzles, container ships, microprocessors, and
microlithography processes.  The HPCD Project is centered at Rutgers
University in New Brunswick, NJ, where the person hired for this
position would be located.

To apply:

Send (hard copy) resumes to
    Karen McGee
    Personnel Department
    Rutgers University
    New Brunswick, NJ 08903
    (908) 445-3020

Refer to "posting number AP 048".  (This is required
to officially apply for the job.)

In addition, I would appreciate a copy be sent to me by email
(preferred) at ellman@cs.rutgers.edu

or US mail at
    Prof. Tom Ellman
    Dept. of Computer Science
    Hill Center, Busch Campus
    Rutgers University
    Piscataway, NJ 08855-1089

Feel free to contact me for further information at either my email
or US mail address.

			Postdoctoral Position
			 Columbia University
	 Natural Language Processing / Statistical Techniques


We are seeking a PhD with expertise in natural language
processing and statistical analysis for a post-doctoral position at
Columbia University. The project involves the  application of both
statistical techniques and language generation to the problem of text
summarization. We are investigating the use of statistical analysis
along with lexical relations to represent information in text for
input to a language generation system in order to produce a
summary. 

Qualifications: Applicants should have completed a PhD in the natural
language processing sub-field of computer science, be familiar with
statistical techniques for language processing, with lexical
semantics, and with language generation. Programming knowledge and interest
in system building necessary.  Interested applicants should
send CV to Prof. Kathleen McKeown via email at: kathy@cs.columbia.edu
and to Dr. Judith Klavans at klavans@cs.columbia.edu

Positions Available - AI jobs/Data mining/programming

Job code: BL/Recon

Join a dynamic team in Palo Alto, CA, developing leading-edge 
Data Mining software to extract patterns and other useful 
information from large quantities of of data.  The software 
integrates deductive database technology with several machine 
learning techniques. This position requires a can-do attitude 
and a keen interest in data mining and related technologies.

Requirements: We have employment opportunities in several 
disciplines.  We are looking for motivated programmers, 
researchers and data analysts from new graduates to seasoned 
professionals.  Desired skills include:  machine learning, 
applied statistics, SAS programming, deductive databases, 
Prolog programming, relational database management systems, 
UNIX and C programming and GUI development in Tcl/Tk.


WHO ARE WE?

The Research and Software Technology Divisions of a Fortune 20
Company are seeking bright and talented Software professionals to
add to their workforce on a Full-time basis.
We have had an influx of project work and have both junior and
senior positions available.  If you are a recent graduate,but 
have several years of proven programming skills and are now 
interested in working in a research setting, we want to talk 
with you!!!


*WHAT IS OUR WORKPLACE LIKE?

We are researchers in an entrepreneurial environment.  You will
have flexibility to make a lot of your own goals - and work with
other talented people in nice offices in Palo Alto. We require 
permanent residency status for most of our work. However,if you have 
an F1 (Educational visa), you must have ONE YEAR MINIMUM 
remaining on your practical training.  NO EXCEPTIONS.

*HOW TO REACH US?

For immediate consideration, fax or Email your resume to my attention.
PLEASE REMEMBER TO REFERENCE THE JOB CODE and let us know the best 
times and places to reach you.  We will review your background and 
contact you to discuss the positions available.

Send your resume via Email to:          Susan Troccolo

                                      	Auguri@ix.netcom.com

Via FAX on HIGH RES to:                 (415) 326-5969

Machine Learning technology Transfer task.  Assist in design, coding, and 
documentation of software system components and algorithms in C and C++. 
 Design and develop graphical user interfaces to existing algorithms.  
Write users and programmers documentation.


IF YOU ARE INTERESTED IN THIS POSITION, PLEASE MAIL OR FAX YOUR RSUM TO 
SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY CORPORATION.  PLEASE INCLUDE THE SOLICITATION 
NUMBER OF THE JOB YOU ARE INTERESTED IN ON THE COVER PAGE.  NO PHONE 
CALLS PLEASE.

From: chien@aig.jpl.nasa.gov (Steve Chien)
Message-Id: <9509052103.AA21344@keynes>
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: AI Opportunities at JPL (revised)
Content-Length: 2690
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Employment Opportunites in Artificial Intelligence at JPL

The Artificial Intelligence Group and the Machine Learning Systems
Group at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), California Institute of
Technology are seeking candidates at the BA/BS, MA/MS and PhD level to
work on fundamental research problems leading to unique software
applications in spacecraft autonomy, scientific data analysis, and
mission operations automation.

Openings in the following areas of artificial intelligence research and
development exist:  planning & scheduling, intelligent systems monitoring and
diagnosis, machine learning / data mining, and pattern recognition / image
understanding.  Responsibilities for these openings range from research
program development to software design and coding.

Candidates must hold a degree in Computer Science, Electrical
Engineering or a related area, and must possess programming skills in
C and/or LISP, as well as have some experience with the UNIX
environment.  Ideally, in addition to a background in artificial
intelligence, a candidate would also have a background in one or more
of the following areas: statistics, applied mathematics, signal
processing, operations research, economics, or image processing.

Some of the new application targets for AI-based software onboard
spacecraft include mission planning and resource management, adaptive
feature detection for science, fault management, artificial economies,
and agent-based architectures.  Some ongoing applications include
automated planning of image analysis for the Galileo mission to
Jupiter, automated procedure generation for the Deep Space Network,
automated anomaly detection in Space Shuttle telemetry, automated sky
object catalog generation from Mt. Palomar Observatory data, and
automated volcano detection in Venus synthetic-aperture radar images
returned by the Magellan spacecraft.  This work has generated new
research results on the path towards unprecedented AI applications.

If you are interested in applying for one of these positions, please send a
resume and any other supporting materials to the address below (electronic
submission of resumes encouraged).  Please include an e-mail address and
phone number at which you can be reached.  Recent graduates are strongly
encouraged to apply.  Please include information on your citizenship status
with your application.

            Dr. Richard J. Doyle
            Technical Section Manager
            Information Systems Technology 
            Jet Propulsion Laboratory, MS 525-3660
            California Institute of Technology
            Pasadena, California 91109-8099

Send email submissions to:  job1@aig.jpl.nasa.gov

[*] Senior Project Leaders:

We are looking for one or two persons with a track record of delivering
useful and innovative software projects to customers on time and within
budget. The position requires strong computer-science technical skills
(advanced degree preferred), including object-oriented design and
programming (preferably C++) in a UNIX environment. The person must be 
able and willing to be an individual contributor, as well as be able to 
lead a team. Strong interpersonal skills are needed, to operate collab-
oratively in a small, dynamic company environment, and to brief and 
interact with senior technical customers. This position also requires 
the ability to take a leadership role in creating proposals.


[*] Senior Software Architect:

We are seeking an individual contributor with 10-20 years experience
creating high quality, reusable architectures for complex distributed
systems. This position requires proven ability to take a leadership 
role in a diverse technical community of customers and other architects. 
We require a strong understanding of object-oriented design methodologies, 
proven programming background in C++ in a UNIX environment, and knowledge 
of OODBMS and distributed object standards (CORBA, DCE, OLE-2, etc.). 
A PhD is desirable.


[*] Software Engineers (junior and senior):

Junior and Senior positions require solid C++ design and programming
experience in a UNIX environment, and excellent documentation skills.
Strengths in one or more of the following areas are required:

   *  distributed computing -- CORBA, DCE, OLE-2, etc.
   *  database systems, especially OODBs
   *  GUI development -- X Windows, Tcl/Tk, etc.
   *  system administration and related programming support to 
      projects - Unix required; Mac and PC desirable


[*] WWW Guru / Programmer (junior or senior Software Engineer):

We are looking for a software engineer with an extensive working 
knowledge of WWW client and server implementations (code) and HTML 
authoring tools. Candidate must be able to take a lead role in 
specifying, designing, and implementing tools and applications that 
make use of and extend WWW technology.

                        NATURAL LANGUAGE DEVELOPER
                               (New York)

U.S. or Canadian citizenship required, or U.S. permanent residency.
Unfortunately, we are unable to assist persons requiring visa sponsorship.

The Speech Services Technology Group has an opening for a developer 
with significant experience in building Natural Language Understanding 
systems.

This group designs and deploys state-of-the-art interacive speech 
recognition and language understanding systems.  Spoken language 
systems combine a recognition framework with natural language and 
discourse modeling capabilities to provide the uninitiated caller with 
an elegant, powerful, and easy-to-use interface to various 
applications, using a standard telephone.  Opportunities for applying 
this technology to multimedia and to text processing may also arise. 

Qualifications:

At least an MS in Computer Science, Linguistics, or related field.

At least 3 years experience, either commercial or academic, directly 
involved in the development of robust natural language systems.

Significant software development experience, most preferably in C or 
C++.

Experience with relevant statistical techniques.

Familiarity with related fields, such as speech recognition, signal 
processing, relevant real time programming issues, and user interface 
design for speech and language systems, are all pluses.

Experience and maturity in conceptualization, software design, and 
software engineering.

Ability to work in a cohesive team.

Strong motivation to excel.

            ** Minimum 3 years on-the-job experience required**

opportunities.

Senior Engineer

technology. The individual is responsible for the development, verification
and documentation of the software components used for the product.

engineering experience including: good oral and written communication
skills, top-down and modular design techniques, network protocols, previous
development in multi-threaded operating system environments, and knowledge
in AI-based or robotics software design. Strong debugging skills and
experience with scripting languages necessary. The individual must be

development team.

of security algorithms, AI-based software, enterprise management a plus.

Flexible Spending Medical and Dependent Care Reimbursements Accounts; 22
paid leave days and 11 paid holidays in the first year; Maternity/Paternity
Leave of Absence; 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan; an Employee Stock Purchase
Plan; Tuition reimbursement; and Flextime Work Schedules.

simulations. Lead project teams to conduct research in emerging
learning and instructional design theories. Promote efforts in
instructional systems, including proposal development. Manage
ISD/multimedia projects, number of hours of interactive
courseware produced on individual projects ranges from 40-100.
Work with advanced training technologies, such as Virtual
Environment (VE), speech recognition systems, computer-generated
imagery (CGI), and digital video. Determine customer training
needs and recommend appropriate instructional strategies,
methods, media. Interpret solicitations, develop technical and
cost proposals, and negotiate contracts. Assist with staff
development, program budgeting and scheduling, product quality
control, contract administration, and client interface. Requires
a MA or PhD, in instructional systems and a minimum of 15 years
experience in ISD project management and 10 years experience in
CBT/IVD/DVI design and production. Must have a successful track
record in marketing (ISD) instructional systems design and
interactive multimedia production. Should be familiar with ICW
authoring systems, such as Visual Basic, Authorware Professional;
electronic performance support systems; distance learning
technologies, Information Mapping; Hypermedia; intelligent
tutoring systems; and desktop simulation. Must be able to
interact with customers and co-workers. Must be a US citizen and
be eligible to obtain a DOD security clearance. 

Southwest Research Institute, founded in 1947 in San Antonio,
Texas, is an independent, applied engineering and physical
sciences R&D organization. Total revenue for 1994 was 243 million
dollars. Currently 60% to 65% of our work is performed for
private industrial sponsors with the balance
derived from research for various government agencies. 

The addition of staff members of high competence is essential to
the company's success. Since technical ability is what the
Institute has to offer, we look for people who measure success
according to their contributions to the advancement of their
chosen field of technology. The opportunities for technical and
professional growth are excellent at the Institute because of the
availability of a wide variety of challenging technical
assignments, and the fact that employees are evaluated on the
basis of their performance in handling such assignmets. Our
company offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits
package. 

San Antonio, the 9th largest city in the country with a
population of 935,933, has a cost of living rated as one of the
lowest among large U.S. cities.  

Forward resumes to:


BE SURE TO INDICATE POSITION CODE - 09504


Via Mail: Professional Staffing, Southwest Research Institute,
P.O. Drawer 28510, San Antonio, Texas, 78228-0510

Via Fax: (210) 522-3990, Attention Professional Staffing Dept.

Via Email: personnel@swri.org

Southwest Research Institute is an Affirmative Action/Equal
Opportunity Employer.

Subject: Job: Intelligent Agents at AT&T Bell Labs HCI Research (Murray Hill, NJ)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: terveen@zimmy.research.att.com (Loren Terveen)
Subject: Agents job position available
Organization: AT&T
Date: Wed, 13 Sep 1995 11:28:06 GMT


Intelligent Agents position available

The Human-Computer Interface Research Department of AT&T Bell
Laboratories is seeking a short term research associate in the area of
Intelligent Agents.  The research associate will work closely with one
or more principal investigators, contributing to the conceptual design
of agent applications and tools, with primary responsibility for
system architecture, design, implementation, documentation, and
enhancement.  

We are seeking candidates with skills in the following areas:

  - excellent application design skills, with experience in designing 
    and enhancing working applications of at least moderate size; 
    iterative prototyping experience is a plus; 

  - knowledge of programming languages and tools including Lisp, C++,
    and Visual Basic (or similar tools);
  
  - familiarity with standard artificial intelligence representation
    (e.g., frames, rules, and logic) and reasoning (e.g., planning and
    search) techniques;

  - basic knowledge of interface design and experience with involving
    users in the design process;

  - development experience in the PC/MS Windows environment;
    knowledge of APIs like MAPI and TAPI is a plus;

  - ability to work and communicate effectively in a team.

We do not expect every applicant to be an expert in all these areas;
however, a broad range of skills is important.

Potential projects include (in approximate order of likelihood):
  - an interface for end users to program agents,
  - agent design tools, and
  - techniques for agents to communicate with other agents and
    information sources.
Likely application areas include messaging, electronic banking, and
information retrieval.

We expect the duration of the appointment to be one year.  The
appointment is particularly suitable for candidates who have just
completed their undergraduate degrees or begun their graduate studies
and are looking for a research apprenticeship.  The successful
candidate will have the opportunity to work in an exciting,
world-class research atmosphere, to help develop and implement novel
concepts in intelligent agents, and to tackle real-world problems of
current business interest.

For more information or to submit an application, please contact:
  Loren Terven
  AT&T Bell Laboratories, 2C-401
  600 Mountain Avenue
  Murray Hill, NJ 07974
  terveen@research.att.com
--

nation.  We have a great reputation, a great team of employees, we are

if this option is open.  I look forward to hearing from you!

Sr CD-ROM IC Design Engineers
ASIC design skills needed to add new products to our CD-ROM controller
family.  Exp with ATA-interface or DRAM-interface logic design. Exp
writing Verilog code and systhesizing using Synopsis is +, 5+ yrs IC
desing and BSEE required.

CD-ROM IC design Engineers
2 yrs of design exp with BSEE required; help add new products to our
CD-ROM controller family.  Must have exp in IC design and simulation,
circuti design exp as well as an understanding of PC system design a
plus

CD-ROM IC Project Leader:
lead a team which develops new IC's for our ATAPI CD-ROM family.
Position combines project mngmnt w/ hands-on ASIC dev. Must be familiar
with custom IC design and have exp in CD-ROM or HDD logic design. Exp
writing Verilog code and synthesizing using Synopiss req.  5-10 yrs IC
design exp plus more than 2 yrs exp in ASIC project mngmnt with a
BSEE/MSEE required.

Analog Design Engineer:
Apply your analog ASIC design skills in the development of new CD-ROM
controller products. Exp with ADC, CAC, high performance operational
amplifier, high speed comparator, filters and PLL designs preferred.
Exp with Verilog, HSPICE, or equivalent analog circuit simulation is a
plus  A BSEE is required with 5 yrs of analog circuit design exp.

Sr Firmware Development Engineer:
Develop new products for our CD-ROM controller family.  Exp with
writing servo assembly code, servo control algorithms, and DSP coding
is preferred.  Exp with CD brushless motor control algorithm and coding
is a plus.  7+ yrs exp and a BSEE is required. An MSEE is a definite
plus.

Servo Design Engineer:
Need theoretical knowledge and creative ideas in the development of new
CD-ROM controller products.  Exp with digital servo control, adaptive
servo control, fuzzy logic servo control algorithm, and model
simulation with MATLAB, MATRIX.X or equivalent preferred.  Exp with
voice coil actuator and brushless CD motor control is a plus. Must have
5+ yrs. and a MSEE degree.

Sr CAD Engineer...Simulatin and timing
Responsible for advanced VLSI design tools evaluation and methodology
integration at fron-end of CMOS ASIC design.  Exp required in Verilog
simulation, EPIC Pathmill/Timemill timing analysis and
simulation/timing model development.  Knowledge of C/C++ programming
skilll and UNIX shell script are pluses.  3+ yrs exp and an MSEE are
required.

Sr CAD Engineer...Place & route & Backannotation

Resp for advanced VLSI design tools evaluation and methodology
integration at back-end of CMOS ASIC design.  Exp required in
Cell3/ArcCell or cell-based floorplanning/timing driven layout, delay
calculation and back-annotation design flow.  Knowledge of Dracula and
UNIX shell script are pluses.  3+yrs exp and an MSEE are required.

Also, I am looking for a CAD Software engineer, a Sr CAD Engineer, and
a 
Sr Circuit Design Engineer as well as a

Layout Designer for modigication and DRC of CMOS standard cell,
megacells and I/O Analog circuit layout and place and route skills are
a plus.  2+ yrs exp and an AA or higher degree are required.

From: info-ret+@NL.CS.CMU.EDU (Information return mailbox)
Subject: IR position(s) at CMU
Date: 15 Sep 1995 17:20:34 GMT
Organization: Carnegie-Mellon University, School of Computer Science

        RESEARCH FACULTY POSITION IN INFORMATION RETRIEVAL
                AT CARNEGIE MELLON UNIVERSITY

The Center for Machine Translation and the School of Computer Science
at Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) are seeking candidates for one or
more research faculty positions in Information Retrieval (IR).  The
position(s) available range from Research Associate (equivalent to
postdoctoral fellow) to Research Scientist (equivalent to Assistant
Professor) and Senior Research Scientist (equivalent to untenured
Associate Professor).  Both position and salary will be commensurate
with experience. A PhD is required, preferably in Computer Science
or closely related field, as is a strong research record in IR, and
significant systems experience.

The ideal candidate(s) will have broad experience in different aspects
of text processing, including information retrieval, text categorization,
and information extraction from text.  Knowledge of classical IR
techniques, statistical methods and linguistic approaches is desirable,
as is familiarity with natural language processing and machine learning
techniques.  HCI experience, fluency in a foreign language, and a strong
algorithms and mathematical background are also a plus.

The selected candidate(s) is(are) expected to contribute to the IR
component of CMU's Digital Library project (Informedia), and/or conduct
their own original funded research and/or work collaboratively with other
CMU faculty on projects such as information-seeking web agents.

Interested candidates should send their curriculum vita to the
address below as soon as they can, and no later than October 31, 1995.
Please include a cover letter with the names and email addresses of
three or more references and a brief statement of how well the educational
and professional background and interests match the criteria set forth
above.  Email postscript submissions are preferred.

Information Retrieval
Center for Machine Translation
School of Computer Science
Carnegie Mellon University
Pittsburgh PA 15213  USA

info-ret@nl.cs.cmu.edu

          27 Sep 95 19:10:05 EDT
Date: Wed, 27 Sep 95 19:09:34 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Faculty: AI and Robotics at Texas A&M Univ. (Texas)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

        A Tenure-Track Faculty Position in AI and Robotics

                        Texas A&M University
                   Department of Computer Science

The Department of Computer Science invites applications for tenure-track
faculty positions at the Assistant, Associate, and Full Professor levels.
Research areas of particular interest are artificial intelligence and robotics.However, exceptional candidates from all areas of specialization will be
considered.

Candidates should have a Ph.D.  in computer science, computer engineering
or a closely related field, a strong commitment to both research and teaching,
and demonstrated ability to perform research and acquire external funding
appropriate to the rank being sought.  Applications from minority and
women candidates are especially encouraged.  Texas A&M University is an
affirmative action/equal opportunity employer committed to diversity.

Texas A&M University is a leading national university with approximately
43,000 students and exceptional professional schools in medicine, veterinary
medicine, engineering, business, and architecture.  Texas A&M was the first
university with land grant, sea grant, and space grant designations and has
annual federal research support of approximately $322 million.  The
Computer Science Department is in the College of Engineering and has 28
faculty members including three NSF PYI/NYI recipients.  The department
has a rapidly growing research program and has had over $2 million in
external research funding annually for the past several years including an
NSF infrastructure grant.  Areas of significant research within the department
include:  vision, graphics and robotics; algorithms, languages and
computability; computer systems and architecture; fault-tolerant computing;
VLSI design and test; computational science and engineering; real-time
computing, software systems; and artificial intelligence and fuzzy logic.

The department and its associated teaching and research laboratories have
exceptional facilities.  Specialized labs exist for teaching real-time systems,microcomputer architecture and the senior design course.  Departmental file
servers provide 35Gb of space.  Specialized parallel computing systems
workstations for graduate students and faculty with access to the university's
Cray YMP2/116.  All department systems are networked with a combination
of FDDI, ethernet, token ring and Appletalk.

Texas A&M University is nestled on a pleasant 5,200-acre campus in the
"golden triangle of Texas." It is a short driving distance to the major cities o
f
Austin, Houston, and Dallas-Fort Worth.  College Station is a desirable place
to live, with many fine residential neighborhoods, low home prices, and a
minimum of urban hassles.

Applicants should send a statement of research and teaching interest, a
complete resume, and the names of at least three references, their addresses
(including email) and telephone/fax numbers to:  Faculty Search Committee,
Department of Computer Science, Texas A&M University, College Station,
Texas 77843-3112.  Applications will be accepted until the positions are filled.

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU

Subject: Job: AI at JPL (CA)
Cc: ai+lisp-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: job1@aig.jpl.nasa.gov (job1)
Subject: Employment Opportunities in Artificial Intelligence at JPL
Date: 13 Sep 1995 01:39:25 GMT
Organization: NASA / Jet Propulsion Laboratory


The Artificial Intelligence Group and the Machine Learning Systems
Group at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), California Institute of
Technology are seeking candidates at the BA/BS, MA/MS and PhD level to
work on fundamental research problems leading to unique software
applications in spacecraft autonomy, scientific data analysis, and
mission operations automation.

Openings in the following areas of artificial intelligence research and
development exist:  planning & scheduling, intelligent systems monitoring and
diagnosis, machine learning / data mining, and pattern recognition / image
understanding.  Responsibilities for these openings range from research
program development to software design and coding.

Candidates must hold a degree in Computer Science, Electrical
Engineering or a related area, and must possess programming skills in
C and/or LISP, as well as have some experience with the UNIX
environment.  Ideally, in addition to a background in artificial
intelligence, a candidate would also have a background in one or more
of the following areas: statistics, applied mathematics, signal
processing, operations research, economics, or image processing.

Some of the new application targets for AI-based software onboard
spacecraft include mission planning and resource management, adaptive
feature detection for science, fault management, artificial economies,
and agent-based architectures.  Some ongoing applications include
automated planning of image analysis for the Galileo mission to
Jupiter, automated procedure generation for the Deep Space Network,
automated anomaly detection in Space Shuttle telemetry, automated sky
object catalog generation from Mt. Palomar Observatory data, and
automated volcano detection in Venus synthetic-aperture radar images
returned by the Magellan spacecraft.  This work has generated new
research results on the path towards unprecedented AI applications.

If you are interested in applying for one of these positions, please send a
resume and any other supporting materials to the address below (electronic
submission of resumes encouraged).  Please include an e-mail address and
phone number at which you can be reached.  Recent graduates are strongly
encouraged to apply.  Please include information on your citizenship status
with your application.

            Dr. Richard J. Doyle
            Technical Section Manager
            Information Systems Technology
            Jet Propulsion Laboratory, MS 525-3660
            California Institute of Technology
            Pasadena, California 91109-8099

Send email submissions to:  job1@aig.jpl.nasa.gov

Subject: Job: Research Scientist/Lecturer at Swiss Federal Inst. of Technology
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

  Opening for a:

  Maitre d'Enseignement et de Recherche in

   Artificial Intelligence - Knowledge Systems

  Swiss Federal Institute of Technology (EPFL), Lausanne
  Artificial Intelligence Laboratory
  Computer Science Department

  This postion corresponds roughly to a research scientist
in many North American Institutions or to a senior lecturer
in British Institutions. It is intended in particular for
application-oriented research in knowledge systems for
engineering and industrial applications. The position allows
for teaching and supervising doctoral students. The position is
awarded by nomination for periods of 3 years, renewable
indefinitely.

  The position will be attached to the Artificial Intelligence
Laboratory in the Computer Science Department. The AI Laboratory
currently consists of one professor and 12 researchers. Many
of the current activities are documented on the world-wide
web under URL:  http://diwww.epfl.ch/w3lia/

  The successful candidate is expected to have a proven
track record in development of knowledge systems and their
applications, and a solid background in computer science.
Some experience beyond the doctorate would be desirable.
Since EPFL is an engineering school, experience in engineering
would be especially welcome. The successful candidate is expected
to speak French or be willing to learn it rapidly. 
The salary will depend on experience, but can be expected to be
above SFr. 100'000 (US$ 85'000) per year.

  Interested candidates should request the complete information
package at:

   Presidence de l'EPFL, CE-Ecublens, 1015 Lausanne, Switzerland

  The closing date for applications in January 5th, 1996.

To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Position at NASA Ames
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU


Caelum Research Corporation is a sub-contractor at NASA Ames research center
in the south San Francisco Bay area.  We currently have an opening on the
Intelligent Maintenance portion of the X-33 program.  The goal of X-33
program is to build a prototype of the next generation reusable launch
vehicle that will replace the space shuttle in the next decade.  The goal of
the Intelligent Maintenance project is to reduce the time needed to
maintain and refurbish the vehicle between flights through the use of
specialize sensors, vehicle component performance monitoring and automated
maintenance scheduling.  The position is primarily to support the automated
maintenance scheduling, but working in machine learning and problem solving
will also be required.

Applicants must be proficient Lisp and should have experience with C/C++ and
tcl/tk.  Familiarity planning and scheduling technology is also a plus.
Salaries are determined by the qualifications of the applicant and will
probably range somewhere between $25-$65k.

Only US citizens or Green card holders are eligible for this position.

To apply, email a cover letter and resume' (ASCII or postscript only) to
allen@ptolemy.arc.nasa.gov.  Please label all correspondence "IM"

If you do not have access to email, a hard copy can be sent to:

 John Allen
 M.S. 269-2
 NASA Ames Research Center
 Moffett Field, CA 94035-1000

          5 Oct 95 11:19:46 EDT
Date: Thu, 5 Oct 95 11:18:39 EDT
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: NLP at Rank Xerox Research Centre (France)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: Gregory Grefenstette <Gregory.Grefenstette@Xerox.fr>


	Research Positions in Multi-Lingual Information Retrieval
		at the Rank Xerox Research Centre

The Multi-Lingual Theory and Technology group at the Rank Xerox
Research Centre (located in Grenoble, France) is looking for motivated
researchers to work on problems in information retrieval and natural
language processing. Two positions are available.

			Research Associate

The candidate will provide technical support for our work in
multi-lingual information retrieval and contribute to the development
of an information retrieval system suited to our research needs.
Secondary work will involve other aspects of natural language
processing, as our interests range from automatic translation to text
generation to information retrieval in a multi-lingual setting. There
are a number of active projects that range in scope from long term
basic research to short term prototyping.

Applicants should have the equivalent of at least a U.S. master's
degree in computer science. A degree in a closely related field may
also be acceptable if they have a strong computational
background. Candidates must have excellent skills and considerable
experience with Unix and C/C++ programming. Some experience with both
corpus linguistics and large scale information retrieval problems
would be highly desirable. The applicant must be able to communicate
effectively in English and knowledge of other major European languages
would also be helpful.  There is no specific deadline for application,
but we expect the position to be filled early in 1996 at the latest.

			Research Scientist

The candidate will collaborate in the development of new approaches to
solving multi-lingual information retrieval problems and will also
contribute to our ongoing work to develop statistical and linguistic
tools for analyzing text in English, French, German, and other major
European languages. In particular, (s)he will collaborate with other
researchers at RXRC on projects involving the automatic extraction and
translation of terminology from multi-lingual text collections.

Applicants should have the equivalent of a PhD in computer science or
some closely related field and have practical experience with
information retrieval and a strong computational background. The ideal
background would include some experience with computational
linguistics, natural language processing, machine learning, and/or the
statistical analysis of text. Experience with large scale information
retrieval problems is also desirable. Candidates will be expected to
develop new ideas and work on long term basic research, so creativity
and strong personal motivation are essential qualities. The applicant
must be able to communicate effectively in English, and working
knowledge of French, German, or other major European languages would be
valuable. The position will be available in mid-1996.

Applications should be sent to:

Annie Zaenen                    annie.zaenen@xerox.fr
RXRC,
6 chemin de Maupertuis,
38240 Meylan, France
fax: +33 76 61 50 99

______________________________________________________________________
                             |
Gregory Grefenstette         |  E-Mail : Gregory.Grefenstette@xerox.fr
Multilingual Theory          |
    and Technology           |  Phone : (33) 76 61 50 82
Rank Xerox Research Centre   |  fax :   (33) 76 61 50 99

X-Vmsmail-To:  @JOBS.DIS

Carnegie Group, Inc., a leading knowledge systems integrator based in
Pittsburgh, PA, currently has a R&D managment position available.

If you qualify, please send your resume, letter of qualifications,
salary history, and list of publications to:

Carnegie Group, Inc.
Attn: Jennifer Price
5 PPG Place
Pittsburgh, PA  15222

email: resumes@cgi.com		fax: 412-642-6906
phone: 800-284-3424
___________________________________________________________________________
POSITION:	Manager of Research and Development
LOCATION:	Pittsburgh, PA

POSITION REQUIRES:  M.S. Engineering, Computer Science, or related
		    field; PhD desirable.

WORK EXPERIENCE:  5-7  years demonstrating innovative technical skills
and ability to adapt state-of-the-art research into state-of-the-practice
applications in the hands of an end user.  At least 2 years of management 
experience.

SKILLS REQUIRED:

1.  Excellent analytic, problem definition and solving skills.  Ability to
distill core research problem from often rich, semi-articulated
problem domains.  Ability to apply leading edge technologies in an
innovative way to form the heart of advanced Decision Support Systems.

2.  In-depth knowledge/training in scheduling, planning and resource
allocation problems.  Excellent ability to formulate these problems,
identify applicable technologies and design algorithmic solutions.
Knowledge of research in these areas is a plus.

3.  Ability and skills in building enabling, innovative, usable
decision support systems using core identified technologies.

4.  Excellent software engineering skills.  Knowledge of software
methodology paradigms and CASE tools.

5.  Project planning and estimation skills.  Knowledge of estimation 
techniques, resource planning, project control and project cost analysis.

6.  Ability and experience in drafting technical proposals.

7.  Ability and skills in developing/maintaining strong customer
relations, particularly in the areas of understanding areas of
customer need and communicting the technical vision to the customer
and potential users.

8.  Proven ability to assemble, motivate, and lead a highly skilled
technical team.  Develop and maintain a high level of 'technical
excitement' on the team.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

The person filling this position would manage a team of 
highly skilled engineers, contractors, and subcontractors in the early
investigation of advanced technologies for Decision Support System
applications in Logistics Planning, Medical Evacuation, and related
domains.  This would range from initial technology investigation 
through proof of concept demonstrations as well as supporting the
transition of promising technologies into separately managed DSS
development efforts.

From: jfcm@mcs.com (Intell/Agent Systems)
Subject: Job: Intelligent Agents for Intell/Agent Systems 
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

AI Programmer sought to develop intelligent agents.

Intell/Agent Systems is seeking an experienced programmer to support
research in the development of intelligent agents.

Duties.

Assist in the development, implementation, and maintenance of computer
programs for natural language interactions with intelligent agents. Assist
in the development and implementation of rapid prototyping tools for these
systems, including graphical user interfaces for simulation engines. Do
system maintenance and administration of system software and coordinating
standards for software development.

Requirements.

Master's or Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field and at
least two years experience in Common Lisp. Basic knowledge of artificial
intelligence research, including natural language understanding, knowledge
representation and planning. Good interpersonal skills.  Smart.

Preferences.

Experience in C++. Experience in programming the Macintosh and UNIX.
Experience in working on innovative software projects.

About Intell/Agent Systems:

The mission of the company is to build intelligent agents.  To this end, we
have three interrelated objectives:

- Intelligent Agents.  To develop software products capable of intelligent
behavior and communication with humans in natural languages.

- Market Creativity.  To develop and take advantage of new markets for
intelligent agents in real world applications.

- Technological Leadership.  To remain at the front of developing
technology, assuring the company's continued competitive advantage.

Intell/Agent is the recipient of Phase II SBIR funding to develop
"Artificial Intelligence for Manned Space System Applications." In
particular, the overall goal of the Phase II work is to create and deliver
a prototype version of the Intell/Agent's DMPA architecture to Johnson
Space Center, designed to run with any system using the NASA three-tiered
planning architecture for robots.

To apply, send a cover letter and a text-only resume to jfcm@mscs.com.
Inquiries can also be sent to this address.

Computational Linguists

Axis, Inc. is a privately owned Engineering Services company founded in 
1987 and located in Peoria, Illinois.

Axis, Inc. works very closely with Caterpillar Inc. in finding 
specialized professionals to fulfill various opportunities within 
Caterpillar.  Axis  currently has several opportunities for individuals 
with the following described capabilities.  A job description and a brief 
background on the translation system is also included:

Caterpillar Inc., the world's leading manufacturer of earthmoving 
equipment is currently developing a state-of-the-art computer translation 
system.  The Caterpillar Automatic Machine Translation (AMT) system 
includes a system of controlled English called Caterpillar Technical 
English.  the technical writer's CTE input is monitored by linguistic 
software integrated into the authoring system.  The controlled input is 
then translated by machine into the target languages.

Caterpillar is currently seeking qualified individuals to help with the 
development and maintenance of this system.  Candidate must possess 
skills in at least three of the following areas:

Computational Linguistics
Contrastive Linguistics (typology)
Technical Writing (including electronic document delivery)
Lexicography (preferred candidates will have heavy machinery experience)
Semantic Domain Modeling
Translations
Heavy equipment
Project Development

Preferred Candidates will have knowledge of one or more of the following 
areas:

SGML
Mechanical Engineering
Automotive Electronics
Publishing
Teaching
Unix (AIX) computing environments

An M.A. or equivalent in an appropriate areas is required.

The positions are scheduled to begin January 2, 1996.    

Axis offers career opportunities along with a competitive salary and an 
excellent benefits package.

Interested candidates should fax or mail their resume, references and 
salary requirements to:

Axis, Inc.
2201 W. Townline Road
Peoria, IL  61615
Attn: Doug Sluser
Fax: 309-691-4172
Phone: 309-691-3988
