that can get what you want, when you want it, as if they had real understanding. 

You Might As Well Love It...   The thought of developing new kinds of video and 
multimedia applications gets you excited. You want to help build dynamic products 
that integrate video and real-time video processing with effortless user interfaces.  
You'd like to work with talented team-mates who are more likely to say 'interesting' 
than  'impossible'.  Needless to say you're very handy with C++.  A bit of wizardry 
with Microsoft Visual C++ would be an asset too. 

Own a Piece of Your Success...   Money isn't everything, but we know it matters.  
We'll give you the opportunity to participate in stock options so you have a chance 
to bank on the successes you build.  

Use Your Head and Keep Your Mind...  You're ready to go to the wall for a 
company that welcomes your creativity and actually wants you to hang on to your 
wide-open mind.  Because we're new, you'll have a voice in shaping a corporate 
culture for the century ahead.  Bring us your ideas. 

We're Televitesse -- a Newbridge affiliate, born to change the way people use Mass 
Media.  Televitesse Systems develops intelligent multimedia solutions that put 
people first.  Right now, we're launching a media revolution called accesTV.  It's a 
personal assistant that actually watches TV for you,  attending every word to zero in 
on subjects you care about.  accesTV will be huge with a world-wide market of 
Cable Companies, Telcos,  Broadcasters and people in the financial industry.  One 
day soon,  everyone will want it.  Televitesse Systems is backed by Newbridge 
Networks Corporation, a world leader in multimedia communications.  We're 
destined to grow.  Fast.

Multimedia Applications Development

with a Bachelor or Masters in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or 
equivalent.  You also have a couple of years experience.   Send your CV and a copy 
of transcripts in confidence to Human Resources at Televitesse Systems Inc.  603 
March Road, Kanata,  Ontario K2K 2M5  by Nov. 1st 1995. 

Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.  
We are an equal opportunity employer.

Subject: Job: Lisp, Machine Learning, Scheduling at Caelum Research (San Francisco, CA)
Cc: ai+lisp-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: allen@wittgenstein.arc.nasa.gov (John Allen)
Subject: F/T LISP, C/C++, San Francicso Bay area
Organization: NASA/ARC Computational Sciences Division
Date: Mon, 2 Oct 1995 18:05:54 GMT


Caelum Research Corporation is a sub-contractor at NASA Ames research center
in the south San Francisco Bay area.  We currently have an opening on the
Intelligent Maintenance portion of the X-33 program.  The goal of X-33
program is to build a prototype of the next generation reusable launch
vehicle that will replace the space shuttle in the next decade.  The goal of
the Intelligent Maintenance project is to reduce the time needed to
maintain and refurbish the vehicle between flights through the use of
specialize sensors, vehicle component performance monitoring and automated
maintenance scheduling.  The position is primarily to support the automated
maintenance scheduling, but working in machine learning and problem solving
will also be required.

Applicants must be proficient Lisp and should have experience with C/C++ and
tcl/tk.  Familiarity planning and scheduling technology is also a plus.
Salaries are determined by the qualifications of the applicant and will
probably range somewhere between $25-$65k.

Only US citizens or Green card holders are eligible for this position.

To apply, email a cover letter and resume' (ASCII or postscript only) to
allen@ptolemy.arc.nasa.gov.  Please label all correspondence "IM"

If you do not have access to email, a hard copy can be sent to:

 John Allen
 M.S. 269-2
 NASA Ames Research Center
 Moffett Field, CA 94035-1000

Keywords:

products. They range from small start-ups with stock equity to large stable
fortune 100 corporations. All offer excellent career growth potential.

resume and/or call to find out more.

from commercial product development areas.  TA and RA and other academically

card or Canadian citizen.

information about the job.

From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Project Manager/Natural Language at MCC (Texas)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: mack@maximillion.mcc.com (Melanie Mack)
Subject: US-TX-PROJECT MANAGER I3-MCC
Organization: MCC Corporate Computing
Date: Tue, 3 Oct 1995 18:26:00 GMT

                  Intuitive Interfaces to Information 
              Systems Project--The Role of Human Language

Information systems now occupy a position of central importance 
in our economy, and successful business competition depends 
critically on effective and efficient processing of information.  
The importance of information processing and of the development of a 
National Information Infrastructure (NII) is acknowledged throughout 
industry, and the importance of a strong NII to the nation's 
well-being is recognized and strongly supported at top levels of 
government.  But, in order to provide full benefit from and full 
access to these information services, significant advances are needed 
in ease-of-use.  Natural and intuitive interfaces are required to 
empower the user, to exploit the potential of information services, 
and to bring information access to everybody.

Human language is clearly the medium and human language technology 
is the key to fulfill this need.  A host of potential application 
areas require human language interfaces.  Generic examples include 
information retrieval based upon natural language queries, machine 
translation of text from one language to another, automatic 
extraction of information from text for creating databases, 
dictation of text by voice, and domain-specific spoken language 
understanding for natural interactions with information systems.  
These applications represent a wave of potential services that will 
be enabled by natural intuitive interfaces using human language 
technology.  The I3S study was created to support and foster this 
vital development.

              PROJECT  MANAGER  GENERAL  RESPONSIBILITIES 

1. Technical leadership
   - Provide the technical direction necessary to develop plans for 
     studies/projects which respond customer needs.
   - Serve as a senior technical contributor to the study/project.
   - Establish responsibilities for subordinate staff in a manner which 
     maximizes the use of available technical talent.
   - Formulate plans for follow-on consortia projects or product 
     developments as appropriate.
2. Business Development
   - Identify, qualify, and take the steps necessary to close deals 
     with potential study/project sponsors.
   - Prepare proposals and "white papers" for government contracts 
     which represent new business opportunities or ways to gain 
     additional leverage for existing projects.
3. Administrative Management
   - Recruit, develop, and retain a competent and motivated staff.
   - Monitor and control project expenditures to insure adherence 
     to budget.
   - Develop contingency plans modifying staffing levels, project 
     deliverables, and other direct costs as necessary to respond 
     to changing financial conditions.
   - Ensure that MCC policies are understood by the project staff 
     and followed.
4. Customer Satisfaction
   - Ensure the timeliness and quality of study findings and project 
     deliverables.
   - Contribute to effectively reporting findings and transferring 
     technology to sponsors.
   - Maintain close liaison with sponsors to understand changing 
     needs and expectations.

Send resume' to: MCC
                 ATTN: Human Resources Department
                 P.O. Box 200195
                 Austin, Texas  78720
        E-mail:  vallen@mcc.com
*************************************************************
The Microelectronics and Computer Technology Corporation

Information technology is advancing at break-neck speeds.
Competition is going global. Business success demands innovation,
agility, and the right strategic partners working together to
get further faster and at less expense.

It was this philosophy-the value of cooperation-that led ten
major U.S. corporations to launch MCC more than a decade ago,
and it continues to be MCC's guiding philosophy today. Shrinking
margins and limited resources make consortial research more
valuable today than ever before, providing a proven strategy for
accelerating technology development and leveraging scarce R&D
resources.

Today's MCC is a rich environment for multidisciplinary
research and development, technology integration, and
alliance-building, with a pervasive commitment to accelerating
the creation, commercialization, and adoption of innovation in
information technologies and advanced electronics. MCC's objective
is to enhance the ability of member companies to harness the
power of information technology to attain sustainable competitive
advantage.

Founded by major computer and semiconductor manufacturers, MCC's
membership has diversified to include a broad range of high-profile
corporations from electronics, computers, aerospace, semiconductors,
and related industries, as well as major end users of advanced
technology. MCC's membership reflects the full range of companies
that are vital to the life cycle of information technology and
advanced electronic products. Active involvement of small- and medium-
sized manufacturers, along with well-established alliances with
government research and development agencies and leading universities,
allows MCC's partners to make cost-effective use of R&D resources.

JOB OPPORTUNITIES
	    NEURAL NETWORK / FUZZY LOGIC SYSTEM DESIGN
			   involving
	     VLSI HARDWARE, and SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT
	at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, Pasadena CA, USA


Requires:   Ph D (EE or Computer Science) and 2 or more years
	    experience for a position as Member of Technical Staff.

	    PhD (EE or Computer Science) for post-doctoral position.
                
Areas of specialization, expertise, knowledge, and interests:  

	All aspects of analog and digital VLSI and system design.
	Knowledgeable in new computing paradigms such as neural
	networks, fuzzy logic, genetic algorithms, etc.  Skilled with
	computer hardware and software development. Interest in
	innovation.

Skills Sought:   

	Experience with VLSI circuit design & layout tools such as
	Spice and Magic. Expertise in C, Unix, X, MSDOS, MS-Windows,
	etc. Knowledge of computer interface techniques and
	hardware.  Familiarity with computer graphics, and some
	knowledge of conventional signal/image processing techniques
	and algorithms.

The Job:

	Development and integration of state of the art
	full-custom/ASIC VLSI concurrent processing architectures for
	real-time sensor signal processing, pattern-recognition, data
	fusion, etc.

US Citizenship or Permanent Resident Status is preferred.

JOB OPPORTUNITIES FOR SOFTWARE DEVELOPERS

Canon Research Centre Europe Ltd                          5th October 1995
Guildford, UK
http://www.cre.canon.co.uk

Canon Research Centre Europe is looking for people with excellent programming
skills, to assist us in further development of our core technologies, and with
the potential to contribute to the long term R&D aims of the centre.

Applicants should have strong skills in one or more of the following areas:

        C/C++ programming
        Software development under PC/Windows
        Embedding software

The centre's work ranges from long-term basic research to solving specific
problems quickly, and currently focusses on speech & natural language, colour
and image processing.  A background in these technologies is not essential.
We are currently embarking on embedding our natural language and speech
software in realistic hardware platforms.

Please note that you need to have the right to work in Britain. If you are 
not a citizen of one of the member states of the European Union, please check
whether you are eligible before applying.

If you are interested, send us a detailed CV and a one-page cover
letter, quoting reference "sd95-264-2", as plain text by e-mail to:

        sdjob@cre.canon.co.uk

Alternatively, you can send a paper copy to:

        Kazuko Cooper (SD)
        Canon Research Centre Europe
        20 Alan Turing Road
        Surrey Research Park
        Guildford GU2 5YF, UK

        tel: +44-1483-448844
        fax: +44-1483-448845

At the moment we are advertising specific posts in software development,
speech processing and natural language processing, but we are always on the
lookout for people who are excellent, and who have the flexibility, capability
and motivation to learn new skills.

For more information on this and other opportunities at Canon Research Centre
Europe, see our WWW jobs page at http://www.cre.canon.co.uk/jobs.html,
or e-mail the above address.

We doubt that you would be disappointed by salary, equipment or working
environment. Our recruitment policy is one of equal opportunity.

JOB OPPORTUNITIES IN SPEECH PROCESSING

Canon Research Centre Europe Ltd                          5th October 1995
Guildford, UK
http://www.cre.canon.co.uk

Canon Research Centre Europe is looking for people to assist us in further
development of core speech recognition technology, and with the potential to
contribute to the long term R&D aims of the centre.

Excellent programming skills and good maths or signal processing abilities
are important. Experience in one of the following areas is an advantage, but
is not essential:

        Speech recognition
        Speech signal processing
        C/C++ programming
        DSP programming

Please note that you need to have the right to work in Britain. If you are
not a citizen of one of the member states of the European Union, please
check whether you are eligible before applying.

If you are interested, send us a detailed CV and a one-page cover
letter, quoting reference "sp95-264-1", as plain text by e-mail to:

        spjob@cre.canon.co.uk

Alternatively, you can send a paper copy to:

        Kazuko Cooper (SP)
        Canon Research Centre Europe
        20 Alan Turing Road
        Surrey Research Park
        Guildford GU2 5YF, UK

        tel: +44-1483-448844
        fax: +44-1483-448845

At the moment we are advertising specific posts in software development,
speech processing and natural language processing, but we are always on the
lookout for people who are excellent, and who have the flexibility, capability
and motivation to learn new skills.

For more information on this and other opportunities at Canon Research Centre
Europe, see our WWW jobs page at http://www.cre.canon.co.uk/jobs.html,
or e-mail the above address.

We doubt that you would be disappointed by salary, equipment or working
environment. Our recruitment policy is one of equal opportunity.

JOB OPPORTUNITIES IN NATURAL LANGUAGE PROCESSING

Canon Research Centre Europe Ltd                          5th October 1995
Guildford, UK
http://www.cre.canon.co.uk

Canon Research Centre Europe is looking for new recruits for its natural 
language group.  We are looking for people who will fit well into the group 
on a permanent basis.  Creativity and innovative work is encouraged.  

Applicants should have skills in one or more of the following areas:

        Computational linguistics
        Functional programming
        Large-scale corpus analysis
        Statistical methods

Our work ranges from long-term basic research to solving specific problems 
quickly, and from interactive spoken dialogue systems to large-scale text 
translation. We are currently embarking on embedding our natural language 
software in realistic hardware platforms.  Skills/expertise relevant to this 
area would be useful.

Please note that you need to have the right to work in Britain. If you are 
not a citizen of one of the member states of the European Union, please 
check whether you are eligible before applying.

If you are interested, send us a detailed CV and a one-page cover
letter, quoting reference "nl95-264-3",  as plain text by e-mail to:
 
        nljob@cre.canon.co.uk

Alternatively, you can send a paper copy to:

        Kazuko Cooper (NL)
        Canon Research Centre Europe
        20 Alan Turing Road
        Surrey Research Park
        Guildford GU2 5YF, UK

        tel: +44-1483-448844
        fax: +44-1483-448845

At the moment we are advertising specific posts in software development, 
speech processing and natural language processing, but we are always on the
lookout for people who are excellent, and who have the flexibility, capability 
and motivation to learn new skills.

For more information on this and other opportunities at Canon Research Centre
Europe, see our WWW jobs page at http://www.cre.canon.co.uk/jobs.html,
or e-mail the above address.

We doubt that you would be disappointed by salary, equipment or working
environment. Our recruitment policy is one of equal opportunity.

Date: 6 Oct 1995 14:17:01 GMT
Organization: CERFnet Dial n' CERF Customer

                        NATURAL LANGUAGE DEVELOPER
                               (New York)

U.S. or Canadian citizenship required, or U.S. permanent residency.
Unfortunately, we are unable to assist persons requiring visa sponsorship.

The Speech Services Technology Group has an opening for a developer 
with significant experience in building Natural Language Understanding 
systems.

This group designs and deploys state-of-the-art interacive speech 
recognition and language understanding systems.  Spoken language 
systems combine a recognition framework with natural language and 
discourse modeling capabilities to provide the uninitiated caller with 
an elegant, powerful, and easy-to-use interface to various 
applications, using a standard telephone.  Opportunities for applying 
this technology to multimedia and to text processing may also arise. 

Qualifications:

At least an MS in Computer Science, Linguistics, or related field.

At least 3 years experience, either commercial or academic, directly 
involved in the development of robust natural language systems.

Significant software development experience, most preferably in C or 
C++.

Experience with relevant statistical techniques.

Familiarity with related fields, such as speech recognition, signal 
processing, relevant real time programming issues, and user interface 
design for speech and language systems, are all pluses.

Experience and maturity in conceptualization, software design, and 
software engineering.

Ability to work in a cohesive team.

Strong motivation to excel.

            ** Minimum 3 years on-the-job experience required**

Please respond directly to Arnold Garlick, President, Pacific Search,
2377 S. El Camino Real, Suite 201, San Clemente, CA  92672.
E Mail:  arnold@pacific.com (ASCII files ONLY PLEASE, NO Postscript
files, please)  Fax: (714) 366-9200.

Please refer to Position #1886

The Hager Group, Inc.

EV.Hager@IX.NETCOM.COM

At The Hager Group, Inc., we base our success in understanding the
interworkings between technology and business.  We provide consultants
who understand the needs of the business while providing technical
expertise to our clients.  We are located between Austin and San
Antonio as to provide the best service for companies in the south Texas
area and beyond.

We develop relationships with the consultants and technology
specialists in the Austin/San Antonio area.  We utilize consultants who
specialize in the technology and skill sets as required by our clients.
 We seek out, interview, and provide for our clients a selection of the
highest qualified people for our clients projects.  The consultants
may be hired for a short term or long term projects or as a try and
buy, using the potential employee as a consultant in an extended
interview process.  Most importantly, our clients will hire the top
technical talent with the flexibilty of getting the best skill set for
the individual projects.

In todays environment, it is difficult to track the many changes in
information technology.  By utilizing our consultants, your firm will
receive the benefit of outside business and technical evaluations of
new technologies.  We will assist you in understanding and implementing
these new products, functions, and features.  

Our mission:

 provide consultants for projects
 provide project management to assist local firms with advanced
technologies
 build long term relationships with consultants and local companies
 place consultants into positions as full time employees with our
clients
 create and utilize a base of technical staff familiar with the
business community.

We welcome the opportunity to discuss our services with your firm at
your earliest convenience.

KNOWLEDGE ENGINEERING PTE LTD (Singapore)
-----------------------------------------
Recipient of the Best Application Award (Artificial Intelligence - 1995) 
in the First International Users' Conference in ILOG SOLVER & ILOG SCHEDULE 
in Paris.

Knowledge Engineering Pte Ltd, a premier software development company,
specializes in the application of object-oriented technologies,
Artificial Intelligence, computer graphics, wireless communications and 
RDBMS to real-world problems. We develop generic software products, 
undertake turnkey projects and consultancy for clients primarily in the 
transportation, manufacturing and communication-services sectors. The 
systems we have developed make innovative use of state-of-the-art 
technologies, including graphics capabilities, search and constraint-based 
optimization and other AI techniques, wireless communications and 
client-server architecture.

We are looking for highly motivated computer professionals who are 
flexible enough to carry out a wide range of tasks ranging from 
software research, analysis and design, implementation, documentation 
and testing to customer liaison, support and training. These positions 
offer excellent prospect for individual growth, providing you with 
challenging and beneficial experience in emerging technologies.


Are you the one we are looking for?

-  A degree or higher degree in Computer Science/EE.
-  Sound knowledge of C++, UNIX and object-oriented analysis and design 
   methodologies.
-  Effective written and oral communication skills.
-  At least 2 years of practical experience in software development.

In addition, the following skills are highly desirable for each of the 
following positions:


Project Managers

-  Working experience with Artificial Intelligence technologies, 
   constraint-based systems or wireless communications would be 
   highly regarded.
-  Able to communicate effectively with team members, users and 
   all levels of management.
-  Experience in managing/developing complex systems using 
   state-of-the-art technologies.


Software Engineers (Artificial Intelligence)

-  Working experience with Artificial Intelligence technologies, 
   constraint-based systems or expert systems would be highly regarded.
-  Experience in implementing planning and scheduling systems, 
   especially in a transportation, manufacturing  or 
   communication-services environment, would be advantageous.
 

Software Engineers (Wireless Communications)

-  Good working knowledge of Real-time operating systems.
-  Experience in communications protocol programming such as DECT,
   ISDN and/or GSM.
-  Knowledge of modern communications systems


Software Engineers (Computer Graphics)

-  Good working knowledge of X Windows, Motif or Interviews.
-  Familiarity with RDBMS.

Software Engineers (Database)

-  Working experience with CA-Ingres, Oracle or Sybase.

If so, and you wish to join us and enjoy the benefits of a dynamic 
working environment where you can excel to your full potential, send 
us a detailed resume. Please enclose your personal particulars, 
educational qualifications, working experience, contact telephone 
number and expected remuneration. (In real-time please.)

Subject: Artificial Intelligence Programmer Job
Date: 6 Oct 1995 11:51:40 -0400
Organization: Rutgers University LCSR


          ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE PROGRAMMER POSITION

The High-Performance Computing and Design (HPCD) Project in the
Laboratory for Computer Science at Rutgers University is looking
for a programmer to support research in ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE,
COMPUTER-AIDED DESIGN and NUMERICAL/SYMBOLIC/SCIENTIFIC COMPUTATION.

Duties:

Developing, implementing and maintaining experimental computer
programs for for simulation and optimization of engineering designs.
Developing and implemeting tools to support automatic or
semi-automatic construction of simulation and optimization codes.
Developing and implementing graphical user interfaces to support
automated design and automated software construction.  Performing
system maintenance and administration, including installing and
maintaining system software.  Coordinating code and coding standards
for the research project.

Qualifications:

Requires either a Masters Degree or Bachelor's degree in computer
science or related field, and least two years experience in
LISP and either C or FROTRAN programming on Unix systems. Requires
knowledge of X systems, understanding of basic algorithms and data
structures and their perofrmance implications, ability to deal with
complex and evolving experimental programs, and effective
interpersonal skills.  Knowledge of Artificial Intelligence and 
Numerical Analysis techniques is preferred.  

Salary Range:  Approximately.  $40,000-$55,000

The HPCD Project:

The HPCD Project is an ARPA-funded, multi-university,
multi-disciplinary research project, whose goal is to study the
application of Artificial Intelligence and other areas of Computer
Science, of Computational Science (especially Computational Fluid
Dynamics), and of high-performance computing to problems of design.
Design tasks we are currently working on include design of jet engine
inlets and nozzles, container ships, microprocessors, and
microlithography processes.  The HPCD Project is centered at Rutgers
University in New Brunswick, NJ, where the person hired for this
position would be located.

To apply:

Send (hard copy) resumes to
    Karen McGee
    Personnel Department
    Rutgers University
    New Brunswick, NJ 08903
    (908) 445-3020

Refer to "posting number AP 048".  (This is required
to officially apply for the job.)

In addition, I would appreciate a copy be sent to me by email
(preferred) at ellman@cs.rutgers.edu or US mail: 


    Prof. Tom Ellman
    Dept. of Computer Science
    Hill Center, Busch Campus
    Rutgers University
    Piscataway, NJ 08855-1089

Feel free to contact me for further information at either my email
or US mail address.

Subject: RA: Applications of AI to River Quality Surveys at Staffordshire Univ. (UK)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: W.J.Walley@soc.staffs.ac.uk (Bill Walley)
Subject: RESEARCH ASSOCIATE: Application of AI in River Quality Surveys
Date: 12 Oct 1995 15:56:46 GMT
Organization: Staffordshire University

Post: RESEARCH ASSOCIATE (Researcher Grade A/B)

Location: School of Computing, Staffordshire University, Stafford, UK

Duration: 2 year contract with possiblity of extension.

Project Title: Application of Artificial Intelligence in River Quality Surveys 
	       (National Rivers Authority R&D Project No. 621)

Objectives:  To develop neural network models for the prediction of river water quality from
	     biological data. Stage one of the project will involve extensive analyses of the
	     NRA's biological and chemical databases. Stage two will involve the development and 
             testing of various neural network models, followed by workshops for the NRA's
	     regional biologists.

Candidates should preferably hold a PhD degree.  They must have a good background in computing
and preferably have: 
a) some knowledge of the theory and application of neural networks;
b) good background knowledge of mathematics and statistics;
c) experience in the construction/use of large databases
e) some knowledge of freshwater biology/chemistry

To receive full details and application forms send your name and address to the Project Manager:
Bill Walley (W.J.Walley@soc.staffs.ac.uk)

Positions Available - AI jobs/Data mining/programming

Job code: BL/Recon

Join a dynamic team in Palo Alto, CA, developing leading-edge 
Data Mining software to extract patterns and other useful 
information from large quantities of of data.  The software 
integrates deductive database technology with several machine 
learning techniques. This position requires a can-do attitude 
and a keen interest in data mining and related technologies.

Requirements: We have employment opportunities in several 
disciplines.  We are looking for motivated programmers, 
researchers and data analysts from new graduates to seasoned 
professionals.  Desired skills include:  machine learning, 
applied statistics, SAS programming, deductive databases, 
Prolog programming, relational database management systems, 
UNIX and C programming and GUI development in Tcl/Tk.


WHO ARE WE?

The Research and Software Technology Divisions of a Fortune 20
Company are seeking bright and talented Software professionals to
add to their workforce on a Full-time basis.
We have had an influx of project work and have both junior and
senior positions available.  If you are a recent graduate,but 
have several years of proven programming skills and are now 
interested in working in a research setting, we want to talk 
with you!!!


*WHAT IS OUR WORKPLACE LIKE?

We are researchers in an entrepreneurial environment.  You will
have flexibility to make a lot of your own goals - and work with
other talented people in a great location. Must have
current authorization to work in the United States.

*HOW TO REACH US?

For immediate consideration, fax or Email your resume to my attention.
PLEASE REMEMBER TO REFERENCE THE JOB CODE and let us know the best 
times and places to reach you.  We will review your background and 
contact you to discuss the positions available.

From: John Paisley <J.M.Paisley@ncl.ac.uk>
Subject: Vacancy for Assistant Professorship
Date: Wed, 11 Oct 1995 15:40:01 +0100
Organization: University of Newcastle (UK)

                 UNIVERSITY OF NEWCASTLE UPON TYNE

                      DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHOLOGY

         Assistant Professorship in behavioural ecology,
          animal behaviour or neural network computing


Applications from suitably qualified and experienced scientists are invited for
a lectureship in this enthusiastic and expanding department. Candidates
should have a good honours degree, a doctorate, and a record of research
activity in published papers and research support. Applicants who will
contribute to our research in behavioural ecology or neural network computing
are particularly encouraged. Excellent research facilities and support will be
provided. Salary will be on the Lecturer Grade A/B Scale (to GBP26,430), at a
position determined by qualifications and experience.

The Department of Psychology at Newcastle is broadly-based and rapidly growing.
All undergraduate courses offered by the Department are heavily over-subscribed
and the Department's postgraduate research community is the fastest growing of
any in the university. Staff have research programs in cognitive neuroscience,
behavioural ecology, and health, and applied cognitive psychology. The
Department is also the home of the Neural Systems Group, an interdisciplinary
centre for research in sensory, systems, computational and cognitive
neuroscience, and neural network computing. The members of the Neural
Systems Group are drawn from the Departments of Psychology, Physiological
Sciences and the School of Neurosciences. Further details of the department can
be found on the WWW at

http://york37.ncl.ac.uk/www/psychol.html

No forms of application will be issued. Applications should take the form of a
covering letter and three copies of the applicant's full curriculum vitae,
with details of present salary and the names and addresses of three referees.
Informal enquiries may be made to Prof. Malcolm Young (0191-222-7525,
mpy%crunch@ncl.ac.uk) or Dr John Lazarus (0191-222-6181, j.lazarus@ncl.ac.uk).
Applications should be sent to: the Director of Personnel, University of
Newcastle upon Tyne, NE1 7RU.

Subject: Job: Graduate position in conceptual information retrieval
Date: Fri, 20 Oct 95 12:05:00 edt
Message-Id: <3087FCB6@instigate.dataware.com>
Encoding: 39 TEXT
X-Mailer: Microsoft Mail V3.0
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU


A position is available, within a research team working on
leading-edge systems of e-mail management and conceptual information
retrieval, for a researcher to work in Conceptual Lexicography.
His/her background will include one or more of the following:
Cognitive Science, Psycholinguistics, Lexicography, Cognitive
Grammar, Computational Linguistics (not Chomskyan or neo-Chomskyan),
Neurolinguistics, or Semantics. It would also be a definite asset for
the candidate to have some skills in computing.

The parts of the project in which he/she will be working will involve
the application of a comprehensive system of conceptual codes to the
construction and use of meaning profiles and conceptual lexicons in
the development of one or more products. The individual will be
expected to work closely with three other lexicographers, and to
liaise with all other members of the team. In addition to having a
degree related to at least one of the above areas, the applicant
should be able to establish his/her ability to conduct research, and
to demonstrate a clear and definite interest in this research area.

If you are interested in this position, we will have an initial
telephone conversation with you. In the first instance, however,
please e-mail, fax or mail your CV, along with a cover letter, and
include a phone number where you can be reached for a confidential
conversation, as soon as possible before November 10, to the
following:

Douglas A. Young
Director of Research
CM Projects
Dataware Technologies
One Antares Drive
Nepean
Ontario, K2E 8C4
Canada

Fax: (613) 225-2304

E-mail: dyoung @ dataware.com

development.

services.

business process automation projects.

CSA Job 95-1002

Motor Company.  The NextPert programmer will perform Artificial Intelligence

facilitate to the KBE tools into the SDRC CAD/CAM Master Series.

THIS IS A GREAT JOB.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 *  Minimum 1 year NextPert A/I programming experience.

 *  Education:  BS in CS, Math, Engineering or equivalent experience

    skills.

 *  Citizenship:  US Citizenship or permanent residence

                    plus excellent benefits

may have an interest in learning more about this position contact me or:

IMMEDIATE OPENING IMMEDIATE OPENING

Web Application Development Position

Inference needs a creative software engineer 
to develop case-base tools as Web Applications. 
(A case base is a document organized as a collection 
of independent records that may be located and 
retrieved by advanced "fuzzy logic" matching techniques. 
A demo version of one of these products is available on-line at: 
http://www.infererence.com/wcp)

We're looking for a person experienced in constructing 
object-oriented software, with knowledge of CGI Scripts, HTML+, C++,
UNIX (Solaris, HP-UX, AIX). Other experience in the areas of NT, 
OS/2, and Win95 development environments, relational databases, 
client/server networking, and information retrieval techniques 
will be helpful. 

The person who applies for this position should be a self-starter, 
who can stay on top of, and one step ahead of, the changes taking 
place in the internet. The person should be capable of working 
closely with software engineers, management, marketing and senior 
writers to complete genuinely user-helpful case base tools on a 
demanding schedule. 

This position is based at Inference Corporation in Novato, Marin 
County, 30 minutes north of San Francisco. Inference is a publicly 
held company and is traded on the NASDAQ exchange under INFR. 
Salary will be commensurate with experience.  Inference is an 
EOE/AA employer. 

For further information, please contact Inference Human Resources.

Subject: Lectureship in Intelligent Systems available
Date: 20 Oct 1995 15:35:03 GMT
Organization: Department of Computer Science, University of York, England



	Lectureship in Computer Science (Intelligent Systems)
			University of York, UK


Applications are invited for a permanent lectureship (equivalent to an
Assistant Prof. in N. America) in the Department of Computer Science
(which achieved the highest ratings in the 1992 Research Assessment
Exercise and the 1994 Teaching Quality Assessment Exercise).  The post
will strengthen the Department's research and teaching activities in
the area of Intelligent Systems, in which applicants must have a
proven research record; experience of university teaching would be an
additional advantage.

The appointment is available from 1 March 1996, or as soon as possible
thereafter, on the Lecturer Scale Grade A (GBP 14,317 to GBP 19,848
per annum).

Informal enquiries may be made to Dr Keith Mander (Head of the Department
of Computer Science, 01904-432727, mander@minster.york.ac.uk) or Dr Alan
Frisch (Head of the Intelligent Systems Research Group, 01904-432745,
frisch@minster.york.ac.uk).

Six copies of applications with full curriculum vitae and the names of
three referees should be sent by Monday, 13 November 1995 to the
Personnel Officer, University of York, Heslington, York YO1 5DD.
Further particulars are available from the Personnel Office (telephone
01904-432151).  Applicants should quote the following reference
number: X/3425.


===========================================================================


		    Department of Computer Science
			University of York, UK

	Lectureship in Computer Science (Intelligent Systems)


		      Information to Candidates


Candidates should read this document in conjunction with general
information about the Department of Computer Science (Facts and
figures about the Department of Computer Science).  The purpose of the
present document is to provide additional information specific to the
advertised post.


1. Lectureship in Intelligent Systems

The Department of Computer Science has a strong research and teaching
record.  It was rated Grade 5 (i.e. attainable levels of international
excellence in some sub- areas of activity and to attainable levels of
national excellence in virtually all others) in the 1992 Research
Assessment Exercise, and Excellent (i.e. demonstrably very high levels
of achievement and best practice) in the 1994 Teaching Quality
Assessment Exercise.  In 1997 the Department will move into a spacious
new building, accompanied by a significant
expansion of its teaching and research activities.


The Department has a small but growing research group in Intelligent
Systems.  The aim of the group is to investigate the theoretical
principles of artificial intelligence and their application to
real-world domains.  Research topics covered by the group include:
knowledge representation and reasoning, especially automated
deduction; constraint logic programming and constraint solving;
machine learning, especially case-based reasoning, learning to plan,
learning grammars for natural languages; generalisation and
computational learning theory; natural language processing.  The
Department expects the successful candidate to be able to make a
significant contribution to this research group or a related area.  A
proven record in research is essential.  Proven ability in university
teaching will be an additional recommendation.


2.

The post is offered on the Lecturer Scale Grade A (currently GBP
14,317 to GBP 19,848 per annum) with membership of USS.  The candidate
appointed may, immediately on starting his or her employment, join USS
--the occupational pension scheme provided by this University-- under
which the employee must contribute 6.35% of salary, the University
contributing an amount equal to 18.55% of salary.  Academic staff are
required to retire on 30 September following the date on which they
attain the age of 67.

The University will meet the full cost within reason of removal of
furniture and household effects within the United Kingdom for new
members of staff.  The extent of payment of removal expenses of staff
coming from overseas is at the discretion of the Vice-Chancellor.
Three estimates of removal costs (one of which should be from a York
firm) must be obtained and the University will meet the full cost of
the lowest estimate.


3.

Informal inquiries may be made to the Head of Department, Dr Keith
Mander (tel: 01904-432727, e-mail: mander@minster.york.ac.uk).  Dr
Alan Frisch (tel:01904-432745, email: frisch@minster.york.ac.uk), who
leads the Intelligent Systems Group, is also available to answer
queries.  The address of the Department's World-Wide-Web page is
http://www.cs.york.ac.uk/.

Six copies of applications with full curriculum vitae and the names of
three referees, should be sent to the Personnel Officer, University of
York, Heslington, York YO1 5DD, by the date specified in the
advertisement. Please quote the advertisement reference number: X/3425.

          7 Nov 95 20:14:15 EST
Date: Tue, 7 Nov 95 20:13:15 EST
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Speech Recognition at Sheffield Univ.
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: S.Renals@dcs.shef.ac.uk
Subject: Research Positions in Speech Recognition [Sheffield]
Date: Wed, 01 Nov 1995 22:04:58 EST

As part of the EU funded project SPRACH (Speech Recognition Algorithms
for Connectionist Hybrids) two Research Associate positions, of three
years duration, are available at the Universities of Cambridge and
Sheffield.  Both positions are concerned with developing new methods
for large vocabulary speech recognition.  The Sheffield position will
have an emphasis towards statistical language modelling;  the Cambridge
position will have an emphasis on connectionist acoustic models.

The research project will build on the recently completed Wernicke
project.  One of the outcomes of that project is the Abbot large
vocabulary speech recognition system, which is available in a
demonstration version at
ftp://svr-ftp.eng.cam.ac.uk/pub/comp.speech/recognition/AbbotDemo/

The job adverts and application details are included below.  For
informal discussion contact either Steve Renals (s.renals@dcs.shef.ac.uk)
or Tony Robinson (ajr@eng.cam.ac.uk).

Tony Robinson, Cambridge University
Steve Renals,  Sheffield University

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

University of Sheffield
Department of Computer Science, Speech and Hearing Group

Research Associate in Continuous Speech Recognition

Applications are invited for a Research Associate to work in the
speech and hearing group in the area of continuous speech recognition.
In particular, the post will involve the investigation of new methods
of statistical language modelling, approaches to domain adaptation and
the development and evaluation of demonstration systems.
The project is funded as a Basic Research Project by the EU and will
be of three years duration, from December 1995.  Candidates for the
post will be expected to hold a postgraduate degree (preferably a PhD)
in a relevant discipline, or to have acquired equivalent experience.
The successful candidate will have had research experience in the area
of statistical language modelling or connectionist/HMM-based speech
recognition.

Salary will be in the range \pounds 14,317 to \pounds 18,985.
Informal enquiries about the post to Dr. Steve Renals
(email: s.renals@dcs.shef.ac.uk; tel: +44-114-282-5575;
fax: +44-114-278-0972).  Further particulars and an application form
are available from the Director of Human Resource Management, The
University of Sheffield, Western Bank, Sheffield  S10 2TN
(tel: +44-114-282-4144; fax: +44-114-276-7897), citing Ref:R780.

The closing date for applications is Friday 10 November 1995.

The University of Sheffield follows an Equal Opportunity Policy.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

University of Cambridge
Engineering Department, Speech Vision and Robotics group

Research Associate in Large Vocabulary Connectionist Speech Recognition

Applications are invited for a Research Assistantship in the use of
connectionist models and hidden Markov models in large vocabulary
automatic speech recognition.  The project is funded by the EU and is of
36 months duration.  Candidates for this post will have a good first
degree and preferably a postgraduate degree in a relevant discipline.
The candidate is expected to have prior knowledge of
connectionist/Markov model hybrids, large vocabulary recognition or a
related area.  The ability to manage a large software project,
participate in international evaluations and liaise with industry would
be advantageous.  Salary will be in the range \pounds 14,317 to \pounds
19,848.

Further details and an application form may be obtained by writing to Dr
Tony Robinson, Cambridge University Engineering Department, Trumpington
Street, Cambridge CB2 1PZ, U.K., email ajr@eng.cam.ac.uk, phone
+44-1223-332815, fax +44-1223-332662, or http://svr-www.eng.cam.ac.uk/~ajr.

The deadline for applications is 26 November 1995.

The University follows an equal opportunities policy.

Date: Tue, 7 Nov 95 20:16:29 EST
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: Machine Translation at Caterpillar Inc. (Peoria, IL)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: ehn+@CS.CMU.EDU (Eric Nyberg)
Subject: US-IL-Peoria Computational Linguist, Caterpillar, Inc.
Date: 25 Oct 1995 16:57:30 GMT
Organization: Carnegie-Mellon University, School of Computer Science

US-IL-Peoria Computational Linguist, Caterpillar, Inc.

Please Post and Distribute (Posting Revised 09/29/95)

Caterpillar Inc., the world's leading manufacturer of earthmoving
equipment is currently developing a state-of-the-art computer
translation system. The Caterpillar Automatic Machine Translation
(AMT) system includes a system of controlled English called
Caterpillar Technical English. The technical writer's CTE input is
monitored by linguistic software integrated into the authoring
system. The controlled input is then translated by machine into the
target languages.

Caterpillar is currently seeking qualified individuals to help with the
development and maintenance of this system. Candidates must possess
skills in at least three of the following areas:

 * Computational Linguistics
 * Contrastive Linguistics (typology)
 * Technical Writing (including electronic document delivery)
 * Lexicography (preferred candidates will have heavy machinery	experience)
 * Semantic Domain Modeling
 * Translations
 * Heavy Equipment
 * Project Development

Preferred Candidates will have knowledge of one or more of the
following areas:

 * SGML
 * Mechanical Engineering
 * Automotive Electronics
 * Publishing
 * Teaching
 * Unix (AIX) computing environments

An M.A. or equivalent in an appropriate area is required.

SUMMARY: Vacancies exist for two people in ASR within a leading edge small

a fresh graduate in computer science.

Forum Technology and the Defence Research Agency, Malvern, have been working
together on a major DTI funded collaborative speech recognition project. The
project is based in the foot of the hills in Malvern, Worcestershire, England.
Forum is a small, young and dynamic company which has been engaged in work on
voice products and speech recognition for some years. The Defence Research
Agency, Malvern (formerly Royal Signals and Radar), has been engaged in speech
research for several decades.

Forum Technology is looking for people who can help develop new systems and
products. The posts will involve language modelling research, some acoustic
modelling research and development work.

The first post if for an experienced researcher. Previous experience
with statistical processing of speech and language is necessary.

The second post is for a fresh graduate in computer science. Experience
in C programming and some knowledge of C++ is required. Previous exposure
to statistical processing of speech and language would be a plus.

Our negotiated renumeration packages are definitely above industry standards.

HIRING REQUISITION

REQ# 319-R
DATE:  10/27/95
Full-time/Regular

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Participate in the design, coding, and testing of a system for control of 
computer applications by continuous speech and natural language 
processing; particularly the grammar and semantic processing for the 
system.  The aim of the system is to let naive users control, by 
speaking, powerful PC applications, such as word processors or 
spreadsheets without having to learn a new command language.  Thus, the 
system must provide very broad coverage of naive users' utterances, and 
must fail in comprehensible ways.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience in computational linguistics;
Experience in writing grammars for real tasks;
Experience in building real, efficient systems (preferably products); 
2 years experience with C programming

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience with:

Windows programming;
OLE;
Windows applications;
Feature structure grammars;
1 year experience with C++ programming;
Graduate training in NLP, PhD

Inference offers a broad spectrum of world-class Consulting Services
which foster routine success with CBR2 products, through technology
transfer Inference is actively searching for several highly qualified
individuals to join our Consulting Services group. The open positions
are described below.  Please respond with a copy of your
qualifications to Human Resources c/o Inference Corporation, 100
Rowland Way, Novato, CA, 94945. E-mail submissions will be accepted at
bergmann@inference.com.  Please reference the job codes given below.

***********************************************************************
***********************************************************************

Consulting Services Group Seeks Qualified Candidates 

***********************************************************************
***********************************************************************

Regional Consulting Manager [PSRCM] 
 

We currently have an opening for a Regional Consulting Manager for the
Western Region.  The position reports to the Vice President of
Consulting Services North America, which it turn reports into the
Senior Vice President of North American Operations.  This position
requires the individual to work out of Inference Corporate
Headquarters in Novato, California.  The selected candidate will be
responsible for all consulting projects conceived, proposed, bid, and
delivered in the Western Region. The selected candidate will also be
responsible for the administration of all the consultants in the
region. We are seeking unique individuals with at least five years
consulting experience in the software industry; with at least two
years proven track record in software consulting service business
development; and with at least two years experience in project
management and delivery of consulting services software projects. The
selected individual will feel comfortable in a business development
role while working with the Sales team as well as in a technical role
in guiding multiple teams of consultants toward successful
implementations of CBR2 and developing satisfied clients.  Candidates
must have at least a Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related
engineering. A background including Case-Based Reasoning (CBR), expert
system solution techniques, and large scale knowledge publishing
techniques is highly desirable. Qualified candidates must be creative,
articulate, personable, self-confident and possess a broad base of
talents and abilities including presentation, writing, analytical, and
client management skills.


***********************************************************************
***********************************************************************

Senior Consultant - Case Base Designer [PSCBD] 
 

We currently have openings for Case Base designers who will work with
our clients to incorporate CBR technology in their front office
systems.  You will interact with customer service center managers,
interview problem solving experts, design Case Base architectures, and
direct clients in the development and deployment of case bases.
 

We are seeking candidates with three or more years general consulting
experience.  Candidates must have excellent writing skills and good
overall computer application development skills. Previous experience
in knowledge engineering for expert systems, Case-Based Reasoning
(CBR) or other problem-solving technologies is highly desired.  At
least one year of programming or training experience is required.
Experience managing or working in a call center environment is also a
plus.  Qualified candidates must be creative, articulate, personable,
self-confident and possess a broad base of talents and abilities
including presentation, writing, analytical, and client management
skills.  Applicants should possess knowledge of leading technologies -
Windows and UNIX, Oracle, Sybase, LAN/WAN. Candidates will be required
to travel extensively and work on-site at client locations.


***********************************************************************
***********************************************************************

Senior Consultant - Application Engineer [PSAE] 
 

We currently have openings for versatile programmers with strong
programming skills to join our Consulting Services group. We are
seeking candidates with a degree in computer science or engineering
with more than three years software development and software
integration experience.  The job entails working closely with clients
to build custom software in support of their front office systems.  A
background in Case-Based Reasoning (CBR), and expert systems
techniques is highly desired.  Projects include a mix of short, proof
of concept engagements as well as full scale, commercial, call center
deployments. The candidate will need to have a proven track record in
integrating Client-Server and World Wide Web applications in either MS
Windows (Win95, WinNT, Win3.x) or UNIX environments so that they
create an easy to use seamless production environments for the
user. The candidate will also be responsible for custom application
development in support of the CBR technology.  Candidates must have
experience programming in MS Windows and a thorough knowledge of
Microsoft Foundation Classes (MFC) Programming skills in C, and C++
and SQL is required.  Experience in building and designing user
interfaces is also desired..

Qualified candidates must be highly technical, creative, articulate,
personable, self-confident and possess a broad base of talents and
abilities including presentation, writing, analytical, and client
management skills.  Skills in any of the following areas are desirable
would be considered a plus: ODBC, Oracle, Sybase, Informix, Lotus
Notes, Web Site implementation and construction, UNIX and LAN and or
WAN technologies. Candidates will be required to travel extensively
and work on-site at client locations.


***********************************************************************
***********************************************************************

Senior Consultant- Web Specialist [PSWS]
 
 
We currently have openings for versatile programmers capable of
helping customers deploy our new CasePoint WebServer product at client
sites.  Candidates must have a strong background in UNIX, C++ and
networking technologies.  The job requires working closely with
clients to deploy CasePoint knowledge bases on the Worldwide Web.
Tasks may include helping clients define and set up a Web page,
converting documents to Web-friendly formats such as HTML, tailoring
the CasePoint WebServer product to match the look and feel of a
WebServer product.  The successful candidate must also be able and
willing to work on projects which do not involve a Web installation.
Such projects might include integrating other applications with our
CBR product line (both in the Windows and UNIX environments),
developing custom code, and coaching clients as they build and deploy
knowledge bases.  We are seeking candidates with at least three years
of programming/consulting experience.

Qualified candidates must be creative, articulate, personable,
self-confident and possess a broad base of talents and abilities
including presentation, writing, analytical, and client management
skills.  Knowledge in any of the following areas would be considered a
plus: Oracle, Sybase, ODBC, Lotus Notes, Visual Basic and/or Visual
C++ programming, Microsoft Foundation Classes, and LAN/WAN
technologies.  A background in Case-based Reasoning (CBR) or
artificial intelligence is also desired.  Candidates will be required
to travel extensively and work on-site at client locations.


 
 

***********************************************************************
About the Company  
 

Inference Corporation, Novato CA, develops, markets and supports
client/server software for the front office, where organizations
interact with their external and internal customers, prospects and
vendors. Inference's CBR Express Release 2 family of products
(''CBR2'') enables users to quickly identify and resolve problems in
front office operations such as external and internal customer
support, sales automation and telemarketing. Inference is the market
and technology leader in problem identification and
resolution. Problem identification and resolution enables
organizations to diagnose and solve, rather than merely track,
customer problems. As a result, organizations may achieve greater
first call resolution and reduced time per call, thereby increasing
customer satisfaction and lowering costs. To permit end users to
resolve problems themselves without calling their suppliers (''call
avoidance''), companies are beginning to offer Inference's technology
directly to their customers by incorporating CBR2 into their
products. Inference is a publicly held and traded company, listed on
the NASDAQ exchange - symbol INFR.
  

Inference Corporation is a dynamic entrepreneurial environment where
individuals can make a real difference on challenging, high visibility
projects. We offer extremely competitive salaries, an extensive
benefits package, and room for growth.  Inference is an Equal
Opportunity Employer.

                        NATURAL LANGUAGE DEVELOPER
                               (New York)

U.S. or Canadian citizenship required, or U.S. permanent residency.
Unfortunately, we are unable to assist persons requiring visa sponsorship.

The Speech Services Technology Group has an opening for a developer 
with significant experience in building Natural Language Understanding 
systems.

This group designs and deploys state-of-the-art interacive speech 
recognition and language understanding systems.  Spoken language 
systems combine a recognition framework with natural language and 
discourse modeling capabilities to provide the uninitiated caller with 
an elegant, powerful, and easy-to-use interface to various 
applications, using a standard telephone.  Opportunities for applying 
this technology to multimedia and to text processing may also arise. 

Qualifications:

At least an MS in Computer Science, Linguistics, or related field.

At least 3 years experience, either commercial or academic, directly 
involved in the development of robust natural language systems.

Significant software development experience, most preferably in C or 
C++.

Experience with relevant statistical techniques.

Familiarity with related fields, such as speech recognition, signal 
processing, relevant real time programming issues, and user interface 
design for speech and language systems, are all pluses.

Experience and maturity in conceptualization, software design, and 
software engineering.

Ability to work in a cohesive team.

Strong motivation to excel.

            ** Minimum 3 years on-the-job experience required**

2377 S. El Camino Real, Suite 201, San Clemente, CA  92672.

files, please)  Fax: (714) 366-9200.

From: corne005@maroon.tc.umn.edu (Henry A Cornelius)
Subject: ICAD / CONCENTRA KBE Project Leaders  (Boston)
Date: 26 Oct 1995 09:22:11 -0500
Organization: University of Minnesota


Position:      ICAD KBE Project Leaders 
               Sr. ICAD KBE Application Developers

CSA Job #:   95-1007

A MAJOR CONSULTING COMPANY is seeking individuals who can either manage or 
support the implementation and delivery of software development projects  
using  Knowledge-Based Engineering (KBE) technology (specifically using The 
ICAD System from Concentra Corporation). 

These projects will focus on helping manufacturing companies re-engineer their 
quotation and product development processes.  Other responsibilities of these 
individuals will include  Statement of Work/Functional Specification 
development, project scoping, "rule" extraction from experts, training, 
documentation, and application testing. As part of a team these individuals 
may also support marketing activities, specifically as they pertain to 
technology positioning. These positions require significant travel and offer 
highly competitive salaries with accelerated career paths in the management 
consulting industry.

REQUIREMENTS: (CANDIDATE SHOULD MEET MOST OF THE FOLLOWING)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Have 2+ years experience working on ICAD projects and implementing the ICAD 
  Design Language (KBE) software.
- Have attended ICAD / IDL training.
- Experience with any Major CAD/CAM System.
- Project management and leadership in the delivery of engineering automation 
  software applications, specifically the ICAD Design Language
- BS/MS Mechanical Engineering or related field
- 2+ years experience in software development, specifically in the 
  implementation and delivery of engineering applications for manufacturing 
  companies
- Good communication and presentation skills
- Ability to deal professionally with consulting / client relationships
- Experience extracting information from engineers
- Experience with UNIX workstations and PC's
- Ability to travel extensively to Client sites (50% travel).


DESIRABLES: (BUT NOT REQUIRED)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Project scoping skills: the ability to analyze engineering problems to 
  provide  schedules, time, and manpower estimates for funding requirements
- Other software development experience: Object-oriented languages, C, LISP, 
  systems integration (SQL databases, MRP, CAD, Windows), Visual Basic
- Ability to develop project support documentation, including Statement of 
  Work (Functional Specification), End-User training, and technology transfer
- An in-depth understanding of the product delivery process for engineered 
  products
- Other technology experience: expert systems, parametric modeling/CAD, MRP
- Advanced degree, Engineering or Computer Science preferred
- Consulting experience, specifically in how to manage client relationships

Location:      Base location is open, Boston area is preferred

Compensation:  $55K - $80K total that includes a base salary and bonus 
               incentive plan

All inquiries are confidential.  If you are interested or know of anyone that
may have an interest in learning more about this position contact me or:

If you are qualified, directly submit a RESUME in ASCII format and:

1) Identify the specific Job Opportunity and location.
2) Outline in some detail specific experience relative to the listed 
   JOB REQUIREMENTS listed in the Job Description.
3) Specify your current salary and salary requirements. 
4) Attach a copy of your resume (even if you have already submitted).

Subject: AI jobs/Data Mining/Prolog in Palo Alto, CA (Recruiter)

Job code: BL/Recon

Join a dynamic team in Palo Alto, CA, developing leading-edge 
Data Mining software to extract patterns and other useful 
information from large quantities of of data.  The software 
integrates deductive database and data visualization technology 
with several machine learning techniques. This position 
requires a can-do attitude and a keen interest in data mining 
and related technologies.

Requirements: We have employment opportunities in several 
disciplines.  We are looking for motivated programmers, 
researchers and data analysts from new graduates to seasoned 
professionals.  Desired skills include:  machine learning, 
applied statistics, SAS programming, deductive databases, 
Prolog programming, relational database management systems, 
UNIX and C++ programming and GUI development in Tcl/Tk.


WHO ARE WE?

The Research and Software Technology Divisions of a Fortune 20 
Company are seeking bright and talented Software professionals 
to add to their workforce on a Full-time basis. We have had an 
influx of project work and have both junior and senior 
positions available.  If you are a recent graduate,but have 
several years of proven programming skills and are now 
interested in working in a research setting, we want to talk 
with you.


*WHAT IS OUR WORKPLACE LIKE?

We are the Research and Development (AI) Labs of a Fortune 20 
Corporation adjacent to Stanford University.   We are also
researchers in an entreprenurial enviornment, which means you 
will have a lot of flexibility to establish and work towards 
your own goals with other talented people.

*HOW TO REACH US?

For immediate consideration, fax or Email your resume to my attention.
PLEASE REMEMBER TO REFERENCE THE JOB CODE and let us know the best 
times and places to reach you.  We will review your background and 
contact you to discuss the positions available.

(ASCII or WinWord format)               DANTE Associates
                                      	Auguri@ix.netcom.com

Via FAX on HIGH RES to:                 (415) 354-5252

Subject: Job:Sr Engineer- AI Based Robotics S/W Design- FTP Software
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Senior Engineer-MA 
 
The Company: 
As the world-wide industry leader, the company has provided PC users with
the ability to share files and printers, access remote applications, and
share resources with an incredible range of computer systems.  The company
is now embarking on a new endeavor with extraordinary possibilities and
important ramifications, one that will propel the company beyond its
leadership position as the developer of TCP/IP solutions. 
 
If you possess the technical skills and want to be an information pioneer,
join a technologically diversified company that sets goals, but not limits.
 Our environment is characterized by boundless creative energy and focused
determination.  And with our increasingly expanding line of cutting edge
products and services, we are moving into the future with limitless
opportunities. 
 
The Position: 
Senior Engineer 
Individual contributor implementing the software architecture for a new
technology. The individual is responsible for the development, verification
and documentation of the software components used for the product. 
 
The position requires an individual with a broad base of software
engineering experience including: good oral and written communication
skills, top-down and modular design techniques, network protocols, previous
development in multi-threaded operating system environments, and knowledge
in AI-based or robotics software design. Strong debugging skills and
experience with scripting languages necessary. The individual must be
self-motivated and capable of working within an aggressive product
development team. 
 
Required Skills 
Degree: minimum BSEE or BSCS. 
Software Design Experience: 6+ years. 
Operating Systems: Windows 3.1, OS/2 or NT required-Win95, Unix a plus.
Language requirements: 2+ C++, 5+ C. 
Other: experience with DDE, OLE, GUI, network protocols required-knowledge
of security algorithms, AI-based software, enterprise management a plus.  
 
Compensation: 
The compensation package includes a highly competitive Salary Structure;
Medical, Dental, Short- and Long-term Disability, and Life Insurances;
Flexible Spending Medical and Dependent Care Reimbursements Accounts; 22
paid leave days and 11 paid holidays in the first year; Maternity/Paternity
Leave of Absence; 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan; an Employee Stock Purchase
Plan; Tuition reimbursement; and Flextime Work Schedules.  
 
Company paid relocation! 
 
Qualified candidates please forward resumes to:  
Ms. Robyn Mather 
Human Resources 
Via Email mather@cyberq.com 
Via Fax 508-659-6557

	id sma001122; Mon Nov 13 13:17:16 1995
Received: from natlab.research.philips.com (prle.prl.philips.nl [130.144.1.112]) by smtp.nl.cis.philips.com (8.6.10/8.6.10-0.9z-02May95) with SMTP id NAA29308 for <ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu>; Mon, 13 Nov 1995 13:19:06 +0100
Received: by natlab.research.philips.com; Mon, 13 Nov 1995 13:16:54 +0100
Received: by eleanor.prl.philips.nl; Mon, 13 Nov 95 13:16:52 +0100
Date: Mon, 13 Nov 95 13:16:52 +0100
Message-Id: <9511131216.AA08349@eleanor.prl.philips.nl>
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Jobs: dialogue management and language generation at IPO (Eindhoven, the Netherlands)
Cc: landsbrn@natlab.research.philips.com
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

                          JOBS AVAILABLE 
                   INSTITUTE FOR PERCEPTION RESEARCH 
                      EINDHOVEN, THE NETHERLANDS



General
-------
In the Institute for Perception Research (IPO), Philips Research and
the Eindhoven University of Technology have a close collaboration. The
essence of the research programme is: how do humans assess information,
especially in interaction with hardware and software. The study of this
topic has a fundamental as well as an applied component. As a
consequence of the involvement of humans with technology, the study has
a strong interdisciplinary character. Actual themes include: perceptual
sound quality, language generation, speech synthesis, perceptual image
quality, interactive instruction, multimodal communication, information
ergonomics and communication resources.

IPO will participate in a European research project of which the
main objective is to integrate and further develop the enabling
technologies required for the design of speech operated human-machine
interfaces, for applications inside the automobile. Demonstrator
systems will be developed for the languages German and French, which
will be tested in the laboratory as well as in the car. IPO will 
participate in the project with two researchers, one for dialogue
management and one for spoken language generation. The first job
is planned for the full project period of 39 months, the second
job will start about 6 months after the start of the project and is
planned for 30 months. The project is expected to start in November
1995.

VACANCY 1
---------
Dialogue management in spoken language systems

Tasks
-----
The researcher will have to design, implement and test the dialogue
management modules of the spoken language systems to be developed. The task
includes research in the ergonomic aspects of the use of speech in the
car and the design of appropriate dialogue structures for operating
devices, for interrogating a navigation system and for verification of
ill-recognized spoken input. He/she will be responsible for both oral
and written reports.

Required
--------
Scientist, preferably with a Ph.D. degree, in computer science or equivalent;
skilled in natural language processing, information ergonomics and
dialogue management. He/she should be able to work independently and to
cooperate with colleagues in an international application-oriented
project. Fluency in German or French is required.

Miscellaneous
-------------
Maximum gross salary: Dfl. 5989.- per month.
Duration of the project: initially 24 months; prolongation with another 
15 months is foreseen but depends on the result of the intermediate 
evaluation of the project.


VACANCY 2
---------
Language generation in spoken language systems


Tasks
-----
The researcher will have to design, implement and test the speech
output modules of the spoken language systems to be developed, for the
languages French and German. This includes the generation, from a
formal representation, of texts annotated with prosodic features, and
the integration of the text generator with an existing speech synthesis
system. He/she will be responsible for both oral and written reports.

Required
-------- 
Scientist, preferably with a Ph.D. degree, in computational linguistics or
equivalent; skilled in natural language processing; interested in
pragmatic aspects. He/she should be able to work independently and to
cooperate with colleagues in an international application-oriented
project. Fluency in French or German is required.

Miscellaneous
-------------
Maximum gross salary: Dfl. 5989.- per month.
Duration of the project: initially 18 months; prolongation with another 
12 months is foreseen but depends on the result of the intermediate 
evaluation of the project.

Applications with c.v. and references can be sent to:
   Prof. Jan Landsbergen
   Institute for Perception research
   P.O. Box 513
   5600 MB  Eindhoven
   The Netherlands

or via e-mail: landsbrn@natlab.research.philips.com

the ability to share files and printers, access remote applications, and
share resources with an incredible range of computer systems.  The company
is now embarking on a new endeavor with extraordinary possibilities and
important ramifications, one that will propel the company beyond its
leadership position as the developer of TCP/IP solutions. 
 
If you possess the technical skills and want to be an information pioneer,
join a technologically diversified company that sets goals, but not limits.
 Our environment is characterized by boundless creative energy and focused
determination.  And with our increasingly expanding line of cutting edge
products and services, we are moving into the future with limitless
opportunities. 
 
The Position: 
Senior Engineer 
Individual contributor implementing the software architecture for a new
technology. The individual is responsible for the development, verification
and documentation of the software components used for the product. 
 
The position requires an individual with a broad base of software
engineering experience including: good oral and written communication
skills, top-down and modular design techniques, network protocols, previous
development in multi-threaded operating system environments, and knowledge
in AI-based or robotics software design. Strong debugging skills and
experience with scripting languages necessary. The individual must be
self-motivated and capable of working within an aggressive product
development team. 
 
Required Skills 
Degree: minimum BSEE or BSCS. 
Software Design Experience: 6+ years. 
Operating Systems: Windows 3.1, OS/2 or NT required-Win95, Unix a plus.
Language requirements: 2+ C++, 5+ C. 
Other: experience with DDE, OLE, GUI, network protocols required-knowledge
of security algorithms, AI-based software, enterprise management a plus.  
 
Compensation: 
The compensation package includes a highly competitive Salary Structure;
Medical, Dental, Short- and Long-term Disability, and Life Insurances;
Flexible Spending Medical and Dependent Care Reimbursements Accounts; 22
paid leave days and 11 paid holidays in the first year; Maternity/Paternity
Leave of Absence; 401(k) Profit Sharing Plan; an Employee Stock Purchase
Plan; Tuition reimbursement; and Flextime Work Schedules.  
 
Company paid relocation! 
 
Qualified candidates please forward resumes to:  
Ms. Robyn Mather 
Human Resources 
Via Email mather@cyberq.com 
Via Fax 508-659-6557
