Subject: Admin: Moderation Style Update
Date: Wed, 15 Nov 95 23:49:20 EST
Message-ID: <24381.816497360@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>
From: Mark Kantrowitz <Mark_Kantrowitz@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU


You may have noticed a slight change in the moderation of the
AI-related jobs mailing lists. Previously, all job postings had to go
through me, resulting in the posts arriving in spurts.

Last week I sent out the enclosed email message to everybody who had
submitted an approved job posting within the last year (more than 600
companies). From now on, I'm assuming that any company that submitted
a valid post in the past is responsible enough to submit only valid
posts in the future. The moderation program now transmits posts from
people on the approved list without requiring human intervention. The
mailing list will still kick out obviously misdirected subscription
requests from these people.

The net result is less work for me, and more timely job postings for you.

Mark Kantrowitz, moderator
mkant@cs.cmu.edu


Greetings,

Sometime during the past year, a job announcement, postdoc announcement, or
predoctoral studentship announcement relating to Artificial Intelligence,
Lisp, or Prolog was either posted by you to one of the following mailing
lists, or was forwarded by a third party to one of these mailing lists:

    AI-Jobs		ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
    Lisp-Jobs		ai+lisp-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
    Prolog-Jobs		ai+prolog-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
    AI-Postdoc		ai+ai-postdoc@cs.cmu.edu
    AI-Predoc		ai+ai-predoc@cs.cmu.edu

The purpose of this email message is to provide you with information about
these mailing lists and the requirements for submitting an announcement to
one or more of these lists. My apologies if you receive multiple copies of
this message.

Best regards,

Mark Kantrowitz
mkant@cs.cmu.edu


PURPOSE OF THE LISTS

These mailing lists exist to help programmers, researchers, and students
find AI, Lisp, and Prolog programming and research positions, and to help
companies with AI, Lisp, and Prolog programming and research positions to
find capable AI, Lisp, and Prolog programmers, researchers, and students.


LIST STATISTICS

  Subscribers as of November 8, 1995:
    AI-Jobs        578  com (17%) edu (42%) org (3%)  gov (2%)  itl (32%)
    Lisp-Jobs      433  com (34%) edu (33%) org (3%)  gov (3%)  itl (25%)
    Prolog-Jobs    187  com (14%) edu (27%) org (<1%) gov (1%)  itl (55%)
    AI-Postdoc     244  com (4%)  edu (43%) org (<1%) gov (<1%) itl (49%)
    AI-Predoc      119  com (10%) edu (30%) org (<1%) gov (<1%) itl (58%)

  Job Postings since January 1, 1995:
    AI-Jobs        575
    Lisp-Jobs      175
    Prolog-Jobs     38
    AI-Postdoc      53
    AI-Predoc       49

As a matter of policy, the list of subscribers is considered confidential
and will not be disclosed to anybody.


SUBMISSION REQUIREMENTS

These mailing lists are moderated. Announcements not meeting the following
requirements will be rejected:

   1. Material appropriate for these job mailing lists include AI, Lisp,
      and Prolog job announcements and AI predoctoral and postdoctoral
      fellowships. 

   2. All announcements must be of genuine positions. Resumes and
      discussion are not permitted. 

   3. The postings must be directly related to the purpose of the list. 
      For example, a C++ job announcement should not be sent to the AI-Jobs
      mailing list unless the position requires significant AI expertise.
      AI expertise must not be merely "desirable", but a specific job
      requirement.  

   4. Cross-posting between the various AI job lists is permitted, provided
      the post is clearly germaine to each list.

   5. Churning is not permitted. You may post the same job announcement
      no more than once a month. If there was a significant error in a 
      previous job announcement, you may repost a corrected copy. The
      post should indicate that it is a corrected copy near the top of
      the announcement and should summarize the corrected information.

   5. ** SUBJECT LINE FORMATTING REQUIREMENTS **

      The goal of the Subject line formatting requirements is to provide
      enough information in a single line to enable the mailing list
      subscribers to decide whether to read further. The subject line
      formatting requirements are as follows,

          Type: Description at Company (Location)

      where 

         -  Type is "Job", "Fellowship", "Postdoc", "Internship",
            "Lectureship", or something similar.

         -  Description is a short description of the job, such as a list
            of relevant AI fields (e.g., "NLP", "Robotics", etc.)

         -  Company is the name of the company offering the position.
            If you are a recruiter, please add "[Recruiter]" after
            the company name.

         -  Location is the location of the position. 

      For example, a Speech Recognition postdoctoral appointment at CMU
      would have the following subject line

        Postdoc: Speech Recognition at Carnegie Mellon Univ. (Pittsburgh, PA)

      and an expert systems position at Gensym might have the 
      following subject line

        Job: Real-Time Expert Systems, Lisp at Gensym (Cambridge, MA)


   6. Body formatting requirements:

      Please use a line-length of no more than 78 characters.


ARCHIVAL

Job postings sent to these lists are automatically archived in appropriate
subdirectories of
   ftp://ftp.cs.cmu.edu/user/ai/jobs/
The AI-related Job Posting Archives web page maintains links to the most
recent three months of job postings at the URL
   http://www.cs.cmu.edu/Web/Groups/AI/html/other/jobs.html


FINDERS FEES

We do not accept finders fees for any jobs filled as a result of a posting
to these mailing lists. If you must give a finders fee to someone, we ask
that you donate it to the Free Software Foundation (675 Massachusetts
Avenue, Cambridge, MA 02139 USA; 1-617-876-3296; gnu@prep.ai.mit.edu).
These mailing lists are not affiliated with the Free Software Foundation;
we just like what they do.

If a position was filled as a result of a posting to these lists, we would
appreciate hearing about it. This isn't a requirement, just a courtesy
request. It lets us know that these lists are performing a worthwhile
service, and gives us a warm fuzzy feeling inside.


QUESTIONS

Questions about these lists may be directed to ai+@cs.cmu.edu.

Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Position:      ICAD KBE Project Leaders 
               Sr. ICAD KBE Application Developers

CSA Job #:   95-1005

A MAJOR CONSULTING COMPANY is seeking individuals who can either manage or 
support the implementation and delivery of software development projects  
using  Knowledge-Based Engineering (KBE) technology (specifically using The 
ICAD System from Concentra Corporation). 

These projects will focus on helping manufacturing companies re-engineer their 
quotation and product development processes.  Other responsibilities of these 
individuals will include  Statement of Work/Functional Specification 
development, project scoping, "rule" extraction from experts, training, 
documentation, and application testing. As part of a team these individuals 
may also support marketing activities, specifically as they pertain to 
technology positioning. These positions require significant travel and offer 
highly competitive salaries with accelerated career paths in the management 
consulting industry.

REQUIREMENTS: (CANDIDATE SHOULD MEET MOST OF THE FOLLOWING)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Have 2+ years experience working on ICAD projects and implementing the ICAD 
  Design Language (KBE) software.
- Have attended ICAD / IDL training.
- Experience with any Major CAD/CAM System.
- Project management and leadership in the delivery of engineering automation 
  software applications, specifically the ICAD Design Language
- BS/MS Mechanical Engineering or related field
- 2+ years experience in software development, specifically in the 
  implementation and delivery of engineering applications for manufacturing 
  companies
- Good communication and presentation skills
- Ability to deal professionally with consulting / client relationships
- Experience extracting information from engineers
- Experience with UNIX workstations and PC's
- Ability to travel extensively to Client sites (50% travel).


DESIRABLES: (BUT NOT REQUIRED)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Project scoping skills: the ability to analyze engineering problems to 
  provide  schedules, time, and manpower estimates for funding requirements
- Other software development experience: Object-oriented languages, C, LISP, 
  systems integration (SQL databases, MRP, CAD, Windows), Visual Basic
- Ability to develop project support documentation, including Statement of 
  Work (Functional Specification), End-User training, and technology transfer
- An in-depth understanding of the product delivery process for engineered 
  products
- Other technology experience: expert systems, parametric modeling/CAD, MRP
- Advanced degree, Engineering or Computer Science preferred
- Consulting experience, specifically in how to manage client relationships

Location:      Base location is open, Boston area is preferred

Compensation:  $50K - $70K total that includes a base salary and bonus 
               incentive plan

All inquiries are confidential.  If you are interested or know of anyone that
may have an interest in learning more about this position contact me or:

If you are qualified, directly submit a RESUME in ASCII format and:

1) Identify the specific Job Opportunity and location.
2) Outline in some detail specific experience relative to the listed 
   JOB REQUIREMENTS listed in the Job Description.
3) Specify your current salary and salary requirements. 
4) Attach a copy of your resume (even if you have already submitted).

Job Announcement
Carnegie Mellon University

Job Number:  			5950			
Date:				PG
Title:				Project Scientist
Department:			Robotics
Salary Range:			Negotiable
Status:                                  Exempt
Hours:				Full-time 

This position is responsible for performing duties to assist an
interdisciplinary team of scientists in designing and implementing integrated
software environments for rapidly reconfigurable manufacturing and other
robotic applications. Duties include software design (including evaluation of
existing public domain and commercial packages formalization of requirements,
discussion with scientific team and development of program structures.);
software system development including writing and testing code; writing
documentation including the publication of research results; participating in
directing team research and other required duties.

QUALIFICATIONS: MS in software engineering or equivalent combination of
education and experience; experience in the design or implementation of large
integrated software systems; designing GUIs and working knowledge of GUI
builders; demonstrated experience with graphical programming environments,
solid models and modeling and
simulation of robotic systems; strong background in C and C++ programming
with thorough knowledge of UNIX and TCP/IP. This position requires the
ability to work under pressure and meet inflexible deadlines. PhD. in
software engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
with experience in industry and five or more years of demonstrated experience
in the design of large integrated software systems; design of high-graphical
content GUIs with working knowledge of distributed computational environments
and additional experience with graphical programming environments, solid
models, and modeling and simulation of robotic systems preferred.


This is a summary statement of the responsibilities and qualifications for
this position.

AA/EEO Employer

PLEASE SPECIFY JOB AND TITLE WHEN YOU APPLY FOR THIS POSITION CONTACT

Overview:  The Chrysler Corporation has an immediate need for a Fortran

graphical CATIA CAD/CAM design tools.  The Chrysler Group is a Software

design and graphics applications.

fixturing of general automotive design.

Date: Tue, 21 Nov 95 19:19:15 EST
From: AI.Repository@GLINDA.OZ.CS.CMU.EDU
To: ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu
Subject: Job: NLG/Dialogue at Institute for Perception Research (Eindhoven, The Netherlands)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: Norbert Glaser <Norbert.Glaser@loria.fr>
Subject: [JOB] Dialogue management & language generation - Eindhoven, NL
Date: 14 Nov 1995 10:20:30 +0100
Organization: CRIN & INRIA-Lorraine - Nancy - FRANCE



                          JOBS AVAILABLE 
                   INSTITUTE FOR PERCEPTION RESEARCH 
                      EINDHOVEN, THE NETHERLANDS



General
- -------
In the Institute for Perception Research (IPO), Philips Research and
the Eindhoven University of Technology have a close collaboration. The
essence of the research programme is: how do humans assess information,
especially in interaction with hardware and software. The study of this
topic has a fundamental as well as an applied component. As a
consequence of the involvement of humans with technology, the study has
a strong interdisciplinary character. Actual themes include: perceptual
sound quality, language generation, speech synthesis, perceptual image
quality, interactive instruction, multimodal communication, information
ergonomics and communication resources.

IPO will participate in a European research project of which the
main objective is to integrate and further develop the enabling
technologies required for the design of speech operated human-machine
interfaces, for applications inside the automobile. Demonstrator
systems will be developed for the languages German and French, which
will be tested in the laboratory as well as in the car. IPO will 
participate in the project with two researchers, one for dialogue
management and one for spoken language generation. The first job
is planned for the full project period of 39 months, the second
job will start about 6 months after the start of the project and is
planned for 30 months. The project is expected to start in November
1995.

VACANCY 1
- ---------
Dialogue management in spoken language systems

Tasks
- -----
The researcher will have to design, implement and test the dialogue
management modules of the spoken language systems to be developed. The task
includes research in the ergonomic aspects of the use of speech in the
car and the design of appropriate dialogue structures for operating
devices, for interrogating a navigation system and for verification of
ill-recognized spoken input. He/she will be responsible for both oral
and written reports.

Required
- --------
Scientist, preferably with a Ph.D. degree, in computer science or equivalent;
skilled in natural language processing, information ergonomics and
dialogue management. He/she should be able to work independently and to
cooperate with colleagues in an international application-oriented
project. Fluency in German or French is required.

Miscellaneous
- -------------
Maximum gross salary: Dfl. 5989.- per month.
Duration of the project: initially 24 months; prolongation with another 
15 months is foreseen but depends on the result of the intermediate 
evaluation of the project.


VACANCY 2
- ---------
Language generation in spoken language systems


Tasks
- -----
The researcher will have to design, implement and test the speech
output modules of the spoken language systems to be developed, for the
languages French and German. This includes the generation, from a
formal representation, of texts annotated with prosodic features, and
the integration of the text generator with an existing speech synthesis
system. He/she will be responsible for both oral and written reports.

Required
- -------- 
Scientist, preferably with a Ph.D. degree, in computational linguistics or
equivalent; skilled in natural language processing; interested in
pragmatic aspects. He/she should be able to work independently and to
cooperate with colleagues in an international application-oriented
project. Fluency in French or German is required.

Miscellaneous
- -------------
Maximum gross salary: Dfl. 5989.- per month.
Duration of the project: initially 18 months; prolongation with another 
12 months is foreseen but depends on the result of the intermediate 
evaluation of the project.

Applications with c.v. and references can be sent to:
   Prof. Jan Landsbergen
   Institute for Perception research
   P.O. Box 513
   5600 MB  Eindhoven
   The Netherlands

or via e-mail: landsbrn@natlab.research.philips.com

==================== This message was resend by =========================
Norbert Glaser
PostDoc Service, CRIN-INRIA Lorraine
http://www.loria.fr/~glaser/postdoc.html

Subject: ICAD / CONCENTRA KBE Application Developers (Boston)
Date: 9 Nov 1995 18:56:28 -0600
Organization: University of Minnesota


Position:      ICAD KBE Project Leaders 
               Sr. ICAD KBE Application Developers

CSA Job #:   95-1007

A MAJOR CONSULTING COMPANY is seeking individuals who can either manage or 
support the implementation and delivery of software development projects  
using  Knowledge-Based Engineering (KBE) technology (specifically using The 
ICAD System from Concentra Corporation). 

These projects will focus on helping manufacturing companies re-engineer their 
quotation and product development processes.  Other responsibilities of these 
individuals will include  Statement of Work/Functional Specification 
development, project scoping, "rule" extraction from experts, training, 
documentation, and application testing. As part of a team these individuals 
may also support marketing activities, specifically as they pertain to 
technology positioning. These positions require significant travel and offer 
highly competitive salaries with accelerated career paths in the management 
consulting industry.

REQUIREMENTS: (CANDIDATE SHOULD MEET MOST OF THE FOLLOWING)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Have 2+ years experience working on ICAD projects and implementing the ICAD 
  Design Language (KBE) software.
- Have attended ICAD / IDL training.
- Experience with any Major CAD/CAM System.
- Project management and leadership in the delivery of engineering automation 
  software applications, specifically the ICAD Design Language
- BS/MS Mechanical Engineering or related field
- 2+ years experience in software development, specifically in the 
  implementation and delivery of engineering applications for manufacturing 
  companies
- Good communication and presentation skills
- Ability to deal professionally with consulting / client relationships
- Experience extracting information from engineers
- Experience with UNIX workstations and PC's
- Ability to travel extensively to Client sites (50% travel).


DESIRABLES: (BUT NOT REQUIRED)
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
- Project scoping skills: the ability to analyze engineering problems to 
  provide  schedules, time, and manpower estimates for funding requirements
- Other software development experience: Object-oriented languages, C, LISP, 
  systems integration (SQL databases, MRP, CAD, Windows), Visual Basic
- Ability to develop project support documentation, including Statement of 
  Work (Functional Specification), End-User training, and technology transfer
- An in-depth understanding of the product delivery process for engineered 
  products
- Other technology experience: expert systems, parametric modeling/CAD, MRP
- Advanced degree, Engineering or Computer Science preferred
- Consulting experience, specifically in how to manage client relationships

Location:      Base location is open, Boston area is preferred

Compensation:  $55K - $80K total that includes a base salary and bonus 
               incentive plan

All inquiries are confidential.  If you are interested or know of anyone that
may have an interest in learning more about this position contact me or:

1) Identify the specific Job Opportunity and location.
2) Outline in some detail specific experience relative to the listed 
   JOB REQUIREMENTS listed in the Job Description.
3) Specify your current salary and salary requirements. 
4) Attach a copy of your resume (even if you have already submitted).

OPENINGS

Knowledge Engineers

with an emphasis on production planning and scheduling systems. The

proposals, as well as participate in project management, client
management, and to occasionally participate in sales situations. Some
travel will be required.

From: Robert Wilensky <wilensky@CS.Berkeley.EDU>

UC Berkeley, Computer Science Division, invites applications for a
Specialist who will be a key member of the Digital Library Research Project
in the Computer Science Division within the Electronics Research
Laboratory.  The project involves researchers in other campus departments,
as well as industrial visitors.  The Specialist has major responsibilities
for new natural language information access system design and
implementation for the Digital Library project.

In collaboration with faculty members, graduate students, CS research staff
and other researchers, the Specialist will participate in research in
support of the goals of the Digital Library project.  In particular, the
Specialist will focus on issues of multimedia information retrieval,
especially statistical natural language analysis for text retrieval, and
the integration of retrieval technologies into overall systems design.  (More
information about this project is available at http://elib.cs.berkeley.edu.)

Qualifications: Ph.D. in Computer Science or related discipline preferred.
Expertise required in statistical natural language processing, information
retrieval, and computer systems.  Expertise preferred in parallel
computation and database management systems.

This is a one year, 100% time position with possibility of extension.
Salary Range: $51,972 - $80,352; salary commensurate with experience.  Full
benefit package.  Please send applications/resumes to Professor Robert
Wilensky, Chairman, Computer Science Department, 389 Soda Hall, Berkeley,
CA 94720-1776.  The University of California is an Affirmative Action/Equal
Opportunity Employer.

From: Iain Stobie <Iain_Stobie@countrywide.com>

Subject: Job: Data Mining, Expert Systems at Countrywide, Pasadena, CA
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: Text/Plain
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

Countrywide Funding Corp, the nation's largest mortgage lender, is seeking
personnel for its AI department in Pasadena, California.

The primary responsibility will be to help develop data mining applications
to improve the efficiency and economy of mortgage origination. In the
last few years the mortgage banking industry has experienced a revolution in
the use of computer technology. It is now a fundamental component in remaining
competitive. Countrywide has been at the forefront of this trend. Its
award-winnning underwriting expert system CLUES underwrites 12,000 mortgage
applications a month. CLUES takes a couple of minutes to evaluate the risk of a
loan, including automatically ordering credit reports and property appraisals.
Countrywide's loan-servicing help desk fields 200,000 questions a month from
current borrowers. Several new projects are currently underway, each with the
potential to reduce costs for customers and improve profitability.

Both medium and senior positions are open. Candidates should have a Masters's
degree in computer science or a related field, a couple of years or more work
experience in AI and familiarity with knowledge induction tools, statistics,
databases and expert system shells. Candidates should be able to evaluate
and apply AI research to practical projects. A working appreciation of
standard software engineering principles is required.  Good communication
skills are essential, since some of the time is spent with non-technical
business people both in knowledge acquisition and project planning. Some
background in financial applications is desirable but not required.

Countrywide provides competitive salary and benefits, including medical,
dental, vision, life insurance; 401K (with the company providing matching
funds), stock options, retirement.

E-mail or fax resumes, plus a cover letter describing salary history and phone
number, to:

        818 666 5299.
        Iain_Stobie@countrywide.com

From: David.Simon@IUS4.IUS.CS.CMU.EDU

Subject: Job: Computer Vision Jobs
Message-Id: <817701480/das@IUS4.IUS.CS.CMU.EDU>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

+----------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|         Employment Opportunities Available at Cognex Corporation           |
|           (a machine vision company 15 miles outside of Boston)            |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------+

Challenges
----------
Imagine developing software for a machine vision computer that is used in
manufacturing operations to guide a robotic arm in placing 40,000 electronic
components on a PC board every hour to within 1/20th pixel accuracy, to
identify a soda can in only 20 milliseconds to ensure it is filled with the
correct liquid, or to inspect the LCD display on a cellular phone to verify
that it's legible.

Rewards
-------
Cognex, the world's #1 supplier of industrial machine vision systems, provides
a work hard/play hard environment unlike any other company in the world. 
Every day, we tackle the toughest machine vision problems in industries
ranging from electronics and automotive parts to healthcare and consumer
products.  And our culture continually rewards these efforts with parties,
innovative recognition programs, and lucrative bonuses and stock options for
top performers.

Opportunities
-------------
We're seeking engineers for all facets of our product development, not just
machine vision.  For example, we offer career opportunities in prototyping,
original product development, product support, and engineering projects for
internal use.  Engineers are needed at all levels of ability, including new
graduates with relevant academic experience.  If you are a clever software
engineer with creativity and drive who wants to join an entrepreneurial,
technically aggressive company, then we want to talk to you!

POSITIONS AVAILABLE:
--------------------
A wide range of Software/Hardware Engineering positions are currently
available.  This list is indicative of the openings that we have.  In
*addition* to the positions listed below, Cognex will be hiring 10 to
12 college graduates during the spring of 1996.

Interested applicants may send resumes to Drew Kelly at one of the
following addresses.  Please state which position(s) you are interested
in.

    Drew Kelly
    Cognex Corporation
    One Vision Dr.
    Natick, MA 01760-2059 
    FAX: 508-650-3340 
    EMail (text only): dkelly@cognex.com 
    EMail (PostScript only): koch@cognex.com 

For more information, and an up-to-date listing of all the available
openings, see our web page at:   http://www.krl.com/cognex/


---> Associate Software Engineer - Systems Tools Development <---

Responsible for enhancing and designing improvements to our PC based
development environment to provide the larger engineering dept. with and easy
to use capability to work within to develop software solutions for Cognex
machine vision applications.   This includes debuggers, editors, compilers,
version control, mail, networking and setting up & writing productivity
enhancements.

Position requires a B. S. in Computer Science and experience with object
oriented design techniques and  developing software that runs on various PC
platforms.  Experience with PC operating system internals is a plus.


---> Manager Software Quality Assurance <---

Responsible for managing and growing a group of 15 - 20 QA Engineers, co-ops
and contractors in an engineering department of over 100 engineers.  The
department has well established software development practices where software
quality and testability are integrated into the development process.  The SQA
group is responsible for reviewing developer written unit test suites,
developing product test plans, writing systems and applications level test
suites (in C and C++), release engineering and second-level customer support.

Position requires a B.S. in Computer Science, a minimum of 3 yrs. management
experience with the development of technical products.  Should have experience
in both developing production quality code and been a project leader for
either a software engineering or SQA group of approximately 10 or more staff. 
Must be able to demonstrate the ability to lead, not just manage an
organization of this size through properly motivating and developing their
professional contributions to the company.  Should understand and be aware of
various QA theories or methodologies yet be flexible and practical about
adopting and implementing any course of action.  Be a strong enough technical
leader who can help individuals and the group improve technically, do more
sophisticated and automated QA while improving coverage, testability and
automated processes.  We are looking for someone who is enthusiastic and
committed to improving software quality.


---> Senior or Principle Software Engineer <---

Responsible for developing real time software applications for Cognex Machine
Vision Systems.  These are developed in C or C++ and utilize strong software
engineering training and experience.  Utilize an in-depth knowledge of class
library design, data structures and algorithm design and development for
Machine Vision and Image Processing.  Must have a strong math background and
show an ability to develop software solutions for complex factory, industrial
automation applications.  Should have some familiarity with lighting / optics
principles and the ability to integrate your engineering skills with an
understanding of electronic / mechanical manufacturing processes.

We are looking for someone with a B.S. in Computer Science and a minimum of 10
yrs. experience utilizing C and C++ in developing real time custom
applications for Cognex products.  Experience with factory floor automation
processes and issues would be a plus.  Any knowledge or experience with GUI
development, Compiler development or an ability to write or speak Japanese
would also be desirable.
 
	
---> Software Engineer <---

Responsibilities: Design and implement C and C++ software on COGNEX
machines. Participate in design and code reviews. Perform installation
and provide integration support at customer sites.

Qualifications: Requires a BSEE/CS and 0 - 3 years industry
experience. Vision or image processing background highly
desirable. Strong math orientation helpful.


---> Senior or Principle Software Engineer - System Tools <---

Research, Architect, specify and lead the creation of a C++ in house
development environment.  Should have a strong background in computer tools
development, assessment and implementation across multiple platforms.  This
experience should include compiler development due to the fact we optimize C++
usage in our systems department.  Will be responsible for designing and
enhancing our Sun based Unix development environment so that the entire
engineering dept. can have a productive and easy to use environment to develop
software in.  Work will involve parallel and distributed builds as well as
enhancing Free Software Foundation tools set.  Other areas of concern include
editors, compilers, version control, mail, networking, Clearcase and related
development tools and productivity enhancements.

B.S. in Computer Science with and M.S. preferred.  A minimum of 5 years
experience which must include design, development, test and implementation of
C and C++ compiler internals.


---> Software Development Manager - System Tools <---

Responsible for managing a small group (5-6) of people who are responsible for
the design and enhancement of our Sun (Unix) and PC (multiple platforms) based
development environments for ~100 engineers. Because of the relatively small
size of the group this position will require some "hands on" development,
principally in the area of compiler internals.  Experience with evaluating and
bringing third party and public domain tools and integrating them into the
existing tool suite is important.  Knowledge of Sun OS / Solaris,  Windows NT,
Clearcase, FSF / GNU compiler suite necessary as is configuration / release
management experience.

Position requires a B.S. in Computer Science and a minimum of 10 years
experience in the development of software engineering tools and related
support systems.  At least several years of experience should have included
project management as well as administrative management responsibilities.


---> Hardware Engineer <---

Responsible for the design of new products and enhancement of existing
architecture's for Cognex vision processors and related digital logic boards. 
Working under the leadership of senior members of Cognex's hardware
engineering team you will assist in the design of small daughter cards with
accelerators, multi board systems with multiple processors and Cognex designed
co-processors.  These designs will utilize the latest technology including
FPGAs, Plds, and CISC and RISC processors.  Any experience with DSP design, 
design for video systems  with a very low noise operation for a frame grabber
sub-system would be very useful. 


A B.S.E.E. and a minimum of three years experience is required.  Strong
knowledge of designing of digital micro based systems is necessary.  Some
programming in C, Assembly, and VHDL.  Some familiarity with EDA tools and
techniques and knowledge of FPGAs, PLDs and video would be a plus.


---> Interconnect Engineer - Mechanical <---

Responsible for designing high performance interconnect systems for machine
vision systems involving multi-layer digital boards involving challenging
cabling issues and thermal cooling requirements.  Will also be involved with
sheet metal design, assembly and configuration documentation, prototyping and
product release.  Must be capable of designing these systems to comply with
EMI, FCC, IEC safety CE and all applicable international standards.  Will
design interconnect, board-board, chip-board and user interface systems
requiring high sophistication, high performance electronics which are I/O
intensive so that they are also flexible in configuration and are cost
effective.  Knowledge of design tools such as Fluent, PRoEngineer, or AutoCAD
is required.

Position requires a B.S.M.E. or equivalent and a minimum of 8 years experience
designing interconnect systems utilizing multi-layer high density logic
designs.  Must be familiar with solving problems related to cabling and
conductivity of high pin count interconnects and thermal design considerations
such as , cooling, board thermal profiling and heat sink design.


---> Senior or Principle Software Q.A. Engineer <---

Responsible for utilizing C, and C++ on both Unix and Windows platforms as a
highly regarded contributing member of a software development team whose goal
is to develop a high quality  S / W product.  Design test plans and implement 
test suites for use with different hardware platforms  and various  S / W
releases.  We need people who, as development engineers design automated S / W
testing tools and tests in C / C++ to improve software development process and
product robustness.  

Position requires a B.S. in C.S. or  a  B.S. E.E. and a minimum of 5 years
experience with both product design and test development experience with an
emphasis on embedded systems products.  Be involved with code and unit test
reviews.  The ability to develop test plans and automated test software for
system level testing of Cognex machine vision products is required.

Research Specialist

POSITION: Research Scientist/Specialist (Natural Language Processing/IR)
DEPT.: Electronics Research Laboratory: Computer Science
SALARY: $51,972 - $80,352; salary commensurate with experience
HOURS: variable
DURATION: One year, 100% time position with possibility of extension. Full 
benefit package. 
CLOSING DATE: continuous

Description:

UC Berkeley, Computer Science Department invites applications for a Specialist 
who will be a
key member of the Digital Library Research Project in the Computer Science 
Division within the
Electronics Research Laboratory. The project involves researchers in other 
campus departments,
as well as industrial visitors. The Specialist has major responsibilities for 
new natural language
information access system design and implementation for the Digital Library 
project. 

In collaboration with faculty members, graduate students, CS research staff 
and other researchers,
the Specialist will participate in research in support of the goals of the 
Digital Library project. In
particular, the Specialist will focus on issues of multimedia information 
retrieval, especially
statistical natural language analysis for text retrieval, and the integration 
of retrieval technologies
into overall systems design. 

Qualifications:

Ph.D. in Computer Science or related discipline preferred. Expertise required 
in statistical natural
language processing, information retrieval, and computer systems. Expertise 
preferred in parallel
computation and database management systems.

POSITION: QUANTITATIVE FINANCIAL ANALYST
JOB# 382
SALARY: $55-65K (maybe more)

LOCATION: Burbank
STATUS: Full time

DESCRIPTION: Responsibilities:  analyze effect of various causal factors
on sales performance, incl: demographics, price, display, nat'l. advertising,
merchandising, product, competitive titles.  Analyze & isolate class of
trade sales patterns.  Integrate analysis results into refining the company's
forecasts.  Collect sales & inventory info from non-direct accounts to
perform in-depth market industry activity analyses.  Perform post-
promotion analyses to review shipments, returns & sell thru with
recommendations for improved future performance.  Develop Neural
Network models; develop data mining analysis techniques.  Analyze
competatiove title activity; perform relevant ad hoc analyses to support
forecasts.  Make returns recommendations when appropriate.  Report on
company performance relative to forecast at regular intervals.  Need 2
years experience in highly quantitative & analytical environment.   Strong
aptitude for decision support & reporting software tools.  At least 4 years
total experience if not more!  Strong writing skills, the ability to articulate
cumbersome quantitative details in a clear, cogent fashion.  This is a high
level staff position.  Requires a highly quantitative individual capable of
looking at the numbers and coming up with a theory as to what's
happening.  What's worked, what's not worked, how can we improve it,
and here are some recommendations.  Must be a very self-directed
individual!  A self-managed person, someone who can look at the numbers
& discuss events in operational terms.  Someone who can make "sense" of
the numbers & see some answers to drops in sales, etc.  They must be able
to see beyond the numbers & theories as to what the problems are!  This
person could come out of a marketing research company or sales &
marketing department of a consumer products company.

EDUCATION: Bachelor's degree in quantitative areas such as math,
science, engineering, economics, business (MBA or related Master's degree
preferrred)
SOFTWARE:  Proficiency with Windows-based spreadsheet, word
processing, graphics & database applications are desired.

Please FAX your resume to Michael Muller (805) 646-5230 and include
your daytime phone number.

Subject: US-CO-Denver Knowledge Base Engineer RE-ENGINEERING/PROCESS DESIGN/SYSTEMS DYNAMICS/CHAOS THEORY, US WEST Technologies
Date: 23 Nov 1995 18:32:53 GMT
Organization: US WEST Technologies

U S WEST
**************************************************
KNOWLEDGE BASE ENGINEER
**************************************************

At U S WEST Technologies, we don't just talk about the future.  We make 
it happen.  If you want a chance to make it happen for yourself, apply 
today for this opening at U S WEST Technologies in Denver, Colorado.

Knowledge Base Engineer

You will work with process designers, software developers and operations 
staff in the areas of service delivery, service assurance, capacity 
provisioning, marketing, finance and information technologies to develop 
systems dynamics models of processes, metrics and reward systems.

Responsibilities will include: obtaining, analyzing, organizing and 
documenting knowledge needed to work in processes and the "surface" and 
"deep" knowledge in process tools; leading the development of archives 
of corporate knowledge and models of corporate systems that promote 
reuse of model components and knowledge elements; documenting learnings 
to support continual process evolution; and, conducting informal 
training with U S WEST staff to facilitate appropriate use of systems 
dynamics tools and data.

Qualifications:

*  Understanding of business process re-engineering principles and 
experience in reengineering, including process design and measurement.
*  Working knowledge of both qualitative and quantitative causal 
modeling, systems dynamics, and collaboration science, including 
software tools for causal model simulation (e.g. I-THINK, Extend).
*  Background with quality improvement principles.
*  Familiarity with chaos theory and strange attractors.
*  Skills in knowledge acquisition and modeling (e.g. KADS).
*  Strong interpersonal skills, as well good oral and written 
communication abilities. 

Send or FAX your resume (ASCII format only) and salary history to:  
ktait@advtech.uswest.com.  
FAX (303) 541-8183.

U S WEST Technologies is an equal opportunity employer.  Any offer of 
employment is contingent upon the applicant's undergoing and passing a 
pre-employment drug test, subject to applicable federal, state, and 
local law.

The Center for Integrated Manufacturing Decision Systems (CIMDS) within the
Robotics Institute (School of Computer Science) at Carnegie Mellon University
is seeking a research programmer to work on projects in  
knowledge-based planning and scheduling. Our Center is a world-leader in 
the development of innovative planning and scheduling technologies for 
complex manufacturing, transportation and space applications.
The successful candidates will initially be part of a research group 
responsible for the development and deployment of advanced manufacturing 
planning and scheduling software. This work involves close collaboration with 
industry and requires highly motivated individuals capable of working 
in a research group comprised of faculty, programmers, and graduate students.

 TITLE:    Research Programmer 
           or
           Senior Research Programmer (min. 6 years of experience)
 REQUIRED:
          -BS/MS in Computer Science. Mathematics, Engineering or 
           related field
          -Min 2 years of experience developing and maintaining complex
           large-scale R&D software applications either in industry or
           academia
          -Excellent working knowledge of C, C++, and X/Motif
          -Familiarity with UNIX
          -Some mathematical sophistication such as familiarity
           with probability theory is required
          -Ability to learn quickly
          -Good problem solving and communication skills
           (both written and verbal)

 DESIRED:
          -Earlier work on planning and/or scheduling applications would 
           be a great asset
          -Exposure to either of the following would be a definite plus:
               -Basic artificial intelligence techniques such
                as search techniques, constraint-directed reasoning and
                blackboard architectures 
               -Basic operations research techniques
          -Experience with any of the following is also a plus:
           XShell or other ORB tools, Relational Database, SQL, HTML

Competititive salaries and benefits. Publishing encouraged.
Opportunities for promotions. Position open for immediate start.

Cycorp is seeking an enthusiastic, multi-talented person for a position
in software development for database applications.  This will involve
working with the Cyc technology -- an immense, broad, multi-contextual
knowledge base and inference engine which our group has developed over
the last eleven years.  Cyc contains facts and rules of thumb for
reasoning about the objects and events of modern everyday life.  Cyc
enables a multitude of knowledge-intensive products and services which
could revolutionize the way in which people use and interact with data,
and Cycorp is dedicated to making this happen.  Cyc currently supports
ground-breaking pilot applications in the areas of heterogeneous
database browsing and integration, captioned image retrieval, and
natural language understanding.   We are looking for a self-motivated
individual with significant database experience to join us in this
challenging enterprise.  Specifically, the individual chosen should have
significant experience and expertise in:

o Database and compiler theory
o Formal logic (predicate calculus) and deductive theorem proving
o Database programming and administration (Oracle, DB2, others)
o C and Lisp application programming expertise

and/or cooperation -- within a dynamic population of autonomous 
software agents.

		* Computational learning -- e.g., evolutionary computation

		* Autonomous agents
		* Evidential reasoning
		* Cognitive systems engineering

interest across the above areas, and less so in a person who 
strives to be the ultimate specialist.

Investigator -- in our corporate research & development 
environment you also must be competent in:**

		* Modeling phenomena and developing algorithms

pressure, and the ability to adapt in the face of changing 
responsibilities.  We want you to make a significant contribution 
to our company, and you will have  the opportunity to grow and 
help define your own future.  If this sounds like you, then we 
want to meet you.  We offer competitive salary (commensurate with 
experience & skills) and an excellent benefits package (BC/BS 
health insurance, dental, LTD, paid vacations, holidays, a smoke-
free environment, and more).

applied mathematics, cognitive systems engineering, electrical 
engineering, or related field.  You should also be a U.S. citizen 
ready to work in a smoke-free environment.

                Sr. ICAD KBE Application Developers

CSA Job #:   95-1005

A MAJOR CONSULTING COMPANY is seeking individuals who can either manage or 
support the implementation and delivery of software development projects  
using  Knowledge-Based Engineering (KBE) technology (specifically using The 
ICAD System from Concentra Corporation). 

These projects will focus on helping manufacturing companies re-engineer their 
quotation and product development processes.  Other responsibilities of these 
individuals will include  Statement of Work/Functional Specification 
development, project scoping, "rule" extraction from experts, training, 
documentation, and application testing. As part of a team these individuals 
may also support marketing activities, specifically as they pertain to 
technology positioning. These positions require significant travel and offer 
highly competitive salaries with accelerated career paths in the management 
consulting industry.

  companies
- Good communication and presentation skills

- Experience extracting information from engineers
- Experience with UNIX workstations and PC's
- Ability to travel extensively to Client sites (50% travel).

  provide  schedules, time, and manpower estimates for funding requirements
- Other software development experience: Object-oriented languages, C, LISP,

- An in-depth understanding of the product delivery process for engineered 
  products

- Advanced degree, Engineering or Computer Science preferred
- Consulting experience, specifically in how to manage client relationships

From: Kurt Vanlehn <vanlehn+@pitt.edu>
To: AI Repository <ai+ai-jobs@cs.cmu.edu>
Subject: Job: Bayesian nets C++/Java at LRDC, U. of Pittsburgh (Pittsburgh, PA)
CC: Kurt Vanlehn <vanlehn+@pitt.edu>
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

The Andes project at the Learning Research and Development Center,
University of Pittsburgh, seeks a full-time research programmer to
help develop a Bayesian reasoning system.  The Andes project is
developing an intelligent tutoring system that will teach college
physics.  The system will be used both as a testbed for evaluating
various instructional methods and as a means of improving instruction
in a 1200-student university physics class.  The research programmer
will be part of an 11-person team composed of physicists, computer
scientists and cognitive scientists.

The specific responsibilities of the programmer will be to develop a
student modeling system.  The system will induce and maintain a model
of the students' knowledge of physics given continuous data on the
student's performance.  The student modelling system will be written
in either C++, C or Java.  The system will employ techniques from
Artificial Intelligence (AI) for reasoning with uncertainty, notably
Bayesian belief networks.  Bayesian belief networks are probably the
fastest growing technology in AI.  We are willing to train a suitably
prepared candidate in this highly marketable skill.

The ideal candidate will have a BS in computer science or its
equivalent and significant experience in C++ or C programming.  A
background in statistics and/or AI are a definite plus.  The position
is funded from now until August 31, 1997.  There is a strong
possibility that funding will be extended for one or two years beyond
that date.  The compensation includes a competitive salary, full
benefits and reduced tuition for graduate and undergraduate courses at
the University of Pittsburgh.  If interested, please immediately
contact Kurt VanLehn via the following:

email: vanlehn@cs.pitt.edu
phone: (412) 624-7458
fax: (412) 624-9149

               Engineering Analyst

Carrier Corporation is seeking an individual with a broad Artificial 
Intelligence background for a position in the Electronic Systems Technology 
Group. The Electronic Systems Technology Group is responsible for developing 
service diagnostic systems and software for HVAC equipment and systems. The 
members of this group work closely with the corporate research center - UTRC 
(United Technologies Research Center). The successful candidate will join a 
team of researchers applying artificial intelligence techniques to problems 
in remote monitoring and diagnostics.  The candidate will spend a major 
portion of his/her time during the first year at UTRC in East Hartford, CT. 
The individual's role will be initially of technical support to the project 
team. The permanent assignment will be in the Electronic Systems Technology 
group in Carrier Electronics in Farmington, CT  with potential for growth to 
be a technology leader depending upon the skill of the individual.

The successful candidate will have an advanced degree (MS)  in Computer 
Science with a concentration in Artificial Intelligence and a strong 
engineering background at the undergraduate level. Background and experience 
desirable in one or more of the following areas: Model-Based Reasoning, 
Knowledge-Based Systems.  Working knowledge of mechanical and thermodynamic 
system is essential.  Database experience, knowledge of software engineering 
methodologies, and strong programming skills (Lisp, C++) are a plus.

Carrier Corporation offers a competitive salary and benefits package 
designed to attract and retain talented professionals. Send your resume and 
salary requirements to: Paul Duff, Carrier Corporation, One Carrier Place, 
Farmington, CT 06034-4015

NO E-MAIL RESPONSES PLEASE.

Research Scientist Position in Computer/Information Science
Center for EUV Astrophysics
University of California, Berkeley
$43.1-$45.6K

The Center for EUV Astrophysics (CEA) invites applications for Assistant
Research Scientist to support the Center's activities in space science,
satellite operations, and science education.  CEA performs research in
astrophysics, scientific data analysis, scheduling, autonomous spacecraft
operations, archiving, Internet-based information distribution and
science education.

Candidates should have a Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical
Engineering, or Information Science and a successful record of applied
research in one or more of the following: Knowledge Representation and
Information Retrieval; Artificial Intelligence Applications;
Object-Oriented Databases; Embedded Systems; Workflow Management; High
Level Image Processing.  

Specific responsibilities will depend on the area of expertise, but will
involve leading the development of solutions to outstanding CEA problems
through original research and innovative use of existing technologies.  A
portion of time may be used for independent research leading to
publication in professional journals.

Applications must be submitted by Jan. 31, 1996, and include a curriculum
vitae, bibliography, and a list of three references.  Apply to: Dr. Mark
Abbott, c/o Cathie Jones, Center for EUV Astrophysics, 2150 Kittredge St.,
University of California, Berkeley, CA 94720-5030  

(The University of California is an Equal Oportunity/Affirmative
 Action Employer)

     Serve as a software engineer  at  the  Center  for  EUV

loops.

Subject: Job: Research Position at Center for EUV Astrophysics (Berkeley CA)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU


Research Scientist Position in Computer/Information Science
Center for EUV Astrophysics
University of California, Berkeley
$43.1-$45.6K


The Center for EUV Astrophysics (CEA) at the University of California,
Berkeley (UCB) invites applications for a Research Scientist position to
support the Center's activities in space science, satellite operations,
and science education.  CEA operates the Extreme Ultraviolet Explorer, a
NASA orbiting telescope performing observations in the wavelength range 70
to 780 Angstroms.  CEA personnel perform research in astrophysics,
scientific data analysis, scheduling, autonomous spacecraft operations,
archiving, and Internet-based information distribution and science
education.

Candidates should have a Ph.D. in Computer Science, Electrical
Engineering, or Information Science and a successful record of applied
research in one or more of the following general areas:

  Knowledge Representation and Information Retrieval: authoring, markup,
  storage and retrieval of multimedia technical documentation, SGML,
  digital libraries, natural language query processing, adaptive
  information presentation.

  Artifical Intelligence Applications: model based reasoning systems,
  rule based expert systems, fault identification, analysis and
  recovery, neural networks, automated rule generation.

  Object-Oriented Databases: object-oriented data modeling and design,
  complex scientific data visualization, POSTGRES, large data volume
  issues.

  Embedded Systems: realtime operating systems, concurrent
  programming, reactive scheduling, fuzzy controllers, interprocess
  communications.

  Workflow Management: business management automation, task planning,
  man-machine task management, continuous process improvement.

  High Level Image Processing:  pattern recognition, signal
  processing, object identification, classification analysis.

Specific responsibilities in this position will depend on the area of
expertise of the successful applicant, but will involve leading the
development of solutions to the outstanding problems CEA faces though
original research or innovative use of existing technologies.  The
responsibilities may also include management of personnel working under
the direction of this position.  A portion of the time in the position may
be used to pursue independent research leading to publication in
appropriate professional journals.  Applicants would also be expected to
pursue funding opportunities for both CEA and their own research and to
develop collaborations with CEA scientists and others at UCB and/or other
institutions.


Applications must be submitted by Jan. 31, 1996, and include a curriculum
vitae, bibliography, and a list of three references.  Apply to: Dr. Mark
Abbott, c/o Cathie Jones, Center for EUV Astrophysics, 2150 Kittredge St.,
University of California, Berkeley, CA 94720-5030  

(The University of California is an Equal Oportunity/Affirmative
 Action Employer)

NOTE: this is a more detailed description of the same job previously
posted on 20-Dec-95

freeze.  However, we are hopeful that the freeze will be
lifted in time for us to fill the position(s) described in

We encourage qualified persons to apply by the January 15, 1996 deadline.

    -----------------------------------------------------------------

                          UNIVERSITY OF WATERLOO

                      Department of Computer Science

    The  University  of Waterloo invites applications for one or more
    tenure-track  faculty  positions in Computer Science.  Considera-
    tion  will  be  given  to applicants whose research interests lie
    within  the  area  of  artificial  intelligence  or who engage in
    experimentally  focused  research in one or more of the following
    areas: database systems, data structures design, distributed sys-
    tems,  operating  systems,  programming  languages,  or  software
    engineering.   The  successful candidate is expected to develop a
    productive  research  program, to supervise graduate students and
    to  teach graduate-level courses, to maintain a strong commitment
    to  teaching  undergraduate  students,  and  to contribute to the
    administration of the Department.  A Ph.D. in Computer Science or
    equivalent  is  required,  with  evidence of outstanding research
    accomplishments or potential and evidence of excellence in teach-
    ing.   Candidates  at  all levels of experience are encouraged to
    apply.  Rank and salary will be commensurate with experience.

    The  Department  of  Computer Science comprises over 40 full-time
    faculty members engaged in research and teaching covering a broad
    spectrum.   The  Department  and  its  research  laboratories are
    housed  in the 300,000 sq. ft. William G. Davis Computer Research
    Centre.  The Department is a key participant in Information Tech-
    nology  Research Centre (ITRC), a provincial Centre of Excellence
    that  supports basic and applied research in information technol-
    ogy.   For  further  information about the Department, please see
    http://math.uwaterloo.ca/CS_Dept.

    Applications  should  include a curriculum vitae and the names of
    three  references  and should be directed to the chair: Professor
    Frank Tompa, Department of Computer Science, University of Water-
    loo,  Waterloo,  Ontario,  Canada  N2L 3G1; fwtompa@uwaterloo.ca.
    The  position commences during the 1996 calendar year, and appli-
    cations will be accepted until January 15, 1996.

    In accordance with Canadian immigration requirements, this adver-
    tisement   is   directed   to  Canadian  citizens  and  Permanent
    Residents.   The  University  of Waterloo encourages applications
    from all qualified individuals, including women, members of visi-
    ble minorities, native peoples, and persons with disabilities.

    This appointment is subject to the availability of funds.

    -----------------------------------------------------------------

From: cic@crl.com (Communication Intelligence Corp)
Subject: US-CA-SanFrancisco character recognitio, Communication Intell. Corp
Date: 15 Dec 1995 18:08:29 -0800
Organization: CRL Dialup Internet Access

Communication Intelligence Corporation (CIC) is a leader in handwriting
recognition and other pen input technologies. We currently market
recognizers for English, Western European, and Asian languages on a variety
of platforms (e.g., DOS, Windows, Macintosh, and so on). These systems enable
the pen to serve as the sole input and control device, combining the functions
of both keyboard and mouse, and adding new capabilities.

Advanced development is directed toward integrated discrete/cursive
recognizers, and future integration with voice recognition, OCR, and
similar technologies.

CIC was founded in 1981 in conjunction with SRI International (formerly
Stanford Research Institute).  CIC is headquartered in Redwood Shores,
California, and has an international subsidiary, CIC Japan, Inc., in
Tokyo, Japan.

**** NOTE: please reply only to ostrem@cic.com

**** NOTE: positions are being offered only to those currently
           residing in the US


CIC currently has an immediate opening for the following position:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

POSITION: Researcher/Software Engineer

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

1.  Strong background in statistics, pattern recognition, algorithm development
2.  Expert C programmer (at least 3-5 years experience)
3.  3-5 years experience in designing and coding for large software projects
    in a UNIX environment
4.  Good English communication skills and works well with other people.
5.  MS or substantial experience in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering
    or the equivalent

HIGHLY DESIRABLE QUALIFICATIONS

1.  Experience with CHARACTER RECOGNITION, especially handwriting recognition,
    either on-line or off-line (OCR)
2.  Experience working in commercial companies
3.  Experience in Speech Recognition
4.  Linguistic experience (particularly statistical linguistics)

JOB DESCRIPTION

Work with a team of researchers on the next generation of handwriting
recognition systems (both off-line and on-line) for the commercial
market


**** NOTE: CIC's research is proprietary and hence results are NOT published

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please reply to ostrem@cic.com (send only ASCII text)

John S. Ostrem

HIRING REQUISITION

Req.#314R & 315R
Job Title:  Knowledge Engineer
Full-time/Regular

JOB DESCRIPTION:

recognition dictation system.

experts, the product manager, software product development and customer 
education/support.

delivering and maintaining aproduct.  Experience working with multiple, 
conflicting experts helpful.  Experience with knowledge representation, 
database design and programming required.  BA or BS plus a minimum of 3 
years experience required.

From: Michele Leavitt <michelel@kurz-ai.com>
Subject: US - Waltham, MA - Kurzweil Applied Intelligene, Inc. - Sr. NLP Engineer
Date: 19 Dec 1995 19:06:53 GMT
Organization: Kurzweil Applied Intelligence, Inc.

HIRING REQUISITION

Req.#319-R
Job Title:  Sr, NLP Engineer
Full-time/Regular

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Participate in the design, coding, and testing of a system for control of 
computer applications by continuous speech and natural language 
processing; particularly the grammar and sematic processing for the 
system.  The aim of the system is to let naive users conrol, by speaking, 
powerful PC applications, such as word processors or spreadsheets without 
having to learn a new command language.  Thus, the system must provide 
very broad coverage of naive users' utterances, and must fail in 
comprehensible ways.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience in computational linguistics
Experience in writing grammars for real tasks
Experience in building real, efficient systems (preferably products)
2 years experience with C programming

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience with:

Windows programming
OLE
Windows applications
Feature structure grammars
1 year experience with C++ programming
Graduate training in NLP, PhD

U S WEST
**************************************************
KNOWLEDGE BASE ENGINEER
**************************************************

At U S WEST Technologies, we don't just talk about the future.  We make 
it happen.  If you want a chance to make it happen for yourself, apply 
today for this opening at U S WEST Technologies in Denver, Colorado.

Knowledge Base Engineer

You will work with process designers, software developers and operations 
staff in the areas of service delivery, service assurance, capacity 
provisioning, marketing, finance and information technologies to develop 
systems dynamics models of processes, metrics and reward systems.

Responsibilities will include: obtaining, analyzing, organizing and 
documenting knowledge needed to work in processes and the "surface" and 
"deep" knowledge in process tools; leading the development of archives 
of corporate knowledge and models of corporate systems that promote 
reuse of model components and knowledge elements; documenting learnings 
to support continual process evolution; and, conducting informal 
training with U S WEST staff to facilitate appropriate use of systems 
dynamics tools and data.

Qualifications:

*  Understanding of business process re-engineering principles and 
experience in reengineering, including process design and measurement.
*  Working knowledge of both qualitative and quantitative causal 
modeling, systems dynamics, and collaboration science, including 
software tools for causal model simulation (e.g. I-THINK, Extend).
*  Background with quality improvement principles.
*  Familiarity with chaos theory and strange attractors.
*  Skills in knowledge acquisition and modeling (e.g. KADS).
*  Strong interpersonal skills, as well good oral and written 
communication abilities. 

Send or FAX your resume (ASCII format only) and salary history to:  
ktait@advtech.uswest.com.  
FAX (303) 541-8183.

U S WEST Technologies is an equal opportunity employer.  Any offer of 
employment is contingent upon the applicant's undergoing and passing a 
pre-employment drug test, subject to applicable federal, state, and 
local law.

Subject: Job: Speech/NLP at Southwestern Bell (Austin, TX)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: S Johnson <sjohnson@sbctri.sbc.com>
Subject: US-TX-Austin-MTS-Speech and Language Scientist-Southwestern Bell TRI
Date: 9 Dec 1995 13:37:47 GMT
Organization: Southwestern Bell Technology Resources

Southwestern Bell Technology Resources, Inc. 
Member of Technical Staff
Speech Scientist in a Speech Technology group

SBC Communications, Inc. (SBC) is a leader  in the telecommunications 
industry.  Our research subsidiary, SOUTHWESTERN BELL TECHNOLOGY
RESOURCES, currently has an opening for a Member of Technical Staff to
work in the area of speech and language technology.


**** Job Description ****
Responsible for projects aimed at moving speech and language technology
out of the laboratory and into the market place, primarily directed at
the use of voice activated user  interfaces to telecommunications or
information services.  Study voice activated user interface problems
through specific data collection and analysis, service prototypes,
performance testing and human factors testing.  Study combining voice
recognition with other user input devices for a multimodal interface. 
Evaluate and recommend commercial vendor products which can be utilized
to meet the functional requirements for specific services. 


**** General Requirements ****
Candidates must have a background in speech technology research and
development, applicable to developing and testing prototype voice
activated services.  Candidates should have applied research experience
in prototype development for voice activated service concept validation
and demonstration of telecommunications based services.  Experience with
a variety of  programming languages is required.  Suitable candidates
must demonstrate strong self motivation and leadership in complex
multi-year projects dependent on changing problem definitions and
customer requirements.

**** Required Technical Experience **** 
Three or more years of industrial R&D experience in several of the
following areas:

>> In-depth understanding of speech and hearing in humans. Well versed in
applied linguistics.

>> Capable of implementing current techniques for real-time
representation and processing of speech signals including LPC, Cepstral,
and CELP techniques, especially for telephone speech.

>> Capable of implementing current techniques for pattern matching coded
speech signals, including hidden Markov modeling and neural networks.
Solid understanding of the methods for developing reference models. 
Experience in collecting, analyzing and utilizing speech databases.

>> A proven record of creatively applying the above expertise to the
development of well engineered systems utilizing speech recognition,
speaker identification and verification, and speech synthesis. 

>> Capable of making informed evaluations of vendor developed speech
processing and recognition systems including the definition and execution
of appropriate experiments.

>> Computer Skills:
- Capable of writing solid, well designed and documented C/C++ code.
- Good UNIX skills (preferably on Sun or Silicon Graphics workstations)
- Able to effectively work as a team member with software engineers.
- A basic understanding of computer networks, client-server
architectures, and distributed computing.
- Familiar with personal computing systems and able to support hardware
and software-based applications of speech technology using them.

**** Desirable Technical Experience ****
Strong expertise required in several of the following areas:

>> Capable of leading a group of application programmers working on a
complex systems development project.

>> Knowledge of computation linguistics and natural language processing
techniques.

>> Familiarity with Prolog or logic programming.

>> Familiarity with methods in artificial intelligence, especially
planning systems and knowledge representation.

**** Education ****
>>MS in Computer Science , Electrical Engineering, or equivalent is
required.  Ph.D. in these areas is preferred.

For consideration, please mail, fax or E-mail your resume as noted below.

Human Resources Department
Southwestern Bell Technology Resources, Inc.  
9505 Arboretum Blvd.
Austin, Texas 78759
Fax: 512-372-5991
E-mail:  sjohnson@sbctri.sbc.com

AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

                    plus excellent benefits

All inquiries are confidential.  If you are interested or know of anyone that
may have an interest in learning more about this position contact me or:

If you meet all or most of the REQUIREMENTS and at least some of the
DESIRABLES of the position you are qualified.

If you are qualified, directly submit a RESUME in ASCII format and RESUME
ADDENDUM (that specifically addresses REQUIREMENTS and DESIRABLES of the
position) GIVE REASONS TO HIRE YOU BASED ON THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE POSITION.

1) Identify the specific Job Opportunity and location.
2) Outline in some detail specific experience relative to the listed
   JOB REQUIREMENTS and DESIRABLES listed in the Job Description.
3) Specify your current salary and salary requirements.
4) Attach a copy of your resume (even if you have already submitted).

Subject: US-PITTSBURGH PA-Algorithm Engineer-Carnegie Group
Organization: Online Career Center
Date: Sat, 16 Dec 1995 09:10:16 GMT

Carnegie Group, Inc., a leading Pittsburgh-based knowledge systems
integrator, currently has an Algorithm Engineer position available
with our TRAC2ES team. TRAC2ES is a decision support system we are 
currently developing for mass casualty evacuations.  This revolutionary
system incorporates powerful planning and scheduling algorithms based on
constraint based reasoning.  Interested?  To see if you qualify, please
read the position requirements below.

Qualified resumes, including salary history,  may be sent to:

Carnegie Group, Inc.		fax: 412-642-6906
5 PPG Place 			email: resumes@cgi.com
Pittsburgh, PA  15222

____________________________________________________________________________
POSITION TITLE:	Engineer/Sr. Engineer I - Algorithm focus
LOCATION:	Pittsburgh

Will consider either fulltime or contract candidates.  

  RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
  ------------------------
  	Design, code, and test algorithms for U.S. Transcom 
	Medical Evacuation Planning software application.

  	Prepare and deliver project status review (Algoithm component)
  	presentations to customer and interested third parties.

  	Travel during project will be modest. 
  
  POSITION REQUIRES:
  -----------------
       B.S. Computer Science (software engineering/development), Software
  	Engineering, or related field, Master's preferred.
  
  WORK EXPERIENCE:
  --------------- 
  	At least 1-3 years software development experience;  Code development
  	in UNIX Workstation (SUN preferred).

	Experience working with knowledge-based systems, preferably
	planning and scheduling applications.

	Prior work on DoD projects is a plus.
  
	Familiarity (preferably experience) with Object-Oriented Data Base
	(Versant OODB a plus), GUI (X/MOTIF), and/or Communications 
	technologies is desired.  

  
  SPECIFIC SKILLS REQUIRED:
  ------------------------
    	Excellent problem-definition and problem-solving skills
  	and experience.
  
	Excellent communication skills; the ability to clearly express
	difficult concepts to fellow developers as well as non-engineers.
  
	Strong object-oriented design and programming skills.
  	(OMT experience is a plus, C/C++ experience is required)

  	Demonstrated ability to take user functional requirements and 
  	design and implement modular well-structured software.
  
  	Flexibility in responding to evolving user/customer requirements.
     
     OPPORTUNITIES for ADVANCEMENT include assuming responsibility for leading
     design & coding efforts of follow-on planning and scheduling applications.

Please submit your resume and the information above using any of the
following vehicles, in order of preference:

  1. Thru our Web site
  2. E-mail in ASCII text format (please, no encoded documents)
  3. High resolution fax with 12 point or larger type font
  4. Other fax
  5. Mail

If you submit via option 1 or 2, you will be assured that your resume
will be searched for all new job requirements on receipt.  Faxed and
mailed resumes need further processing before searching.

Our Web site has a complete set of all our open positions and a search
engine that can locate all jobs by any word or phrase including job
titles, skills, and geographic areas.

Web response allows you to select job openings on-line and submit your
job search preferences and resume.  You will get instantaneous
confirmation by E-mail of your submitted job selections, preferences
and resume.

If you submit your response via Email or fax please leave us a
voicemail message if you are not sure that your transmission was
successful.

We will only present your resume for jobs for which we have gained your
verbal approval.

HIRING REQUISITION

Req. #318-R
Job Title:  Sr. Software Engineer
Full-time/Regular

JOB DESCRIPTION:

We are looking for a senior software engineer to join a team designing 
and building the next generation of speech recognition products and 
voice-aware applications for use in hospital and clinical settings.  
These recognizers and applications will run onn Windows, Windows 95 and 
Windows NT.  They are used by doctors and other healthcare professionals 
to create medical reports by voice.

QUALIFICATIONS:

BS and 5+ years C, C++ programming, MS a plus.  SGML experience, 
including DTD design.  System architecture and design.  Significant 
MS-Windows application design.  Product development/test/release/support 
cycle.  Experience with other windowing systems is helpful. UNIX system 
experience is helpful.  Experience with OLE 2.0, Microsoft Visual C++ and 
Microsoft Foundation Classes helpful.

SENIOR PRODUCT MANAGER

As speech recognition technologies gain in accuracy and acceptance,

customer applications or potential applications through research methods,
leading ultimately to specification and product development.

product development of office products, telecommunications or software

communication skills.

Subject: Job: Prolog/NLP/Speech at OGI (Portland, OR)
Sender: ai@A.GP.CS.CMU.EDU

From: halm@church.cse.ogi.edu (Hal Miller)
Subject: USA-OR User Interface programmer
Date: 20 Dec 1995 01:16:38 GMT
Organization: Oregon Graduate Institute (OGI), Portland, Oregon

The Center for Human-Computer Communication is in need of a talented
Windows/Unix programmer to develop innovative multimodal user interface
software.  The ideal candidate will have an MS in Computer Science with 5+
years of corporate programming experience in Visual Basic and Visual C++,
as well as Unix and X-Windows (any widget set).  Furthermore, the candidate
should be versed in graphics algorithms and have a keen interest in advancing
the state of the art in next generation human-interface technology.
Finally, the ideal candidate should have experience in a multidisciplinary
environment, including team participants with backgrounds and perspectives
other than computer science.

Desirable qualifications also include working knowledge of any of: Prolog,
natural language processing, speech, handwriting, distributed systems.

Salary will be competitive with experience and education.

INSTITUTION: The Center for Human-Computer Communication is a newly formed
research center at OGI within the Department of Computer Science and
Engineering. We are a multidisciplinary group, including computer
scientists, psychologists, and linguists dedicated to advancing the science
and technology of human-computer and human-human communication. Research
support comes from ARPA, MITI, NASA, NSF, ONR, the State of Oregon, and a
variety of computer and telecommunications companies. A new usability and
intelligent systems laboratory includes Sun sparcstations, SGIs, PC's,
PowerMacs, and PDA's, as well as state-of-the-art video recording and
production equipment.

The Department of Computer Science and Engineering is one of the most
rapidly growing departments in the U.S., with 18 faculty, over
100 Ph.D. and M.S. students, and a departmental research budget exceeding
$6M per year.  CSE's research is organized around a number of
Centers, including CHCC, the Center for Spoken Language Understanding, and
the Data Intensive Systems Center. In these areas of specialization, CSE is
one of the leading computer science departments on the West Coast.



To apply, send a cover letter, current resume, and list of three professional
references to:

    Dr. Phil Cohen
    Department of Computer Science and Engineering
    Oregon Graduate Institute
    P.O. Box 91000
    Portland, Oregon 97291-1000

Email submissions will be accepted at pcohen@cse.ogi.edu, and must
include the above information.  Refer to the position number in the subject
line of your message.

OGI is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer.  Qualified women
and minorities are encouraged to apply.
--
| Hal Miller     halm@cse.ogi.edu  | System Administrator  (HAM10) |
| Oregon Graduate Institute        | PO Box 91000, Portland 97291  |
| 20000 NW Walker Road             | voice: +1 503 690-1350        |
